original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽kasyacit tv atha kālasya rājā daśarathaḥ sutam /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  kasyacid tu atha kālasya rājā daśarathaḥ sutam
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.🔽After some time, King Dasharatha, the delighter of the Raghu dynasty,

original: bharataṃ kekayīputram abravīd raghunandanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharatam kekayī putram abravīt raghunandanaḥ
translated: spoke to his son Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi:

original: ayaṃ kekayarājasya putro vasati putraka /
analyzed: ayam kekaya rājasya putraḥ vasati putraka
translated: O son, this son of the king of Kekaya is staying here.

original: tvāṃ netum āgato vīra yudhājin mātulas tava // / / //
analyzed: tvām netum āgataḥ vīra yudhājit mātulaḥ tava
translated: Your maternal uncle Yudhājit has come to take you away, O hero.

original: śrutvā daśarathasyaitad bharataḥ kekayīsutaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā daśarathasya etat bharataḥ kekayī sutaḥ
translated: Hearing this from Dasharatha, Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi,

original: gamanāyābhicakrāma śatrughnasahitas tadā // / / //🔽āpṛcchya pitaraṃ śūro rāmaṃ cākliṣṭakāriṇam /
analyzed: gamanāya abhicakrāma śatrughna sahitaḥ tadā  āpṛcchya pitaram śūraḥ rāmam ca akliṣṭa kāriṇam
translated: prepared to leave, accompanied by Shatrughna.🔽The hero, the best among men, took leave of his father, Rama, the performer of difficult deeds,

original: mātḥṃś cāpi naraśreṣṭhaḥ śatrughnasahito yayau // / / //
analyzed: mātṛ ca api nara śreṣṭhaḥ śatrughna sahitaḥ yayau
translated: and his mothers, and left with Shatrughna.

original: yudhājit prāpya bharataṃ saśatrughnaṃ praharṣitaḥ /
analyzed: yudhājit prāpya bharatam sa śatrughnam praharṣitaḥ
translated: Yudhājit, having met Bharata and Shatrughna, was delighted.

original: svapuraṃ prāviśad vīraḥ pitā tasya tutoṣa ha // / / //
analyzed: sva puram prāviśat vīraḥ pitā tasya tutoṣa ha
translated: The hero entered his own city, and his father was pleased.

original: sa tatra nyavasad bhrātrā saha satkārasatkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sa tatra nyavasat bhrātrā saha satkāra satkṛtaḥ
translated: He stayed there with his brother, well-received with honor,

original: mātulenāśvapatinā putrasnehena lālitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mātulena aśvapatinā putra snehena lālitaḥ
translated: cared for with affection by his maternal uncle Ashvapati, as if he were his own son.

original: tatrāpi nivasantau tau tarpyamāṇau ca kāmataḥ /
analyzed: tatra api nivasantau tau tarpyamāṇau ca kāmataḥ
translated: Even there, they stayed, their desires being fulfilled,🔽and they were always engaged in the welfare of their maternal uncle.

original: bhrātarau smaratāṃ vīrau vṛddhaṃ daśarathaṃ nṛpam // / / //
analyzed: bhrātarau smaratām vīrau vṛddham daśaratham nṛpam
translated: Remembering the aged king Dasharatha, the two heroic brothers...

original: rājāpi tau mahātejāḥ sasmāra proṣitau sutau /
analyzed: rājā api tau mahā tejāḥ sasmāra proṣitau sutau
translated: The greatly energetic king also remembered his two sons who had gone away,

original: ubhau bharataśatrughnau mahendravaruṇopamau // / / //
analyzed: ubhau bharata śatrughnau mahā indra varuṇa upamau
translated: Both Bharata and Shatrughna, who were like Indra and Varuna.

original: sarva eva tu tasyeṣṭāś catvāraḥ puruṣarṣabhāḥ /
analyzed: sarve eva tu tasya iṣṭāḥ catvāraḥ puruṣa ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: But he loved all four of them equally, those bulls among men,

original: svaśarīrād vinirvṛttāś catvāra iva bāhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva śarīrāt vinirvṛttāḥ catvāraḥ iva bāhavaḥ
translated: As if they were four arms that had grown out of his own body.

original: teṣām api mahātejā rāmo ratikaraḥ pituḥ /
analyzed: teṣām api mahā tejāḥ rāmaḥ rati karaḥ pituḥ
translated: Among them, the greatly energetic Rama, who delighted his father,

original: svayambhūr iva bhūtānāṃ babhūva guṇavattaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: svayambhūḥ iva bhūtānām babhūva guṇavattaraḥ
translated: Became even more virtuous, like the self-existent one to all beings.

original: gate ca bharate rāmo lakṣmaṇaś ca mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: gate ca bharate rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: And when Bharata had left, Rama and the greatly strong Lakshmana

original: pitaraṃ devasaṃkāśaṃ pūjayāmāsatus tadā // / / //🔽pitur ājñāṃ puraskṛtya paurakāryāṇi sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: pitaram deva saṃkāśam pūjayāmāsatuḥ tadā  pituḥ ājñām puraskṛtya paura kāryāṇi sarvaśas
translated: Honored their father, who was like a god.🔽Putting the command of his father first, Rama, with a righteous soul,

original: cakāra rāmo dharmātmā priyāṇi ca hitāni ca // / / //
analyzed: cakāra rāmaḥ dharma ātmā priyāṇi ca hitāni ca
translated: Did all the duties of the city and also pleasant and beneficial things.

original: mātṛbhyo mātṛkāryāṇi kṛtvā paramayantritaḥ /
analyzed: mātṛbhyaḥ mātṛ kāryāṇi kṛtvā parama yantritaḥ
translated: Being extremely controlled, he did the duties of a mother to his mothers,

original: gurūṇāṃ gurukāryāṇi kāle kāle 'nvavaikṣata // / / //
analyzed: gurūṇām guru kāryāṇi kāle kāle nu avaikṣata
translated: And from time to time looked after the duties of a disciple to his teachers.

original: evaṃ daśarathaḥ prīto brāhmaṇā naigamās tathā /
analyzed: evam daśarathaḥ prītaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ naigamāḥ tathā
translated: Thus Dasharatha was pleased, as were the Brahmins and the citizens,

original: rāmasya śīlavṛttena sarve viṣayavāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmasya śīla vṛttena sarve viṣaya vāsinaḥ
translated: All the residents of the country are devoted to Rama because of his character and conduct.

original: sa hi nityaṃ praśāntātmā mṛdupūrvaṃ ca bhāṣate /
analyzed: sa hi nityam praśānta ātmā mṛdu pūrvam ca bhāṣate
translated: He is always peaceful in mind and speaks gently first.

original: ucyamāno 'pi paruṣaṃ nottaraṃ pratipadyate // / / //
analyzed: ucyamānaḥ u pi paruṣam na uttaram pratipadyate
translated: Even when spoken to harshly, he does not respond in kind.

original: kathaṃcid upakāreṇa kṛtenaikena tuṣyati /
analyzed: kathaṃcid upakāreṇa kṛtena ekena tuṣyati
translated: He is satisfied with just one favor, no matter how small.

original: na smaraty apakārāṇāṃ śatam apy ātmavattayā // / / //
analyzed: na smarati apakārāṇām śatam api ātmavat tayā
translated: He does not remember even a hundred wrongs, as if they were his own.

original: śīlavṛddhair jñānavṛddhair vayovṛddhaiś ca sajjanaiḥ /
analyzed: śīla vṛddhaiḥ jñāna vṛddhaiḥ vayaḥ vṛddhaiḥ ca sat janaiḥ
translated: He always converses with good people who are advanced in age, knowledge, and virtue,

original: kathayann āsta vai nityam astrayogyāntareṣv api // / / //
analyzed: kathayan āsta vai nityam astra yogya antareṣu api
translated: even in the intervals of practicing weapons.

original: kalyāṇābhijanaḥ sādhur adīnaḥ satyavāg ṛjuḥ /
analyzed: kalyāṇa abhijanaḥ sādhuḥ adīnaḥ satya vāc ṛjuḥ
translated: He is of noble birth, virtuous, not timid, truthful, straightforward,

original: vṛddhair abhivinītaś ca dvijair dharmārthadarśibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛddhaiḥ abhivinītaḥ ca dvijaiḥ dharma artha darśibhiḥ
translated: and well-disciplined by elderly twice-born people who see dharma and artha.

original: dharmārthakāmatattvajñaḥ smṛtimān pratibhāvanān /
analyzed: dharma artha kāma tattva jñaḥ smṛtimān
translated: He knows the truth of dharma, artha, and kama, has memory and imagination,

original: laukike samayācare kṛtakalpo viśāradaḥ // / / //
analyzed: laukike kṛtakalpaḥ viśāradaḥ
translated: and is skilled in worldly conventions.

original: śāstrajñaś ca kṛtajñaś ca puruṣāntarakovidaḥ /
analyzed: śāstra jñaḥ ca kṛtajñaḥ ca puruṣa antara kovidaḥ
translated: He knows the scriptures, is grateful, and knows the inner workings of people.

original: yaḥ pragrahānugrahayor yathānyāyaṃ vicakṣaṇaḥ // / / //🔽āyakarmaṇy upāyajñaḥ saṃdṛṣṭavyayakarmavit /
analyzed: yaḥ pragraha anugrahayoḥ yathānyāyam vicakṣaṇaḥ 🔽āya karmaṇi upāya jñaḥ saṃdṛṣṭa vyayakarma vid
translated: He is skilled in proper rewards and punishments.🔽He knows the means of income and the proper expenditure of wealth.

original: śraiṣṭhyaṃ śāstrasamūheṣu prāpto vyāmiśrakeṣv api // / / //
analyzed: śraiṣṭhyam śāstra samūheṣu prāptaḥ vyāmiśrakeṣu api
translated: And has attained preeminence among the collections of scriptures, even the mixed ones.

original: arthadharmau ca saṃgṛhya sukhatantro na cālasaḥ /
analyzed: artha dharmau ca saṃgṛhya sukha tantraḥ na ca alasaḥ
translated: And having grasped wealth and dharma, he is of a happy disposition and not lazy.

original: vaihārikāṇāṃ śilpānāṃ vijñātārthavibhāgavit // / / //
analyzed: vaihārikāṇām śilpānām vijñāta artha vibhāga vid
translated: And knowing the divisions of the meanings of worldly arts,

original: ārohe vinaye caiva yukto vāraṇavājinām /
analyzed: ārohe vinaye ca eva yuktaḥ vāraṇa vājinām
translated: He is skilled in the mounting and training of elephants and horses.

original: dhanurvedavidāṃ śreṣṭho loke 'tirathasaṃmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhanurveda vidām śreṣṭhaḥ loke tiratha saṃmataḥ
translated: And is considered an atiratha in the world, the best among those who know the science of archery.

original: abhiyātā prahartā ca senānayaviśāradaḥ /
analyzed: abhiyātā prahartā ca senā naya viśāradaḥ
translated: And he is one who attacks and strikes, skilled in the strategy of the army.

original: apradhṛṣyaś ca saṃgrāme kruddhair api surāsuraiḥ /
analyzed: apradhṛṣyaḥ ca saṃgrāme kruddhaiḥ api sura asuraiḥ
translated: And is unassailable in battle, even by angry gods and demons.

original: anasūyo jitakrodho na dṛpto na ca matsarī /
analyzed: anasūyaḥ jita krodhaḥ na dṛptaḥ na ca matsarī
translated: And is free from envy, has conquered anger, is not arrogant, and is not jealous.

original: na cāvamantā bhūtānāṃ na ca kālavaśānugaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca avamantā bhūtānām na ca kāla vaśa anugaḥ
translated: And does not despise beings, and is not under the sway of time.

original: evaṃ śreṣṭhair guṇair yuktaḥ prajānāṃ pārthivātmajaḥ /
analyzed: evam śreṣṭhaiḥ guṇaiḥ yuktaḥ prajānām pārthiva ātmajaḥ
translated: Thus, the son of the king, endowed with such excellent qualities,

original: saṃmatas triṣu lokeṣu vasudhāyāḥ kṣamāguṇaiḥ /
analyzed: saṃmataḥ triṣu lokeṣu vasudhāyāḥ kṣamā guṇaiḥ
translated: Is revered in the three worlds, by the earth's quality of forgiveness.

original: buddhyā bṛhaspates tulyo vīryeṇāpi śacīpateḥ // / / //🔽tathā sarvaprajākāntaiḥ prītisaṃjananaiḥ pituḥ /
analyzed: buddhyā bṛhaspateḥ tulyaḥ vīryeṇa api śacīpateḥ  tathā sarva prajā kāntaiḥ prīti saṃjananaiḥ pituḥ
translated: And is equal to Brihaspati in intellect, and to Indra in valor.🔽And in this way, Rama shines with the qualities that delight his father and are beloved by all the people,

original: guṇair viruruce rāmo dīptaḥ sūrya ivāṃśubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: guṇaiḥ viruruce rāmaḥ dīptaḥ sūryaḥ iva aṃśubhiḥ
translated: Like the sun shining with its rays.

original: tam evaṃvṛttasampannam apradhṛṣyaparākramam /
analyzed: tam evam vṛtta sampannam apradhṛṣya parākramam
translated: That king, who was endowed with good conduct and invincible prowess,

original: lokapālopamaṃ nātham akāmayata medinī // / / //
analyzed: lokapāla upamam nātham akāmayata medinī
translated: and who was like the guardian of the world, the earth desired.

original: etais tu bahubhir yuktaṃ guṇair anupamaiḥ sutam /
analyzed: etaiḥ tu bahubhiḥ yuktam guṇaiḥ anupamaiḥ sutam
translated: Seeing his son endowed with these many incomparable virtues,

original: dṛṣṭvā daśaratho rājā cakre cintāṃ paraṃtapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā daśarathaḥ rājā cakre cintām paraṃtapaḥ
translated: King Dasharatha, the scorcher of enemies, began to think.

original: eṣā hy asya parā prītir hṛdi samparivartate /
analyzed: eṣā hi asya parā prītiḥ hṛdi samparivartate
translated: For this supreme joy was always turning in his heart:

original: kadā nāma sutaṃ drakṣyāmy abhiṣiktam ahaṃ priyam // / / //
analyzed: kadā nāma sutam drakṣyāmi abhiṣiktam aham priyam
translated: When shall I see my beloved son consecrated?

original: vṛddhikāmo hi lokasya sarvabhūtānukampanaḥ /
analyzed: vṛddhi kāmaḥ hi lokasya sarva bhūta anukampanaḥ
translated: Desiring the welfare of the world and compassionate towards all beings,

original: mattaḥ priyataro loke parjanya iva vṛṣṭimān // / / //
analyzed: mattaḥ priyataraḥ loke parjanyaḥ iva vṛṣṭimān
translated: he was dearer to the people than I, like rain-bearing Parjanya.

original: yamaśakrasamo vīrye bṛhaspatisamo matau /
analyzed: yama śakra samaḥ vīrye bṛhaspati samaḥ matau
translated: Equal to Yama and Shakra in valor, equal to Brihaspati in intellect,

original: mahīdharasamo dhṛtyāṃ mattaś ca guṇavattaraḥ // / / //🔽mahīm aham imāṃ kṛtsnām adhitiṣṭhantam ātmajam /
analyzed: mahīdhara samaḥ dhṛtyām mattaḥ ca guṇavattaraḥ  mahīm aham imām kṛtsnām adhitiṣṭhantam ātmajam
translated: equal to the earth-supporting mountains in forbearance, and superior to me in virtues,🔽seeing my son ruling this entire earth,

original: anena vayasā dṛṣṭvā yathā svargam avāpnuyām // / / //
analyzed: anena vayasā dṛṣṭvā yathā svargam avāpnuyām
translated: at this age, I shall attain heaven.

original: taṃ samīkṣya mahārājo yuktaṃ samuditair guṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tam samīkṣya mahā rājaḥ yuktam samuditaiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: Seeing him endowed with all these qualities, the great king,

original: niścitya sacivaiḥ sārdhaṃ yuvarājam amanyata // / / //
analyzed: niścitya sacivaiḥ sārdham yuvarājam amanyata
translated: after consulting with his ministers, considered him fit to be the prince regent.

original: nānānagaravāstavyān pṛthagjānapadān api /
analyzed: nānā nagara vāstavyān pṛthak jānapadān api
translated: Those who live in various cities and countries, even the ordinary people,

original: samānināya medinyāḥ pradhānān pṛthivīpatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: samānināya medinyāḥ pradhānān pṛthivīpatiḥ
translated: The lord of the earth brought together the foremost men from various cities and provinces residing in the country.

original: atha rājavitīrṇeṣu vividheṣv āsaneṣu ca /
analyzed: atha rāja vitīrṇeṣu vividheṣu āsaneṣu ca
translated: Then, on various seats offered by the king,

original: rājānam evābhimukhā niṣedur niyatā nṛpāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rājānam eva abhimukhāḥ niṣeduḥ niyatāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: the kings sat facing the king, restrained.

original: sa labdhamānair vinayānvitair nṛpaiḥ purālayair jānapadaiś ca mānavaiḥ /
analyzed: sa labdha mānaiḥ vinaya anvitaiḥ nṛpaiḥ pura ālayaiḥ jānapadaiḥ ca mānavaiḥ
translated: Surrounded by those kings who had obtained honor and were endowed with humility, by the citizens and country people,

original: upopaviṣṭair nṛpatir vṛto babhau sahasracakṣur bhagavān ivāmaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: upopaviṣṭaiḥ nṛpatiḥ vṛtaḥ babhau sahasracakṣuḥ bhagavān iva amaraiḥ
translated: the king shone like the thousand-eyed lord surrounded by the immortals.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tataḥ pariṣadaṃ sarvām āmantrya vasudhādhipaḥ /
analyzed: tatas pariṣadam sarvām āmantrya vasudhādhipaḥ
translated: Then, addressing the entire assembly, the lord of the earth,

original: hitam uddharṣaṇaṃ cedam uvācāpratimaṃ vacaḥ // / / //🔽dundubhisvanakalpena gambhīreṇānunādinā /
analyzed: hitam uddharṣaṇam ca idam uvāca apratimam vacaḥ  dundubhi svana kalpena gambhīreṇa anunādinā
translated: spoke these incomparable words, beneficial and inspiring.🔽With a great voice deep and resonant like the sound of a drum,

original: svareṇa mahatā rājā jīmūta iva nādayan // / / //
analyzed: svareṇa mahatā rājā jīmūtaḥ iva nādayan
translated: the king, resounding like a cloud,

original: so 'ham ikṣvākubhiḥ pūrvair narendraiḥ paripālitam /
analyzed: saḥ ham ikṣvākubhiḥ pūrvaiḥ narendraiḥ paripālitam
translated: I, who am protected by the former kings of the Ikshvaku dynasty,

original: śreyasā yoktukāmo 'smi sukhārham akhilaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: śreyasā yoktu kāmaḥ smi sukha arham akhilam jagat
translated: desiring to unite the entire world, worthy of happiness, with prosperity,

original: mayāpy ācaritaṃ pūrvaiḥ panthānam anugacchatā /
analyzed: mayā api ācaritam pūrvaiḥ panthānam anugacchatā
translated: following the path followed by my ancestors,

original: prajā nityam atandreṇa yathāśakty abhirakṣatā // / / //🔽idaṃ śarīraṃ kṛtsnasya lokasya caratā hitam /
analyzed: prajāḥ nityam atandreṇa yathāśakti abhirakṣatā  idam śarīram kṛtsnasya lokasya caratā hitam
translated: Always protecting the subjects without laziness, to the best of his ability.

original: pāṇḍur asyātapatrasya chāyāyāṃ jaritaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: pāṇḍuḥ asya ātapatrasya chāyāyām jaritam mayā
translated: This body of mine has served the welfare of the entire world, moving about in the shade of this white parasol.

original: prāpya varṣasahasrāṇi bahūny āyūṃṣi jīvitaḥ /
analyzed: prāpya varṣa sahasrāṇi bahūni āyūṃṣi jīvitaḥ
translated: Having lived for many thousands of years, having attained long life,

original: jīrṇasyāsya śarīrasya viśrāntim abhirocaye // / / //
analyzed: jīrṇasya asya śarīrasya viśrāntim abhirocaye
translated: I desire rest for this aged body.

original: rājaprabhāvajuṣṭāṃ hi durvahām ajitendriyaiḥ /
analyzed: rāja prabhāva juṣṭām hi durvahām ajita indriyaiḥ
translated: For it is difficult for those who have not conquered their senses to bear the glory of kingship,

original: pariśrānto 'smi lokasya gurvīṃ dharmadhuraṃ vahan // / / //
analyzed: pariśrāntaḥ smi lokasya gurvīm dharma dhuram vahan
translated: I am exhausted from bearing the heavy burden of dharma for the world.

original: so 'haṃ viśramam icchāmi putraṃ kṛtvā prajāhite /
analyzed: saḥ ham viśramam icchāmi putram kṛtvā prajā hite
translated: Therefore, desiring rest, I wish to place my son in the welfare of the subjects,

original: saṃnikṛṣṭān imān sarvān anumānya dvijarṣabhān // / / //
analyzed: saṃnikṛṣṭān imān sarvān anumānya dvijarṣabhān
translated: Having consulted with all these eminent brahmins who are close to me.

original: anujāto hi me sarvair guṇair jyeṣṭho mamātmajaḥ /
analyzed: anujātaḥ hi me sarvaiḥ guṇaiḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ mama ātmajaḥ
translated: For my eldest son, born after me, is endowed with all good qualities,

original: puraṃdarasamo vīrye rāmaḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: puraṃdara samaḥ vīrye rāmaḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ
translated: Rama, the conqueror of enemy cities, equal to Purandara in valor.

original: taṃ candram iva puṣyeṇa yuktaṃ dharmabhṛtāṃ varam /
analyzed: tam candram iva puṣyeṇa yuktam dharma bhṛtām varam
translated: Like the moon in conjunction with Pushya, that best of righteous ones,

original: yauvarājyena yoktāsmi prītaḥ puruṣapuṃgavam // / / //
analyzed: yauvarājyena yoktāsmi prītaḥ puruṣa puṃgavam
translated: I am pleased to appoint that bull among men as heir apparent.

original: anurūpaḥ sa vo nātho lakṣmīvāṃl lakṣmaṇāgrajaḥ /
analyzed: anurūpaḥ sa vaḥ nāthaḥ lakṣmīvān lakṣmaṇa agrajaḥ
translated: Lakshmana's elder brother, endowed with good fortune, is a suitable lord for you all.

original: trailokyam api nāthena yena syān nāthavattaram // / / //
analyzed: trailokyam api nāthena yena syāt nāthavattaram
translated: By whom even the three worlds would be more protected, though already well-protected.

original: anena śreyasā sadyaḥ saṃyojyāham imāṃ mahīm /
analyzed: anena śreyasā sadyas saṃyojya aham imām mahīm
translated: Having immediately united this earth with this prosperity,

original: gatakleśo bhaviṣyāmi sute tasmin niveśya vai // / / //
analyzed: gata kleśaḥ bhaviṣyāmi sute tasmin niveśya vai
translated: I shall be free from sorrow, having installed my son in the kingdom.

original: iti bruvantaṃ muditāḥ pratyanandan nṛpā nṛpam /
analyzed: iti bruvantam muditāḥ pratyanandat nṛpāḥ nṛpam
translated: Thus spoke the king, and the delighted kings rejoiced in the king,

original: vṛṣṭimantaṃ mahāmeghaṃ nardantam iva barhiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛṣṭimantam mahā megham nardantam iva barhiṇaḥ
translated: Like peacocks crying in joy at the thundering of a great rain-bearing cloud.

original: tasya dharmārthaviduṣo bhāvam ājñāya sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: tasya dharma artha viduṣaḥ bhāvam ājñāya sarvaśas
translated: Having understood in every way the intention of the one who knows dharma and artha,

original: ūcuś ca manasā jñātvā vṛddhaṃ daśarathaṃ nṛpam // / / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ ca manasā jñātvā vṛddham daśaratham nṛpam
translated: They spoke, having mentally understood the aged king Dasharatha.

original: anekavarṣasāhasro vṛddhas tvam asi pārthiva /
analyzed: aneka varṣa sāhasraḥ vṛddhaḥ tvam asi pārthiva
translated: You are aged, O king, having endured many thousands of years,

original: sa rāmaṃ yuvarājānam abhiṣiñcasva pārthivam // / / //
analyzed: sa rāmam yuvarājānam abhiṣiñcasva pārthivam
translated: Therefore, consecrate Rama as the prince regent, O king.

original: iti tadvacanaṃ śrutvā rājā teṣāṃ manaḥpriyam /
analyzed: iti tat vacanam śrutvā rājā teṣām manaḥ priyam
translated: Having heard these words pleasing to their minds,

original: ajānann iva jijñāsur idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: a jānan iva jijñāsuḥ idam vacanam abravīt
translated: The king, as if not knowing, but desiring to know, spoke these words:

original: kathaṃ nu mayi dharmeṇa pṛthivīm anuśāsati /
analyzed: katham nu mayi dharmeṇa pṛthivīm anuśāsati
translated: How is it that while I am righteously ruling the earth,

original: bhavanto draṣṭum icchanti yuvarājaṃ mamātmajam // / / //
analyzed: bhavantaḥ draṣṭum icchanti yuvarājam mama ātmajam
translated: You desire to see my son as the prince regent?

original: te tam ūcur mahātmānaṃ paurajānapadaiḥ saha /
analyzed: te tam ūcuḥ mahātmānam paura jānapadaiḥ saha
translated: They spoke to the great-souled one, along with the citizens and country people:🔽 O king, we do not desire the kingdom for ourselves, nor do we desire to obtain wealth.🔽We desire the consecration of Rama, the best of men, as the prince regent.

original: bahavo nṛpa kalyāṇā guṇāḥ putrasya santi te // / / //
analyzed: bahavaḥ nṛpa kalyāṇāḥ guṇāḥ putrasya santi te
translated: O king, your son possesses many auspicious qualities.

original: divyair guṇaiḥ śakrasamo rāmaḥ satyaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: divyaiḥ guṇaiḥ śakra samaḥ rāmaḥ satya parākramaḥ
translated: Rama, who is equal to Shakra in divine qualities and whose prowess is truth,

original: ikṣvākubhyo hi sarvebhyo 'py atirakto viśāmpate // / / //
analyzed: ikṣvākubhyaḥ hi sarvebhyaḥ pi atiraktaḥ viśām pate
translated: is superior to all the Ikshvakus, O lord of the people.

original: rāmaḥ satpuruṣo loke satyadharmaparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ sat puruṣaḥ loke satya dharma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Rama is a virtuous man in the world, devoted to truth and righteousness.

original: dharmajñaḥ satyasaṃdhaś ca śīlavān anasūyakaḥ // / / //🔽kṣāntaḥ sāntvayitā ślakṣṇaḥ kṛtajño vijitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: dharma jñaḥ satya saṃdhaḥ ca śīlavān anasūyakaḥ  kṣāntaḥ sāntvayitā ślakṣṇaḥ kṛtajñaḥ vijita indriyaḥ
translated: He knows dharma, is true to his word, has good character, is free from malice.🔽He is patient, conciliatory, smooth, grateful, and has conquered his senses.

original: mṛduś ca sthiracittaś ca sadā bhavyo 'nasūyakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mṛduḥ ca sthira cittaḥ ca sadā bhavyaḥ nasūyakaḥ
translated: He is gentle, steadfast, always virtuous, and free from malice.

original: priyavādī ca bhūtānāṃ satyavādī ca rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: priya vādī ca bhūtānām satya vādī ca rāghavaḥ
translated: Rama is a pleasant speaker and truthful to all beings.

original: bahuśrutānāṃ vṛddhānāṃ brāhmaṇānām upāsitā // / / //
analyzed: bahuśrutānām vṛddhānām brāhmaṇānām upāsitā
translated: He has served the learned, the aged, and the Brahmins.

original: tenāsyehātulā kīrtir yaśas tejaś ca vardhate /
analyzed: tena asya iha atulā kīrtiḥ yaśaḥ tejaḥ ca vardhate
translated: Therefore, his fame, glory, and splendor increase here immeasurably.

original: devāsuramanuṣyāṇāṃ sarvāstreṣu viśāradaḥ // / / //
analyzed: deva asura manuṣyāṇām sarva astreṣu viśāradaḥ
translated: He is skilled in all weapons among gods, demons, and humans.

original: yadā vrajati saṃgrāmaṃ grāmārthe nagarasya vā /
analyzed: yadā vrajati saṃgrāmam grāma arthe nagarasya vā
translated: When he goes to battle for the sake of a village or a city,

original: gatvā saumitrisahito nāvijitya nivartate // / / //
analyzed: gatvā saumitri sahitaḥ na a vijitya nivartate
translated: having gone with Lakshmana, he does not return without conquering.

original: saṃgrāmāt punar āgamya kuñjareṇa rathena vā /
analyzed: saṃgrāmāt punar āgamya kuñjareṇa rathena vā
translated: Having returned from battle, either on an elephant or in a chariot,

original: paurān svajanavan nityaṃ kuśalaṃ paripṛcchati // / / //
analyzed: paurān sva jana vat nityam kuśalam paripṛcchati
translated: Always inquires about the welfare of the citizens as if they were his own relatives.

original: putreṣv agniṣu dāreṣu preṣyaśiṣyagaṇeṣu ca /
analyzed: putreṣu agniṣu dāreṣu preṣya śiṣya gaṇeṣu ca
translated: Regarding his sons, sacrificial fires, wife, servants, and disciples,

original: nikhilenānupūrvyā ca pitā putrān ivaurasān // / / //
analyzed: nikhilena ānupūrvyā ca pitā putrān iva aurasān
translated: In every way and in due order, like a father to his own uterine sons.

original: śuśrūṣante ca vaḥ śiṣyāḥ kaccit karmasu daṃśitāḥ /
analyzed: śuśrūṣante ca vaḥ śiṣyāḥ kaccit karmasu daṃśitāḥ
translated: Do your disciples serve you? Are they diligent in their tasks?

original: iti naḥ puruṣavyāghraḥ sadā rāmo 'bhibhāṣate // / / //
analyzed: iti naḥ puruṣa vyāghraḥ sadā rāmaḥ abhibhāṣate
translated: Thus does Rama, the tiger among men, always address us.

original: vyasaneṣu manuṣyāṇāṃ bhṛśaṃ bhavati duḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: vyasaneṣu manuṣyāṇām bhṛśam bhavati duḥkhitaḥ
translated: He is deeply distressed by the misfortunes of men,

original: utsaveṣu ca sarveṣu piteva parituṣyati // / / //
analyzed: utsaveṣu ca sarveṣu pitā iva parituṣyati
translated: And rejoices like a father in all their festivities.

original: satyavādī maheṣvāso vṛddhasevī jitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: satya vādī mahā iṣvāsaḥ vṛddha sevī jita indriyaḥ
translated: He is truthful, a great archer, attends to the elderly, and has conquered his senses.

original: vatsaḥ śreyasi jātas te diṣṭyāsau tava rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: vatsaḥ śreyasi jātaḥ te diṣṭyā asau tava rāghavaḥ
translated: By good fortune, this Raghava has been born to you as a son, for your welfare.

original: diṣṭyā putraguṇair yukto mārīca iva kaśyapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: diṣṭyā putra guṇaiḥ yuktaḥ mārīcaḥ iva kaśyapaḥ
translated: By good fortune, he is endowed with the qualities of a son, like Maricha to Kashyapa.

original: balam ārogyam āyuś ca rāmasya viditātmanaḥ /
analyzed: balam ārogyam āyuḥ ca rāmasya vidita ātmanaḥ
translated: The strength, health, and longevity of Rama, who knows his own self,

original: āśaṃsate janaḥ sarvo rāṣṭre puravare tathā // / / //
analyzed: āśaṃsate janaḥ sarvaḥ rāṣṭre puravare tathā
translated: Are desired by all the people in the city and the kingdom.

original: abhyantaraś ca bāhyaś ca paurajānapado janaḥ /
analyzed: abhyantaraḥ ca bāhyaḥ ca paura jānapadaḥ janaḥ
translated: The people within and outside, the citizens and country dwellers,

original: striyo vṛddhās taruṇyaś ca sāyamprātaḥ samāhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: striyaḥ vṛddhāḥ taruṇyaḥ ca sāyamprātar samāhitāḥ
translated: The women, the elderly, and the young, are devoted in the morning and evening.

original: sarvān devān namasyanti rāmasyārthe yaśasvinaḥ /
analyzed: sarvān devān namasyanti rāmasya arthe yaśasvinaḥ
translated: All the illustrious gods are bowing down for Rama's sake.

original: teṣām āyācitaṃ deva tvatprasādāt samṛdhyatām // / / //
analyzed: teṣām āyācitam deva tvad prasādāt samṛdhyatām
translated: O God, may their prayers be fulfilled through your grace.

original: rāmam indīvaraśyāmaṃ sarvaśatrunibarhaṇam /
analyzed: rāmam indīvara śyāmam sarva śatru nibarhaṇam
translated: We wish to see Rama, dark like a blue lotus, the destroyer of all enemies,

original: paśyāmo yauvarājyasthaṃ tava rājottamātmajam // / / //
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ yauvarājya stham tava rāja uttama ātmajam
translated: installed as the heir apparent, O best of kings, as your son.

original: taṃ devadevopamam ātmajaṃ te sarvasya lokasya hite niviṣṭam /
analyzed: tam devadeva upamam ātmajam te sarvasya lokasya hite niviṣṭam
translated: Your son, who is like the god of gods, who is devoted to the welfare of the entire world,

original: hitāya naḥ kṣipram udārajuṣṭaṃ mudābhiṣektuṃ varada tvam arhasi // / / //
analyzed: hitāya naḥ kṣipram udāra juṣṭam mudā abhiṣektum vara da tvam arhasi
translated: for our welfare, O bestower of boons, you should joyfully and quickly consecrate him, who is loved by the magnanimous.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: teṣām añjalipadmāni pragṛhītāni sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām añjali padmāni pragṛhītāni sarvaśas
translated: All of them held their folded palms like lotus flowers.

original: pratigṛhyābravīd rājā tebhyaḥ priyahitaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratigṛhya abravīt rājā tebhyaḥ priya hitam vacaḥ
translated: Accepting them, the king spoke words of love and benefit to them.

original: aho 'smi paramaprītaḥ prabhāvaś cātulo mama /
analyzed: aho smi parama prītaḥ prabhāvaḥ ca atulaḥ mama
translated: Oh, I am extremely delighted and my power is immeasurable,

original: yan me jyeṣṭhaṃ priyaṃ putraṃ yauvarājyastham icchatha // / / //🔽iti pratyarcya tān rājā brāhmaṇān idam abravīt /
analyzed: yat me jyeṣṭham priyam putram yauvarājya stham icchatha  iti pratyarcya tān rājā brāhmaṇān idam abravīt
translated: that you all desire my eldest beloved son to be the heir apparent.🔽 Thus, the king honored those Brahmins and said this to Vasishtha and Vamadeva,

original: vasiṣṭhaṃ vāmadevaṃ ca teṣām evopaśṛṇvatām // / / //
analyzed: vasiṣṭham vāmadevam ca teṣām eva upaśṛṇvatām
translated: while they were listening,

original: caitraḥ śrīmān ayaṃ māsaḥ puṇyaḥ puṣpitakānanaḥ /
analyzed: caitraḥ śrīmān ayam māsaḥ puṇyaḥ puṣpita kānanaḥ
translated: This month of Chaitra is auspicious, with blossoming forests, and is the best of all months.

original: yauvarājyāya rāmasya sarvam evopakalpyatām // / / //
analyzed: yauvarājyāya rāmasya sarvam eva upakalpyatām
translated: Let everything be prepared for the installation of Rama as the heir apparent.

original: kṛtam ity eva cābrūtām abhigamya jagatpatim /
analyzed: kṛtam iti eva ca abrūtām abhigamya jagatpatim
translated: And having approached the lord of the world, they said, It is done,

original: yathoktavacanaṃ prītau harṣayuktau dvijarṣabhau // / / //
analyzed: yathā ukta vacanam prītau harṣa yuktau dvijarṣabhau
translated: and the two bulls among Brahmins, delighted and full of joy, spoke the words as they had been instructed.

original: tataḥ sumantraṃ dyutimān rājā vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: tatas sumantram dyutimān rājā vacanam abravīt
translated: Then the radiant king spoke to Sumantra,

original: rāmaḥ kṛtātmā bhavatā śīghram ānīyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ kṛta ātmā bhavatā śīghram ānīyatām iti
translated: Bring Rama here quickly, with his soul purified.

original: sa tatheti pratijñāya sumantro rājaśāsanāt /
analyzed: sa tathā iti pratijñāya sumantraḥ rāja śāsanāt
translated: Sumantra, having promised, So be it, by the king's command,

original: rāmaṃ tatrānayāṃcakre rathena rathināṃ varam // / / //🔽atha tatra samāsīnās tadā daśarathaṃ nṛpam /
analyzed: rāmam tatra ānayāṃcakre rathena rathinām varam  atha tatra samāsīnāḥ tadā daśaratham nṛpam
translated: brought Rama, the best of charioteers, there by chariot.🔽Then the kings from the east, north, west, and south,

original: prācyodīcyāḥ pratīcyāś ca dākṣiṇātyāś ca bhūmipāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prācya udīcyāḥ pratīcyāḥ ca dākṣiṇātyāḥ ca bhūmipāḥ
translated: who were seated there,

original: mlecchāś cāryāś ca ye cānye vanaśailāntavāsinaḥ /
analyzed: mlecchāḥ ca āryāḥ ca ye ca anye vana śaila anta vāsinaḥ
translated: the Mlecchas, Aryas, and others who lived in the forests and mountains,

original: upāsāṃcakrire sarve taṃ devā iva vāsavam // / / //
analyzed: upāsāṃcakrire sarve tam devāḥ iva vāsavam
translated: all worshipped him as the gods do Indra.

original: teṣāṃ madhye sa rājarṣir marutām iva vāsavaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām madhye sa rājarṣiḥ marutām iva vāsavaḥ
translated: The royal sage, like Indra among the Maruts,

original: prāsādastho rathagataṃ dadarśāyāntam ātmajam // / / //
analyzed: prāsāda sthaḥ ratha gatam dadarśa āyāntam ātmajam
translated: seated in the palace, saw his son coming on a chariot.

original: gandharvarājapratimaṃ loke vikhyātapauruṣam /
analyzed: gandharvarāja pratimam loke vikhyāta pauruṣam
translated: Resembling the king of the Gandharvas, renowned for his manliness in the world,

original: dīrghabāhuṃ mahāsattvaṃ mattamātaṃgagāminam // / / //
analyzed: dīrgha bāhum mahāsattvam matta mātaṃga gāminam
translated: Long-armed, of great strength, and having the gait of an elephant in rut.

original: candrakāntānanaṃ rāmam atīva priyadarśanam /
analyzed: candrakānta ānanam rāmam atīva priya darśanam
translated: Rama, whose face is lovely like the moon, and who is extremely handsome to behold,

original: rūpaudāryaguṇaiḥ puṃsāṃ dṛṣṭicittāpahāriṇam // / / //
analyzed: rūpa audārya guṇaiḥ puṃsām dṛṣṭi citta apahāriṇam
translated: With his beauty, magnanimity, and virtues, he captivates the eyes and minds of men.

original: gharmābhitaptāḥ parjanyaṃ hlādayantam iva prajāḥ /
analyzed: gharma abhitaptāḥ parjanyam hlādayantam iva prajāḥ
translated: Like the people are delighted by the rain when they are scorched by heat,

original: na tatarpa samāyāntaṃ paśyamāno narādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tatarpa samāyāntam paśyamānaḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: The king, beholding him coming, was not satisfied.

original: avatārya sumantras taṃ rāghavaṃ syandanottamāt /
analyzed: avatārya sumantraḥ tam rāghavam syandana uttamāt
translated: Sumantra, having brought down Raghava from the excellent chariot,

original: pituḥ samīpaṃ gacchantaṃ prāñjaliḥ pṛṣṭhato 'nvagāt // / / //🔽sa taṃ kailāsaśṛṅgābhaṃ prāsādaṃ narapuṃgavaḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ samīpam gacchantam prāñjaliḥ pṛṣṭhatas nvagāt  sa tam kailāsa śṛṅga ābham prāsādam nara puṃgavaḥ
translated: With folded hands followed him from behind as he was going towards his father.🔽That bull among men, Raghava, along with the charioteer,

original: āruroha nṛpaṃ draṣṭuṃ saha sūtena rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āruroha nṛpam draṣṭum saha sūtena rāghavaḥ
translated: Ascended the palace resembling the peak of Kailash to see the king.

original: sa prāñjalir abhipretya praṇataḥ pitur antike /
analyzed: sa prāñjaliḥ abhipretya praṇataḥ pituḥ antike
translated: Approaching his father with folded hands, he bowed down,

original: nāma svaṃ śrāvayan rāmo vavande caraṇau pituḥ // / / //🔽taṃ dṛṣṭvā praṇataṃ pārśve kṛtāñjalipuṭaṃ nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: nāma svam śrāvayan rāmaḥ vavande caraṇau pituḥ  tam dṛṣṭvā praṇatam pārśve kṛta añjali puṭam nṛpaḥ
translated: And announcing his name, he saluted his father's feet.🔽Seeing him bowing down at his side with folded hands, the king

original: gṛhyāñjalau samākṛṣya sasvaje priyam ātmajam // / / //
analyzed: gṛhya añjalau samākṛṣya sasvaje priyam ātmajam
translated: Took him by the hands, drew him close, and embraced his beloved son.

original: tasmai cābhyudyataṃ śrīmān maṇikāñcanabhūṣitam /
analyzed: tasmai ca abhyudyatam śrīmān maṇi kāñcana bhūṣitam
translated: To him, the prosperous one, adorned with jewels and gold,

original: dideśa rājā ruciraṃ rāmāya paramāsanam // / / //
analyzed: dideśa rājā ruciram rāmāya parama āsanam
translated: the king gave Rama a beautiful and excellent seat.

original: tad āsanavaraṃ prāpya vyadīpayata rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: tat āsana varam prāpya vyadīpayata rāghavaḥ
translated: Having reached that excellent seat, Raghava shone forth,

original: svayeva prabhayā merum udaye vimalo raviḥ // / / //
analyzed: svayā iva prabhayā merum udaye vimalaḥ raviḥ
translated: like the clear sun rising on Mount Meru with its own radiance.

original: tena vibhrājitā tatra sā sabhābhivyarocata /
analyzed: tena vibhrājitā tatra sā sabhā abhivyarocata
translated: The assembly there was illuminated by him and shone forth,

original: vimalagrahanakṣatrā śāradī dyaur ivendunā // / / //
analyzed: vimala graha nakṣatrā śāradī dyauḥ iva indunā
translated: like the autumn sky with clear planets, stars and the moon.

original: taṃ paśyamāno nṛpatis tutoṣa priyam ātmajam /
analyzed: tam paśyamānaḥ nṛpatiḥ tutoṣa priyam ātmajam
translated: The king, seeing his beloved son, was delighted,

original: alaṃkṛtam ivātmānam ādarśatalasaṃsthitam // / / //
analyzed: alaṃkṛtam iva ātmānam ādarśa tala saṃsthitam
translated: like one seeing one's own adorned self reflected in a mirror.

original: sa taṃ sasmitam ābhāṣya putraṃ putravatāṃ varaḥ /
analyzed: sa tam sa smitam ābhāṣya putram putravatām varaḥ
translated: The best of those who have sons, having spoken to his smiling son,

original: uvācedaṃ vaco rājā devendram iva kaśyapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca idam vacaḥ rājā deva indram iva kaśyapaḥ
translated: the king spoke these words, like Kashyapa to Indra of the gods.

original: jyeṣṭhāyām asi me patnyāṃ sadṛśyāṃ sadṛśaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāyām asi me patnyām sadṛśyām sadṛśaḥ sutaḥ
translated: On my eldest wife, who is your equal, a son equal to her has been born.

original: utpannas tvaṃ guṇaśreṣṭho mama rāmātmajaḥ priyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utpannaḥ tvam guṇa śreṣṭhaḥ mama rāma ātmajaḥ priyaḥ
translated: You, O Rama, my dear son, have been born as the best of qualities.

original: tvayā yataḥ prajāś cemāḥ svaguṇair anurañjitāḥ /
analyzed: tvayā yatas prajāḥ ca imāḥ sva guṇaiḥ anurañjitāḥ
translated: Since these subjects have been delighted by you with your own qualities,

original: tasmāt tvaṃ puṣyayogena yauvarājyam avāpnuhi // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt tvam puṣya yogena yauvarājyam avāpnuhi
translated: therefore, by the conjunction of Pushya, you should attain the status of heir apparent.

original: kāmatas tvaṃ prakṛtyaiva vinīto guṇavān asi /
analyzed: kāmatas tvam prakṛtyā eva vinītaḥ guṇavān asi
translated: You are naturally humble and virtuous, even out of desire.

original: guṇavaty api tu snehāt putra vakṣyāmi te hitam // / / //
analyzed: guṇavati api tu snehāt putra vakṣyāmi te hitam
translated: But out of affection, O son of good qualities, I will tell you what is for your welfare.

original: bhūyo vinayam āsthāya bhava nityaṃ jitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas vinayam āsthāya bhava nityam jita indriyaḥ
translated: Again, adopting humility, always be self-controlled.

original: kāmakrodhasamutthāni tyajethā vyasanāni ca // / / //
analyzed: kāma krodha samutthāni tyajethāḥ vyasanāni ca
translated: And abandon the vices arising from desire and anger.

original: parokṣayā vartamāno vṛttyā pratyakṣayā tathā /
analyzed: parokṣayā vartamānaḥ vṛttyā pratyakṣayā tathā
translated: Conducting yourself in secret and openly,

original: amātyaprabhṛtīḥ sarvāḥ prakṛtīś cānurañjaya // / / //🔽tuṣṭānuraktaprakṛtir yaḥ pālayati medinīm /
analyzed: amātya prabhṛtīḥ sarvāḥ prakṛtīḥ ca anurañjaya  tuṣṭa anurakta prakṛtiḥ yaḥ pālayati medinīm
translated: Please all the subjects, starting with the ministers.🔽He whose subjects are satisfied and devoted, who protects the earth,

original: tasya nandanti mitrāṇi labdhvāmṛtam ivāmarāḥ /
analyzed: tasya nandanti mitrāṇi labdhvā amṛtam iva amarāḥ
translated: His friends rejoice, as if having obtained nectar, like the immortals.

original: tasmāt putra tvam ātmānaṃ niyamyaiva samācara // / / //🔽tac chrutvā suhṛdas tasya rāmasya priyakāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt putra tvam ātmānam niyamya eva samācara  tat śrutvā suhṛdaḥ tasya rāmasya priya kāriṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, O son, having restrained yourself, act accordingly.🔽Having heard that, Rama's well-wishers, who do what is pleasing to him,

original: tvaritāḥ śīghram abhyetya kausalyāyai nyavedayan // / / //🔽sā hiraṇyaṃ ca gāś caiva ratnāni vividhāni ca /
analyzed: tvaritāḥ śīghram abhyetya kausalyāyai nyavedayan  sā hiraṇyam ca gāḥ ca eva ratnāni vividhāni ca
translated: Quickly approached and informed Kausalya.🔽That best of women, Kausalya, distributed gold, cows, and various jewels

original: vyādideśa priyākhyebhyaḥ kausalyā pramadottamā // / / //
analyzed: vyādideśa priya ākhyebhyaḥ kausalyā pramadā uttamā
translated: To her beloved ones.

original: athābhivādya rājānaṃ ratham āruhya rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: atha abhivādya rājānam ratham āruhya rāghavaḥ
translated: Then, having greeted the king, Raghava, mounted on a chariot,

original: yayau svaṃ dyutimad veśma janaughaiḥ pratipūjitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yayau svam dyutimat veśma jana oghaiḥ pratipūjitaḥ
translated: Went to his own radiant abode, honored by the multitude of people.

original: te cāpi paurā nṛpater vacas tacchrutvā tadā lābham iveṣṭam āpya /
analyzed: te ca api paurāḥ nṛpateḥ vacaḥ tat śrutvā tadā lābham iva iṣṭam āpya
translated: And those citizens, having heard those words of the king, as if having obtained a desired gain,

original: narendram āmantrya gṛhāṇi gatvā devān samānarcur atīva hṛṣṭāḥ // / / //
analyzed: narendram āmantrya gṛhāṇi gatvā devān samānarcuḥ atīva hṛṣṭāḥ
translated: having taken leave of the lord of men and gone to their homes, worshipped the gods with great joy.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: gateṣv atha nṛpo bhūyaḥ paureṣu saha mantribhiḥ /
analyzed: gateṣu atha nṛpaḥ bhūyas paureṣu saha mantribhiḥ
translated: Then, after the citizens had left, the king, together with his ministers,

original: mantrayitvā tataś cakre niścayajñaḥ sa niścayam // / / //
analyzed: mantrayitvā tatas cakre niścaya jñaḥ sa niścayam
translated: counseled and then, knowing what should be done, made up his mind.

original: śva eva puṣyo bhavitā śvo 'bhiṣecyas tu me sutaḥ /
analyzed: śvas eva puṣyaḥ bhavitā śvas bhiṣecyaḥ tu me sutaḥ
translated: Tomorrow Pushya will be, and tomorrow my son will be consecrated,

original: rāmo rājīvatāmrākṣo yauvarājya iti prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ rājīva tāmra akṣaḥ yauvarājye iti prabhuḥ
translated: the lord Rama, with eyes like lotus petals, as prince regent.

original: athāntargṛham āviśya rājā daśarathas tadā /
analyzed: atha antargṛham āviśya rājā daśarathaḥ tadā
translated: Then King Dasharatha, having entered the inner quarters,

original: sūtam ājñāpayāmāsa rāmaṃ punar ihānaya // / / //
analyzed: sūtam ājñāpayāmāsa rāmam punar iha ānaya
translated: commanded the charioteer, Bring Rama here again.

original: pratigṛhya sa tadvākyaṃ sūtaḥ punar upāyayau /
analyzed: pratigṛhya sa tat vākyam sūtaḥ punar upāyayau
translated: Having accepted those words, the charioteer went again,

original: rāmasya bhavanaṃ śīghraṃ rāmam ānayituṃ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmasya bhavanam śīghram rāmam ānayitum punar
translated: quickly to Rama's abode to bring Rama back.

original: dvāḥsthair āveditaṃ tasya rāmāyāgamanaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: dvāḥsthaiḥ āveditam tasya rāmāya āgamanam punar
translated: The doorkeepers informed him of Rama's arrival again.

original: śrutvaiva cāpi rāmas taṃ prāptaṃ śaṅkānvito 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā eva ca api rāmaḥ tam prāptam śaṅkā anvitaḥ bhavat
translated: And having heard that he had arrived, Rama became suspicious.

original: praveśya cainaṃ tvaritaṃ rāmo vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: praveśya ca enam tvaritam rāmaḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: And having quickly brought him in, Rama spoke these words:

original: yad āgamanakṛtyaṃ te bhūyas tad brūhy aśeṣataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat āgamana kṛtyam te bhūyas tat brūhi aśeṣatas
translated: Tell me again in full what the purpose of your coming is.

original: tam uvāca tataḥ sūto rājā tvāṃ draṣṭum icchati /
analyzed: tam uvāca tatas sūtaḥ rājā tvām draṣṭum icchati
translated: Then the charioteer said to him, The king desires to see you.

original: śrutvā pramāṇam atra tvaṃ gamanāyetarāya vā // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā pramāṇam atra tvam gamanāya itarāya vā
translated: Having heard, you should decide whether to go or not.

original: iti sūtavacaḥ śrutvā rāmo 'tha tvarayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: iti sūta vacaḥ śrutvā tvarayā anvitaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of the charioteer, Rama, filled with haste,

original: prayayau rājabhavanaṃ punar draṣṭuṃ nareśvaram // / / //
analyzed: prayayau rāja bhavanam punar draṣṭum nareśvaram
translated: went again to the royal palace to see the lord of men.

original: taṃ śrutvā samanuprāptaṃ rāmaṃ daśaratho nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: tam śrutvā samanuprāptam rāmam daśarathaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Having heard that Rama had arrived, King Dasharatha,

original: praveśayāmāsa gṛhaṃ vivikṣuḥ priyam uttamam // / / //
analyzed: praveśayāmāsa gṛham vivikṣuḥ priyam uttamam
translated: desiring to bestow an excellent favor, had him brought into the house.

original: praviśann eva ca śrīmān rāghavo bhavanaṃ pituḥ /
analyzed: praviśan eva ca śrīmān rāghavaḥ bhavanam pituḥ
translated: As the prosperous Raghava was entering his father's house,

original: dadarśa pitaraṃ dūrāt praṇipatya kṛtāñjaliḥ // / / //🔽praṇamantaṃ samutthāpya taṃ pariṣvajya bhūmipaḥ /
analyzed: dadarśa pitaram dūrāt praṇipatya kṛtāñjaliḥ  praṇamantam samutthāpya tam pariṣvajya bhūmipaḥ
translated: he saw his father from a distance, and with folded hands prostrated himself.🔽The king raised him up as he was bowing down, and embracing him,

original: pradiśya cāsmai ruciram āsanaṃ punar abravīt // / / //
analyzed: pradiśya ca asmai ruciram āsanam punar abravīt
translated: and showing him an attractive seat, spoke again:

original: rāma vṛddho 'smi dīrghāyur bhuktā bhogā mayepsitāḥ /
analyzed: rāma vṛddhaḥ smi dīrgha āyuḥ bhuktāḥ bhogāḥ mayā īpsitāḥ
translated: Rama, I am old, long-lived, and have enjoyed the pleasures I desired.

original: annavadbhiḥ kratuśatais tatheṣṭaṃ bhūridakṣiṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: annavadbhiḥ kratu śataiḥ tathā iṣṭam bhūri dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: I have performed many sacrifices with abundant gifts, as if they were mere food.

original: jātam iṣṭam apatyaṃ me tvam adyānupamaṃ bhuvi /
analyzed: jātam iṣṭam apatyam me tvam adya anupamam bhuvi
translated: My son, who is born, is dear to me, and is incomparable on earth.

original: dattam iṣṭam adhītaṃ ca mayā puruṣasattama // / / //
analyzed: dattam iṣṭam adhītam ca mayā puruṣa sattama
translated: O best of men, I have given gifts, performed sacrifices, and studied.

original: anubhūtāni ceṣṭāni mayā vīra sukhāni ca /
analyzed: anubhūtāni ca iṣṭāni mayā vīra sukhāni ca
translated: O hero, I have enjoyed all desirable pleasures.

original: devarṣipitṛviprāṇām anṛṇo 'smi tathātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: deva ṛṣi pitṛ viprāṇām anṛṇaḥ smi tathā ātmanaḥ
translated: I am free from debt to gods, sages, ancestors, Brahmins, and to myself.

original: na kiṃcin mama kartavyaṃ tavānyatrābhiṣecanāt /
analyzed: na kiṃcid mama kartavyam tava anyatra abhiṣecanāt
translated: I have nothing more to do, except for your consecration.

original: ato yat tvām ahaṃ brūyāṃ tan me tvaṃ kartum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: atas yat tvām aham brūyām tat me tvam kartum arhasi
translated: Therefore, whatever I tell you, you should do for me.

original: adya prakṛtayaḥ sarvās tvām icchanti narādhipam /
analyzed: adya prakṛtayaḥ sarvāḥ tvām icchanti narādhipam
translated: Today all the subjects desire you as their king.

original: atas tvāṃ yuvarājānam abhiṣekṣyāmi putraka // / / //
analyzed: atas tvām yuvarājānam abhiṣekṣyāmi putraka
translated: Therefore, O son, I will consecrate you as the prince regent.

original: api cādyāśubhān rāma svapnān paśyāmi dāruṇān /
analyzed: api ca adya aśubhān rāma svapnān paśyāmi dāruṇān
translated: Moreover, O Rama, I am seeing inauspicious and terrible dreams today.

original: sanirghātā maholkāś ca patantīha mahāsvanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa nirghātāḥ mahā ulkāḥ ca patanti iha mahā svanāḥ
translated: Loud meteors are falling with great noise, accompanied by earthquakes.

original: avaṣṭabdhaṃ ca me rāma nakṣatraṃ dāruṇair grahaiḥ /
analyzed: avaṣṭabdham ca me rāma nakṣatram dāruṇaiḥ grahaiḥ
translated: O Rama, my birth star is afflicted by terrible planets.

original: āvedayanti daivajñāḥ sūryāṅgārakarāhubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: āvedayanti daivajñāḥ sūrya aṅgāraka rāhubhiḥ
translated: The astrologers predict this through the sun, Mars, and Rahu.

original: prāyeṇa hi nimittānām īdṛśānāṃ samudbhave /
analyzed: prāyeṇa hi nimittānām īdṛśānām samudbhave
translated: For generally, when such omens arise,

original: rājā vā mṛtyum āpnoti ghorāṃ vāpadam ṛcchati // / / //
analyzed: rājā vā mṛtyum āpnoti ghorām vā āpadam ṛcchati
translated: either the king meets with death or encounters terrible calamity.

original: tad yāvad eva me ceto na vimuhyati rāghava /
analyzed: tat yāvat eva me cetaḥ na vimuhyati rāghava
translated: Therefore, O Raghava, as long as my mind is not bewildered,

original: tāvad evābhiṣiñcasva calā hi prāṇināṃ matiḥ // / / //🔽adya candro 'bhyupagataḥ puṣyāt pūrvaṃ punar vasum /
analyzed: tāvat eva abhiṣiñcasva calā hi prāṇinām matiḥ  adya candraḥ bhyupagataḥ puṣyāt pūrvam punar vasum
translated: do you get yourself installed, for the mind of living beings is fickle.🔽Today the moon has entered the asterism Pushya before the asterism Hasta.

original: śvaḥ puṣyayogaṃ niyataṃ vakṣyante daivacintakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śvas puṣya yogam niyatam vakṣyante daiva cintakāḥ
translated: Tomorrow the astrologers will certainly declare the conjunction of Pushya.

original: tatra puṣye 'bhiṣiñcasva manas tvarayatīva mām /
analyzed: tatra puṣye bhiṣiñcasva manaḥ tvarayati iva mām
translated: There, in Pushya, get yourself installed, for my mind is urging me.

original: śvas tvāham abhiṣekṣyāmi yauvarājye paraṃtapa // / / //
analyzed: śvas tvā aham abhiṣekṣyāmi yauvarājye paraṃtapa
translated: Tomorrow, O scorcher of enemies, I shall install you as heir-apparent.

original: tasmāt tvayādya vratinā niśeyaṃ niyatātmanā /
analyzed: tasmāt tvayā adya vratinā niśā iyam niyata ātmanā
translated: Therefore, you, observing a vow, should spend this night with self-control,

original: saha vadhvopavastavyā darbhaprastaraśāyinā // / / //
analyzed: saha vadhvā upavastavyā darbha prastara śāyinā
translated: together with your bride, lying on a bed of darbha grass.

original: suhṛdaś cāpramattās tvāṃ rakṣantv adya samantataḥ /
analyzed: suhṛdaḥ ca apramattāḥ tvām rakṣantu adya samantataḥ
translated: And let your friends, being vigilant, guard you on all sides today,

original: bhavanti bahuvighnāni kāryāṇy evaṃvidhāni hi // / / //
analyzed: bhavanti bahu vighnāni kāryāṇi evaṃvidhāni hi
translated: for undertakings of this kind are beset with many obstacles.

original: viproṣitaś ca bharato yāvad eva purād itaḥ /
analyzed: viproṣitaḥ ca bharataḥ yāvat eva purāt itas
translated: And as long as Bharata is away from this city,

original: tāvad evābhiṣekas te prāptakālo mato mama // / / //🔽kāmaṃ khalu satāṃ vṛtte bhrātā te bharataḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat eva abhiṣekaḥ te prāpta kālaḥ mataḥ mama  kāmam khalu satām vṛtte bhrātā te bharataḥ sthitaḥ
translated: for so long the installation is, in my opinion, the proper time for you.🔽Surely your brother Bharata is established in the conduct of the good,

original: jyeṣṭhānuvartī dharmātmā sānukrośo jitendriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jyeṣṭha anuvartī dharma ātmā sa anukrośaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: obedient to his elder brother, righteous, compassionate, and self-controlled.

original: kiṃ tu cittaṃ manuṣyāṇām anityam iti me matiḥ /
analyzed: kim tu cittam manuṣyāṇām anityam iti me matiḥ
translated: But the minds of men are fickle, I think.

original: satāṃ ca dharmanityānāṃ kṛtaśobhi ca rāghava // / / //
analyzed: satām ca dharma nityānām kṛta śobhi ca rāghava
translated: And, O Raghava, the virtuous who are ever devoted to righteousness, are ever intent on doing good.

original: ity uktaḥ so 'bhyanujñātaḥ śvobhāviny abhiṣecane /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ saḥ bhyanujñātaḥ śvas bhāvini abhiṣecane
translated: Thus addressed, he was permitted to go, his installation being fixed for the morrow.

original: vrajeti rāmaḥ pitaram abhivādyābhyayād gṛham // / / //
analyzed: vraja iti rāmaḥ pitaram abhivādya abhyayāt gṛham
translated: And Rama, having saluted his father, went to his own abode.

original: praviśya cātmano veśma rājñoddiṣṭe 'bhiṣecane /🔽tasmin kṣaṇe vinirgatya mātur antaḥpuraṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: praviśya ca ātmanaḥ veśma rājñā uddiṣṭe bhiṣecane  tasmin kṣaṇe vinirgatya mātuḥ antaḥpuram yayau
translated: And having entered his own house, where the installation was prepared for him by the king,🔽he immediately went out and entered the inner apartments of his mother.

original: tatra tāṃ pravaṇām eva mātaraṃ kṣaumavāsinīm /
analyzed: tatra tām pravaṇām eva mātaram kṣauma vāsinīm
translated: There he saw his mother, who was already inclined to favour him, clad in silken robes,

original: vāgyatāṃ devatāgāre dadarśa yācatīṃ śriyam // / / //
analyzed: vāgyatām devatāgāre dadarśa yācatīm śriyam
translated: self-controlled, in the temple of the gods, beseeching Sri.

original: prāg eva cāgatā tatra sumitrā lakṣmaṇas tathā /
analyzed: prāk eva ca āgatā tatra sumitrā lakṣmaṇaḥ tathā
translated: And Sumitra had already come there, and Lakshmana,

original: sītā cānāyitā śrutvā priyaṃ rāmābhiṣecanam // / / //
analyzed: sītā ca ānāyitā śrutvā priyam rāma abhiṣecanam
translated: and Sita, having heard the welcome news of Rama's installation.

original: tasmin kāle hi kausalyā tasthāv āmīlitekṣaṇā /
analyzed: tasmin kāle hi kausalyā tasthau āmīlita īkṣaṇā
translated: At that time, Kausalyā stood with closed eyes,

original: sumitrayānvāsyamānā sītayā lakṣmaṇena ca // / / //
analyzed: sumitrayā anvāsyamānā sītayā lakṣmaṇena ca
translated: attended by Sumitrā, Sita, and Lakṣmaṇa.

original: śrutvā puṣyeṇa putrasya yauvarājyābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: śrutvā puṣyeṇa putrasya yauvarājya abhiṣecanam
translated: Having heard of the installation of her son as heir-apparent under the constellation Puṣya,

original: prāṇāyāmena puruṣaṃ dhyāyamānā janārdanam // / / //
analyzed: prāṇāyāmena puruṣam dhyāyamānāḥ janārdanam
translated: she was meditating on the Supreme Being, Janārdana, by the practice of prāṇāyāma.

original: tathā saniyamām eva so 'bhigamyābhivādya ca /
analyzed: tathā sa niyamām eva saḥ abhigamya abhivādya ca
translated: Having approached her, who was observing the rules, and having saluted her,

original: uvāca vacanaṃ rāmo harṣayaṃs tām idaṃ tadā // / / //🔽amba pitrā niyukto 'smi prajāpālanakarmaṇi /
analyzed: uvāca vacanam rāmaḥ harṣayan tām idam tadā  amba pitrā niyuktaḥ smi prajā pālana karmaṇi
translated: Rama spoke these words, delighting her:🔽Mother, I have been appointed by my father to the task of protecting the subjects.

original: bhavitā śvo 'bhiṣeko me yathā me śāsanaṃ pituḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhavitā śvas bhiṣekaḥ me yathā me śāsanam pituḥ
translated: My consecration will take place tomorrow, as per my father's command.

original: sītayāpy upavastavyā rajanīyaṃ mayā saha /
analyzed: sītayā api upavastavyā rajanīyam mayā saha
translated: Sita should also observe a fast with me for the night.

original: evam ṛtvigupādhyāyaiḥ saha mām uktavān pitā // / / //
analyzed: evam ṛtvij upādhyāyaiḥ saha mām uktavān pitā
translated: This is what my father told me, along with the priests and preceptors.

original: yāni yāny atra yogyāni śvobhāviny abhiṣecane /
analyzed: yāni yāni atra yogyāni śvobhāvini abhiṣecane
translated: Whatever is appropriate for the consecration to be held tomorrow,

original: tāni me maṅgalāny adya vaidehyāś caiva kāraya // / / //🔽etac chrutvā tu kausalyā cirakālābhikāṅkṣitam /
analyzed: tāni me maṅgalāni adya vaidehyāḥ ca eva kāraya  etat śrutvā tu kausalyā cira kāla abhikāṅkṣitam
translated: have those auspicious rites performed for me and Vaidehi today.🔽Having heard this, which she had longed for over a long period of time,

original: harṣabāṣpakalaṃ vākyam idaṃ rāmam abhāṣata // / / //
analyzed: harṣa bāṣpa kalam vākyam idam rāmam abhāṣata
translated: Kausalya, with words choked with tears of joy, spoke to Rama:

original: vatsa rāma ciraṃ jīva hatās te paripanthinaḥ /
analyzed: vatsa rāma ciram jīva hatāḥ te paripanthinaḥ
translated: My son Rama, live long. Those who stood in your way have been destroyed.

original: jñātīn me tvaṃ śriyā yuktaḥ sumitrāyāś ca nandaya // / / //
analyzed: jñātīn me tvam śriyā yuktaḥ sumitrāyāḥ ca nandaya
translated: Endowed with prosperity, delight my kinsmen and Sumitra.

original: kalyāṇe bata nakṣatre mayi jāto 'si putraka /
analyzed: kalyāṇe bata nakṣatre mayi jātaḥ si putraka
translated: Oh, in an auspicious constellation you were born to me, my son,

original: yena tvayā daśaratho guṇair ārādhitaḥ pitā // / / //
analyzed: yena tvayā daśarathaḥ guṇaiḥ ārādhitaḥ pitā
translated: by whom you have pleased your father Dasharatha with your qualities.

original: amoghaṃ bata me kṣāntaṃ puruṣe puṣkarekṣaṇe /
analyzed: amogham bata me kṣāntam puruṣe puṣkara īkṣaṇe
translated: O lotus-eyed one, I have indeed forgiven this man.

original: yeyam ikṣvākurājyaśrīḥ putra tvāṃ saṃśrayiṣyati // / / //🔽ity evam ukto mātredaṃ rāmo bhrātaram abravīt /
analyzed: yā iyam ikṣvāku rājya śrīḥ putra tvām saṃśrayiṣyati  iti evam uktaḥ mātrā idam rāmaḥ bhrātaram abravīt
translated: O son, this prosperity of the kingdom of the Ikshvaku lineage will resort to you.

original: prāñjaliṃ prahvam āsīnam abhivīkṣya smayann iva // / / //
analyzed: prāñjalim prahvam āsīnam abhivīkṣya smayan iva
translated: Thus addressed by his mother, Rama, looking at his brother Lakshmana seated with folded hands and humble, as if smiling, said this:

original: lakṣmaṇemāṃ mayā sārdhaṃ praśādhi tvaṃ vasuṃdharām /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇa imām mayā sārdham praśādhi tvam vasuṃdharām
translated: O Lakshmana, rule this earth along with me.

original: dvitīyaṃ me 'ntarātmānaṃ tvām iyaṃ śrīr upasthitā // / / //
analyzed: dvitīyam me ntarātmānam tvām iyam śrīḥ upasthitā
translated: This prosperity has come to you, who are like my second self.

original: saumitre bhuṅkṣva bhogāṃs tvam iṣṭān rājyaphalāni ca /
analyzed: saumitre bhuṅkṣva bhogān tvam iṣṭān rājya phalāni ca
translated: O son of Sumitra, enjoy pleasures and the fruits of kingdom that you desire.

original: jīvitaṃ ca hi rājyaṃ ca tvadartham abhikāmaye // / / //
analyzed: jīvitam ca hi rājyam ca tvad artham abhikāmaye
translated: I desire life and kingdom for your sake.

original: ity uktvā lakṣmaṇaṃ rāmo mātarāv abhivādya ca /
analyzed: iti uktvā lakṣmaṇam rāmaḥ mātarau abhivādya ca
translated: Having said this to Lakshmana and having paid homage to his mothers,

original: abhyanujñāpya sītāṃ ca jagāma svaṃ niveśanam // / / //
analyzed: abhyanujñāpya sītām ca jagāma svam niveśanam
translated: and having taken leave of Sita, he went to his own abode.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: saṃdiśya rāmaṃ nṛpatiḥ śvobhāviny abhiṣecane /
analyzed: saṃdiśya rāmam nṛpatiḥ śvas bhāvini abhiṣecane
translated: Having instructed Rama about the consecration to be held the next day,

original: purohitaṃ samāhūya vasiṣṭham idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: purohitam samāhūya vasiṣṭham idam abravīt
translated: the king summoned the priest Vasishtha and said this:

original: gacchopavāsaṃ kākutsthaṃ kārayādya tapodhana /
analyzed: gaccha upavāsam kākutstham kāraya adya tapodhana
translated: Go and make Kakutstha observe the fast today, O ascetic.

original: śrīyaśorājyalābhāya vadhvā saha yatavratam // / / //
analyzed: śrī yaśaḥ rājya lābhāya vadhvā saha yata vratam
translated: for the prosperity, fame and kingdom, along with his daughter-in-law, who was devoted to austerities.

original: tatheti ca sa rājānam uktvā vedavidāṃ varaḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti ca sa rājānam uktvā veda vidām varaḥ
translated: Having said So be it to the king, that best among the knowers of the Vedas,

original: svayaṃ vasiṣṭho bhagavān yayau rāmaniveśanam // / / //
analyzed: svayam vasiṣṭhaḥ bhagavān yayau rāma niveśanam
translated: the illustrious Vashishtha himself went to Rama's residence.

original: sa rāmabhavanaṃ prāpya pāṇḍurābhraghanaprabham /
analyzed: sa rāma bhavanam prāpya pāṇḍura abhra ghana prabham
translated: Having reached Rama's residence, which had the luster of white clouds,

original: tisraḥ kakṣyā rathenaiva viveśa munisattamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tisraḥ kakṣyāḥ rathena eva viveśa muni sattamaḥ
translated: the best of sages entered the three courtyards by chariot.

original: tam āgatam ṛṣiṃ rāmas tvarann iva sasaṃbhramaḥ /
analyzed: tam āgatam ṛṣim rāmaḥ tvaran iva sa saṃbhramaḥ
translated: Rama, seeing the sage who had come, as if in haste and with excitement,

original: mānayiṣyan sa mānārhaṃ niścakrāma niveśanāt // / / //
analyzed: mānayiṣyan sa māna arham niścakrāma niveśanāt
translated: desiring to honor him who deserved honor, went out of the house.

original: abhyetya tvaramāṇaś ca rathābhyāśaṃ manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: abhyetya tvaramāṇaḥ ca ratha abhyāśam manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Having approached near the chariot of the wise one, and going quickly,

original: tato 'vatārayāmāsa parigṛhya rathāt svayam // / / //
analyzed: tatas vatārayāmāsa parigṛhya rathāt svayam
translated: he himself helped him to descend from the chariot.

original: sa cainaṃ praśritaṃ dṛṣṭvā sambhāṣyābhiprasādya ca /
analyzed: sa ca enam praśritam dṛṣṭvā sambhāṣya abhiprasādya ca
translated: And he, seeing him humble, and having spoken to him and pleased him,

original: priyārhaṃ harṣayan rāmam ity uvāca purohitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: priya arham harṣayan rāmam iti uvāca purohitaḥ
translated: the priest, delighting Rama who deserved affection, said this:

original: prasannas te pitā rāma yauvarājyam avāpsyasi /
analyzed: prasannaḥ te pitā rāma yauvarājyam avāpsyasi
translated: Your father is pleased with you, Rama, you will obtain the rank of heir apparent.

original: upavāsaṃ bhavān adya karotu saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: upavāsam bhavān adya karotu saha sītayā
translated: Today you and Sita should observe a fast.

original: prātas tvām abhiṣektā hi yauvarājye narādhipaḥ /
analyzed: prātar tvām abhiṣektā hi yauvarājye narādhipaḥ
translated: Tomorrow morning the king will consecrate you as heir apparent.

original: pitā daśarathaḥ prītyā yayātiṃ nahuṣo yathā // / / //
analyzed: pitā daśarathaḥ prītyā yayātim nahuṣaḥ yathā
translated: His father Dasha ratha, with affection, like Nahusha with Yayati.

original: ity uktvā sa tadā rāmam upavāsaṃ yatavratam /
analyzed: iti uktvā sa tadā rāmam upavāsam yata vratam
translated: Having spoken thus to Rama, who was observing a fast and was firm in his vows,

original: mantravat kārayāmāsa vaidehyā sahitaṃ muniḥ // / / //
analyzed: mantravat kārayāmāsa vaidehyā sahitam muniḥ
translated: The sage made him and Vaidehi perform the rituals.

original: tato yathāvad rāmeṇa sa rājño gurur arcitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas yathāvat rāmeṇa sa rājñaḥ guruḥ arcitaḥ
translated: Then Rama duly worshipped the guru of the king,

original: abhyanujñāpya kākutsthaṃ yayau rāmaniveśanāt // / / //
analyzed: abhyanujñāpya kākutstham yayau rāma niveśanāt
translated: And with Kakutstha's permission, he left Rama's residence.

original: suhṛdbhis tatra rāmo 'pi tān anujñāpya sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: suhṛdbhiḥ tatra tān anujñāpya sarvaśas
translated: There, Rama too, with the permission of all his well-wishers,

original: sabhājito viveśātha tān anujñāpya sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sabhājitaḥ viveśa atha tān anujñāpya sarvaśas
translated: And having been honored by all, entered (his residence).

original: hṛṣṭanārīnarayutaṃ rāmaveśma tadā babhau /
analyzed: hṛṣṭa nārī nara yutam rāma veśma tadā babhau
translated: Then Rama's residence was radiant with delighted men and women,

original: yathā mattadvijagaṇaṃ praphullanalinaṃ saraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā matta dvija gaṇam praphulla nalinam saraḥ
translated: Like a lake with blooming lotuses and a flock of intoxicated birds.

original: sa rājabhavanaprakhyāt tasmād rāmaniveśanāt /
analyzed: sa rāja bhavana prakhyāt tasmāt rāma niveśanāt
translated: From that residence of Rama, which was like a royal palace,

original: nirgatya dadṛśe mārgaṃ vasiṣṭho janasaṃvṛtam // / / //
analyzed: nirgatya dadṛśe mārgam vasiṣṭhaḥ jana saṃvṛtam
translated: Vasishtha, having come out, saw the path crowded with people.

original: vṛndavṛndair ayodhyāyāṃ rājamārgāḥ samantataḥ /🔽babhūvur abhisaṃbādhāḥ kutūhalajanair vṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛnda vṛndaiḥ ayodhyāyām rājamārgāḥ samantataḥ  babhūvuḥ abhisaṃbādhāḥ kutūhala janaiḥ vṛtāḥ
translated: The royal roads in Ayodhya were completely blocked on all sides🔽By crowds of people eager to see (the procession).

original: janavṛndormisaṃgharṣaharṣasvanavatas tadā /
analyzed: jana vṛnda ūrmi saṃgharṣa harṣa svanavataḥ tadā
translated: Then, with the joyful sounds of the crowds of people rubbing against each other,

original: babhūva rājamārgasya sāgarasyeva nisvanaḥ // / / //🔽siktasaṃmṛṣṭarathyā hi tad ahar vanamālinī /
analyzed: babhūva rājamārgasya sāgarasya iva nisvanaḥ  sikta saṃmṛṣṭa rathyā hi tat ahar vanamālinī
translated: The sound of the royal road was like the ocean.🔽On that day, the streets were sprinkled and swept, and the city was adorned with garlands.

original: āsīd ayodhyā nagarī samucchritagṛhadhvajā // / / //
analyzed: āsīt ayodhyā nagarī samucchrita gṛha dhvajā
translated: The city of Ayodhya had its house flags raised high.

original: tadā hy ayodhyānilayaḥ sastrībālābalo janaḥ /
analyzed: tadā hi ayodhyā nilayaḥ sa strī bāla abalaḥ janaḥ
translated: Then, the people residing in Ayodhya, with their women, children and the weak,

original: rāmābhiṣekam ākāṅkṣann ākāṅkṣann udayaṃ raveḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāma abhiṣekam ākāṅkṣan ākāṅkṣan udayam raveḥ
translated: Desiring Rama's consecration, awaited the rising of the sun.

original: prajālaṃkārabhūtaṃ ca janasyānandavardhanam /
analyzed: prajā alaṃkāra bhūtam ca janasya ānanda vardhanam
translated: He was an ornament to the people and a delight to the people.

original: utsuko 'bhūj jano draṣṭuṃ tam ayodhyāmahotsavam // / / //🔽evaṃ taṃ janasambādhaṃ rājamārgaṃ purohitaḥ /
analyzed: utsukaḥ bhūt janaḥ draṣṭum tam ayodhyā mahā utsavam  evam tam jana sambādham rājamārgam purohitaḥ
translated: The people were eager to see that great festival of Ayodhya.🔽Thus, the priest, on that royal road crowded with people,

original: vyūhann iva janaughaṃ taṃ śanai rājakulaṃ yayau // / / //🔽sitābhraśikharaprakhyaṃ prāsādam adhiruhya saḥ /
analyzed: vyūhan iva jana ogham tam śanais rāja kulam yayau  sita abhra śikhara prakhyam prāsādam adhiruhya saḥ
translated: Slowly went to the royal palace, as if arranging that multitude of people.🔽Having ascended the palace resembling the peak of a white cloud,

original: samiyāya narendreṇa śakreṇeva bṛhaspatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: samiyāya narendreṇa śakreṇa iva bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: He met with the lord of men, like Brihaspati with Indra.

original: tam āgatam abhiprekṣya hitvā rājāsanaṃ nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: tam āgatam abhiprekṣya hitvā rāja āsanam nṛpaḥ
translated: Seeing him arrived, the king left his royal seat

original: papraccha sa ca tasmai tat kṛtam ity abhyavedayat // / / //
analyzed: papraccha sa ca tasmai tat kṛtam iti abhyavedayat
translated: And asked him, and he announced that it had been done.

original: guruṇā tv abhyanujñāto manujaughaṃ visṛjya tam /
analyzed: guruṇā tu abhyanujñātaḥ manuja ogham visṛjya tam
translated: But, having been permitted by the preceptor, he dismissed that multitude of people

original: viveśāntaḥpuraṃ rājā siṃho giriguhām iva // / / //
analyzed: viveśa antaḥpuram rājā siṃhaḥ giri guhām iva
translated: the king entered the inner apartments, like a lion entering a mountain cave.

original: tad agryaveṣapramadājanākulaṃ mahendraveśmapratimaṃ niveśanam /
analyzed: tat agrya veṣa pramadā jana ākulam mahā indra veśma pratimam niveśanam
translated: That house, crowded with the best dressed women, resembling the palace of Indra,

original: vidīpayaṃś cāru viveśa pārthivaḥ śaśīva tārāgaṇasaṃkulaṃ nabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vidīpayan cāru viveśa pārthivaḥ śaśī iva tārā gaṇa saṃkulam nabhaḥ
translated: the king entered, illuminating it beautifully, like the moon the sky filled with stars.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: gate purohite rāmaḥ snāto niyatamānasaḥ /
analyzed: gate purohite rāmaḥ snātaḥ niyata mānasaḥ
translated: When the priest had left, Rama, having bathed and controlled his mind,

original: saha patnyā viśālākṣyā nārāyaṇam upāgamat // / / //🔽pragṛhya śirasā pātrīṃ haviṣo vidhivat tadā /
analyzed: saha patnyā viśāla akṣyā nārāyaṇam upāgamat  pragṛhya śirasā pātrīm haviṣaḥ vidhivat tadā
translated: together with his large-eyed wife, approached Narayana.

original: mahate daivatāyājyaṃ juhāva jvalite 'nale // / / //
analyzed: mahate daivatāya ājyam juhāva jvalite nale
translated: Holding the vessel of oblations on his head, he duly offered it to the great deity, in the blazing fire.

original: śeṣaṃ ca haviṣas tasya prāśyāśāsyātmanaḥ priyam /
analyzed: śeṣam ca haviṣaḥ tasya prāśya āśāsya ātmanaḥ priyam
translated: Having eaten the remaining oblations, he wished for his own welfare,

original: dhyāyan nārāyaṇaṃ devaṃ svāstīrṇe kuśasaṃstare // / / //
analyzed: dhyāyan nārāyaṇam devam su āstīrṇe kuśa saṃstare
translated: meditating on Lord Narayana, on a bed spread with kusha grass.

original: vāgyataḥ saha vaidehyā bhūtvā niyatamānasaḥ /
analyzed: vāgyataḥ saha vaidehyā bhūtvā niyata mānasaḥ
translated: Controlling his speech and keeping his mind steady, together with Vaidehi,

original: śrīmaty āyatane viṣṇoḥ śiśye naravarātmajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrīmati āyatane viṣṇoḥ śiśye nara vara ātmajaḥ
translated: the son of the best of men slept in the glorious temple of Vishnu.

original: ekayāmāvaśiṣṭāyāṃ rātryāṃ prativibudhya saḥ /
analyzed: eka yāma avaśiṣṭāyām rātryām prativibudhya saḥ
translated: When only one watch of the night remained, he woke up

original: alaṃkāravidhiṃ kṛtsnaṃ kārayāmāsa veśmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: alaṃkāra vidhim kṛtsnam kārayāmāsa veśmanaḥ
translated: and had the entire decoration done in the house.

original: tatra śṛṇvan sukhā vācaḥ sūtamāgadhabandinām /
analyzed: tatra śṛṇvan sukhāḥ vācaḥ sūta māgadha bandinām
translated: There, listening to the pleasant words of the bards, panegyrists and genealogists,

original: pūrvāṃ saṃdhyām upāsīno jajāpa yatamānasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pūrvām saṃdhyām upāsīnaḥ jajāpa yata mānasaḥ
translated: he performed his evening prayers with a concentrated mind.

original: tuṣṭāva praṇataś caiva śirasā madhusūdanam /
analyzed: tuṣṭāva praṇataḥ ca eva śirasā madhusūdanam
translated: Bowing down with his head, he praised Madhusudana (Krishna).

original: vimalakṣaumasaṃvīto vācayāmāsa ca dvijān // / / //
analyzed: vimala kṣauma saṃvītaḥ vācayāmāsa ca dvijān
translated: Wearing pure and fine garments, he made the Brahmins recite the scriptures.

original: teṣāṃ puṇyāhaghoṣo 'tha gambhīramadhuras tadā /
analyzed: teṣām puṇya aha ghoṣaḥ gambhīra madhuraḥ tadā
translated: Then the deep and sweet sound of their auspicious chants

original: ayodhyāṃ pūrayāmāsa tūryaghoṣānunāditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām pūrayāmāsa tūrya ghoṣa anunāditaḥ
translated: filled Ayodhya, resounding with the sound of trumpets.

original: kṛtopavāsaṃ tu tadā vaidehyā saha rāghavam /
analyzed: kṛta upavāsam tu tadā vaidehyā saha rāghavam
translated: When Raghava, along with Vaidehi, observed the fast,

original: ayodhyānilayaḥ śrutvā sarvaḥ pramudito janaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyā nilayaḥ śrutvā sarvaḥ pramuditaḥ janaḥ
translated: all the people residing in Ayodhya, hearing about it, became extremely delighted.

original: tataḥ paurajanaḥ sarvaḥ śrutvā rāmābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: tatas paura janaḥ sarvaḥ śrutvā rāma abhiṣecanam
translated: Then all the citizens, hearing about Rama's consecration,

original: prabhātāṃ rajanīṃ dṛṣṭvā cakre śobhāṃ parāṃ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prabhātām rajanīm dṛṣṭvā cakre śobhām parām punar
translated: and seeing the dawn, again made great preparations.

original: sitābhraśikharābheṣu devatāyataneṣu ca /
analyzed: sita abhra śikhara ābheṣu devatāyataneṣu ca
translated: In the temples resembling the peaks of white clouds,

original: catuṣpatheṣu rathyāsu caityeṣv aṭṭālakeṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: catuṣpatheṣu rathyāsu caityeṣu aṭṭālakeṣu ca
translated: at the crossroads, on the streets, at the shrines and watchtowers,

original: nānāpaṇyasamṛddheṣu vaṇijām āpaṇeṣu ca /
analyzed: nānā paṇya samṛddheṣu vaṇijām āpaṇeṣu ca
translated: in the shops of the merchants filled with various goods,

original: kuṭumbināṃ samṛddheṣu śrīmatsu bhavaneṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: kuṭumbinām samṛddheṣu śrīmatsu bhavaneṣu ca
translated: and in the prosperous and wealthy houses of the householders,

original: sabhāsu caiva sarvāsu vṛkṣeṣv ālakṣiteṣu ca /
analyzed: sabhāsu ca eva sarvāsu vṛkṣeṣu ālakṣiteṣu ca
translated: And in all the assembly halls and on all the conspicuous trees,

original: dhvajāḥ samucchritāś citrāḥ patākāś cābhavaṃs tadā // / / //
analyzed: dhvajāḥ samucchritāḥ citrāḥ patākāḥ ca abhavan tadā
translated: colorful flags and banners were hoisted.

original: naṭanartakasaṃghānāṃ gāyakānāṃ ca gāyatām /
analyzed: naṭa nartaka saṃghānām gāyakānām ca gāyatām
translated: The songs of groups of actors, dancers, and singers,

original: manaḥkarṇasukhā vācaḥ śuśruvuś ca tatas tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: manaḥ karṇa sukhāḥ vācaḥ śuśruvuḥ ca tatas tatas
translated: pleasing to the mind and ears, were heard here and there.

original: rāmābhiṣekayuktāś ca kathāś cakrur mitho janāḥ /
analyzed: rāma abhiṣeka yuktāḥ ca kathāḥ cakruḥ mithas janāḥ
translated: People engaged in conversations about Rama's consecration,

original: rāmābhiṣeke samprāpte catvareṣu gṛheṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: rāma abhiṣeke samprāpte catvareṣu gṛheṣu ca
translated: as the time for Rama's consecration approached, in the courtyards and houses.

original: bālā api krīḍamānā gṛhadvāreṣu saṃghaśaḥ /
analyzed: bālāḥ api krīḍamānāḥ gṛha dvāreṣu saṃghaśas
translated: Even children playing in groups at the doors of the houses,

original: rāmābhiṣekasaṃyuktāś cakrur eva mithaḥ kathāḥ // / / //🔽kṛtapuṣpopahāraś ca dhūpagandhādhivāsitaḥ /
analyzed: rāma abhiṣeka saṃyuktāḥ cakruḥ eva mithas kathāḥ  kṛta puṣpa upahāraḥ ca dhūpa gandha adhivāsitaḥ
translated: engaged in conversations about Rama's consecration.

original: rājamārgaḥ kṛtaḥ śrīmān paurai rāmābhiṣecane // / / //
analyzed: rājamārgaḥ kṛtaḥ śrīmān pauraiḥ rāma abhiṣecane
translated: The glorious royal road, for Rama's consecration, was adorned by the citizens with offerings of flowers and perfumed with incense.

original: prakāśakaraṇārthaṃ ca niśāgamanaśaṅkayā /
analyzed: prakāśa karaṇa artham ca niśā gamana śaṅkayā
translated: And in order to illuminate and because of the fear of night's arrival,

original: dīpavṛkṣāṃs tathā cakrur anu rathyāsu sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dīpavṛkṣān tathā cakruḥ anu rathyāsu sarvaśas
translated: lamp trees were erected along all the streets.

original: alaṃkāraṃ purasyaivaṃ kṛtvā tatpuravāsinaḥ /
analyzed: alaṃkāram purasya evam kṛtvā tad pura vāsinaḥ
translated: Having thus decorated the city, the citizens of that city,

original: ākāṅkṣamāṇā rāmasya yauvarājyābhiṣecanam // / / //
analyzed: ākāṅkṣamāṇāḥ rāmasya yauvarājya abhiṣecanam
translated: eagerly awaiting Rama's consecration as prince regent,

original: sametya saṃghaśaḥ sarve catvareṣu sabhāsu ca /
analyzed: sametya saṃghaśas sarve catvareṣu sabhāsu ca
translated: Having assembled together in groups in the crossroads and assembly halls,

original: kathayanto mithas tatra praśaśaṃsur janādhipam // / / //
analyzed: kathayantaḥ mithas tatra praśaśaṃsuḥ janādhipam
translated: they praised the king among themselves, saying:

original: aho mahātmā rājāyam ikṣvākukulanandanaḥ /
analyzed: aho mahātmā rājā ayam ikṣvāku kula nandanaḥ
translated: Oh, what a great soul is this king, the delighter of the Ikshvaku dynasty!

original: jñātvā yo vṛddham ātmānaṃ rāmaṃ rājye 'hbiṣekṣyati // / / //
analyzed: jñātvā yaḥ vṛddham ātmānam rāmam rājye
translated: Knowing himself to be old, he will consecrate Rama in the kingdom.

original: sarve hy anugṛhītāḥ sma yan no rāmo mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: sarve hi anugṛhītāḥ sma yat naḥ rāmaḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: All of us are favored that Rama will be the lord of the earth.

original: cirāya bhavitā goptā dṛṣṭalokaparāvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: cirāya bhavitā goptā dṛṣṭa loka parāvaraḥ
translated: He will be our protector for a long time, having seen the highest and the lowest.

original: anuddhatamanā vidvān dharmātmā bhrātṛvatsalaḥ /
analyzed: anuddhata manāḥ vidvān dharma ātmā bhrātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: The wise one, whose mind is not agitated, who has dharma in his soul, and who is affectionate towards his brothers,

original: yathā ca bhrātṛṣu snigdhas tathāsmāsv api rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā ca bhrātṛṣu snigdhaḥ tathā asmāsu api rāghavaḥ
translated: Just as Raghava is affectionate towards his brothers, so is he towards us.

original: ciraṃ jīvatu dharmātmā rājā daśaratho 'naghaḥ /
analyzed: ciram jīvatu dharma ātmā rājā daśarathaḥ naghaḥ
translated: May the righteous and sinless king Dasharatha live long,

original: yatprasādenābhiṣiktaṃ rāmaṃ drakṣyāmahe vayam // / / //
analyzed: yad prasādena abhiṣiktam rāmam drakṣyāmahe vayam
translated: by whose grace we will see Rama consecrated.

original: evaṃvidhaṃ kathayatāṃ paurāṇāṃ śuśruvus tadā /
analyzed: evaṃvidham kathayatām paurāṇām śuśruvuḥ tadā
translated: While the citizens were conversing in this way,

original: digbhyo 'pi śrutavṛttāntāḥ prāptā jānapadā janāḥ // / / //🔽te tu digbhyaḥ purīṃ prāptā draṣṭuṃ rāmābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: digbhyaḥ pi śruta vṛttāntāḥ prāptāḥ jānapadāḥ janāḥ  te tu digbhyaḥ purīm prāptāḥ draṣṭum rāma abhiṣecanam
translated: people from the countryside, who had heard the news from all directions, arrived.🔽They had come from all directions to see Rama's consecration.

original: rāmasya pūrayāmāsuḥ purīṃ jānapadā janāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmasya pūrayāmāsuḥ purīm jānapadāḥ janāḥ
translated: The people from the countryside filled the city with Rama.

original: janaughais tair visarpadbhiḥ śuśruve tatra nisvanaḥ /
analyzed: jana oghaiḥ taiḥ visarpadbhiḥ śuśruve tatra nisvanaḥ
translated: The sound of that multitude of people moving out was heard there,

original: parvasūdīrṇavegasya sāgarasyeva nisvanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parvasu udīrṇa vegasya sāgarasya iva nisvanaḥ
translated: like the sound of the ocean with its surging waves.

original: tatas tad indrakṣayasaṃnibhaṃ puraṃ didṛkṣubhir jānapadair upāgataiḥ /
analyzed: tatas tat indra kṣaya saṃnibham puram didṛkṣubhiḥ jānapadaiḥ upāgataiḥ
translated: Then that city, resembling Indra's abode, became filled with a loud noise on all sides,

original: samantataḥ sasvanam ākulaṃ babhau samudrayādobhir ivārṇavodakam // / / //
analyzed: samantataḥ sa svanam ākulam babhau samudra yādobhiḥ iva arṇava udakam
translated: as the people of the country came to see it, like the ocean water with the ocean monsters.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: jñātidāsī yato jātā kaikeyyās tu sahoṣitā /🔽prāsādaṃ candrasaṃkāśam āruroha yadṛcchayā // / / //
analyzed: jñātidāsī yatas jātā kaikeyyāḥ tu saha uṣitā  prāsādam candra saṃkāśam āruroha yadṛcchayā
translated: She was born as a slave of Kaikeyi's relatives and lived with her.🔽She ascended the palace resembling the moon, as she pleased.

original: siktarājapathāṃ kṛtsnāṃ prakīrṇakamalotpalām /
analyzed: sikta rāja pathām kṛtsnām prakīrṇa kamala utpalām
