analyzed: tatas sukhataram sarve rāme vatsyāma rājani
translated: Then all of us will live more happily under King Rama.

original: alam adya hi bhuktena paramārthair alaṃ ca naḥ /
analyzed: alam adya hi bhuktena parama arthaiḥ alam ca naḥ
translated: Enough now of eating, enough of the highest objects for us,

original: yathā paśyāma niryāntaṃ rāmaṃ rājye pratiṣṭhitam // / / //
analyzed: yathā paśyāma niryāntam rāmam rājye pratiṣṭhitam
translated: so that we may see Rama set out and established in the kingdom.

original: ato hi na priyataraṃ nānyat kiṃcid bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: atas hi na priyataram na anyat kiṃcid bhaviṣyati
translated: For there is nothing more dear to us than this,

original: yathābhiṣeko rāmasya rājyenāmitatejasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā abhiṣekaḥ rāmasya rājyena amita tejasaḥ
translated: than the consecration of Rama of immeasurable splendour in the kingdom.

original: etāś cānyāś ca suhṛdām udāsīnaḥ kathāḥ śubhāḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ ca anyāḥ ca suhṛdām udāsīnaḥ kathāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: Hearing these and other auspicious conversations of well-wishers, indifferent to them,

original: ātmasaṃpūjanīḥ śṛṇvan yayau rāmo mahāpatham // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇvan yayau rāmaḥ mahāpatham
translated: Rama went along the great road, hearing self-praising words.

original: na hi tasmān manaḥ kaścic cakṣuṣī vā narottamāt /
analyzed: na hi tasmāt manaḥ kaścid cakṣuṣī vā nara uttamāt
translated: For no one is able to turn his mind or eyes away from that best of men,

original: naraḥ śaknoty apākraṣṭum atikrānte 'pi rāghave // / / //
analyzed: naraḥ śaknoti apākraṣṭum atikrānte pi rāghave
translated: even when Raghava has passed by.

original: sarveṣāṃ sa hi dharmātmā varṇānāṃ kurute dayām /
analyzed: sarveṣām sa hi dharma ātmā varṇānām kurute dayām
translated: For he, the righteous one, shows compassion to all the social classes,

original: caturṇāṃ hi vayaḥsthānāṃ tena te tam anuvratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: caturṇām hi vayaḥsthānām tena te tam anuvratāḥ
translated: and therefore they are devoted to him, among the four stages of life.

original: sa rājakulam āsādya mahendrabhavanopamam /
analyzed: sa rājakulam āsādya mahā indra bhavana upamam
translated: Having reached the royal palace, resembling the palace of great Indra,

original: rājaputraḥ pitur veśma praviveśa śriyā jvalan // / / //
analyzed: rāja putraḥ pituḥ veśma praviveśa śriyā jvalan
translated: the prince, blazing with prosperity, entered his father's house.

original: sa sarvāḥ samatikramya kakṣyā daśarathātmajaḥ /
analyzed: sa sarvāḥ samatikramya kakṣyāḥ daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: Having passed through all the ten courts, Dasharatha's son,

original: saṃnivartya janaṃ sarvaṃ śuddhāntaḥpuram abhyagāt // / / //
analyzed: saṃnivartya janam sarvam śuddhāntaḥpuram abhyagāt
translated: having turned back all the people, went to the inner apartments.

original: tataḥ praviṣṭe pitur antikaṃ tadā janaḥ sa sarvo mudito nṛpātmaje /
analyzed: tatas praviṣṭe pituḥ antikam tadā janaḥ sa sarvaḥ muditaḥ nṛpa ātmaje
translated: Then, when the prince had entered his father's presence, all the people, delighted in the prince,

original: pratīkṣate tasya punaḥ sma nirgamaṃ yathodayaṃ candramasaḥ saritpatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratīkṣate tasya punar sma nirgamam yathā udayam candramasaḥ saritpatiḥ
translated: Awaited his return, as the lord of the waters [awaits] the rising of the moon.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: sa dadarśāsane rāmo niṣaṇṇaṃ pitaraṃ śubhe /
analyzed: sa dadarśa āsane rāmaḥ niṣaṇṇam pitaram śubhe
translated: Rama saw his father seated on a splendid throne,

original: kaikeyīsahitaṃ dīnaṃ mukhena pariśuṣyatā // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyī sahitam dīnam mukhena pariśuṣyatā
translated: pale and with a dry face, together with Kaikeyi.

original: sa pituś caraṇau pūrvam abhivādya vinītavat /
analyzed: sa pituḥ caraṇau pūrvam abhivādya vinīta vat
translated: Having first respectfully bowed at his father's feet,

original: tato vavande caraṇau kaikeyyāḥ susamāhitaḥ // / / //🔽rāmety uktvā ca vacanaṃ bāṣpaparyākulekṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vavande caraṇau kaikeyyāḥ su samāhitaḥ  rāma iti uktvā ca vacanam bāṣpa paryākula īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: he then duly saluted Kaikeyi's feet.🔽The king, with eyes filled with tears, uttered the word Rama,

original: śaśāka nṛpatir dīno nekṣituṃ nābhibhāṣitum // / / //
analyzed: śaśāka nṛpatiḥ dīnaḥ nā īkṣitum nā abhibhāṣitum
translated: but was too distressed to look at him or speak to him.

original: tad apūrvaṃ narapater dṛṣṭvā rūpaṃ bhayāvaham /
analyzed: tat apūrvam narapateḥ dṛṣṭvā rūpam bhaya āvaham
translated: Seeing that unprecedented fearful appearance of the king,

original: rāmo 'pi bhayam āpannaḥ padā spṛṣṭveva pannagam // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ u pi bhayam āpannaḥ padā spṛṣṭvā iva pannagam
translated: Rama too was frightened, as if he had stepped on a snake with his foot.

original: indriyair aprahṛṣṭais taṃ śokasaṃtāpakarśitam /
analyzed: indriyaiḥ a prahṛṣṭaiḥ tam śoka saṃtāpa karśitam
translated: With senses not delighted, emaciated by grief and sorrow,

original: niḥśvasantaṃ mahārājaṃ vyathitākulacetasam // / / //
analyzed: niḥśvasantam mahā rājam vyathita ākula cetasam
translated: sighing, the great king, with a troubled and agitated mind,

original: ūrmimālinam akṣobhyaṃ kṣubhyantam iva sāgaram /
analyzed: ūrmimālinam akṣobhyam kṣubhyantam iva sāgaram
translated: like an agitated and unperturbed ocean with garlands of waves,

original: upaplutam ivādityam uktānṛtam ṛṣiṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: upaplutam iva ādityam ukta anṛtam ṛṣim yathā
translated: like the sun when it is eclipsed, or like a Rishi when he speaks an untruth.

original: acintyakalpaṃ hi pitus taṃ śokam upadhārayan /
analyzed: acintya kalpam hi pituḥ tam śokam upadhārayan
translated: And remembering that grief of his father, which was beyond all thought,

original: babhūva saṃrabdhataraḥ samudra iva parvaṇi // / / //
analyzed: babhūva saṃrabdhataraḥ samudraḥ iva parvaṇi
translated: he became more and more agitated, like the ocean on the day of the full moon.

original: cintayāmāsa ca tadā rāmaḥ pitṛhite rataḥ /
analyzed: cintayāmāsa ca tadā rāmaḥ pitṛ hite rataḥ
translated: And then Rama, ever intent on the welfare of his father, began to reflect,

original: kiṃsvid adyaiva nṛpatir na māṃ pratyabhinandati // / / //
analyzed: kim svid adyā eva nṛpatiḥ na mām pratyabhinandati
translated: Why is it that the king does not to-day welcome me as usual?

original: anyadā māṃ pitā dṛṣṭvā kupito 'pi prasīdati /
analyzed: anyadā mām pitā dṛṣṭvā kupitaḥ pi prasīdati
translated: For when my father has seen me before, even if he was angry, he has been appeased.

original: tasya mām adya samprekṣya kimāyāsaḥ pravartate // / / //
analyzed: tasya mām adya samprekṣya kimāyāsaḥ pravartate
translated: But what is the cause of his grief now, that he does not look at me?

original: sa dīna iva śokārto viṣaṇṇavadanadyutiḥ /
analyzed: sa dīnaḥ iva śoka ārtaḥ viṣaṇṇa vadana dyutiḥ
translated: And he, as if afflicted and sorrowful, with his face and his lustre depressed,

original: kaikeyīm abhivādyaiva rāmo vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyīm abhivādya eva rāmaḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: having saluted Kaikeyi, Rama said these words:

original: kaccin mayā nāparādham ajñānād yena me pitā /
analyzed: kaccit mayā na aparādham ajñānāt yena me pitā
translated: Have I, through ignorance, committed any offence against my father, by which he is angry with me?

original: kupitas tan mamācakṣva tvaṃ caivainaṃ prasādaya // / / //🔽vivarṇavadano dīno na hi mām abhibhāṣate /
analyzed: kupitaḥ tat mama ācakṣva tvam ca eva enam prasādaya  vivarṇa vadanaḥ dīnaḥ na hi mām abhibhāṣate
translated: Tell me that, and appease his wrath.🔽For he does not speak to me, with his face pale and his countenance dejected.

original: śārīro mānaso vāpi kaccid enaṃ na bādhate /
analyzed: śārīraḥ mānasaḥ vā api kaccit enam na bādhate
translated: I hope no bodily or mental pain afflicts him.

original: saṃtāpo vābhitāpo vā durlabhaṃ hi sadā sukham // / / //
analyzed: saṃtāpaḥ vā abhitāpaḥ vā durlabham hi sadā sukham
translated: For sorrow or burning sorrow, one or the other, is always hard to bear.

original: kaccin na kiṃcid bharate kumāre priyadarśane /
analyzed: kaccit na kiṃcid bharate kumāre priya darśane
translated: Is there any misfortune to Bharata, the handsome prince,

original: śatrughne vā mahāsattve mātḥṇāṃ vā mamāśubham // / / //
analyzed: śatrughne vā mahāsattve mātḥṇām vā mama aśubham
translated: or to the greatly virtuous Shatrughna, or to my mothers?

original: atoṣayan mahārājam akurvan vā pitur vacaḥ /
analyzed: atoṣayat mahā rājam akurvan vā pituḥ vacaḥ
translated: Displeasing the great king or not carrying out my father's words,

original: muhūrtam api neccheyaṃ jīvituṃ kupite nṛpe // / / //
analyzed: muhūrtam api nā iccheyam jīvitum kupite nṛpe
translated: I would not wish to live even for a moment, if the king is angry.

original: yatomūlaṃ naraḥ paśyet prādurbhāvam ihātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yatomūlam naraḥ paśyet prādurbhāvam iha ātmanaḥ
translated: From which root a man should see his manifestation here,

original: kathaṃ tasmin na varteta pratyakṣe sati daivate // / / //
analyzed: katham tasmin na varteta pratyakṣe sati daivate
translated: how can he not act towards that, when the manifest deity is present?

original: kaccit te paruṣaṃ kiṃcid abhimānāt pitā mama /
analyzed: kaccit te paruṣam kiṃcid abhimānāt pitā mama
translated: Have you spoken harshly to my father out of pride,

original: ukto bhavatyā kopena yatrāsya lulitaṃ manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uktaḥ bhavatyā kopena yatra asya lulitam manaḥ
translated: out of anger, where his mind is shaken?

original: etad ācakṣva me devi tattvena paripṛcchataḥ /
analyzed: etat ācakṣva me devi tattvena paripṛcchataḥ
translated: Tell me this, O queen, truly, when I ask you.

original: kiṃnimittam apūrvo 'yaṃ vikāro manujādhipe // / / //
analyzed: kiṃnimittam apūrvaḥ yam vikāraḥ manuja adhipe
translated: For what reason is this unprecedented change in the lord of men?

original: ahaṃ hi vacanād rājñaḥ pateyam api pāvake /
analyzed: aham hi vacanāt rājñaḥ pateyam api pāvake
translated: For at the king's command I would even fall into the fire,

original: bhakṣayeyaṃ viṣaṃ tīkṣṇaṃ majjeyam api cārṇave /
analyzed: bhakṣayeyam viṣam tīkṣṇam majjeyam api ca arṇave
translated: I would eat sharp poison or even drown in the ocean.

original: niyukto guruṇā pitrā nṛpeṇa ca hitena ca // / / //
analyzed: niyuktaḥ guruṇā pitrā nṛpeṇa ca hitena ca
translated: Appointed by my father, the guru, and by the beneficent king,

original: tad brūhi vacanaṃ devi rājño yad abhikāṅkṣitam /
analyzed: tat brūhi vacanam devi rājñaḥ yat abhikāṅkṣitam
translated: Therefore, tell me, O queen, what the king desires to say.

original: kariṣye pratijāne ca rāmo dvir nābhibhāṣate // / / //
analyzed: kariṣye pratijāne ca rāmaḥ dvis na abhibhāṣate
translated: Rama speaks twice, but does not speak a second time after promising to do something.

original: tam ārjavasamāyuktam anāryā satyavādinam /
analyzed: tam ārjava samāyuktam anāryā satya vādinam
translated: To that truthful one endowed with sincerity,

original: uvāca rāmaṃ kaikeyī vacanaṃ bhṛśadāruṇam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rāmam kaikeyī vacanam bhṛśa dāruṇam
translated: Kaikeyi spoke to Rama these extremely terrible words.

original: purā devāsure yuddhe pitrā te mama rāghava /
analyzed: purā devāsure yuddhe pitrā te mama rāghava
translated: O Raghava, in the battle between gods and demons in the past, your father,

original: rakṣitena varau dattau saśalyena mahāraṇe // / / //
analyzed: rakṣitena varau dattau sa śalyena mahā raṇe
translated: protected by me, granted two boons in the great battle with arrows still in his body.

original: tatra me yācito rājā bharatasyābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: tatra me yācitaḥ rājā bharatasya abhiṣecanam
translated: There, the king was requested by me for the consecration of Bharata,

original: gamanaṃ daṇḍakāraṇye tava cādyaiva rāghava // / / //
analyzed: gamanam daṇḍaka araṇye tava ca adya eva rāghava
translated: and for your departure to the Dandaka forest today itself, O Raghava.

original: yadi satyapratijñaṃ tvaṃ pitaraṃ kartum icchasi /
analyzed: yadi satya pratijñam tvam pitaram kartum icchasi
translated: If you wish to fulfill your promise to your father,

original: ātmānaṃ ca naraśreṣṭha mama vākyam idaṃ śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: ātmānam ca nara śreṣṭha mama vākyam idam śṛṇu
translated: and to yourself, O best among men, listen to these words of mine.

original: sa nideśe pitus tiṣṭha yathā tena pratiśrutam /
analyzed: sa nideśe pituḥ tiṣṭha yathā tena pratiśrutam
translated: Abide by your father's command, as promised by him.

original: tvayāraṇyaṃ praveṣṭavyaṃ nava varṣāṇi pañca ca // / / //
analyzed: tvayā araṇyam praveṣṭavyam nava varṣāṇi pañca ca
translated: You must enter the forest for fourteen years.

original: sapta sapta ca varṣāṇi daṇḍakāraṇyam āśritaḥ /
analyzed: sapta sapta ca varṣāṇi daṇḍaka araṇyam āśritaḥ
translated: For seven years and seven months, residing in the Dandaka forest,

original: abhiṣekam imaṃ tyaktvā jaṭācīradharo vasa // / / //
analyzed: abhiṣekam imam tyaktvā jaṭā cīra dharaḥ vasa
translated: renouncing this consecration, wearing matted hair and bark garments, live.

original: bharataḥ kosalapure praśāstu vasudhām imām /
analyzed: bharataḥ kosala pure praśāstu vasudhām imām
translated: Let Bharata rule this earth in the city of Kosala.

original: nānāratnasamākīrṇāṃ savājirathakuñjarām // / / //
analyzed: nānā ratna samākīrṇām sa vāji ratha kuñjarām
translated: Filled with various gems, with horses, chariots and elephants.

original: tad apriyam amitraghno vacanaṃ maraṇopamam /
analyzed: tat apriyam amitra ghnaḥ vacanam maraṇa upamam
translated: Having heard those words, unpleasant and deadly,

original: śrutvā na vivyathe rāmaḥ kaikeyīṃ cedam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā na vivyathe rāmaḥ kaikeyīm ca idam abravīt
translated: Rama, the slayer of enemies, was not distressed and said to Kaikeyi:

original: evam astu gamiṣyāmi vanaṃ vastum ahaṃ tv ataḥ /
analyzed: evam astu gamiṣyāmi vanam vastum aham tu atas
translated: So be it. I shall go to the forest to live there.

original: jaṭācīradharo rājñaḥ pratijñām anupālayan // / / //🔽idaṃ tu jñātum icchāmi kimarthaṃ māṃ mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: jaṭā cīra dharaḥ rājñaḥ pratijñām anupālayan  idam tu jñātum icchāmi kimartham mām mahīpatiḥ
translated: Wearing matted hair and bark garments, I shall fulfill the king's vow.🔽But I wish to know why the invincible lord of the earth, the conqueror of enemies,

original: nābhinandati durdharṣo yathāpuram ariṃdamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na abhinandati durdharṣaḥ yathāpuram ariṃdamaḥ
translated: does not receive me as before.

original: manyur na ca tvayā kāryo devi brūhi tavāgrataḥ /
analyzed: manyuḥ na ca tvayā kāryaḥ devi brūhi tava agratas
translated: O queen, do not be angry. Tell me in front of you.

original: yāsyāmi bhava suprītā vanaṃ cīrajaṭādharaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yāsyāmi bhava su prītā vanam cīra jaṭā dharaḥ
translated: I shall go to the forest, wearing bark garments and matted hair. Be happy.

original: hitena guruṇā pitrā kṛtajñena nṛpeṇa ca /
analyzed: hitena guruṇā pitrā kṛtajñena nṛpeṇa ca
translated: By my kind and venerable father, the grateful king,

original: niyujyamāno viśrabdhaṃ kiṃ na kuryād ahaṃ priyam // / / //
analyzed: niyujyamānaḥ viśrabdham kim na kuryāt aham priyam
translated: when commanded with confidence, what favor should I not do?

original: alīkaṃ mānasaṃ tv ekaṃ hṛdayaṃ dahatīva me /
analyzed: alīkam mānasam tu ekam hṛdayam dahati iva me
translated: But one false thought burns my heart,

original: svayaṃ yan nāha māṃ rājā bharatasyābhiṣecanam // / / //
analyzed: svayam yat na āha mām rājā bharatasya abhiṣecanam
translated: that the king did not himself announce my consecration to Bharata.

original: ahaṃ hi sītāṃ rājyaṃ ca prāṇān iṣṭān dhanāni ca /
analyzed: aham hi sītām rājyam ca prāṇān iṣṭān dhanāni ca
translated: I give up Sita, the kingdom, my cherished life and wealth,

original: hṛṣṭo bhrātre svayaṃ dadyāṃ bharatāyāpracoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hṛṣṭaḥ bhrātre svayam dadyām bharatāya a pracoditaḥ
translated: I would myself give it to my brother Bharata, even without being asked.

original: kiṃ punar manujendreṇa svayaṃ pitrā pracoditaḥ /
analyzed: kim punar manuja indreṇa svayam pitrā pracoditaḥ
translated: What then, when I am urged by my father, the lord of men himself?

original: tava ca priyakāmārthaṃ pratijñām anupālayan // / / //
analyzed: tava ca priya kāma artham pratijñām anupālayan
translated: Fulfilling my promise for the sake of doing what is pleasing to you.

original: tad āśvāsaya hīmaṃ tvaṃ kiṃ nv idaṃ yan mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: tat āśvāsaya hi imam tvam kim nu idam yat mahīpatiḥ
translated: Therefore, console him. What is this that the lord of the earth,

original: vasudhāsaktanayano mandam aśrūṇi muñcati // / / //🔽gacchantu caivānayituṃ dūtāḥ śīghrajavair hayaiḥ /
analyzed: vasudhā sakta nayanaḥ mandam aśrūṇi muñcati  gacchantu ca eva ānayitum dūtāḥ śīghra javaiḥ hayaiḥ
translated: with eyes fixed on the ground, is shedding tears slowly?🔽And let messengers go today itself, by the king's command, to bring Bharata,

original: bharataṃ mātulakulād adyaiva nṛpaśāsanāt // / / //
analyzed: bharatam mātula kulāt adyā eva nṛpa śāsanāt
translated: on swift horses, from his maternal uncle's house.

original: daṇḍakāraṇyam eṣo 'ham ito gacchāmi satvaraḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍaka araṇyam eṣaḥ ham itas gacchāmi sa tvaraḥ
translated: I shall quickly go from here to the Dāndaka forest,

original: avicārya pitur vākyaṃ samāvastuṃ caturdaśa // / / //🔽sā hṛṣṭā tasya tadvākyaṃ śrutvā rāmasya kaikeyī /
analyzed: a vicārya pituḥ vākyam samāvastum caturdaśa  sā hṛṣṭā tasya tat vākyam śrutvā rāmasya kaikeyī
translated: without considering my father's words, and live there fourteen years.🔽Hearing those words of Rama, Kaikeyi was delighted,

original: prasthānaṃ śraddadhānā hi tvarayāmāsa rāghavam // / / //🔽evaṃ bhavatu yāsyanti dūtāḥ śīghrajavair hayaiḥ /
analyzed: prasthānam śraddadhānā hi tvarayāmāsa rāghavam  evam bhavatu yāsyanti dūtāḥ śīghra javaiḥ hayaiḥ
translated: and being eager for his departure, she hastened Rāghava.🔽Let it be so. Men shall go on swift horses to bring Bharata,

original: bharataṃ mātulakulād upāvartayituṃ narāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharatam mātula kulāt upāvartayitum narāḥ
translated: from his maternal uncle's house.

original: tava tv ahaṃ kṣamaṃ manye notsukasya vilambanam /
analyzed: tava tu aham kṣamam manye na utsukasya vilambanam
translated: But I think it is not proper for one who is eager to delay.

original: rāma tasmād itaḥ śīghraṃ vanaṃ tvaṃ gantum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: rāma tasmāt itas śīghram vanam tvam gantum arhasi
translated: Therefore, O Rama, you should quickly go from here to the forest.

original: vrīḍānvitaḥ svayaṃ yac ca nṛpas tvāṃ nābhibhāṣate /
analyzed: vrīḍā anvitaḥ svayam yat ca nṛpaḥ tvām nā abhibhāṣate
translated: And because the king himself, out of shame, does not address you,

original: naitat kiṃcin naraśreṣṭha manyur eṣo 'panīyatām // / / //
analyzed: na etat kiṃcid nara śreṣṭha manyuḥ eṣa u panīyatām
translated: this is nothing, O best of men, let this anger be removed.

original: yāvat tvaṃ na vanaṃ yātaḥ purād asmād abhitvaran /
analyzed: yāvat tvam na vanam yātaḥ purāt asmāt abhitvaran
translated: As long as you do not go to the forest from this city in haste,

original: pitā tāvan na te rāma snāsyate bhokṣyate 'pi vā // / / //
analyzed: pitā tāvat na te rāma snāsyate bhokṣyate vā
translated: your father, O Rama, will neither bathe nor eat.

original: dhik kaṣṭam iti niḥśvasya rājā śokapariplutaḥ /
analyzed: dhik kaṣṭam iti niḥśvasya rājā śoka pariplutaḥ
translated: Sighing Alas, misfortune! the king, overwhelmed with grief,

original: mūrchito nyapatat tasmin paryaṅke hemabhūṣite // / / //
analyzed: mūrchitaḥ nyapatat tasmin paryaṅke hema bhūṣite
translated: fell down unconscious on that couch adorned with gold.

original: rāmo 'py utthāpya rājānaṃ kaikeyyābhipracoditaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ pi utthāpya rājānam kaikeyyā abhipracoditaḥ
translated: Rama also, urged on by Kaikeyi, raised the king

original: kaśayevāhato vājī vanaṃ gantuṃ kṛtatvaraḥ // / / //🔽tad apriyam anāryāyā vacanaṃ dāruṇodaram /
analyzed: kaśayā iva āhataḥ vājī vanam gantum kṛta tvaraḥ  tat apriyam anāryāyāḥ vacanam dāruṇa udaram
translated: and, like a horse struck with a whip, hastened to go to the forest.🔽Having heard those words of the ignoble one, of terrible import,

original: śrutvā gatavyatho rāmaḥ kaikeyīṃ vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā gata vyathaḥ rāmaḥ kaikeyīm vākyam abravīt
translated: Rama, unperturbed, spoke to Kaikeyi.

original: nāham arthaparo devi lokam āvastum utsahe /
analyzed: na aham artha paraḥ devi lokam āvastum utsahe
translated: I do not, O queen, desire to live in this world for the sake of wealth.

original: viddhi mām ṛṣibhis tulyaṃ kevalaṃ dharmam āsthitam // / / //
analyzed: viddhi mām ṛṣibhiḥ tulyam kevalam dharmam āsthitam
translated: Know me to be equal to the sages, abiding solely in righteousness.

original: yad atrabhavataḥ kiṃcic chakyaṃ kartuṃ priyaṃ mayā /
analyzed: yat atrabhavataḥ kiṃcid śakyam kartum priyam mayā
translated: Whatever I can do to please you,

original: prāṇān api parityajya sarvathā kṛtam eva tat // / / //
analyzed: prāṇān api parityajya sarvathā kṛtam eva tat
translated: I will do it by all means, even at the cost of my life.

original: na hy ato dharmacaraṇaṃ kiṃcid asti mahattaram /
analyzed: na hi atas dharma caraṇam kiṃcid asti mahattaram
translated: For there is no greater practice of dharma

original: yathā pitari śuśrūṣā tasya vā vacanakriyā // / / //
analyzed: yathā pitari śuśrūṣā tasya vā vacana kriyā
translated: than serving one's father or doing what he says.

original: anukto 'py atrabhavatā bhavatyā vacanād aham /
analyzed: an uktaḥ pi atrabhavatā bhavatyāḥ vacanāt aham
translated: Even though you have not said so, I will live

original: vane vatsyāmi vijane varṣāṇīha caturdaśa // / / //
analyzed: vane vatsyāmi vijane varṣāṇi iha caturdaśa
translated: in the desolate forest for fourteen years by your word.🔽O Kaikeyi, you certainly do not expect

original: na nūnaṃ mayi kaikeyi kiṃcid āśaṃsase guṇam /
analyzed: na nūnam mayi kaikeyi kiṃcid āśaṃsase guṇam
translated: any good qualities from me,

original: yad rājānam avocas tvaṃ mameśvaratarā satī // / / //
analyzed: yat rājānam avocaḥ tvam mama īśvaratarā satī
translated: since you spoke to the king, being more powerful than me,🔽saying, Let Rama go to the forest.

original: yāvan mātaram āpṛcche sītāṃ cānunayāmy aham /
analyzed: yāvat mātaram āpṛcche sītām ca anunayāmi aham
translated: As long as I take leave of my mother and console Sita,

original: tato 'dyaiva gamiṣyāmi daṇḍakānāṃ mahad vanam // / / //
analyzed: tatas gamiṣyāmi daṇḍakānām mahat vanam
translated: then I will leave today very morning for the great forest of the Dandakas.

original: bharataḥ pālayed rājyaṃ śuśrūṣec ca pitur yathā /
analyzed: bharataḥ pālayet rājyam śuśrūṣet ca pituḥ yathā
translated: Bharata should rule the kingdom and serve his father,

original: tathā bhavatyā kartavyaṃ sa hi dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ // / / //🔽sa rāmasya vacaḥ śrutvā bhṛśaṃ duḥkhahataḥ pitā /
analyzed: tathā bhavatyā kartavyam sa hi dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ  sa rāmasya vacaḥ śrutvā bhṛśam duḥkha hataḥ pitā
translated: just as it is the eternal duty of you to do likewise.🔽 Hearing Rama's words, his father, deeply afflicted by sorrow,

original: śokād aśaknuvan bāṣpaṃ praruroda mahāsvanam // / / //
analyzed: śokāt a śaknuvan bāṣpam praruroda mahā svanam
translated: was unable to control his tears and wept aloud in grief.

original: vanditvā caraṇau rāmo visaṃjñasya pitus tadā /
analyzed: vanditvā caraṇau rāmaḥ visaṃjñasya pituḥ tadā
translated: And having saluted the feet of his unconscious father,

original: kaikeyyāś cāpy anāryāyā niṣpapāta mahādyutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ ca api anāryāyāḥ niṣpapāta mahā dyutiḥ
translated: and also of the ignoble Kaikeyi, the greatly effulgent Rama departed.

original: sa rāmaḥ pitaraṃ kṛtvā kaikeyīṃ ca pradakṣiṇam /
analyzed: sa rāmaḥ pitaram kṛtvā kaikeyīm ca pradakṣiṇam
translated: And Rama, having circumambulated his father and Kaikeyi,

original: niṣkramyāntaḥpurāt tasmāt svaṃ dadarśa suhṛjjanam // / / //🔽taṃ bāṣpaparipūrṇākṣaḥ pṛṣṭhato 'nujagāma ha /
analyzed: niṣkramya antaḥpurāt tasmāt svam dadarśa suhṛd janam  tam bāṣpa paripūrṇa akṣaḥ pṛṣṭhatas nujagāma ha
translated: went out of the inner apartments and saw his friends and relatives.

original: lakṣmaṇaḥ paramakruddhaḥ sumitrānandavardhanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ parama kruddhaḥ sumitrā ānanda vardhanaḥ
translated: And Lakshmana, the enhancer of Sumitra's joy, followed him at the rear, his eyes filled with tears, exceedingly wroth.

original: ābhiṣecanikaṃ bhāṇḍaṃ kṛtvā rāmaḥ pradakṣiṇam /
analyzed: ābhiṣecanikam bhāṇḍam kṛtvā rāmaḥ pradakṣiṇam
translated: And Rama, having circumambulated the vessels for the installation,

original: śanair jagāma sāpekṣo dṛṣṭiṃ tatrāvicālayan // / / //
analyzed: śanais jagāma sa apekṣaḥ dṛṣṭim tatra a vicālayan
translated: slowly went away, casting his eyes on that spot, with a longing heart.

original: na cāsya mahatīṃ lakṣmīṃ rājyanāśo 'pakarṣati /
analyzed: na ca asya mahatīm lakṣmīm rājya nāśaḥ upakarṣati
translated: And the loss of his kingdom did not diminish his great glory,

original: lokakāntasya kāntatvaṃ śītaraśmer iva kṣapā // / / //
analyzed: loka kāntasya kānta tvam śītaraśmeḥ iva kṣapā
translated: just as the night does not diminish the beauty of the moon, dear to all.

original: na vanaṃ gantukāmasya tyajataś ca vasuṃdharām /
analyzed: na vanam gantu kāmasya tyajataḥ ca vasuṃdharām
translated: And as he was about to go to the forest, and to abandon the earth,

original: sarvalokātigasyeva lakṣyate cittavikriyā // / / //
analyzed: sarva loka atigasya iva lakṣyate citta vikriyā
translated: no change was seen in his mind, as if he had transcended all the worlds.

original: dhārayan manasā duḥkham indriyāṇi nigṛhya ca /
analyzed: dhārayan manasā duḥkham indriyāṇi nigṛhya ca
translated: And restraining his senses, and bearing his grief in his mind,

original: praviveśātmavān veśma mātur apriyaśaṃsivān // / / //
analyzed: praviveśa ātmavān veśma mātuḥ apriya śaṃsivān
translated: the self-possessed one entered his mother's apartment, to announce to her the unwelcome news.

original: praviśya veśmātibhṛśaṃ mudānvitaṃ samīkṣya tāṃ cārthavipattim āgatām /
analyzed: praviśya veśma ati bhṛśam mudā anvitam samīkṣya tām ca artha vipattim āgatām
translated: Entering the house filled with great joy, and seeing her come to misfortune,

original: na caiva rāmo 'tra jagāma vikriyāṃ suhṛjjanasyātmavipattiśaṅkayā // / / //
analyzed: na ca eva jagāma vikriyām suhṛd janasya ātma vipatti śaṅkayā
translated: Rama did not show any change here, fearing misfortune for his friends.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: rāmas tu bhṛśam āyasto niḥśvasann iva kuñjaraḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tu bhṛśam āyastaḥ niḥśvasan iva kuñjaraḥ
translated: But Rama, greatly afflicted, sighing like an elephant,

original: jagāma sahito bhrātrā mātur antaḥpuraṃ vaśī // / / //
analyzed: jagāma sahitaḥ bhrātrā mātuḥ antaḥpuram vaśī
translated: went with his brother to his mother's inner quarters, the self-controlled one.

original: so 'paśyat puruṣaṃ tatra vṛddhaṃ paramapūjitam /
analyzed: saḥ paśyat puruṣam tatra vṛddham parama pūjitam
translated: He saw there an old man, greatly honored,

original: upaviṣṭaṃ gṛhadvāri tiṣṭhataś cāparān bahūn // / / //
analyzed: upaviṣṭam gṛha dvāri tiṣṭhataḥ ca aparān bahūn
translated: seated at the door of the house and many others standing.

original: praviśya prathamāṃ kakṣyāṃ dvitīyāyāṃ dadarśa saḥ /
analyzed: praviśya prathamām kakṣyām dvitīyāyām dadarśa saḥ
translated: Having entered the first courtyard, in the second he saw

original: brāhmaṇān vedasampannān vṛddhān rājñābhisatkṛtān // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇān veda sampannān vṛddhān rājñā abhisatkṛtān
translated: brahmins endowed with the Vedas, old, honored by the king.

original: praṇamya rāmas tān vṛddhāṃs tṛtīyāyāṃ dadarśa saḥ /
analyzed: praṇamya rāmaḥ tān vṛddhān tṛtīyāyām dadarśa saḥ
translated: Rama, having bowed to those old men, in the third he saw

original: striyo vṛddhāś ca bālāś ca dvārarakṣaṇatatparāḥ // / / //🔽vardhayitvā prahṛṣṭās tāḥ praviśya ca gṛhaṃ striyaḥ /
analyzed: striyaḥ vṛddhāḥ ca bālāḥ ca dvāra rakṣaṇa tatparāḥ  vardhayitvā prahṛṣṭāḥ tāḥ praviśya ca gṛham striyaḥ
translated: old women and young girls, intent on guarding the door.🔽Having delighted them, the women, having entered the house,

original: nyavedayanta tvaritā rāmamātuḥ priyaṃ tadā // / / //
analyzed: nyavedayanta tvaritāḥ rāma mātuḥ priyam tadā
translated: quickly informed Rama's mother of that good news.

original: kausalyāpi tadā devī rātriṃ sthitvā samāhitā /
analyzed: kausalyā api tadā devī rātrim sthitvā samāhitā
translated: And the queen Kausalyā, having passed the night in meditation,

original: prabhāte tv akarot pūjāṃ viṣṇoḥ putrahitaiṣiṇī // / / //
analyzed: prabhāte tu akarot pūjām viṣṇoḥ putra hita eṣiṇī
translated: in the morning worshipped Viṣṇu, desirous of the welfare of her son.

original: sā kṣaumavasanā hṛṣṭā nityaṃ vrataparāyaṇā /
analyzed: sā kṣauma vasanā hṛṣṭā nityam vrata parāyaṇā
translated: She, clad in silken garments, ever devoted to vows,

original: agniṃ juhoti sma tadā mantravat kṛtamaṅgalā // / / //
analyzed: agnim juhoti sma tadā mantravat kṛta maṅgalā
translated: and having performed auspicious rites, offered oblations into the fire with mantras.

original: praviśya ca tadā rāmo mātur antaḥpuraṃ śubham /
analyzed: praviśya ca tadā rāmaḥ mātuḥ antaḥpuram śubham
translated: And Rāma, having entered the auspicious inner apartments of his mother,

original: dadarśa mātaraṃ tatra hāvayantīṃ hutāśanam // / / //
analyzed: dadarśa mātaram tatra hāvayantīm hutāśanam
translated: saw his mother there offering oblations into the sacred fire.

original: sā cirasyātmajaṃ dṛṣṭvā mātṛnandanam āgatam /
analyzed: sā cirasya ātmajam dṛṣṭvā mātṛ nandanam āgatam
translated: And she, having seen her son, the delighter of his mother, come after a long time,

original: abhicakrāma saṃhṛṣṭā kiśoraṃ vaḍabā yathā // / / //🔽tam uvāca durādharṣaṃ rāghavaṃ sutam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: abhicakrāma saṃhṛṣṭā kiśoram vaḍabā yathā  tam uvāca durādharṣam rāghavam sutam ātmanaḥ
translated: approached him joyfully, like a mare to her colt.

original: kausalyā putravātsalyād idaṃ priyahitaṃ vacaḥ // / / //🔽vṛddhānāṃ dharmaśīlānāṃ rājarṣīṇāṃ mahātmanām /
analyzed: kausalyā putra vātsalyāt idam priya hitam vacaḥ  vṛddhānām dharma śīlānām rājarṣīṇām mahātmanām
translated: And Kausalyā, out of affection for her son, spoke to that invincible son of hers, Rāghava, these words that were dear and beneficial:

original: prāpnuhy āyuś ca kīrtiṃ ca dharmaṃ copahitaṃ kule // / / //
analyzed: prāpnuhi āyuḥ ca kīrtim ca dharmam ca upahitam kule
translated: Obtain long life, fame, and righteousness established in the family of those great royal sages of advanced age and virtuous conduct.

original: satyapratijñaṃ pitaraṃ rājānaṃ paśya rāghava /
analyzed: satya pratijñam pitaram rājānam paśya rāghava
translated: See, O Rāghava, your father, who is true to his promise, the king.

original: adyaiva hi tvāṃ dharmātmā yauvarājye 'bhiṣekṣyati // / / //
analyzed: adyā eva hi tvām dharma ātmā yauvarājye bhiṣekṣyati
translated: For today only the righteous one will consecrate you as heir apparent.

original: mātaraṃ rāghavaḥ kiṃcit prasāryāñjalim abravīt /
analyzed: mātaram rāghavaḥ kiṃcid prasārya añjalim abravīt
translated: Rāghava, stretching out his joined hands a little, spoke to his mother, saying,

original: sa svabhāvavinītaś ca gauravāc ca tadānataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa svabhāva vinītaḥ ca gauravāt ca tadā ānataḥ
translated: He, who was naturally modest, and from respect was bent down,

original: devi nūnaṃ na jānīṣe mahad bhayam upasthitam /
analyzed: devi nūnam na jānīṣe mahat bhayam upasthitam
translated: said, O goddess, you know not, forsooth, the great danger that is at hand.

original: idaṃ tava ca duḥkhāya vaidehyā lakṣmaṇasya ca // / / //
analyzed: idam tava ca duḥkhāya vaidehyāḥ lakṣmaṇasya ca
translated: This will be a cause of grief to you, to Vaidehī, and to Lakṣmaṇa.

original: caturdaśa hi varṣāṇi vatsyāmi vijane vane /
analyzed: caturdaśa hi varṣāṇi vatsyāmi vijane vane
translated: For fourteen years I shall dwell in a solitary forest,

original: madhumūlaphalair jīvan hitvā munivad āmiṣam // / / //
analyzed: madhu mūla phalaiḥ jīvan hitvā muni vat āmiṣam
translated: living on honey, roots, and fruits, and renouncing flesh as the ascetics do.

original: bharatāya mahārājo yauvarājyaṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: bharatāya mahā rājaḥ yauvarājyam prayacchati
translated: The great king bestows the office of heir-apparent on Bharata,

original: māṃ punar daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ vivāsayati tāpasam // / / //
analyzed: mām punar daṇḍaka araṇyam vivāsayati tāpasam
translated: and sends me, an ascetic, to the forest of Dandaka.

original: tām aduḥkhocitāṃ dṛṣṭvā patitāṃ kadalīm iva /
analyzed: tām aduḥkha ucitām dṛṣṭvā patitām kadalīm iva
translated: Seeing her, who was not accustomed to misery, fallen down like a plantain tree,

original: rāmas tūtthāpayāmāsa mātaraṃ gatacetasam // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ tu utthāpayāmāsa mātaram gata cetasam
translated: Rāma raised up his mother, who had lost her senses.

original: upāvṛtyotthitāṃ dīnāṃ vaḍabām iva vāhitām /
analyzed: upāvṛtya utthitām dīnām vaḍabām iva vāhitām
translated: She, who had come back and risen up, miserable, like a mare beaten (by her driver),

original: pāṃśuguṇṭhitasarvāṅgīṃ vimamarśa ca pāṇinā // / / //
analyzed: pāṃśu guṇṭhita sarva aṅgīm vimamarśa ca pāṇinā
translated: whose whole body was covered with dust, he stroked with his hand.

original: sā rāghavam upāsīnam asukhārtā sukhocitā /
analyzed: sā rāghavam upāsīnam asukha ārtā sukha ucitā
translated: She, who was accustomed to happiness, and who was afflicted with sorrow,

original: uvāca puruṣavyāghram upaśṛṇvati lakṣmaṇe // / / //
analyzed: uvāca puruṣa vyāghram upaśṛṇvati lakṣmaṇe
translated: spoke to Rāghava, the best of men, in the hearing of Lakṣmaṇa,

original: yadi putra na jāyethā mama śokāya rāghava /
analyzed: yadi putra na jāyethāḥ mama śokāya rāghava
translated: If, O son, you had not been born, O Rāghava, to cause me sorrow,

original: na sma duḥkham ato bhūyaḥ paśyeyam aham aprajā // / / //
analyzed: na sma duḥkham atas bhūyas paśyeyam aham aprajā
translated: I shall never again see such sorrow as I do today, childless as I am.

original: eka eva hi vandhyāyāḥ śoko bhavati mānavaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva hi vandhyāyāḥ śokaḥ bhavati mānavaḥ
translated: For a barren woman there is only one sorrow, O man,

original: aprajāsmīti saṃtāpo na hy anyaḥ putra vidyate // / / //
analyzed: aprajā asmi iti saṃtāpaḥ na hi anyaḥ putra vidyate
translated: that she is childless. There is no other, O son.

original: na dṛṣṭapūrvaṃ kalyāṇaṃ sukhaṃ vā patipauruṣe /
analyzed: na dṛṣṭa pūrvam kalyāṇam sukham vā pati pauruṣe
translated: I have never seen any good or happiness in my husband's person.

original: api putre vipaśyeyam iti rāmāsthitaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: api putre vipaśyeyam iti rāma āsthitam mayā
translated: I have lived in the hope, O Rama, that I might see them in a son.

original: sā bahūny amanojñāni vākyāni hṛdayacchidām /
analyzed: sā bahūni amanojñāni vākyāni hṛdaya chidām
translated: I shall hear many unpleasant words, cutting to the heart,

original: ahaṃ śroṣye sapatnīnām avarāṇāṃ varā satī /
analyzed: aham śroṣye sapatnīnām avarāṇām varā satī
translated: from my co-wives, though I am the best of them, being the eldest.

original: ato duḥkhataraṃ kiṃ nu pramadānāṃ bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: atas duḥkhataram kim nu pramadānām bhaviṣyati
translated: What can be more sorrowful to women than this?

original: tvayi saṃnihite 'py evam aham āsaṃ nirākṛtā /
analyzed: tvayi saṃnihite pi evam aham āsam nirākṛtā
translated: Even while you are present, I am thus slighted.

original: kiṃ punaḥ proṣite tāta dhruvaṃ maraṇam eva me // / / //
analyzed: kim punar proṣite tāta dhruvam maraṇam eva me
translated: What will it be, O father, when you are gone? Death is certain.

original: yo hi māṃ sevate kaścid atha vāpy anuvartate /
analyzed: yaḥ hi mām sevate kaścid atha vā api anuvartate
translated: Whoever serves me or follows me,

original: kaikeyyāḥ putram anvīkṣya sa jano nābhibhāṣate // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ putram anvīkṣya sa janaḥ na abhibhāṣate
translated: that man, seeing that Kaikeyi's son is to be king, does not speak to me.

original: daśa sapta ca varṣāṇi tava jātasya rāghava /
analyzed: daśa sapta ca varṣāṇi tava jātasya rāghava
translated: Seven and ten years have passed, O Raghava, since your birth,

original: atītāni prakāṅkṣantyā mayā duḥkhaparikṣayam // / / //
analyzed: atītāni prakāṅkṣantyā mayā duḥkha parikṣayam
translated: while I have been waiting for the end of my sorrow.

original: upavāsaiś ca yogaiś ca bahubhiś ca pariśramaiḥ /
analyzed: upavāsaiḥ ca yogaiḥ ca bahubhiḥ ca pariśramaiḥ
translated: By fasts, by penances, by many toils,

original: duḥkhaṃ saṃvardhito moghaṃ tvaṃ hi durgatayā mayā // / / //
analyzed: duḥkham saṃvardhitaḥ mogham tvam hi durgatayā mayā
translated: Have I reared thee in vain, O thou of wretched life!

original: sthiraṃ tu hṛdayaṃ manye mamedaṃ yan na dīryate /
analyzed: sthiram tu hṛdayam manye mama idam yat na dīryate
translated: I think my heart must be hard, since it does not break,

original: prāvṛṣīva mahānadyāḥ spṛṣṭaṃ kūlaṃ navāmbhasā // / / //
analyzed: prāvṛṣi iva mahā nadyāḥ spṛṣṭam kūlam nava ambhasā
translated: Like a bank of the great river in the rains, when touched by the fresh waters.

original: mamaiva nūnaṃ maraṇaṃ na vidyate na cāvakāśo 'sti yamakṣaye mama /
analyzed: mama eva nūnam maraṇam na vidyate na ca avakāśaḥ sti yama kṣaye mama
translated: Surely death does not exist for me, nor is there room for me in Yama's abode,

original: yad antako 'dyaiva na māṃ jihīrṣati prasahya siṃho rudatīṃ mṛgīm iva // / / //
analyzed: yat antakaḥ dyā eva na mām jihīrṣati prasahya siṃhaḥ rudatīm mṛgīm iva
translated: Since the Destroyer does not carry me off this very day, like a weeping hind by a lion.

original: sthiraṃ hi nūnaṃ hṛdayaṃ mamāyasaṃ na bhidyate yad bhuvi nāvadīryate /
analyzed: sthiram hi nūnam hṛdayam mama āyasam na bhidyate yat bhuvi na avadīryate
translated: Surely my heart is hard as iron, since it does not break into a hundred pieces on the ground,

original: anena duḥkhena ca deham arpitaṃ dhruvaṃ hy akāle maraṇaṃ na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: anena duḥkhena ca deham arpitam dhruvam hi akāle maraṇam na vidyate
translated: And since my body is not torn to pieces by this grief, for death at the wrong time certainly does not exist.

original: idaṃ tu duḥkhaṃ yad anarthakāni me vratāni dānāni ca saṃyamāś ca hi /
analyzed: idam tu duḥkham yat anarthakāni me vratāni dānāni ca saṃyamāḥ ca hi
translated: But this is the grief that my vows, gifts, and restraints are fruitless,

original: tapaś ca taptaṃ yad apatyakāraṇāt suniṣphalaṃ bījam ivoptam ūṣare // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ ca taptam yat apatya kāraṇāt su niṣphalam bījam iva uptam ūṣare
translated: And that the penance I have performed for the sake of offspring is like seed sown in salt soil, without fruit.

original: yadi hy akāle maraṇaṃ svayecchayā labheta kaścid guruduḥkhakarśitaḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi akāle maraṇam svayā icchayā labheta kaścid guru duḥkha karśitaḥ
translated: If anyone, afflicted by the sorrow of his elders, could obtain death at his own will, not at the proper time,

original: gatāham adyaiva paretasaṃsadaṃ vinā tvayā dhenur ivātmajena vai // / / //
analyzed: gatā aham adyā eva pareta saṃsadam vinā tvayā dhenuḥ iva ātmajena vai
translated: Then I would have gone today itself to the assembly of the dead, without you, like a cow without her calf.

original: bhṛśam asukham amarṣitā tadā bahu vilalāpa samīkṣya rāghavam /
analyzed: bhṛśam asukham amarṣitā tadā bahu vilalāpa samīkṣya rāghavam
translated: Having seen Raghava, she lamented much in great sorrow and intolerance,

original: vyasanam upaniśāmya sā mahat sutam iva baddham avekṣya kiṃnarī // / / //
analyzed: vyasanam upaniśāmya sā mahat sutam iva baddham avekṣya kiṃnarī
translated: Like a kinnara woman seeing her bound son, having witnessed that great calamity.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽tathā tu vilapantīṃ tāṃ kausalyāṃ rāmamātaram /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  tathā tu vilapantīm tām kausalyām rāma mātaram
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: uvāca lakṣmaṇo dīnas tat kālasadṛśaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca lakṣmaṇaḥ dīnaḥ tat kāla sadṛśam vacaḥ
translated: Thus, Lakshmana spoke to Kausalya, the mother of Rama, who was lamenting like this, words befitting that occasion, in a distressed manner.

original: na rocate mamāpy etad ārye yad rāghavo vanam /
analyzed: na rocate mama api etat ārye yat rāghavaḥ vanam
translated: O noble one, I also do not like that Raghava should go to the forest,

original: tyaktvā rājyaśriyaṃ gacchet striyā vākyavaśaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tyaktvā rājya śriyam gacchet striyāḥ vākya vaśam gataḥ
translated: Abandoning the glory of the kingdom, under the control of a woman's words.

original: viparītaś ca vṛddhaś ca viṣayaiś ca pradharṣitaḥ /
analyzed: viparītaḥ ca vṛddhaḥ ca viṣayaiḥ ca pradharṣitaḥ
translated: The king, being contrary, old, and overcome by sensual objects,

original: nṛpaḥ kim iva na brūyāc codyamānaḥ samanmathaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nṛpaḥ kim iva na brūyāt codyamānaḥ sa manmathaḥ
translated: What would he not say, being goaded by lust?

original: nāsyāparādhaṃ paśyāmi nāpi doṣaṃ tathāvidham /
analyzed: na asya aparādham paśyāmi nā api doṣam tathāvidham
translated: I do not see any offense of his, nor any such fault,

original: yena nirvāsyate rāṣṭrād vanavāsāya rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yena nirvāsyate rāṣṭrāt vana vāsāya rāghavaḥ
translated: By which Raghava is being exiled from the kingdom to live in the forest.

original: na taṃ paśyāmy ahaṃ loke parokṣam api yo naraḥ /
analyzed: na tam paśyāmi aham loke parokṣam api yaḥ naraḥ
translated: I do not see in this world, even in secret, that man,

original: amitro 'pi nirasto 'pi yo 'sya doṣam udāharet // / / //
analyzed: amitraḥ pi nirastaḥ pi yaḥ sya doṣam udāharet
translated: even if he be an enemy or a defeated person, who would point out his fault.

original: devakalpam ṛjuṃ dāntaṃ ripūṇām api vatsalam /
analyzed: deva kalpam ṛjum dāntam ripūṇām api vatsalam
translated: He was like a god, upright, self-controlled, and kind even to his enemies.

original: avekṣamāṇaḥ ko dharmaṃ tyajet putram akāraṇāt // / / //
analyzed: avekṣamāṇaḥ kaḥ dharmam tyajet putram akāraṇāt
translated: Considering this, who would abandon his son without cause, forsaking righteousness?

original: tad idaṃ vacanaṃ rājñaḥ punar bālyam upeyuṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat idam vacanam rājñaḥ punar bālyam upeyuṣaḥ
translated: This is the speech of the king, who has again become a child.

original: putraḥ ko hṛdaye kuryād rājavṛttam anusmaran // / / //
analyzed: putraḥ kaḥ hṛdaye kuryāt rāja vṛttam anusmaran
translated: What son, remembering the conduct of a king, would keep it in his heart?

original: yāvad eva na jānāti kaścid artham imaṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: yāvat eva na jānāti kaścid artham imam naraḥ
translated: As long as no man knows this matter,

original: tāvad eva mayā sārdham ātmasthaṃ kuru śāsanam // / / //
analyzed: tāvat eva mayā sārdham ātma stham kuru śāsanam
translated: for so long keep your command in your own heart, together with me.

original: mayā pārśve sadhanuṣā tava guptasya rāghava /
analyzed: mayā pārśve sa dhanuṣā tava guptasya rāghava
translated: With me at your side, with my bow, protecting you, O Raghava,

original: kaḥ samartho 'dhikaṃ kartuṃ kṛtāntasyeva tiṣṭhataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ samarthaḥ dhikam kartum kṛtāntasya iva tiṣṭhataḥ
translated: who is able to do more than this, as if standing before Death himself?

original: nirmanuṣyām imāṃ sarvām ayodhyāṃ manujarṣabha /
analyzed: nirmanuṣyām imām sarvām ayodhyām manuja ṛṣabha
translated: This entire Ayodhya, bull among men, I will make devoid of men

original: kariṣyāmi śarais tīkṣṇair yadi sthāsyati vipriye // / / //
analyzed: kariṣyāmi śaraiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ yadi sthāsyati vipriye
translated: with my sharp arrows, if it stands in opposition.

original: bharatasyātha pakṣyo vā yo vāsya hitam icchati /
analyzed: bharatasya atha pakṣyaḥ vā yaḥ vā asya hitam icchati
translated: Whether it be the partisans of Bharata or anyone who wishes him well,

original: sarvān etān vadhiṣyāmi mṛdur hi paribhūyate // / / //
analyzed: sarvān etān vadhiṣyāmi mṛduḥ hi paribhūyate
translated: I will slay them all, for the gentle one is despised.

original: tvayā caiva mayā caiva kṛtvā vairam anuttamam /
analyzed: tvayā ca eva mayā ca eva kṛtvā vairam anuttamam
translated: Having created an excellent enmity with you and me,

original: kasya śaktiḥ śriyaṃ dātuṃ bharatāyāriśāsana // / / //
analyzed: kasya śaktiḥ śriyam dātum bharatāya ari śāsana
translated: O chastiser of enemies, who has the power to bestow prosperity on Bharata?

original: anurakto 'smi bhāvena bhrātaraṃ devi tattvataḥ /
analyzed: anuraktaḥ smi bhāvena bhrātaram devi tattvataḥ
translated: O queen, I am truly devoted to my brother with all my heart.

original: satyena dhanuṣā caiva datteneṣṭena te śape // / / //
analyzed: satyena dhanuṣā ca eva dattena iṣṭena te śape
translated: I swear by truth, by the bow, by the gifts and sacrifices I have made to you.

original: dīptam agnim araṇyaṃ vā yadi rāmaḥ pravekṣyate /
analyzed: dīptam agnim araṇyam vā yadi rāmaḥ pravekṣyate
translated: If Rama enters a blazing fire or the forest,

original: praviṣṭaṃ tatra māṃ devi tvaṃ pūrvam avadhāraya // / / //
analyzed: praviṣṭam tatra mām devi tvam pūrvam avadhāraya
translated: O queen, you should know that I have entered there before him.

original: harāmi vīryād duḥkhaṃ te tamaḥ sūrya ivoditaḥ /
analyzed: harāmi vīryāt duḥkham te tamaḥ sūryaḥ iva uditaḥ
translated: I will remove your sorrow by my prowess, like the rising sun dispels darkness.

original: devī paśyatu me vīryaṃ rāghavaś caiva paśyatu // / / //
analyzed: devī paśyatu me vīryam rāghavaḥ ca eva paśyatu
translated: Let the queen see my prowess, and let Raghava also see it.

original: etat tu vacanaṃ śrutvā lakṣmaṇasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: etat tu vacanam śrutvā lakṣmaṇasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of the great-souled Lakshmana,

original: uvāca rāmaṃ kausalyā rudantī śokalālasā // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rāmam kausalyā rudantī śoka lālasā
translated: Kausalya, weeping and overwhelmed with grief, spoke to Rama:

original: bhrātus te vadataḥ putra lakṣmaṇasya śrutaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: bhrātuḥ te vadataḥ putra lakṣmaṇasya śrutam tvayā
translated: O son, you have heard what your brother Lakshmana said.

original: yad atrānantaraṃ tat tvaṃ kuruṣva yadi rocate // / / //🔽na cādharmyaṃ vacaḥ śrutvā sapatnyā mama bhāṣitam /
analyzed: yat atra anantaram tat tvam kuruṣva yadi rocate  na ca adharmyam vacaḥ śrutvā sapatnyāḥ mama bhāṣitam
translated: Do what is proper next, if it pleases you.🔽Having heard the words of my co-wife, which are not in accordance with dharma,

original: vihāya śokasaṃtaptāṃ gantum arhasi mām itaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vihāya śoka saṃtaptām gantum arhasi mām itas
translated: you should not leave me here, tormented by grief.

original: dharmajña yadi dharmiṣṭho dharmaṃ caritum icchasi /
analyzed: dharma jña yadi dharmiṣṭhaḥ dharmam caritum icchasi
translated: If you are a knower of dharma and most righteous, and wish to practice dharma,

original: śuśrūṣa mām ihasthas tvaṃ cara dharmam anuttamam // / / //
analyzed: śuśrūṣa mām ihasthaḥ tvam cara dharmam anuttamam
translated: Serve me here, and practice the supreme dharma.

original: śuśrūṣur jananīṃ putra svagṛhe niyato vasan /
analyzed: śuśrūṣuḥ jananīm putra sva gṛhe niyataḥ vasan
translated: Serving your mother, O son, dwelling in your own house, restrained,

original: pareṇa tapasā yuktaḥ kāśyapas tridivaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pareṇa tapasā yuktaḥ kāśyapaḥ tridivam gataḥ
translated: Endowed with supreme austerity, Kashyapa went to heaven.

original: yathaiva rājā pūjyas te gauraveṇa tathā hy aham /
analyzed: yathā eva rājā pūjyaḥ te gauraveṇa tathā hi aham
translated: Just as the king is to be honored by you out of respect, so am I.

original: tvāṃ nāham anujānāmi na gantavyam ito vanam // / / //
analyzed: tvām na aham anujānāmi na gantavyam itas vanam
translated: I do not permit you, you should not go to the forest from here.

original: tvadviyogān na me kāryaṃ jīvitena sukhena vā /
analyzed: tvad viyogāt na me kāryam jīvitena sukhena vā
translated: Without you, I have no purpose in life or happiness.

original: tvayā saha mama śreyas tṛṇānām api bhakṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: tvayā saha mama śreyaḥ tṛṇānām api bhakṣaṇam
translated: With you, it is better for me to eat even grass.

original: yadi tvaṃ yāsyasi vanaṃ tyaktvā māṃ śokalālasām /
analyzed: yadi tvam yāsyasi vanam tyaktvā mām śoka lālasām
translated: If you will go to the forest, abandoning me who is overcome with grief,

original: ahaṃ prāyam ihāsiṣye na hi śakṣyāmi jīvitum // / / //
analyzed: aham prāyam iha āsiṣye na hi śakṣyāmi jīvitum
translated: I will fast to death here, for I cannot bear to live.

original: tatas tvaṃ prāpsyase putra nirayaṃ lokaviśrutam /
analyzed: tatas tvam prāpsyase putra nirayam loka viśrutam
translated: Then, O son, you will attain hell, renowned in the world,

original: brahmahatyām ivādharmāt samudraḥ saritāṃ patiḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmahatyām iva adharmāt samudraḥ saritām patiḥ
translated: Like the ocean, the lord of rivers, from the sin of Brahmanicide.

original: vilapantīṃ tathā dīnāṃ kausalyāṃ jananīṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: vilapantīm tathā dīnām kausalyām jananīm tatas
translated: Then to Kausalya, his miserable mother who was lamenting thus,

original: uvāca rāmo dharmātmā vacanaṃ dharmasaṃhitam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rāmaḥ dharma ātmā vacanam dharma saṃhitam
translated: The righteous Rama spoke these words consistent with dharma:

original: nāsti śaktiḥ pitur vākyaṃ samatikramituṃ mama /
analyzed: na asti śaktiḥ pituḥ vākyam samatikramitum mama
translated: I do not have the power to transgress my father's words.

original: prasādaye tvāṃ śirasā gantum icchāmy ahaṃ vanam // / / //
analyzed: prasādaye tvām śirasā gantum icchāmi aham vanam
translated: I seek your grace by bowing my head. I wish to go to the forest.

original: ṛṣiṇā ca pitur vākyaṃ kurvatā vratacāriṇā /
analyzed: ṛṣiṇā ca pituḥ vākyam kurvatā vrata cāriṇā
translated: And by the sage Vishvamitra, who was observing a vow,

original: gaur hatā jānatā dharmaṃ kaṇḍunāpi vipaścitā // / / //
analyzed: gauḥ hatā jānatā dharmam kaṇḍunā api vipaścitā
translated: the cow was killed, even though he knew dharma and was wise.

original: asmākaṃ ca kule pūrvaṃ sagarasyājñayā pituḥ /
analyzed: asmākam ca kule pūrvam sagarasya ājñayā pituḥ
translated: And in our family earlier, by the order of their father Sagara,

original: khanadbhiḥ sāgarair bhūtim avāptaḥ sumahān vadhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: khanadbhiḥ sāgaraiḥ bhūtim avāptaḥ su mahān vadhaḥ
translated: while digging, the Sagara princes met with a great calamity.

original: jāmadagnyena rāmeṇa reṇukā jananī svayam /
analyzed: jāmadagnyena rāmeṇa reṇukā jananī svayam
translated: And by Rama, the son of Jamadagni, his own mother Renuka

original: kṛttā paraśunāraṇye pitur vacanakāriṇā // / / //
analyzed: kṛttā paraśunā araṇye pituḥ vacana kāriṇā
translated: was beheaded in the forest, by the one who carried out his father's words.

original: na khalv etan mayaikena kriyate pitṛśāsanam /
analyzed: na khalu etat mayā ekena kriyate pitṛ śāsanam
translated: This command of my father is not being done by me alone.

original: pūrvair ayam abhipreto gato mārgo 'nugamyate // / / //
analyzed: pūrvaiḥ ayam abhipretaḥ gataḥ mārgaḥ nugamyate
translated: This intended path is being followed by my ancestors.

original: tad etat tu mayā kāryaṃ kriyate bhuvi nānyathā /
analyzed: tat etat tu mayā kāryam kriyate bhuvi nā anyathā
translated: This is to be done by me on earth, not otherwise.

original: pitur hi vacanaṃ kurvan na kaścin nāma hīyate // / / //
analyzed: pituḥ hi vacanam kurvat na kaścid nāma hīyate
translated: No one who carries out his father's words ever suffers a loss.

original: tām evam uktvā jananīṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ punar abravīt /
analyzed: tām evam uktvā jananīm lakṣmaṇam punar abravīt
translated: Having spoken thus to his mother, he again spoke to Lakshmana:

original: tava lakṣmaṇa jānāmi mayi sneham anuttamam /
analyzed: tava lakṣmaṇa jānāmi mayi sneham anuttamam
translated: O Lakṣmaṇa, I know your excellent affection for me,

original: abhiprāyam avijñāya satyasya ca śamasya ca // / / //
analyzed: abhiprāyam a vijñāya satyasya ca śamasya ca
translated: not understanding the intention of truth and peace.

original: dharmo hi paramo loke dharme satyaṃ pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: dharmaḥ hi paramaḥ loke dharme satyam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: For dharma is supreme in the world, and truth is established in dharma.

original: dharmasaṃśritam etac ca pitur vacanam uttamam // / / //
analyzed: dharma saṃśritam etat ca pituḥ vacanam uttamam
translated: And this excellent word of the father is based on dharma.

original: saṃśrutya ca pitur vākyaṃ mātur vā brāhmaṇasya vā /
analyzed: saṃśrutya ca pituḥ vākyam mātuḥ vā brāhmaṇasya vā
translated: Having heard the words of the father, or of the mother, or of the brāhmaṇa,

original: na kartavyaṃ vṛthā vīra dharmam āśritya tiṣṭhatā // / / //
analyzed: na kartavyam vṛthā vīra dharmam āśritya tiṣṭhatā
translated: O hero, one should not act in vain, relying on dharma and remaining steadfast.

original: so 'haṃ na śakṣyāmi pitur niyogam ativartitum /
analyzed: saḥ ham na śakṣyāmi pituḥ niyogam ativartitum
translated: Therefore, I am unable to transgress the command of my father.

original: pitur hi vacanād vīra kaikeyyāhaṃ pracoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pituḥ hi vacanāt vīra kaikeyyā aham pracoditaḥ
translated: For I was urged by Kaikeyī on account of my father's word, O hero.

original: tad enāṃ visṛjānāryāṃ kṣatradharmāśritāṃ matim /
analyzed: tat enām visṛja anāryām kṣatra dharma āśritām matim
translated: Therefore, abandon this ignoble thought based on the dharma of the warrior class.

original: dharmam āśraya mā taikṣṇyaṃ madbuddhir anugamyatām // / / //
analyzed: dharmam āśraya mā taikṣṇyam mad buddhiḥ anugamyatām
translated: Rely on dharma, not on harshness; let my mind be followed.

original: tam evam uktvā sauhārdād bhrātaraṃ lakṣmaṇāgrajaḥ /
analyzed: tam evam uktvā sauhārdāt bhrātaram lakṣmaṇa agrajaḥ
translated: Having thus spoken to his brother out of affection, the elder brother of Lakṣmaṇa,

original: uvāca bhūyaḥ kausalyāṃ prāñjaliḥ śirasānataḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca bhūyas kausalyām prāñjaliḥ śirasā ānataḥ
translated: again spoke to Kausalyā, with folded hands, his head bowed down.

original: anumanyasva māṃ devi gamiṣyantam ito vanam /
analyzed: anumanyasva mām devi gamiṣyantam itas vanam
translated: Give me permission, O queen, to go from here to the forest.

original: śāpitāsi mama prāṇaiḥ kuru svastyayanāni me /
analyzed: śāpitāsi mama prāṇaiḥ kuru svastyayanāni me
translated: You are pledged by my life; perform the benedictions for me.

original: tīrṇapratijñaś ca vanāt punar eṣyāmy ahaṃ purīm // / / //
analyzed: tīrṇa pratijñaḥ ca vanāt punar eṣyāmi aham purīm
translated: And having fulfilled my vow, I will return from the forest to the city.

original: yaśo hy ahaṃ kevalarājyakāraṇān na pṛṣṭhataḥ kartum alaṃ mahodayam /
analyzed: yaśaḥ hi aham kevala rājya kāraṇāt na pṛṣṭhatas kartum alam mahā udayam
translated: For the sake of mere sovereignty, I cannot bring disgrace upon my great fame.

original: adīrghakāle na tu devi jīvite vṛṇe 'varām adya mahīm adharmataḥ // / / //🔽prasādayan naravṛṣabhaḥ sa mātaraṃ parākramāj jigamiṣur eva daṇḍakān /
analyzed: adīrgha kāle na tu devi jīvite vṛṇe varām adya mahīm adharmataḥ  prasādayan nara vṛṣabhaḥ sa mātaram parākramāt jigamiṣuḥ eva daṇḍakān
translated: O queen, in this short life, I do not choose an inferior kingdom through unrighteousness.🔽The best of men, desiring to go to Dandaka out of his valor, was appeasing his mother.

original: athānujaṃ bhṛśam anuśāsya darśanaṃ cakāra tāṃ hṛdi jananīṃ pradakṣiṇam // / / //
analyzed: athā anujam bhṛśam anuśāsya darśanam cakāra tām hṛdi jananīm pradakṣiṇam
translated: Then, having severely admonished his younger brother, he took leave of his mother and circumambulated her, keeping her to his right, as he set out for the forest.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.

original: atha taṃ vyathayā dīnaṃ saviśeṣam amarṣitam /🔽śvasantam iva nāgendraṃ roṣavisphāritekṣaṇam // / / //🔽āsādya rāmaḥ saumitriṃ suhṛdaṃ bhrātaraṃ priyam /
analyzed: atha tam vyathayā dīnam sa viśeṣam amarṣitam  śvasantam iva nāga indram roṣa visphārita īkṣaṇam  āsādya rāmaḥ saumitrim suhṛdam bhrātaram priyam
translated: Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.🔽Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.

original: uvācedaṃ sa dhairyeṇa dhārayan sattvam ātmavān // / / //🔽saumitre yo 'bhiṣekārthe mama sambhārasambhramaḥ /
analyzed: uvāca idam sa dhairyeṇa dhārayan sattvam ātmavān  saumitre yaḥ bhiṣeka arthe mama sambhāra sambhramaḥ
translated: Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata, spoke to him with a sorrowful heart.

original: abhiṣekanivṛttyarthe so 'stu sambhārasambhramaḥ // / / //
analyzed: abhiṣeka nivṛtti arthe saḥ stu sambhāra sambhramaḥ
translated: Then, Rama, the best of men, the lord of men, the son of Dasha-ratha, seeing Bharata

original: yasyā madabhiṣekārthaṃ mānasaṃ paritapyate /🔽mātā naḥ sā yathā na syāt saviśaṅkā tathā kuru // / / //
analyzed: yasyāḥ mad abhiṣeka artham mānasam paritapyate  mātā naḥ sā yathā na syāt sa viśaṅkā tathā kuru
translated: Do that, O Lakşmaņa, whereby our mother may not be filled with anxiety on account of my installation.

original: tasyāḥ śaṅkāmayaṃ duḥkhaṃ muhūrtam api notsahe /🔽manasi pratisaṃjātaṃ saumitre 'ham upekṣitum // / / //🔽na buddhipūrvaṃ nābuddhaṃ smarāmīha kadācana /
analyzed: tasyāḥ śaṅkā mayam duḥkham muhūrtam api nā utsahe  manasi pratisaṃjātam saumitre ham upekṣitum  na buddhi pūrvam na abuddham smarāmi iha kadācana
translated: I am not able to bear, O Saumitri, even for a moment, the grief born of anxiety in her mind.🔽I am not able to disregard it.

original: mātḥṇāṃ vā pitur vāhaṃ kṛtam alpaṃ ca vipriyam // / / //
analyzed: mātḥṇām vā pituḥ vā aham kṛtam alpam ca vipriyam
translated: I do not remember, whether intentionally or unintentionally, to have done the least wrong to my mother or father.

original: satyaḥ satyābhisaṃdhaś ca nityaṃ satyaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: satyaḥ satya abhisaṃdhaḥ ca nityam satya parākramaḥ
translated: Truthful, firm in promise, and ever having truth for his prowess,

original: paralokabhayād bhīto nirbhayo 'stu pitā mama // / / //🔽tasyāpi hi bhaved asmin karmaṇy apratisaṃhṛte /
analyzed: para loka bhayāt bhītaḥ nirbhayaḥ stu pitā mama  tasya api hi bhavet asmin karmaṇi a pratisaṃhṛte
translated: may my father be freed from fear, fearing as he does the other world, on account of this act of mine not being withdrawn.

original: satyaṃ neti manastāpas tasya tāpas tapec ca mām // / / //
analyzed: satyam na iti manaḥ tāpaḥ tasya tāpaḥ tapet ca mām
translated: If this act of mine be not withdrawn, he will have mental anguish, thinking, 'this is not true.' And that anguish will torment me.

original: abhiṣekavidhānaṃ tu tasmāt saṃhṛtya lakṣmaṇa /
analyzed: abhiṣeka vidhānam tu tasmāt saṃhṛtya lakṣmaṇa
translated: Therefore, O Lakşmaņa, withdrawing the arrangements for my installation,

original: anvag evāham icchāmi vanaṃ gantum itaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anvak eva aham icchāmi vanam gantum itas punar
translated: I desire to go to the forest from this place.

original: mama pravrājanād adya kṛtakṛtyā nṛpātmajā /
analyzed: mama pravrājanāt adya kṛtakṛtyā nṛpa ātmajā
translated: The king's daughter (Kaikeyi) will to-day have her object gained by my banishment.

original: sutaṃ bharatam avyagram abhiṣecayitā tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sutam bharatam avyagram abhiṣecayitā tatas
translated: She will then install her son Bharata in the kingdom without any anxiety.

original: mayi cīrājinadhare jaṭāmaṇḍaladhāriṇi /
analyzed: mayi cīra ajina dhare jaṭā maṇḍala dhāriṇi
translated: When I, wearing rags and deer-skin, with matted locks on my head,

original: gate 'raṇyaṃ ca kaikeyyā bhaviṣyati manaḥsukham // / / //
analyzed: gate raṇyam ca kaikeyyāḥ bhaviṣyati manaḥ sukham
translated: shall have gone to the forest, Kaikeyi's mind will be at ease.

original: buddhiḥ praṇītā yeneyaṃ manaś ca susamāhitam /
analyzed: buddhiḥ praṇītā yena iyam manaḥ ca su samāhitam
translated: Since this my understanding has been sharpened and my mind well-composed,

original: tat tu nārhāmi saṃkleṣṭuṃ pravrajiṣyāmi māciram // / / //🔽kṛtāntas tv eva saumitre draṣṭavyo matpravāsane /
analyzed: tat tu nā arhāmi saṃkleṣṭum pravrajiṣyāmi māciram  kṛtāntaḥ tu eva saumitre draṣṭavyaḥ mad pravāsane
translated: I ought not to afflict her. I shall go forth without delay.🔽O son of Sumitrā, the only cause of my exile and the revocation of the promised kingdom,

original: rājyasya ca vitīrṇasya punar eva nivartane // / / //
analyzed: rājyasya ca vitīrṇasya punar eva nivartane
translated: must be seen in the inevitable decree of fate.

original: kaikeyyāḥ pratipattir hi kathaṃ syān mama pīḍane /
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ pratipattiḥ hi katham syāt mama pīḍane
translated: How could Kaikeyi's purpose be fulfilled, and I be afflicted,

original: yadi bhāvo na daivo 'yaṃ kṛtāntavihito bhavet // / / //
analyzed: yadi bhāvaḥ na daivaḥ yam kṛtānta vihitaḥ bhavet
translated: if this were not the work of fate, ordained by the inevitable decree?

original: jānāsi hi yathā saumya na mātṛṣu mamāntaram /
analyzed: jānāsi hi yathā saumya na mātṛṣu mama antaram
translated: You know, O gentle one, that there is no difference between my mothers,

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ viśeṣo vā tasyā mayi sute 'pi vā // / / //🔽so 'bhiṣekanivṛttyarthaiḥ pravāsārthaiś ca durvacaiḥ /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam viśeṣaḥ vā tasyāḥ mayi sute vā  saḥ bhiṣeka nivṛtti arthaiḥ pravāsa arthaiḥ ca durvacaiḥ
translated: nor has there been any distinction between them, or between me and their son.🔽I can attribute her harsh words, intended to prevent my consecration and to banish me,

original: ugrair vākyair ahaṃ tasyā nānyad daivāt samarthaye // / / //
analyzed: ugraiḥ vākyaiḥ aham tasyāḥ na anyat daivāt samarthaye
translated: to nothing but fate.

original: kathaṃ prakṛtisampannā rājaputrī tathāguṇā /
analyzed: katham prakṛti sampannā rāja putrī tathāguṇā
translated: How could the princess, endowed with a good nature and good qualities,

original: brūyāt sā prākṛteva strī matpīḍāṃ bhartṛsaṃnidhau // / / //
analyzed: brūyāt sā prākṛtā iva strī mad pīḍām bhartṛ saṃnidhau
translated: She would speak as if she were an ordinary woman, about my suffering in the presence of her husband.

original: yad acintyaṃ tu tad daivaṃ bhūteṣv api na hanyate /
analyzed: yat acintyam tu tat daivam bhūteṣu api na hanyate
translated: But what is inconceivable is fate, which is not destroyed even among beings.

original: vyaktaṃ mayi ca tasyāṃ ca patito hi viparyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyaktam mayi ca tasyām ca patitaḥ hi viparyayaḥ
translated: It is clear that misfortune has befallen me and her.

original: kaścid daivena saumitre yoddhum utsahate pumān /
analyzed: kaścid daivena saumitre yoddhum utsahate pumān
translated: O son of Sumitrā, which man would dare to fight with fate,

original: yasya na grahaṇaṃ kiṃcit karmaṇo 'nyatra dṛśyate // / / //
analyzed: yasya na grahaṇam kiṃcid karmaṇaḥ nyatra dṛśyate
translated: whose effect is not seen anywhere else?

original: sukhaduḥkhe bhayakrodhau lābhālābhau bhavābhavau /
analyzed: sukha duḥkhe bhaya krodhau lābha alābhau bhava abhavau
translated: Happiness, sorrow, fear, anger, gain, loss, existence and non-existence -

original: yasya kiṃcit tathā bhūtaṃ nanu daivasya karma tat // / / //
analyzed: yasya kiṃcid tathā bhūtam nanu daivasya karma tat
translated: if something is like that, then indeed that is the work of fate.

original: vyāhate 'py abhiṣeke me paritāpo na vidyate /
analyzed: vyāhate pi abhiṣeke me paritāpaḥ na vidyate
translated: Even though my consecration has been obstructed, I am not tormented.

original: tasmād aparitāpaḥ saṃs tvam apy anuvidhāya mām /
analyzed: tasmāt aparitāpaḥ san tvam api anuvidhāya mām
translated: Therefore, O Lakṣmaṇa, you too, following me, be without torment.

original: pratisaṃhāraya kṣipram ābhiṣecanikīṃ kriyām // / / //
analyzed: pratisaṃhāraya kṣipram ābhiṣecanikīm kriyām
translated: Quickly withdraw the consecration ceremony.

original: na lakṣmaṇāsmin mama rājyavighne mātā yavīyasy atiśaṅkanīyā /
analyzed: na lakṣmaṇa asmin mama rājya vighne mātā yavīyasī atiśaṅkanīyā
translated: O Lakṣmaṇa, my younger mother is not to be suspected in this obstruction to my kingdom.

original: daivābhipannā hi vadanty aniṣṭaṃ jānāsi daivaṃ ca tathā prabhāvam // / / //🔽Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: daiva abhipannāḥ hi vadanti aniṣṭam jānāsi daivam ca tathā prabhāvam 🔽rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: For those overwhelmed by fate speak unpleasantly. You know fate and its power.

original: iti bruvati rāme tu lakṣmaṇo 'dhaḥśirā muhuḥ /
analyzed: iti bruvati rāme tu lakṣmaṇaḥ dhaḥśirāḥ muhur
translated: As Rama was speaking thus, Lakshmana, with his head bent down,

original: śrutvā madhyaṃ jagāmeva manasā duḥkhaharṣayoḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā madhyam jagāma iva manasā duḥkha harṣayoḥ
translated: hearing this, his mind went into a state of both sorrow and joy.

original: tadā tu baddhvā bhrukuṭīṃ bhruvor madhye nararṣabhaḥ /
analyzed: tadā tu baddhvā bhrukuṭīm bhruvoḥ madhye nara ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: Then, the bull among men, knitting his brows in the middle,

original: niśaśvāsa mahāsarpo bilastha iva roṣitaḥ // / / //🔽tasya duṣprativīkṣyaṃ tad bhrukuṭīsahitaṃ tadā /
analyzed: niśaśvāsa mahā sarpaḥ bila sthaḥ iva roṣitaḥ  tasya duṣprativīkṣyam tat bhrukuṭī sahitam tadā
translated: sighed like a great angry serpent dwelling in a hole.🔽Then, his face with knitted brows, difficult to behold,

original: babhau kruddhasya siṃhasya mukhasya sadṛśaṃ mukham // / / //
analyzed: babhau kruddhasya siṃhasya mukhasya sadṛśam mukham
translated: his face resembled the face of an angry lion.

original: agrahas taṃ vidhunvaṃs tu hastī hastam ivātmanaḥ /
analyzed: agrahaḥ tam vidhunvan tu hastī hastam iva ātmanaḥ
translated: Shaking his head as if shaking his own trunk,

original: tiryag ūrdhvaṃ śarīre ca pātayitvā śirodharām // / / //
analyzed: tiryak ūrdhvam śarīre ca pātayitvā śirodharām
translated: and lowering his neck sideways and upwards on his body,

original: agrākṣṇā vīkṣamāṇas tu tiryag bhrātaram abravīt /
analyzed: agra akṣṇā vīkṣamāṇaḥ tu tiryak bhrātaram abravīt
translated: looking askance with his upper eye, he spoke to his brother,

original: asthāne sambhramo yasya jāto vai sumahān ayam // / / //
analyzed: asthāne sambhramaḥ yasya jātaḥ vai su mahān ayam
translated: This great confusion has arisen in an improper place.

original: dharmadoṣaprasaṅgena lokasyānatiśaṅkayā /
analyzed: dharma doṣa prasaṅgena lokasya anatiśaṅkayā
translated: Due to the connection with the fault of dharma and the lack of suspicion of the world,

original: kathaṃ hy etad asambhrāntas tvadvidho vaktum arhati // / / //
analyzed: katham hi etat asambhrāntaḥ tvadvidhaḥ vaktum arhati
translated: how can one like you speak this without confusion?

original: yathā daivam aśauṇḍīraṃ śauṇḍīraḥ kṣatriyarṣabhaḥ /
analyzed: yathā daivam a śauṇḍīram śauṇḍīraḥ kṣatriya ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: As fate is not heroic, a heroic bull among kshatriyas,

original: kiṃ nāma kṛpaṇaṃ daivam aśaktam abhiśaṃsasi // / / //
analyzed: kim nāma kṛpaṇam daivam aśaktam abhiśaṃsasi
translated: What is this wretched fate that you are powerless to overcome?

original: pāpayos tu kathaṃ nāma tayoḥ śaṅkā na vidyate /
analyzed: pāpayoḥ tu katham nāma tayoḥ śaṅkā na vidyate
translated: But how is it that you have no suspicion of those two wicked ones?

original: santi dharmopadhāḥ ślakṣṇā dharmātman kiṃ na budhyase // / / //
analyzed: santi dharmopadhāḥ ślakṣṇāḥ dharma ātman kim na budhyase
translated: O righteous one, do you not understand that there are subtle means of righteousness?

original: lokavidviṣṭam ārabdhaṃ tvadanyasyābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: loka vidviṣṭam ārabdham tvad anyasya abhiṣecanam
translated: The consecration of someone other than you has been undertaken, which is detested by the people.

original: yeneyam āgatā dvaidhaṃ tava buddhir mahīpate /
analyzed: yena iyam āgatā dvaidham tava buddhiḥ mahīpate
translated: O lord of the earth, it is he by whom your mind has been divided into two.

original: sa hi dharmo mama dveṣyaḥ prasaṅgād yasya muhyasi // / / //
analyzed: sa hi dharmaḥ mama dveṣyaḥ prasaṅgāt yasya muhyasi
translated: That righteousness which you follow out of attachment, I hate.

original: yady api pratipattis te daivī cāpi tayor matam /
analyzed: yadi api pratipattiḥ te daivī ca api tayoḥ matam
translated: Even if you consider their undertaking to be divine,

original: tathāpy upekṣaṇīyaṃ te na me tad api rocate // / / //
analyzed: tathā api upekṣaṇīyam te na me tat api rocate
translated: I do not approve of your indifference towards it.

original: viklavo vīryahīno yaḥ sa daivam anuvartate /
analyzed: viklavaḥ vīrya hīnaḥ yaḥ sa daivam anuvartate
translated: He who is timid and weak follows fate.

original: vīrāḥ saṃbhāvitātmāno na daivaṃ paryupāsate // / / //
analyzed: vīrāḥ saṃbhāvita ātmānaḥ na daivam paryupāsate
translated: The heroes who esteem themselves do not attend upon fate.

original: daivaṃ puruṣakāreṇa yaḥ samarthaḥ prabādhitum /
analyzed: daivam puruṣakāreṇa yaḥ samarthaḥ prabādhitum
translated: He who is able to counteract fate by manly effort,

original: na daivena vipannārthaḥ puruṣaḥ so 'vasīdati // / / //
analyzed: na daivena vipanna arthaḥ puruṣaḥ saḥ vasīdati
translated: that man does not despair when his purpose is frustrated by fate.

original: drakṣyanti tv adya daivasya pauruṣaṃ puruṣasya ca /
analyzed: drakṣyanti tu adya daivasya pauruṣam puruṣasya ca
translated: Today you will see the manliness of fate and of a man.

original: daivamānuṣayor adya vyaktā vyaktir bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: daiva mānuṣayoḥ adya vyaktā vyaktiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Today the distinction between destiny and human effort will become clear.

original: adya matpauruṣahataṃ daivaṃ drakṣyanti vai janāḥ /
analyzed: adya mad pauruṣa hatam daivam drakṣyanti vai janāḥ
translated: Today people will see destiny struck down by my manliness,

original: yad daivād āhataṃ te 'dya dṛṣṭaṃ rājyābhiṣecanam // / / //
analyzed: yat daivāt āhatam te dya dṛṣṭam rājya abhiṣecanam
translated: since your royal consecration, struck down by destiny, was seen by me today.

original: atyaṅkuśam ivoddāmaṃ gajaṃ madabaloddhatam /
analyzed: atyaṅkuśam iva uddāmam gajam mada bala uddhatam
translated: Like an elephant in rut, hard to control, intoxicated with the strength of its rut,

original: pradhāvitam ahaṃ daivaṃ pauruṣeṇa nivartaye // / / //
analyzed: pradhāvitam aham daivam pauruṣeṇa nivartaye
translated: I will turn back destiny, which is running towards me, with my manliness.

original: lokapālāḥ samastās te nādya rāmābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: lokapālāḥ samastāḥ te na adya rāma abhiṣecanam
translated: All the Lokapalas together cannot prevent Rama's consecration today,

original: na ca kṛtsnās trayo lokā vihanyuḥ kiṃ punaḥ pitā // / / //
analyzed: na ca kṛtsnāḥ trayaḥ lokāḥ vihanyuḥ kim punar pitā
translated: and the three worlds cannot be destroyed, let alone our father.

original: yair vivāsas tavāraṇye mitho rājan samarthitaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ vivāsaḥ tava araṇye mithas rājan samarthitaḥ
translated: O king, those who have agreed among themselves on your exile to the forest,

original: araṇye te vivatsyanti caturdaśa samās tathā // / / //
analyzed: araṇye te vivatsyanti caturdaśa samāḥ tathā
translated: they will live in the forest for fourteen years, as agreed.

original: ahaṃ tadāśāṃ chetsyāmi pitus tasyāś ca yā tava /
analyzed: aham tad āśām chetsyāmi pituḥ tasyāḥ ca yā tava
translated: I will cut off that hope of yours and of your father,

original: abhiṣekavighātena putrarājyāya vartate // / / //
analyzed: abhiṣeka vighātena putra rājyāya vartate
translated: which is based on obstructing the consecration for the sake of the kingdom for your son.

original: madbalena viruddhāya na syād daivabalaṃ tathā /
analyzed: mad balena viruddhāya na syāt daiva balam tathā
translated: For one who opposes me with force, destiny will not have the power

original: prabhaviṣyati duḥkhāya yathograṃ pauruṣaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: prabhaviṣyati duḥkhāya yathā ugram pauruṣam mama
translated: to cause suffering, as my fierce manliness will.

original: ūrdhvaṃ varṣasahasrānte prajāpālyam anantaram /
analyzed: ūrdhvam varṣa sahasra ante prajāpālyam anantaram
translated: After a thousand years have passed, the protection of the subjects will be

original: āryaputrāḥ kariṣyanti vanavāsaṃ gate tvayi // / / //
analyzed: ārya putrāḥ kariṣyanti vana vāsam gate tvayi
translated: The noble sons will do so, when you have gone to the forest.

original: pūrvarājarṣivṛttyā hi vanavāso vidhīyate /
analyzed: pūrva rājarṣi vṛttyā hi vana vāsaḥ vidhīyate
translated: For the dwelling in the forest is ordained according to the practice of the royal sages of old,

original: prajā nikṣipya putreṣu putravat paripālane // / / //🔽sa ced rājany anekāgre rājyavibhramaśaṅkayā /
analyzed: prajāḥ nikṣipya putreṣu putra vat paripālane  sa ced rājani anekāgre rājya vibhrama śaṅkayā
translated: after entrusting the subjects to their sons, to be protected as if they were their own sons.

original: naivam icchasi dharmātman rājyaṃ rāma tvam ātmani // / / //
analyzed: na evam icchasi dharma ātman rājyam rāma tvam ātmani
translated: If, O king, you do not wish it thus, O righteous one, to take the kingdom upon yourself, O Rāma, fearing distraction in the kingdom,

original: pratijāne ca te vīra mā bhūvaṃ vīralokabhāk /
analyzed: pratijāne ca te vīra mā bhūvam vīra loka bhāj
translated: I swear to you, O hero, may I not attain the world of heroes,

original: rājyaṃ ca tava rakṣeyam ahaṃ veleva sāgaram // / / //
analyzed: rājyam ca tava rakṣeyam aham velā iva sāgaram
translated: and I will protect your kingdom like the shore protects the ocean.

original: maṅgalair abhiṣiñcasva tatra tvaṃ vyāpṛto bhava /
analyzed: maṅgalaiḥ abhiṣiñcasva tatra tvam vyāpṛtaḥ bhava
translated: Be consecrated with auspicious rites, be engaged there,

original: aham eko mahīpālān alaṃ vārayituṃ balāt // / / //
analyzed: aham ekaḥ mahīpālān alam vārayitum balāt
translated: I alone am able to forcibly ward off the kings.

original: na śobhārthāv imau bāhū na dhanur bhūṣaṇāya me /
analyzed: na śobhā arthau imau bāhū na dhanuḥ bhūṣaṇāya me
translated: These arms of mine are not for the sake of beauty, nor is the bow for ornament,

original: nāsirābandhanārthāya na śarāḥ stambhahetavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na asiḥ ābandhana arthāya na śarāḥ stambha hetavaḥ
translated: nor is the sword for binding, nor are the arrows for supporting.

original: amitradamanārthaṃ me sarvam etac catuṣṭayam /
analyzed: amitra damana artham me sarvam etat catuṣṭayam
translated: All these four are for subduing enemies,

original: na cāhaṃ kāmaye 'tyarthaṃ yaḥ syāc chatrur mato mama // / / //
analyzed: na ca aham kāmaye tyartham yaḥ syāt śatruḥ mataḥ mama
translated: and I do not greatly desire one who might be considered my enemy.

original: asinā tīkṣṇadhāreṇa vidyuccalitavarcasā /
analyzed: asinā tīkṣṇa dhāreṇa vidyut calita varcasā
translated: With a sword having a sharp edge, with a brilliance flickering like lightning,

original: pragṛhītena vai śatruṃ vajriṇaṃ vā na kalpaye // / / //🔽khaḍganiṣpeṣaniṣpiṣṭair gahanā duścarā ca me /
analyzed: pragṛhītena vai śatrum vajriṇam vā na kalpaye  khaḍga niṣpeṣa niṣpiṣṭaiḥ gahanā duścarā ca me
translated: I will not consider even the wielder of the thunderbolt as an enemy when I have taken up this sword.

original: hastyaśvanarahastoruśirobhir bhavitā mahī // / / //🔽khaḍgadhārā hatā me 'dya dīpyamānā ivādrayaḥ /
analyzed: hasti aśva nara hasta uru śirobhiḥ bhavitā mahī  khaḍga dhārāḥ hatāḥ me dya dīpyamānāḥ iva adrayaḥ
translated: The earth will be impassable and difficult to traverse for me due to the crushed and mangled trunks, thighs, and heads of elephants, horses, and men.🔽Today, struck by the edge of my sword, the elephants will fall on the ground like blazing mountains,

original: patiṣyanti dvipā bhūmau meghā iva savidyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: patiṣyanti dvipāḥ bhūmau meghāḥ iva sa vidyutaḥ
translated: like clouds with lightning.

original: baddhagodhāṅgulitrāṇe pragṛhītaśarāsane /
analyzed: baddha godhā aṅguli trāṇe pragṛhīta śarāsane
translated: With my fingers and wrists protected by leather guards, and with my bow and arrows in hand,

original: kathaṃ puruṣamānī syāt puruṣāṇāṃ mayi sthite // / / //
analyzed: katham puruṣa mānī syāt puruṣāṇām mayi sthite
translated: how can I be considered a man when I am standing here?

original: bahubhiś caikam atyasyann ekena ca bahūñ janān /
analyzed: bahubhiḥ ca ekam atyasyan ekena ca bahūm janān
translated: Overpowering many with one, and many people with one alone,

original: viniyokṣyāmy ahaṃ bāṇān nṛvājigajamarmasu // / / //
analyzed: viniyokṣyāmi aham bāṇān nṛ vāji gaja marmasu
translated: I will shoot my arrows at the vital points of men, horses, and elephants.

original: adya me 'straprabhāvasya prabhāvaḥ prabhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adya me stra prabhāvasya prabhāvaḥ prabhaviṣyati
translated: Today the power of my weapons will be powerful,

original: rājñaś cāprabhutāṃ kartuṃ prabhutvaṃ ca tava prabho // / / //
analyzed: rājñaḥ ca aprabhu tām kartum prabhu tvam ca tava prabho
translated: to make the king powerless and you powerful, O Lord.

original: adya candanasārasya keyūrāmokṣaṇasya ca /
analyzed: adya candanasārasya keyūra āmokṣaṇasya ca
translated: Today, with the essence of sandalwood, the removal of bracelets,
