translated: and now Sita, O friend, wishes to give you a girdle...

original: paryaṅkam agryāstaraṇaṃ nānāratnavibhūṣitam /
analyzed: paryaṅkam agrya āstaraṇam nānā ratna vibhūṣitam
translated: The couch with the best bedding, adorned with various jewels,

original: tam apīcchati vaidehī pratiṣṭhāpayituṃ tvayi // / / //
analyzed: tam api icchati vaidehī pratiṣṭhāpayitum tvayi
translated: that also Vaidehi wishes to establish in you...

original: nāgaḥ śatruṃjayo nāma mātulo yaṃ dadau mama /
analyzed: nāgaḥ śatruṃjayaḥ nāma mātulaḥ yam dadau mama
translated: The elephant named Shatrunjaya, who is my maternal uncle's gift to me,

original: taṃ te gajasahasreṇa dadāmi dvijapuṃgava // / / //
analyzed: tam te gaja sahasreṇa dadāmi dvija puṃgava
translated: I give him to you, O best of Brahmins, in exchange for a thousand elephants.

original: ity uktaḥ sa hi rāmeṇa suyajñaḥ pratigṛhya tat /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa hi rāmeṇa suyajñaḥ pratigṛhya tat
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Suyajna accepted it all,

original: rāmalakṣmaṇasītānāṃ prayuyojāśiṣaḥ śivāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāma lakṣmaṇa sītānām prayuyoja āśiṣaḥ śivāḥ
translated: and pronounced auspicious blessings upon Rama, Lakshmana and Sita.

original: atha bhrātaram avyagraṃ priyaṃ rāmaḥ priyaṃvadaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhrātaram avyagram priyam rāmaḥ priyaṃvadaḥ
translated: Then the sweet-speaking Rama, to his dear brother Lakshmana, who was not distracted,

original: saumitriṃ tam uvācedaṃ brahmeva tridaśeśvaram // / / //
analyzed: saumitrim tam uvāca idam brahmā iva tridaśeśvaram
translated: spoke thus, like Brahma to the lord of the thirty gods:

original: agastyaṃ kauśikaṃ caiva tāv ubhau brāhmaṇottamau /
analyzed: agastyam kauśikam ca eva tau ubhau brāhmaṇa uttamau
translated: Those two best of Brahmins, Agastya and Vishvamitra,

original: arcayāhūya saumitre ratnaiḥ sasyam ivāmbubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: arcaya āhūya saumitre ratnaiḥ sasyam iva ambubhiḥ
translated: with jewels, O son of Sumitrā, like the rain-bearing clouds (refreshing) the crops with water.

original: kausalyāṃ ca ya āśīrbhir bhaktaḥ paryupatiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kausalyām ca yaḥ āśīrbhiḥ bhaktaḥ paryupatiṣṭhati
translated: And he who attends upon Kausalyā with blessings,

original: ācāryas taittirīyāṇām abhirūpaś ca vedavit // / / //
analyzed: ācāryaḥ taittirīyāṇām abhirūpaḥ ca veda vid
translated: the preceptor of the Taittirīyas, who is handsome and learned in the Vedas,

original: tasya yānaṃ ca dāsīś ca saumitre saṃpradāpaya /
analyzed: tasya yānam ca dāsīḥ ca saumitre saṃpradāpaya
translated: give him a vehicle, female slaves, and other things, O son of Sumitrā.

original: kauśeyāni ca vastrāṇi yāvat tuṣyati sa dvijaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kauśeyāni ca vastrāṇi yāvat tuṣyati sa dvijaḥ
translated: Give him silken garments, until that twice-born one is satisfied.

original: sūtaś citrarathaś cāryaḥ sacivaḥ suciroṣitaḥ /
analyzed: sūtaḥ citrarathaḥ ca āryaḥ sacivaḥ su cira uṣitaḥ
translated: The noble charioteer Citraratha, who has been a minister for a long time,

original: toṣayainaṃ mahārhaiś ca ratnair vastrair dhanais tathā // / / //🔽śālivāhasahasraṃ ca dve śate bhadrakāṃs tathā /
analyzed: toṣaya enam mahārhaiḥ ca ratnaiḥ vastraiḥ dhanaiḥ tathā  śālivāha sahasram ca dve śate bhadrakān tathā
translated: satisfy him with very valuable jewels, garments, and wealth.🔽And, O son of Sumitrā, give him a thousand Śāli-rice-bearing cows, two hundred good cows,

original: vyañjanārthaṃ ca saumitre gosahasram upākuru // / / //
analyzed: vyañjana artham ca saumitre go sahasram upākuru
translated: and a thousand cows for the sake of curds.

original: tataḥ sa puruṣavyāghras tad dhanaṃ lakṣmaṇaḥ svayam /
analyzed: tatas sa puruṣa vyāghraḥ tat dhanam lakṣmaṇaḥ svayam
translated: Then that best of men, Lakṣmaṇa himself,

original: yathoktaṃ brāhmaṇendrāṇām adadād dhanado yathā // / / //
analyzed: yathā uktam brāhmaṇa indrāṇām adadāt dhanadaḥ yathā
translated: gave that wealth to the leading Brāhmaṇas, like the god of wealth (Kubera).

original: athābravīd bāṣpakalāṃs tiṣṭhataś copajīvinaḥ /
analyzed: athā bravīt bāṣpa kalān tiṣṭhataḥ ca upajīvinaḥ
translated: Then he said to the dependents who were standing there with tears in their eyes,

original: sampradāya bahu dravyam ekaikasyopajīvinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sampradāya bahu dravyam ekaikasya upajīvinaḥ
translated: having given much wealth to each of the dependents.

original: lakṣmaṇasya ca yad veśma gṛhaṃ ca yad idaṃ mama /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇasya ca yat veśma gṛham ca yat idam mama
translated: And Lakshmana's house, and this house of mine,

original: aśūnyaṃ kāryam ekaikaṃ yāvadāgamanaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: a śūnyam kāryam ekaikam yāvat āgamanam mama
translated: Let each be occupied by someone, until my return.

original: ity uktvā duḥkhitaṃ sarvaṃ janaṃ tam upajīvinam /
analyzed: iti uktvā duḥkhitam sarvam janam tam upajīvinam
translated: Having said this to all the sorrowful people who depended on him,

original: uvācedaṃ dhanādhyakṣaṃ dhanam ānīyatām iti /
analyzed: uvāca idam dhanādhyakṣam dhanam ānīyatām iti
translated: He said this to the treasurer: Bring the wealth!

original: tato 'sya dhanam ājahruḥ sarvam evopajīvinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas sya dhanam ājahruḥ sarvam eva upajīvinaḥ
translated: Then all his dependents brought his entire wealth.

original: tataḥ sa puruṣavyāghras tad dhanaṃ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa puruṣa vyāghraḥ tat dhanam sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Then the tiger among men, together with Lakshmana,

original: dvijebhyo bālavṛddhebhyaḥ kṛpaṇebhyo 'bhyadāpayat // / / //
analyzed: dvijebhyaḥ bāla vṛddhebhyaḥ kṛpaṇebhyaḥ bhyadāpayat
translated: Gave away that wealth to the twice-born, the young and the old, and the poor.

original: tatrāsīt piṅgalo gārgyas trijaṭo nāma vai dvijaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āsīt piṅgalaḥ gārgyaḥ trijaṭaḥ nāma vai dvijaḥ
translated: There was a tawny-colored Gargya brahmin named Trijata,

original: ā pañcamāyāḥ kakṣyāyā nainaṃ kaścid avārayat // / / //
analyzed: ā pañcamāyāḥ kakṣyāyāḥ na enam kaścid avārayat
translated: No one stopped him up to the fifth courtyard.

original: sa rājaputram āsādya trijaṭo vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: sa rāja putram āsādya trijaṭaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Approaching the prince, Trijata spoke these words:

original: nirdhano bahuputro 'smi rājaputra mahāyaśaḥ /
analyzed: nirdhanaḥ bahu putraḥ smi rāja putra mahā yaśaḥ
translated: O prince of great fame, I am poor and have many sons.

original: uñchavṛttir vane nityaṃ pratyavekṣasva mām iti // / / //
analyzed: uñcha vṛttiḥ vane nityam pratyavekṣasva mām iti
translated: I always live in the forest by gleaning, please consider me.

original: tam uvāca tato rāmaḥ parihāsasamanvitam /
analyzed: tam uvāca tatas rāmaḥ parihāsa samanvitam
translated: Then Rama said to him with a jest:

original: gavāṃ sahasram apy ekaṃ na tu viśrāṇitaṃ mayā /
analyzed: gavām sahasram api ekam na tu viśrāṇitam mayā
translated: I have not given away even a single thousand cows,

original: parikṣipasi daṇḍena yāvat tāvad avāpsyasi // / / //🔽sa śāṭīṃ tvaritaḥ kaṭyāṃ saṃbhrāntaḥ pariveṣṭya tām /
analyzed: parikṣipasi daṇḍena yāvat tāvat avāpsyasi  sa śāṭīm tvaritaḥ kaṭyām saṃbhrāntaḥ pariveṣṭya tām
translated: You will obtain as much as you can cover with your staff.🔽He hurriedly wrapped his garment around his waist,

original: āvidhya daṇḍaṃ cikṣepa sarvaprāṇena vegitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āvidhya daṇḍam cikṣepa sarva prāṇena vegitaḥ
translated: and with all his might, he whirled his staff and threw it.

original: uvāca ca tato rāmas taṃ gārgyam abhisāntvayan /
analyzed: uvāca ca tatas rāmaḥ tam gārgyam abhisāntvayan
translated: Then Rama, comforting Gargya, said:

original: manyur na khalu kartavyaḥ parihāso hy ayaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: manyuḥ na khalu kartavyaḥ parihāsaḥ hi ayam mama
translated: You should not be angry, this was just a joke of mine.

original: tataḥ sabhāryas trijaṭo mahāmunir gavām anīkaṃ pratigṛhya moditaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa bhāryaḥ trijaṭaḥ mahā muniḥ gavām anīkam pratigṛhya moditaḥ
translated: Then the great sage Trijata, delighted, accepted the herd of cows along with his wife,

original: yaśobalaprītisukhopabṛṃhiṇīs tad āśiṣaḥ pratyavadan mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaśaḥ bala prīti sukha upabṛṃhiṇīḥ tat āśiṣaḥ pratyavadat mahātmanaḥ
translated: and the great souls gave him blessings that enhance fame, strength, joy, happiness, and well-being.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: dattvā tu saha vaidehyā brāhmaṇebhyo dhanaṃ bahu /
analyzed: dattvā tu saha vaidehyā brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dhanam bahu
translated: Having given much wealth to the Brahmins along with Vaidehi,

original: jagmatuḥ pitaraṃ draṣṭuṃ sītayā saha rāghavau // / / //
analyzed: jagmatuḥ pitaram draṣṭum sītayā saha rāghavau
translated: the two Raghavas went to see their father with Sita.

original: tato gṛhīte duṣprekṣye aśobhetāṃ tadāyudhe /
analyzed: tatas gṛhīte duṣprekṣye aśobhetām tadā āyudhe
translated: Then, when the difficult-to-look-at weapon was taken up, it shone,

original: mālādāmabhir āsakte sītayā samalaṃkṛte // / / //
analyzed: mālā dāmabhiḥ āsakte sītayā samalaṃkṛte
translated: adorned with garlands and wreaths, along with Sita.

original: tataḥ prāsādaharmyāṇi vimānaśikharāṇi ca /
analyzed: tatas prāsāda harmyāṇi vimāna śikharāṇi ca
translated: Then the palaces, mansions, and the tops of the celestial vehicles,

original: adhiruhya janaḥ śrīmān udāsīno vyalokayat // / / //
analyzed: adhiruhya janaḥ śrīmān udāsīnaḥ vyalokayat
translated: The prosperous people, standing on the terraces of their houses, looked on.

original: na hi rathyāḥ sma śakyante gantuṃ bahujanākulāḥ /🔽āruhya tasmāt prāsādān dīnāḥ paśyanti rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: na hi rathyāḥ sma śakyante gantum bahu jana ākulāḥ  āruhya tasmāt prāsādān dīnāḥ paśyanti rāghavam
translated: The streets were so crowded with people that it was impossible to move about.🔽Therefore, the people, with sorrowful hearts, looked at Rāghava from the terraces of their houses.

original: padātiṃ varjitacchattraṃ rāmaṃ dṛṣṭvā tadā janāḥ /
analyzed: padātim varjita chattram rāmam dṛṣṭvā tadā janāḥ
translated: Seeing Rāma on foot, without an umbrella, the people,

original: ūcur bahuvidhā vācaḥ śokopahatacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ bahuvidhāḥ vācaḥ śoka upahata cetasaḥ
translated: with their minds overwhelmed with grief, uttered many lamentations.

original: yaṃ yāntam anuyāti sma caturaṅgabalaṃ mahat /
analyzed: yam yāntam anuyāti sma catur aṅga balam mahat
translated: Whom, when going, was followed by a great army of four divisions,

original: tam ekaṃ sītayā sārdham anuyāti sma lakṣmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam ekam sītayā sārdham anuyāti sma lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: now he alone, with Sītā, is followed by Lakṣmaṇa.

original: aiśvaryasya rasajñaḥ san kāmināṃ caiva kāmadaḥ /
analyzed: aiśvaryasya rasa jñaḥ san kāminām ca eva kāma daḥ
translated: Knowing the taste of sovereignty, and being the fulfiller of desires for lovers,

original: necchaty evānṛtaṃ kartuṃ pitaraṃ dharmagauravāt // / / //
analyzed: na icchati eva anṛtam kartum pitaram dharma gauravāt
translated: he does not wish to act falsely towards his father, out of respect for righteousness.

original: yā na śakyā purā draṣṭuṃ bhūtair ākāśagair api /
analyzed: yā na śakyā purā draṣṭum bhūtaiḥ ākāśa gaiḥ api
translated: She, who could not be seen before by even the sky-going beings,

original: tām adya sītāṃ paśyanti rājamārgagatā janāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tām adya sītām paśyanti rājamārga gatāḥ janāḥ
translated: that Sītā is seen today by the people on the royal road.

original: aṅgarāgocitāṃ sītāṃ raktacandanasevinīm /
analyzed: aṅgarāga ucitām sītām raktacandana sevinīm
translated: Sītā, who is used to unguents and the application of red sandal paste,

original: varṣam uṣṇaṃ ca śītaṃ ca neṣyaty āśu vivarṇatām // / / //
analyzed: varṣam uṣṇam ca śītam ca neṣyati āśu vivarṇa tām
translated: will soon turn pale, unable to bear the rain, heat and cold.

original: adya nūnaṃ daśarathaḥ sattvam āviśya bhāṣate /
analyzed: adya nūnam daśarathaḥ sattvam āviśya bhāṣate
translated: Today, indeed, Dasha ratha, having entered into (Rama's) soul, speaks.

original: na hi rājā priyaṃ putraṃ vivāsayitum arhati // / / //
analyzed: na hi rājā priyam putram vivāsayitum arhati
translated: For a king should not banish his beloved son.

original: nirguṇasyāpi putrasya kathaṃ syād vipravāsanam /
analyzed: nirguṇasya api putrasya katham syāt vipravāsanam
translated: How can there be banishment of a son who is devoid of good qualities?

original: kiṃ punar yasya loko 'yaṃ jito vṛttena kevalam // / / //
analyzed: kim punar yasya lokaḥ yam jitaḥ vṛttena kevalam
translated: What to speak of one who has conquered the world merely by his conduct?

original: ānṛśaṃsyam anukrośaḥ śrutaṃ śīlaṃ damaḥ śamaḥ /
analyzed: ānṛśaṃsyam anukrośaḥ śrutam śīlam damaḥ śamaḥ
translated: Non-violence, compassion, learning, character, self-control, and tranquility -

original: rāghavaṃ śobhayanty ete ṣaḍguṇāḥ puruṣottamam // / / //
analyzed: rāghavam śobhayanti ete ṣaṣ guṇāḥ puruṣa uttamam
translated: these six qualities adorn Raghava, the best of men.

original: tasmāt tasyopaghātena prajāḥ paramapīḍitāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tasya upaghātena prajāḥ parama pīḍitāḥ
translated: Therefore, the people are greatly afflicted by his affliction,

original: audakānīva sattvāni grīṣme salilasaṃkṣayāt // / / //
analyzed: audakāni iva sattvāni grīṣme salila saṃkṣayāt
translated: like aquatic beings in summer due to the depletion of water.

original: pīḍayā pīḍitaṃ sarvaṃ jagad asya jagatpateḥ /
analyzed: pīḍayā pīḍitam sarvam jagat asya jagatpateḥ
translated: The entire world is afflicted by the affliction of this lord of the world,

original: mūlasyevopaghātena vṛkṣaḥ puṣpaphalopagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mūlasya iva upaghātena vṛkṣaḥ puṣpa phala upagaḥ
translated: like a tree bearing flowers and fruits due to the affliction of its root.

original: te lakṣmaṇa iva kṣipraṃ sapatnyaḥ sahabāndhavāḥ /
analyzed: te lakṣmaṇaḥ iva kṣipram sa patnyaḥ saha bāndhavāḥ
translated: Like Lakshmana, we with our co-wives and relatives,

original: gacchantam anugacchāmo yena gacchati rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gacchantam anugacchāmaḥ yena gacchati rāghavaḥ
translated: shall follow him wherever Raghava goes.

original: udyānāni parityajya kṣetrāṇi ca gṛhāṇi ca /
analyzed: udyānāni parityajya kṣetrāṇi ca gṛhāṇi ca
translated: Abandoning the gardens, fields, and houses,

original: ekaduḥkhasukhā rāmam anugacchāma dhārmikam // / / //
analyzed: eka duḥkha sukhāḥ rāmam anugacchāma dhārmikam
translated: we shall follow righteous Rama, who shares our sorrow and joy.

original: samuddhṛtanidhānāni paridhvastājirāṇi ca /
analyzed: samuddhṛta nidhānāni paridhvasta ajirāṇi ca
translated: With their treasures uplifted and their courtyards devastated,

original: upāttadhanadhānyāni hṛtasārāṇi sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: upātta dhana dhānyāni hṛta sārāṇi sarvaśas
translated: with their wealth and grain taken away, and their essence extracted in every way.

original: rajasābhyavakīrṇāni parityaktāni daivataiḥ /
analyzed: rajasā abhyavakīrṇāni parityaktāni daivataiḥ
translated: Covered with dust, abandoned by the gods,

original: asmattyaktāni veśmāni kaikeyī pratipadyatām // / / //
analyzed: asmad tyaktāni veśmāni kaikeyī pratipadyatām
translated: let Kaikeyi take possession of the houses abandoned by us.

original: vanaṃ nagaram evāstu yena gacchati rāghavaḥ /🔽asmābhiś ca parityaktaṃ puraṃ saṃpadyatāṃ vanam // / / //
analyzed: vanam nagaram eva astu yena gacchati rāghavaḥ  asmābhiḥ ca parityaktam puram saṃpadyatām vanam
translated: Let the forest be the very city, by which Raghava goes.🔽Let the city become a forest, abandoned by us.

original: bilāni daṃṣṭriṇaḥ sarve sānūni mṛgapakṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: bilāni daṃṣṭriṇaḥ sarve sānūni mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Let all the fanged animals enter their dens, and the deer and birds the mountains and valleys.

original: asmattyaktaṃ prapadyantāṃ sevyamānaṃ tyajantu ca // / / //
analyzed: asmad tyaktam prapadyantām sevyamānam tyajantu ca
translated: Let them resort to what is abandoned by us, and leave what is being used by them.

original: ity evaṃ vividhā vāco nānājanasamīritāḥ /
analyzed: iti evam vividhāḥ vācaḥ nānā jana samīritāḥ
translated: Thus various words, uttered by different people,

original: śuśrāva rāmaḥ śrutvā ca na vicakre 'sya mānasam // / / //
analyzed: śuśrāva rāmaḥ śrutvā ca na vicakre sya mānasam
translated: Rama heard. Having heard, his mind did not waver.

original: pratīkṣamāṇo 'bhijanaṃ tadārtam anārtarūpaḥ prahasann ivātha /🔽jagāma rāmaḥ pitaraṃ didṛkṣuḥ pitur nideśaṃ vidhivac cikīrṣuḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratīkṣamāṇaḥ tadā ārtam an ārta rūpaḥ prahasan iva atha  jagāma rāmaḥ pitaram didṛkṣuḥ pituḥ nideśam vidhivat cikīrṣuḥ
translated: Waiting for the people who were distressed, he, with a sorrowful appearance, as if smiling,🔽then Rama went, desiring to see his father, desiring to duly carry out his father's command.

original: tat pūrvam aikṣvākasuto mahātmā rāmo gamiṣyan vanam ārtarūpam /
analyzed: tat pūrvam aikṣvāka sutaḥ mahātmā rāmaḥ gamiṣyan vanam ārta rūpam
translated: First, the great-souled son of Ikshvaku, Rama, about to go to the forest in a sorrowful state,

original: vyatiṣṭhata prekṣya tadā sumantraṃ pitur mahātmā pratihāraṇārtham // / / //
analyzed: vyatiṣṭhata prekṣya tadā sumantram pituḥ mahātmā pratihāraṇa artham
translated: The high-souled one stood there, looking at Sumantra, for the purpose of announcing his arrival to his father.

original: pitur nideśena tu dharmavatsalo vanapraveśe kṛtabuddhiniścayaḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ nideśena tu dharma vatsalaḥ vana praveśe kṛta buddhi niścayaḥ
translated: But the one devoted to dharma, having made up his mind to enter the forest at his father's command,

original: sa rāghavaḥ prekṣya sumantram abravīn nivedayasvāgamanaṃ nṛpāya me // / / //
analyzed: sa rāghavaḥ prekṣya sumantram abravīt nivedayasva āgamanam nṛpāya me
translated: that Raghava, seeing Sumantra, said, Announce my arrival to the king.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽sa rāmapreṣitaḥ kṣipraṃ saṃtāpakaluṣendriyaḥ /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  sa rāma preṣitaḥ kṣipram saṃtāpa kaluṣa indriyaḥ
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.🔽Sent by Rama, with senses clouded by distress,

original: praviśya nṛpatiṃ sūto niḥśvasantaṃ dadarśa ha // / / //
analyzed: praviśya nṛpatim sūtaḥ niḥśvasantam dadarśa ha
translated: the charioteer entered and saw the king sighing.

original: ālokya tu mahāprājñaḥ paramākulacetasaṃ /
analyzed: ālokya tu mahā prājñaḥ parama ākula cetasam
translated: The greatly wise one, seeing him with a mind extremely agitated,

original: rāmam evānuśocantaṃ sūtaḥ prāñjalir āsadat // / / //
analyzed: rāmam eva anuśocantam sūtaḥ prāñjaliḥ āsadat
translated: mourning only for Rama, the charioteer, with folded hands, approached him.

original: ayaṃ sa puruṣavyāghra dvāri tiṣṭhati te sutaḥ /
analyzed: ayam sa puruṣa vyāghra dvāri tiṣṭhati te sutaḥ
translated: This is your son, O tiger among men, standing at the door.

original: brāhmaṇebhyo dhanaṃ dattvā sarvaṃ caivopajīvinām // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dhanam dattvā sarvam ca eva upajīvinām
translated: Having given wealth to the Brahmins and all the dependents,

original: sa tvā paśyatu bhadraṃ te rāmaḥ satyaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvā paśyatu bhadram te rāmaḥ satya parākramaḥ
translated: may he see you, blessed be you, Rama, for whom truth is his prowess.

original: sarvān suhṛda āpṛcchya tvām idānīṃ didṛkṣate // / / //
analyzed: sarvān suhṛdaḥ āpṛcchya tvām idānīm didṛkṣate
translated: Having taken leave of all his well-wishers, he now wishes to see you.

original: gamiṣyati mahāraṇyaṃ taṃ paśya jagatīpate /
analyzed: gamiṣyati mahā araṇyam tam paśya jagatīpate
translated: Let him see you, O lord of the earth, he who will go to the great forest.

original: vṛtaṃ rājaguṇaiḥ sarvair ādityam iva raśmibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛtam rāja guṇaiḥ sarvaiḥ ādityam iva raśmibhiḥ
translated: Surrounded by all the qualities of a king, like the sun by its rays.

original: sa satyavādī dharmātmā gāmbhīryāt sāgaropamaḥ /
analyzed: sa satya vādī dharma ātmā gāmbhīryāt sāgara upamaḥ
translated: He, truthful, righteous, deep like the ocean,

original: ākāśa iva niṣpaṅko narendraḥ pratyuvāca tam // / / //
analyzed: ākāśaḥ iva niṣpaṅkaḥ narendraḥ pratyuvāca tam
translated: The lord of men replied to him like the sky free from impurities.

original: sumantrānaya me dārān ye kecid iha māmakāḥ /
analyzed: sumantra ānaya me dārān ye kecid iha māmakāḥ
translated: O Sumantra, bring my wives, whatever number there are of mine.

original: dāraiḥ parivṛtaḥ sarvair draṣṭum icchāmi rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: dāraiḥ parivṛtaḥ sarvaiḥ draṣṭum icchāmi rāghavam
translated: Surrounded by all the wives, I wish to see Raghava.

original: so 'ntaḥpuram atītyaiva striyas tā vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: saḥ ntaḥpuram atītya eva striyaḥ tāḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Having passed beyond the inner quarters, he spoke these words to the women:

original: āryo hvayati vo rājā gamyatāṃ tatra māciram // / / //
analyzed: āryaḥ hvayati vaḥ rājā gamyatām tatra māciram
translated: The noble king summons you. Go there without delay.

original: evam uktāḥ striyaḥ sarvāḥ sumantreṇa nṛpājñayā /
analyzed: evam uktāḥ striyaḥ sarvāḥ sumantreṇa nṛpa ājñayā
translated: Thus addressed, all the women, by the king's order through Sumantra,

original: pracakramus tad bhavanaṃ bhartur ājñāya śāsanam // / / //
analyzed: pracakramuḥ tat bhavanam bhartuḥ ājñāya śāsanam
translated: Set out for that palace, having understood their husband's command.

original: ardhasaptaśatās tās tu pramadās tāmralocanāḥ /
analyzed: ardhasaptaśatāḥ tāḥ tu pramadāḥ tāmra locanāḥ
translated: Those seven hundred and fifty women with coppery eyes,

original: kausalyāṃ parivāryātha śanair jagmur dhṛtavratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kausalyām parivārya atha śanais jagmuḥ dhṛta vratāḥ
translated: Circling around Kausalya, slowly proceeded, firm in their vows.

original: āgateṣu ca dāreṣu samavekṣya mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: āgateṣu ca dāreṣu samavekṣya mahīpatiḥ
translated: And when the wives had arrived, the lord of the earth,

original: uvāca rājā taṃ sūtaṃ sumantrānaya me sutam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rājā tam sūtam sumantra ānaya me sutam
translated: The king said to the charioteer Sumantra, Bring my son.

original: sa sūto rāmam ādāya lakṣmaṇaṃ maithilīṃ tadā /
analyzed: sa sūtaḥ rāmam ādāya lakṣmaṇam maithilīm tadā
translated: The charioteer, taking Rama, Lakshmana, and Maithilee,

original: jagāmābhimukhas tūrṇaṃ sakāśaṃ jagatīpateḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagāma abhimukhaḥ tūrṇam sakāśam jagatīpateḥ
translated: And quickly went in the direction of the lord of the earth.

original: sa rājā putram āyāntaṃ dṛṣṭvā dūrāt kṛtāñjalim /
analyzed: sa rājā putram āyāntam dṛṣṭvā dūrāt kṛta añjalim
translated: The king, seeing his son coming from afar with folded hands,

original: utpapātāsanāt tūrṇam ārtaḥ strījanasaṃvṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utpapāta āsanāt tūrṇam ārtaḥ strī jana saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: Suddenly rose from his seat, afflicted, surrounded by the women.

original: so 'bhidudrāva vegena rāmaṃ dṛṣṭvā viśāṃpatiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ bhidudrāva vegena rāmam dṛṣṭvā viśām patiḥ
translated: Seeing Rama, the lord of the people, he rushed towards him with speed.

original: tam asaṃprāpya duḥkhārtaḥ papāta bhuvi mūrchitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam a saṃprāpya duḥkha ārtaḥ papāta bhuvi mūrchitaḥ
translated: Not reaching him, afflicted with grief, he fell down on the ground, unconscious.

original: taṃ rāmo 'bhyapatat kṣipraṃ lakṣmaṇaś ca mahārathaḥ /
analyzed: tam rāmaḥ bhyapatat kṣipram lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā rathaḥ
translated: Rama and the great warrior Lakshmana quickly rushed to him,

original: visaṃjñam iva duḥkhena saśokaṃ nṛpatiṃ tadā // / / //🔽strīsahasraninādaś ca saṃjajñe rājaveśmani /🔽hā hā rāmeti sahasā bhūṣaṇadhvanimūrchitaḥ // / / //🔽taṃ pariṣvajya bāhubhyāṃ tāv ubhau rāmalakṣmaṇau /
analyzed: visaṃjñam iva duḥkhena sa śokam nṛpatim tadā  strī sahasra ninādaḥ ca saṃjajñe rāja veśmani  hā hā rāma iti sahasā bhūṣaṇa dhvani mūrchitaḥ  tam pariṣvajya bāhubhyām tau ubhau rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: To the king who, overcome with grief, seemed to have lost his senses.🔽And a cry of Alas! Alas! Rama! suddenly arose in the king's palace, mingled with the sound of ornaments.

original: paryaṅke sītayā sārdhaṃ rudantaḥ samaveśayan // / / //🔽atha rāmo muhūrtena labdhasaṃjñaṃ mahīpatim /
analyzed: paryaṅke sītayā sārdham rudantaḥ samaveśayan  atha rāmaḥ muhūrtena labdha saṃjñam mahīpatim
translated: Rama and Lakshmana embraced him with their arms and made him sit on the couch along with Sita, all of them weeping.🔽Then, in a moment, when the king had regained consciousness,

original: uvāca prāñjalir bhūtvā śokārṇavapariplutam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca prāñjaliḥ bhūtvā śoka arṇava pariplutam
translated: Rama, with folded hands, spoke to him, who was immersed in an ocean of sorrow.

original: āpṛcche tvāṃ mahārāja sarveṣām īśvaro 'si naḥ /
analyzed: āpṛcche tvām mahā rāja sarveṣām īśvaraḥ si naḥ
translated: I take leave of you, great king, for you are the lord of us all.

original: prasthitaṃ daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ paśya tvaṃ kuśalena mām // / / //
analyzed: prasthitam daṇḍaka araṇyam paśya tvam kuśalena mām
translated: And see me off to the forest of Dandaka with your blessings.

original: lakṣmaṇaṃ cānujānīhi sītā cānveti māṃ vanam /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇam ca anujānīhi sītā ca anveti mām vanam
translated: And give permission to Lakshmana, and Sita is following me to the forest.

original: kāraṇair bahubhis tathyair vāryamāṇau na cecchataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāraṇaiḥ bahubhiḥ tathyaiḥ vāryamāṇau na ca icchataḥ
translated: Though repeatedly dissuaded with many true reasons, they do not wish to

original: anujānīhi sarvān naḥ śokam utsṛjya mānada /
analyzed: anujānīhi sarvān naḥ śokam utsṛjya mānada
translated: Give permission to all of us, O giver of honor, casting off sorrow.

original: lakṣmaṇaṃ māṃ ca sītāṃ ca prajāpatir iva prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇam mām ca sītām ca prajāpatiḥ iva prajāḥ
translated: Lakshmana, Sita and me, O lord of the earth, like Prajapati (does to his offspring).

original: pratīkṣamāṇam avyagram anujñāṃ jagatīpateḥ /
analyzed: pratīkṣamāṇam avyagram anujñām jagatīpateḥ
translated: Waiting eagerly for the permission of the lord of the earth,

original: uvāca rājā samprekṣya vanavāsāya rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rājā samprekṣya vana vāsāya rāghavam
translated: The king, seeing Raghava ready for exile in the forest, said:

original: ahaṃ rāghava kaikeyyā varadānena mohitaḥ /
analyzed: aham rāghava kaikeyyāḥ vara dānena mohitaḥ
translated: O Raghava, I was deluded by the boon granted by Kaikeyi.

original: ayodhyāyās tvam evādya bhava rājā nigṛhya mām // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyāyāḥ tvam eva adya bhava rājā nigṛhya mām
translated: You alone be the king of Ayodhya from today, restraining me.

original: evam ukto nṛpatinā rāmo dharmabhṛtāṃ varaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ nṛpatinā rāmaḥ dharma bhṛtām varaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the king, Rama, the best among the upholders of dharma,

original: pratyuvācāñjaliṃ kṛtvā pitaraṃ vākyakovidaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca añjalim kṛtvā pitaram vākya kovidaḥ
translated: Replied with folded hands, skilled in speech, to his father:

original: bhavān varṣasahasrāya pṛthivyā nṛpate patiḥ /
analyzed: bhavān varṣa sahasrāya pṛthivyāḥ nṛpate patiḥ
translated: You, O lord of the earth, be the king for a thousand years.

original: ahaṃ tv araṇye vatsyāmi na me kāryaṃ tvayānṛtam // / / //
analyzed: aham tu araṇye vatsyāmi na me kāryam tvayā anṛtam
translated: But I will dwell in the forest, I have no need of your falsehood.

original: śreyase vṛddhaye tāta punarāgamanāya ca /
analyzed: śreyase vṛddhaye tāta punarāgamanāya ca
translated: For the sake of welfare and prosperity, O father, and for my return,

original: gacchasvāriṣṭam avyagraḥ panthānam akutobhayam // / / //
analyzed: gacchasva ariṣṭam avyagraḥ panthānam akutobhayam
translated: Go now, without anxiety, on a path free from danger.

original: adya tv idānīṃ rajanīṃ putra mā gaccha sarvathā /
analyzed: adya tu idānīm rajanīm putra mā gaccha sarvathā
translated: But today, O son, by all means do not go this night.

original: mātaraṃ māṃ ca saṃpaśyan vasemām adya śarvarīm /
analyzed: mātaram mām ca saṃpaśyan vasa imām adya śarvarīm
translated: Looking after your mother and me, stay this night.

original: tarpitaḥ sarvakāmais tvaṃ śvaḥkāle sādhayiṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: tarpitaḥ sarva kāmaiḥ tvam śvaḥkāle sādhayiṣyasi
translated: Having been gratified with all your desires, you will accomplish your purpose tomorrow.

original: atha rāmas tathā śrutvā pitur ārtasya bhāṣitam /
analyzed: atha rāmaḥ tathā śrutvā pituḥ ārtasya bhāṣitam
translated: Then Rama, having heard those words of his afflicted father,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā dīno vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā dīnaḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: together with his brother Lakshmana, spoke these distressed words:

original: prāpsyāmi yān adya guṇān ko me śvastān pradāsyati /
analyzed: prāpsyāmi yān adya guṇān kaḥ me śvas tān pradāsyati
translated: Who will bestow on me today the virtues I will obtain tomorrow?

original: apakramaṇam evātaḥ sarvakāmair ahaṃ vṛṇe // / / //
analyzed: apakramaṇam eva atas sarva kāmaiḥ aham vṛṇe
translated: Therefore, I choose only departure, with all my desires.

original: iyaṃ sarāṣṭrā sajanā dhanadhānyasamākulā /
analyzed: iyam sa rāṣṭrā sa janā dhana dhānya samākulā
translated: This earth, with its kingdoms, people, wealth, grain, and abundance,

original: mayā visṛṣṭā vasudhā bharatāya pradīyatām // / / //
analyzed: mayā visṛṣṭā vasudhā bharatāya pradīyatām
translated: given up by me, should be given to Bharata.

original: apagacchatu te duḥkhaṃ mā bhūr bāṣpapariplutaḥ /
analyzed: apagacchatu te duḥkham mā bhūḥ bāṣpa pariplutaḥ
translated: Let your sorrow depart, do not be overwhelmed with tears.

original: na hi kṣubhyati durdharṣaḥ samudraḥ saritāṃ patiḥ // / / //
analyzed: na hi kṣubhyati durdharṣaḥ samudraḥ saritām patiḥ
translated: For the invincible ocean, the lord of rivers, does not become agitated.

original: naivāhaṃ rājyam icchāmi na sukhaṃ na ca maithilīm /
analyzed: na eva aham rājyam icchāmi na sukham na ca maithilīm
translated: I do not desire the kingdom, nor happiness, nor Maithili.

original: tvām ahaṃ satyam icchāmi nānṛtaṃ puruṣarṣabha // / / //
analyzed: tvām aham satyam icchāmi na anṛtam puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: I desire you to be true, O best of men, and not false.

original: puraṃ ca rāṣṭraṃ ca mahī ca kevalā mayā nisṛṣṭā bharatāya dīyatām /
analyzed: puram ca rāṣṭram ca mahī ca kevalā mayā nisṛṣṭāḥ bharatāya dīyatām
translated: The city, the kingdom, and the whole earth have been given up by me. Let them be given to Bharata.

original: ahaṃ nideśaṃ bhavato 'nupālayan vanaṃ gamiṣyāmi cirāya sevitum // / / //
analyzed: aham nideśam bhavataḥ nu pālayan vanam gamiṣyāmi cirāya sevitum
translated: O king, I shall go to the forest to live there for a long time, obeying your command.

original: mayā nisṛṣṭāṃ bharato mahīm imāṃ saśailakhaṇḍāṃ sapurāṃ sakānanām /
analyzed: mayā nisṛṣṭām bharataḥ mahīm imām sa śaila khaṇḍām sa purām sa kānanām
translated: Let Bharata rule this earth, with its mountains, divisions, cities and forests, which I have given up.

original: śivāṃ susīmām anuśāstu kevalaṃ tvayā yad uktaṃ nṛpate yathāstu tat // / / //
analyzed: śivām su sīmām anuśāstu kevalam tvayā yat uktam nṛpate yathā astu tat
translated: Let him rule it peacefully, with good boundaries, as you have said.

original: na me tathā pārthiva dhīyate mano mahatsu kāmeṣu na cātmanaḥ priye /
analyzed: na me tathā pārthiva dhīyate manaḥ mahatsu kāmeṣu na ca ātmanaḥ priye
translated: O king, my mind is not so much set on great pleasures or on my own happiness,

original: yathā nideśe tava śiṣṭasaṃmate vyapaitu duḥkhaṃ tava matkṛte 'nagha // / / //
analyzed: yathā nideśe tava śiṣṭa saṃmate vyapaitu duḥkham tava mad kṛte nagha
translated: as on obeying your command, which is approved by the virtuous. O sinless one, let your sorrow on my account be removed.

original: tad adya naivānagha rājyam avyayaṃ na sarvakāmān na sukhaṃ na maithilīm /
analyzed: tat adya na eva anagha rājyam avyayam na sarva kāmān na sukham na maithilīm
translated: Today I do not choose this imperishable kingdom, nor all pleasures, nor happiness, nor Maithilee,

original: na jīvitaṃ tvām anṛtena yojayan vṛṇīya satyaṃ vratam astu te tathā // / / //
analyzed: na jīvitam tvām anṛtena yojayan vṛṇīya satyam vratam astu te tathā
translated: nor life, by joining you with falsehood. Let my vow be true, as you have said.

original: phalāni mūlāni ca bhakṣayan vane girīṃś ca paśyan saritaḥ sarāṃsi ca /
analyzed: phalāni mūlāni ca bhakṣayan vane girīn ca paśyan saritaḥ sarāṃsi ca
translated: Eating fruits and roots in the forest, seeing mountains, rivers and lakes,

original: vanaṃ praviśyaiva vicitrapādapaṃ sukhī bhaviṣyāmi tavāstu nirvṛtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vanam praviśya eva vicitra pādapam sukhī bhaviṣyāmi tava astu nirvṛtiḥ
translated: Entering the forest with its diverse trees, I shall be happy. Let there be peace for you.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽tataḥ sumantram aikṣvākaḥ pīḍito 'tra pratijñayā /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  tatas sumantram aikṣvākaḥ pīḍitaḥ u tra pratijñayā
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.🔽Then the descendant of Ikshvaku, afflicted by his vow in this matter,

original: sabāṣpam atiniḥśvasya jagādedaṃ punaḥ punaḥ // / / //🔽sūta ratnasusampūrṇā caturvidhabalā camūḥ /
analyzed: sa bāṣpam atiniḥśvasya jagāda idam punar punar  sūta ratna su sampūrṇā caturvidha balā camūḥ
translated: Sighing deeply with tears, repeatedly said this:🔽O charioteer, let an army be quickly prepared, filled with jewels and consisting of four divisions,

original: rāghavasyānuyātrārthaṃ kṣipraṃ pratividhīyatām // / / //🔽rūpājīvāśca śālinyo vaṇijaś ca mahādhanāḥ /
analyzed: rāghavasya anuyātrā artham kṣipram pratividhīyatām  rūpājīvāḥ ca śālinyaḥ vaṇijaḥ ca mahādhanāḥ
translated: For the escort of Raghava.🔽Let beautiful courtesans, wealthy merchants,

original: śobhayantu kumārasya vāhinīṃ suprasāritāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śobhayantu kumārasya vāhinīm su prasāritāḥ
translated: Adorn the prince's army, well-displayed.

original: ye cainam upajīvanti ramate yaiś ca vīryataḥ /
analyzed: ye ca enam upajīvanti ramate yaiḥ ca vīryataḥ
translated: And those who depend on him, by whom he delights through his valor,

original: teṣāṃ bahuvidhaṃ dattvā tān apy atra niyojaya // / / //
analyzed: teṣām bahuvidham dattvā tān api atra niyojaya
translated: Having given them various gifts, employ them here as well.

original: nighnan mṛgān kuñjarāṃś ca pibaṃś cāraṇyakaṃ madhu /
analyzed: nighnan mṛgān kuñjarān ca piban ca āraṇyakam madhu
translated: Slaying deer and elephants, drinking forest honey,

original: nadīś ca vividhāḥ paśyan na rājyaṃ saṃsmariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: nadīḥ ca vividhāḥ paśyan na rājyam saṃsmariṣyati
translated: And seeing various rivers, he will not remember the kingdom.

original: dhānyakośaś ca yaḥ kaścid dhanakośaś ca māmakaḥ /
analyzed: dhānya kośaḥ ca yaḥ kaścid dhana kośaḥ ca māmakaḥ
translated: And whatever grain treasury and wealth treasury I have,

original: tau rāmam anugacchetāṃ vasantaṃ nirjane vane // / / //
analyzed: tau rāmam anugacchetām vasantam nirjane vane
translated: Let them follow Rama, dwelling in the desolate forest.

original: yajan puṇyeṣu deśeṣu visṛjaṃś cāptadakṣiṇāḥ /
analyzed: yajan puṇyeṣu deśeṣu visṛjan ca āpta dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: Performing sacrifices in sacred places and giving away abundant gifts,

original: ṛṣibhiś ca samāgamya pravatsyati sukhaṃ vane // / / //
analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ ca samāgamya pravatsyati sukham vane
translated: and associating with sages, he will happily dwell in the forest.

original: bharataś ca mahābāhur ayodhyāṃ pālayiṣyati /
analyzed: bharataḥ ca mahā bāhuḥ ayodhyām pālayiṣyati
translated: And the mighty-armed Bharata will rule Ayodhya.

original: sarvakāmaiḥ punaḥ śrīmān rāmaḥ saṃsādhyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: sarva kāmaiḥ punar śrīmān rāmaḥ saṃsādhyatām iti
translated: Let the prosperous Rama be honored with all desired objects.

original: evaṃ bruvati kākutsthe kaikeyyā bhayam āgatam /
analyzed: evam bruvati kākutsthe kaikeyyāḥ bhayam āgatam
translated: When Kakutstha said this, fear came upon Kaikeyi.

original: mukhaṃ cāpy agamacchoṣaṃ svaraś cāpi nyarudhyata // / / //
analyzed: mukham ca api agamat śoṣam svaraḥ ca api nyarudhyata
translated: Her face became dry and her voice choked up.

original: sā viṣaṇṇā ca saṃtrastā kaikeyī vākyam abravīt /🔽rājyaṃ gatajanaṃ sādho pītamaṇḍāṃ surām iva /
analyzed: sā viṣaṇṇā ca saṃtrastā kaikeyī vākyam abravīt  rājyam gata janam sādho pīta maṇḍām surām iva
translated: She, dejected and frightened, spoke these words:🔽O good man, Bharata will not accept the kingdom, which has lost its people, like liquor with the sediment drunk.

original: nirāsvādyatamaṃ śūnyaṃ bharato nābhipatsyate // / / //
analyzed: nirāsvādyatamam śūnyam bharataḥ nā abhipatsyate
translated: It is devoid of all taste and is empty.

original: kaikeyyāṃ muktalajjāyāṃ vadantyām atidāruṇam /
analyzed: kaikeyyām mukta lajjāyām vadantyām ati dāruṇam
translated: When Kaikeyi, who had cast aside shame, was speaking these extremely terrible words,

original: rājā daśaratho vākyam uvācāyatalocanām /
analyzed: rājā daśarathaḥ vākyam uvāca āyata locanām
translated: King Dasharatha spoke to the large-eyed one:

original: vahantaṃ kiṃ tudasi māṃ niyujya dhuri māhite // / / //
analyzed: vahantam kim tudasi mām niyujya dhuri mā ahite
translated: Having yoked me to the burden, why do you strike me, O wicked one?

original: kaikeyī dviguṇaṃ kruddhā rājānam idam abravīt /
analyzed: kaikeyī dviguṇam kruddhā rājānam idam abravīt
translated: Kaikeyi, twice as angry, spoke to the king:

original: tavaiva vaṃśe sagaro jyeṣṭhaṃ putram upārudhat /
analyzed: tava eva vaṃśe sagaraḥ jyeṣṭham putram upārudhat
translated: In your own lineage, Sagara bound his eldest son

original: asamañja iti khyātaṃ tathāyaṃ gantum arhati // / / //
analyzed: asamañjaḥ iti khyātam tathā ayam gantum arhati
translated: and he is known as Asamanja. He deserves to be banished.

original: evam ukto dhig ity eva rājā daśaratho 'bravīt /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ dhik iti eva rājā daśarathaḥ bravīt
translated: Thus addressed, King Dasharatha said, Shame!

original: vrīḍitaś ca janaḥ sarvaḥ sā ca tan nāvabudhyata // / / //
analyzed: vrīḍitaḥ ca janaḥ sarvaḥ sā ca tat na avabudhyata
translated: And all the people were ashamed, but she did not understand what it meant.

original: tatra vṛddho mahāmātraḥ siddhārtho nāma nāmataḥ /
analyzed: tatra vṛddhaḥ mahāmātraḥ siddhārthaḥ nāma nāmataḥ
translated: There an old chief minister named Siddhārtha,

original: śucir bahumato rājñaḥ kaikeyīm idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: śuciḥ bahu mataḥ rājñaḥ kaikeyīm idam abravīt
translated: pure and highly regarded by the king, said this to Kaikeyī:

original: asamañjo gṛhītvā tu krīḍitaḥ pathi dārakān /
analyzed: asamañjaḥ gṛhītvā tu krīḍitaḥ pathi dārakān
translated: Asamanja, having seized the children on the road, plays with them.

original: sarayvāḥ prakṣipann apsu ramate tena durmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarayvāḥ prakṣipan apsu ramate tena durmatiḥ
translated: Throwing them into the water of the Sarayū, he delights in it, that evil-minded one.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā nāgarāḥ sarve kruddhā rājānam abruvan /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā nāgarāḥ sarve kruddhāḥ rājānam abruvan
translated: Seeing him, all the citizens, angry, said to the king:

original: asamañjaṃ vṛṇīṣvaikam asmān vā rāṣṭravardhana // / / //
analyzed: asamañjam vṛṇīṣva ekam asmān vā rāṣṭra vardhana
translated: Either choose Asamanja or us, O enhancer of the kingdom.

original: tān uvāca tato rājā kiṃnimittam idaṃ bhayam /
analyzed: tān uvāca tatas rājā kiṃnimittam idam bhayam
translated: Then the king said, What is the cause of this fear?

original: tāś cāpi rājñā saṃpṛṣṭā vākyaṃ prakṛtayo 'bruvan // / / //
analyzed: tāḥ ca api rājñā saṃpṛṣṭāḥ vākyam prakṛtayaḥ bruvan
translated: And the subjects, thus questioned by the king, spoke these words:

original: krīḍitas tv eṣa naḥ putrān bālān udbhrāntacetanaḥ /
analyzed: krīḍitaḥ tu eṣa naḥ putrān bālān udbhrānta cetanaḥ
translated: This one, while playing, with a deranged mind, throws our children,

original: sarayvāṃ prakṣipan maurkhyād atulāṃ prītim aśnute // / / //
analyzed: sarayvām prakṣipan maurkhyāt atulām prītim aśnute
translated: the boys, into the Sarayū out of foolishness, and enjoys incomparable delight.

original: sa tāsāṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā prakṛtīnāṃ narādhipa /
analyzed: sa tāsām vacanam śrutvā prakṛtīnām narādhipa
translated: Hearing the words of those subjects, the king,

original: taṃ tatyājāhitaṃ putraṃ tāsāṃ priyacikīrṣayā // / / //
analyzed: tam tatyāja ahitam putram tāsām priya cikīrṣayā
translated: desiring to do what was agreeable to them, abandoned that unrighteous son.

original: ity evam atyajad rājā sagaro vai sudhārmikaḥ /
analyzed: iti evam atyajat rājā sagaraḥ vai su dhārmikaḥ
translated: Thus did the extremely righteous king Sagara abandon him.

original: rāmaḥ kim akarot pāpaṃ yenaivam uparudhyate // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ kim akarot pāpam yena evam uparudhyate
translated: What sin did Rama commit that he is thus obstructed?

original: śrutvā tu siddhārthavaco rājā śrāntatarasvanaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā tu siddhārtha vacaḥ rājā śrāntatara svanaḥ
translated: Having heard the words of the successful one, the king, with a voice more tired than before,

original: śokopahatayā vācā kaikeyīm idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: śoka upahatayā vācā kaikeyīm idam abravīt
translated: with words affected by grief, said this to Kaikeyi:

original: anuvrajiṣyāmy aham adya rāmaṃ rājyaṃ parityajya sukhaṃ dhanaṃ ca /
analyzed: anuvrajiṣyāmi aham adya rāmam rājyam parityajya sukham dhanam ca
translated: Today I will follow Rama, abandoning the kingdom, happiness, and wealth.

original: sahaiva rājñā bharatena ca tvaṃ yathā sukhaṃ bhuṅkṣva cirāya rājyam // / / //
analyzed: saha eva rājñā bharatena ca tvam yathā sukham bhuṅkṣva cirāya rājyam
translated: With King Bharata and you, enjoy the kingdom for a long time as you please.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽mahāmātravacaḥ śrutvā rāmo daśarathaṃ tadā /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  mahāmātra vacaḥ śrutvā rāmaḥ daśaratham tadā
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.🔽Having heard the words of the chief minister, Rama,

original: anvabhāṣata vākyaṃ tu vinayajño vinītavat // / / //
analyzed: anvabhāṣata vākyam tu vinaya jñaḥ vinīta vat
translated: the one who knew humility, spoke these words humbly to Dasharatha:

original: tyaktabhogasya me rājan vane vanyena jīvataḥ /
analyzed: tyakta bhogasya me rājan vane vanyena jīvataḥ
translated: O king, I have renounced pleasures and will live in the forest on forest fare.

original: kiṃ kāryam anuyātreṇa tyaktasaṅgasya sarvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kim kāryam anuyātreṇa tyakta saṅgasya sarvatas
translated: What need do I have for a following, being detached from everything?

original: yo hi dattvā dvipaśreṣṭhaṃ kakṣyāyāṃ kurute manaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi dattvā dvipa śreṣṭham kakṣyāyām kurute manaḥ
translated: He who, having given away the best of elephants, sets his mind on the harem,

original: rajjusnehena kiṃ tasya tyajataḥ kuñjarottamam // / / //
analyzed: rajju snehena kim tasya tyajataḥ kuñjara uttamam
translated: What need have I of the affection of a rope, when I am abandoning this excellent elephant?

original: tathā mama satāṃ śreṣṭha kiṃ dhvajinyā jagatpate /
analyzed: tathā mama satām śreṣṭha kim dhvajinyā jagatpate
translated: O best of the virtuous, O lord of the world, what need have I of an army?

original: sarvāṇy evānujānāmi cīrāṇy evānayantu me // / / //
analyzed: sarvāṇi eva anujānāmi cīrāṇi eva ānayantu me
translated: I grant permission for everything. Let them bring me only rags.

original: khanitrapiṭake cobhe mamānayata gacchataḥ /
analyzed: khanitra piṭake ca ubhe mama ānayata gacchataḥ
translated: And bring me both the spade and the basket, for I am going away.

original: caturdaśa vane vāsaṃ varṣāṇi vasato mama // / / //🔽atha cīrāṇi kaikeyī svayam āhṛtya rāghavam /
analyzed: caturdaśa vane vāsam varṣāṇi vasataḥ mama  atha cīrāṇi kaikeyī svayam āhṛtya rāghavam
translated: For fourteen years I will dwell in the forest, while you will live here.

original: uvāca paridhatsveti janaughe nirapatrapā // / / //
analyzed: uvāca paridhatsva iti jana oghe nirapatrapā
translated: Then Kaikeyi herself brought the rags and said to Raghava, Put them on, in the midst of a crowd of people, without shame.

original: sa cīre puruṣavyāghraḥ kaikeyyāḥ pratigṛhya te /
analyzed: sa cīre puruṣa vyāghraḥ kaikeyyāḥ pratigṛhya te
translated: The tiger among men, having accepted those rags from Kaikeyi,

original: sūkṣmavastram avakṣipya munivastrāṇy avasta ha // / / //
analyzed: sūkṣma vastram avakṣipya muni vastrāṇi avasta ha
translated: removed his fine garments and put on the sage's garments.

original: lakṣmaṇaś cāpi tatraiva vihāya vasane śubhe /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca api tatra eva vihāya vasane śubhe
translated: And Lakshmana, too, there itself, having discarded his fine garments,

original: tāpasāc chādane caiva jagrāha pitur agrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāpasāt chādane ca eva jagrāha pituḥ agratas
translated: took a sage's robe in front of his father.

original: athātmaparidhānārthaṃ sītā kauśeyavāsinī /
analyzed: atha ātma paridhāna artham sītā kauśeya vāsinī
translated: Then Sita, wearing silk garments, for the sake of her own attire,

original: samīkṣya cīraṃ saṃtrastā pṛṣatī vāgurām iva // / / //
analyzed: samīkṣya cīram saṃtrastā pṛṣatī vāgurām iva
translated: seeing the rag, was frightened, like a spotted doe at a snare.

original: sā vyapatrapamāṇeva pratigṛhya ca durmanāḥ /
analyzed: sā vyapatrapamāṇā iva pratigṛhya ca durmanāḥ
translated: She, as if ashamed, accepted it, and being dejected,

original: gandharvarājapratimaṃ bhartāram idam abravīt /
analyzed: gandharvarāja pratimam bhartāram idam abravīt
translated: And said to her husband, who was like the king of the Gandharvas:

original: kathaṃ nu cīraṃ badhnanti munayo vanavāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham nu cīram badhnanti munayaḥ vana vāsinaḥ
translated: How do the sages who dwell in the forest tie their bark garments?

original: kṛtvā kaṇṭhe ca sā cīram ekam ādāya pāṇinā /
analyzed: kṛtvā kaṇṭhe ca sā cīram ekam ādāya pāṇinā
translated: Having tied the bark garment around her neck with one hand,

original: tasthau hy akuśalā tatra vrīḍitā janakātmajā // / / //
analyzed: tasthau hi akuśalā tatra vrīḍitā janakātmajā
translated: Janaka's daughter stood there, unskilled in that, feeling embarrassed.

original: tasyās tat kṣipram āgamya rāmo dharmabhṛtāṃ varaḥ /🔽cīraṃ babandha sītāyāḥ kauśeyasyopari svayam // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ tat kṣipram āgamya rāmaḥ dharma bhṛtām varaḥ  cīram babandha sītāyāḥ kauśeyasya upari svayam
translated: Rama, the best of the upholders of dharma, quickly came to her🔽and himself put the bark garment over Sita's silken garment.

original: tasyāṃ cīraṃ vasānāyāṃ nāthavatyām anāthavat /
analyzed: tasyām cīram vasānāyām nāthavatyām anātha vat
translated: When she was wearing the bark garment, though she had a protector, she was like one without a protector.

original: pracukrośa janaḥ sarvo dhik tvāṃ daśarathaṃ tv iti // / / //
analyzed: pracukrośa janaḥ sarvaḥ dhik tvām daśaratham tu iti
translated: All the people cried out, Shame on you, Dasharatha!

original: sa niḥśvasyoṣṇam aikṣvākas tāṃ bhāryām idam abravīt /
analyzed: sa niḥśvasya uṣṇam aikṣvākaḥ tām bhāryām idam abravīt
translated: Dasharatha, the descendant of Ikshvaku, sighed deeply and said this to his wife:

original: kaikeyi kuśacīreṇa na sītā gantum arhati // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyi kuśa cīreṇa na sītā gantum arhati
translated: Kaikeyi, Sita does not deserve to go in a garment of kusha grass.

original: nanu paryāptam etat te pāpe rāmavivāsanam /
analyzed: nanu paryāptam etat te pāpe rāma vivāsanam
translated: O sinful one, is not the banishment of Rama enough for you?

original: kim ebhiḥ kṛpaṇair bhūyaḥ pātakair api te kṛtaiḥ // / / //🔽evaṃ bruvantaṃ pitaraṃ rāmaḥ samprasthito vanam /
analyzed: kim ebhiḥ kṛpaṇaiḥ bhūyas pātakaiḥ api te kṛtaiḥ  evam bruvantam pitaram rāmaḥ samprasthitaḥ vanam
translated: What more miserable and sinful deeds do you want to do?🔽When his father said this, Rama, who was about to leave for the forest,

original: avākśirasam āsīnam idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: avāk śirasam āsīnam idam vacanam abravīt
translated: while his father was sitting with his head down, spoke these words:

original: iyaṃ dhārmika kausalyā mama mātā yaśasvinī /
analyzed: iyam dhārmika kausalyā mama mātā yaśasvinī
translated: O righteous one, this illustrious Kausalyā is my mother.

original: vṛddhā cākṣudraśīlā ca na ca tvāṃ devagarhite // / / //
analyzed: vṛddhā ca akṣudra śīlā ca na ca tvām deva garhite
translated: She is old, of noble character, and does not censure you, O you who are censured by the gods.

original: mayā vihīnāṃ varada prapannāṃ śokasāgaram /
analyzed: mayā vihīnām vara da prapannām śoka sāgaram
translated: Deprived of me, O bestower of boons, she will be plunged into an ocean of grief.

original: adṛṣṭapūrvavyasanāṃ bhūyaḥ saṃmantum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: adṛṣṭa pūrva vyasanām bhūyas saṃmantum arhasi
translated: She has never experienced sorrow before. It behoves you to console her again and again.

original: imāṃ mahendropamajātagarbhiṇīṃ tathā vidhātuṃ jananīṃ mamārhasi /
analyzed: imām mahā indra upama jāta garbhiṇīm tathā vidhātum jananīm mama arhasi
translated: You should act in such a way that my mother, who is pregnant with a child like Indra,

original: yathā vanasthe mayi śokakarśitā na jīvitaṃ nyasya yamakṣayaṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: yathā vana sthe mayi śoka karśitā na jīvitam nyasya yama kṣayam vrajet
translated: should not, being afflicted with grief on account of my living in the forest, cast off her life and go to the abode of Yama.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: rāmasya tu vacaḥ śrutvā muniveṣadharaṃ ca tam /
analyzed: rāmasya tu vacaḥ śrutvā muni veṣa dharam ca tam
translated: Having heard Rama's words and seeing him in the guise of an ascetic,

original: samīkṣya saha bhāryābhī rājā vigatacetanaḥ // / / //🔽nainaṃ duḥkhena saṃtaptaḥ pratyavaikṣata rāghavam /
analyzed: samīkṣya saha bhāryābhiḥ rājā vigata cetanaḥ  na enam duḥkhena saṃtaptaḥ pratyavaikṣata rāghavam
translated: the king, along with his wives, became senseless.🔽Afflicted with grief, he did not look at Raghava.

original: na cainam abhisamprekṣya pratyabhāṣata durmanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca enam abhisamprekṣya pratyabhāṣata durmanāḥ
translated: Distressed, he did not look at him or reply.

original: sa muhūrtam ivāsaṃjño duḥkhitaś ca mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: sa muhūrtam iva asaṃjñaḥ duḥkhitaḥ ca mahīpatiḥ
translated: For a moment, the grief-stricken king became unconscious.

original: vilalāpa mahābāhū rāmam evānucintayan // / / //
analyzed: vilalāpa mahā bāhuḥ rāmam eva anucintayan
translated: Thinking only of Rama, the mighty-armed one lamented.

original: manye khalu mayā pūrvaṃ vivatsā bahavaḥ kṛtāḥ /
analyzed: manye khalu mayā pūrvam vivatsāḥ bahavaḥ kṛtāḥ
translated: I think I must have separated many cows from their calves in the past.

original: prāṇino hiṃsitā vāpi tasmād idam upasthitam // / / //
analyzed: prāṇinaḥ hiṃsitāḥ vā api tasmāt idam upasthitam
translated: And also creatures have been injured, therefore this has befallen me.

original: na tv evānāgate kāle dehāc cyavati jīvitam /
analyzed: na tu eva anāgate kāle dehāt cyavati jīvitam
translated: But life does not depart from the body before the appointed time.

original: kaikeyyā kliśyamānasya mṛtyur mama na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyyā kliśyamānasya mṛtyuḥ mama na vidyate
translated: For one who is afflicted by Kaikeyi, death does not exist for me.

original: yo 'haṃ pāvakasaṃkāśaṃ paśyāmi purataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: yaḥ ham pāvaka saṃkāśam paśyāmi puratas sthitam
translated: I who see my son standing before me, radiant like fire,

original: vihāya vasane sūkṣme tāpasācchādam ātmajam // / / //
analyzed: vihāya vasane sūkṣme tāpasa ācchādam ātmajam
translated: Abandoning his fine garments, clad in the garb of an ascetic.

original: ekasyāḥ khalu kaikeyyāḥ kṛte 'yaṃ kliśyate janaḥ /
analyzed: ekasyāḥ khalu kaikeyyāḥ kṛte yam kliśyate janaḥ
translated: For the sake of one alone, Kaikeyi, this people is afflicted,

original: svārthe prayatamānāyāḥ saṃśritya nikṛtiṃ tv imām // / / //
analyzed: sva arthe prayatamānāyāḥ saṃśritya nikṛtim tu imām
translated: Relying on her deceitfulness, striving for her own purpose.

original: evam uktvā tu vacanaṃ bāṣpeṇa pihitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā tu vacanam bāṣpeṇa pihita indriyaḥ
translated: Having spoken these words, with his senses covered by tears,

original: rāmeti sakṛd evoktvā vyāhartuṃ na śaśāka ha // / / //
analyzed: rāmaiḥ iti sakṛt evā uktvā vyāhartum na śaśāka ha
translated: Having said Rama only once, he was unable to speak further.

original: saṃjñāṃ tu pratilabhyaiva muhūrtāt sa mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñām tu pratilabhya eva muhūrtāt sa mahīpatiḥ
translated: But having regained consciousness in a moment, the lord of the earth,

original: netrābhyām aśrupūrṇābhyāṃ sumantram idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: netrābhyām aśru pūrṇābhyām sumantram idam abravīt
translated: With eyes filled with tears, said this to Sumantra:

original: aupavāhyaṃ rathaṃ yuktvā tvam āyāhi hayottamaiḥ /
analyzed: aupavāhyam ratham yuktvā tvam āyāhi haya uttamaiḥ
translated: Having yoked the royal chariot with excellent horses, come here.

original: prāpayainaṃ mahābhāgam ito janapadāt param // / / //
analyzed: prāpaya enam mahābhāgam itas janapadāt param
translated: Convey this illustrious one beyond this country.

original: evaṃ manye guṇavatāṃ guṇānāṃ phalam ucyate /
analyzed: evam manye guṇavatām guṇānām phalam ucyate
translated: I think this is said to be the fruit of the virtues of the virtuous,

original: pitrā mātrā ca yat sādhur vīro nirvāsyate vanam // / / //
analyzed: pitrā mātrā ca yat sādhuḥ vīraḥ nirvāsyate vanam
translated: That the virtuous and heroic one should be exiled to the forest by his father and mother.

original: rājño vacanam ājñāya sumantraḥ śīghravikramaḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ vacanam ājñāya sumantraḥ śīghra vikramaḥ
translated: Having heard the king's words, Sumantra, swift in action,

original: yojayitvāyayau tatra ratham aśvair alaṃkṛtam // / / //
analyzed: yojayitvā āyayau tatra ratham aśvaiḥ alaṃkṛtam
translated: Having yoked the chariot adorned with horses, came there.

original: taṃ rathaṃ rājaputrāya sūtaḥ kanakabhūṣitam /🔽ācacakṣe 'ñjaliṃ kṛtvā yuktaṃ paramavājibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam ratham rāja putrāya sūtaḥ kanaka bhūṣitam  ācacakṣe ñjalim kṛtvā yuktam parama vājibhiḥ
translated: The charioteer, with folded hands, informed the prince about the chariot adorned with gold,🔽Yoked with excellent horses.

original: rājā satvaram āhūya vyāpṛtaṃ vittasaṃcaye /
analyzed: rājā sa tvaram āhūya vyāpṛtam vitta saṃcaye
translated: The king, knowing the right time and place, spoke to the one engaged in accumulating wealth, who was summoned quickly,

original: uvāca deśakālajño niścitaṃ sarvataḥ śuci // / / //
analyzed: uvāca deśa kāla jñaḥ niścitam sarvatas śuci
translated: Being certain and pure in every way.

original: vāsāṃsi ca mahārhāṇi bhūṣaṇāni varāṇi ca /
analyzed: vāsāṃsi ca mahārhāṇi bhūṣaṇāni varāṇi ca
translated: Bring the most expensive garments and excellent ornaments,

original: varṣāṇy etāni saṃkhyāya vaidehyāḥ kṣipram ānaya // / / //
analyzed: varṣāṇi etāni saṃkhyāya vaidehyāḥ kṣipram ānaya
translated: Counting these years, quickly bring them to Vaidehi.

original: narendreṇaivam uktas tu gatvā kośagṛhaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: narendreṇa evam uktaḥ tu gatvā kośagṛham tatas
translated: Thus addressed by the king, he went to the treasury house and

original: prāyacchat sarvam āhṛtya sītāyai kṣipram eva tat // / / //
analyzed: prāyacchat sarvam āhṛtya sītāyai kṣipram eva tat
translated: Quickly brought everything and gave it to Sita.

original: sā sujātā sujātāni vaidehī prasthitā vanam /
analyzed: sā sujātā sujātāni vaidehī prasthitā vanam
translated: Vaidehi, of good birth, going to the forest,

original: bhūṣayāmāsa gātrāṇi tair vicitrair vibhūṣaṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhūṣayāmāsa gātrāṇi taiḥ vicitraiḥ vibhūṣaṇaiḥ
translated: Adorned her body with those colorful ornaments.

original: vyarājayata vaidehī veśma tat suvibhūṣitā /
analyzed: vyarājayata vaidehī veśma tat su vibhūṣitā
translated: Vaidehi, well adorned, illuminated that house.

original: udyato 'ṃśumataḥ kāle khaṃ prabheva vivasvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: udyataḥ u ṃśumataḥ kāle kham prabhā iva vivasvataḥ
translated: like the rays of the sun rising at the proper time in the sky.

original: tāṃ bhujābhyāṃ pariṣvajya śvaśrūr vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: tām bhujābhyām pariṣvajya śvaśrūḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: Embracing her with her arms, her mother-in-law spoke these words:

original: anācarantīṃ kṛpaṇaṃ mūrdhny upāghrāya maithilīm // / / //
analyzed: an ācarantīm kṛpaṇam mūrdhni upāghrāya maithilīm
translated: Sniffing the head of Maithili, who was not acting pitifully,

original: asatyaḥ sarvaloke 'smin satataṃ satkṛtāḥ priyaiḥ /
analyzed: asatyaḥ sarva loke smin satatam satkṛtāḥ priyaiḥ
translated: In this entire world, women, though always honored with truth and affection,

original: bhartāraṃ nānumanyante vinipātagataṃ striyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhartāram na anumanyante vinipāta gatam striyaḥ
translated: Do not consent to their husbands who have fallen into misfortune.

original: sa tvayā nāvamantavyaḥ putraḥ pravrājito mama /
analyzed: sa tvayā na avamantavyaḥ putraḥ pravrājitaḥ mama
translated: You should not despise my son who has been exiled,

original: tava daivatam astv eṣa nirdhanaḥ sadhano 'pi vā // / / //🔽vijñāya vacanaṃ sītā tasyā dharmārthasaṃhitam /
analyzed: tava daivatam astu eṣa nirdhanaḥ vā  vijñāya vacanam sītā tasyāḥ dharma artha saṃhitam
translated: Whether he is destitute or wealthy, may he be your deity.🔽 Understanding those words of hers, which were full of dharma and artha,

original: kṛtāñjalir uvācedaṃ śvaśrūm abhimukhe sthitā // / / //
analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ uvāca idam śvaśrūm abhimukhe sthitā
translated: Sita, standing in front of her mother-in-law, said this with folded hands:

original: kariṣye sarvam evāham āryā yad anuśāsti mām /
analyzed: kariṣye sarvam eva aham āryā yat anuśāsti mām
translated: I will do everything that the noble one instructs me to do.

original: abhijñāsmi yathā bhartur vartitavyaṃ śrutaṃ ca me // / / //
analyzed: abhijñā asmi yathā bhartuḥ vartitavyam śrutam ca me
translated: I know how to conduct myself towards my husband, and I have heard it said:

original: na mām asajjanenāryā samānayitum arhati /
analyzed: na mām asat janena āryā samānayitum arhati
translated: The noble one should not compare me to an evil person.

original: dharmād vicalituṃ nāham alaṃ candrād iva prabhā // / / //
analyzed: dharmāt vicalitum na aham alam candrāt iva prabhā
translated: I am not able to deviate from dharma, just as the radiance is not able to deviate from the moon.

original: nātantrī vādyate vīṇā nācakro vartate rathaḥ /
analyzed: na a tantrī vādyate vīṇā na a cakraḥ vartate rathaḥ
translated: A lute is not played without strings, a chariot does not move without wheels,

original: nāpatiḥ sukham edhate yā syād api śatātmajā // / / //
analyzed: nāpatiḥ sukham edhate yā syāt api śata ātmajā
translated: and a woman does not prosper without a husband, even if she has a hundred sons.

original: mitaṃ dadāti hi pitā mitaṃ mātā mitaṃ sutaḥ /
analyzed: mitam dadāti hi pitā mitam mātā mitam sutaḥ
translated: The father gives a limited amount, the mother a limited amount, the son a limited amount,

original: amitasya hi dātāraṃ bhartāraṃ kā na pūjayet // / / //
analyzed: amitasya hi dātāram bhartāram kā na pūjayet
translated: but who would not honor the husband, the giver of the unlimited?

original: sāham evaṃgatā śreṣṭhā śrutadharmaparāvarā /
analyzed: sā aham evaṃgatā śreṣṭhā śruta dharma parāvarā
translated: I am the best of those who have gone forth, who have heard the Dharma and are superior in virtue.

original: ārye kim avamanyeyaṃ strīṇāṃ bhartā hi daivatam // / / //
analyzed: ārye kim avamanyeyam strīṇām bhartā hi daivatam
translated: O noble one, what should I despise? For a woman, the husband is the deity.

original: sītāyā vacanaṃ śrutvā kausalyā hṛdayaṃgamam /
analyzed: sītāyāḥ vacanam śrutvā kausalyā hṛdayaṃgamam
translated: Having heard Sita's words, which went to the heart,

original: śuddhasattvā mumocāśru sahasā duḥkhaharṣajam // / / //🔽tāṃ prāñjalir abhikramya mātṛmadhye 'tisatkṛtām /
analyzed: śuddha sattvā mumoca aśru sahasā duḥkha harṣa jam  tām prāñjaliḥ abhikramya mātṛ madhye ti satkṛtām
translated: Kausalya, pure in mind, suddenly released tears of sorrow and joy.🔽Rama, who knew the highest Dharma, approached her, who was greatly honored in the midst of the mothers with folded hands,

original: rāmaḥ paramadharmajño mātaraṃ vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ parama dharma jñaḥ mātaram vākyam abravīt
translated: and spoke these words to his mother:

original: amba mā duḥkhitā bhūs tvaṃ paśya tvaṃ pitaraṃ mama /
analyzed: amba mā duḥkhitā bhūḥ tvam paśya tvam pitaram mama
translated: Mother, do not be sorrowful. Look at my father.

original: kṣayo hi vanavāsasya kṣipram eva bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: kṣayaḥ hi vana vāsasya kṣipram eva bhaviṣyati
translated: For the stay in the forest will soon come to an end.

original: suptāyās te gamiṣyanti navavarṣāṇi pañca ca /
analyzed: suptāyāḥ te gamiṣyanti nava varṣāṇi pañca ca
translated: While you sleep, nine years and five will pass.

original: sā samagram iha prāptaṃ māṃ drakṣyasi suhṛdvṛtam // / / //
analyzed: sā samagram iha prāptam mām drakṣyasi suhṛd vṛtam
translated: You will see me return here, complete, surrounded by friends.

original: etāvad abhinītārtham uktvā sa jananīṃ vacaḥ /🔽trayaḥ śataśatārdhā hi dadarśāvekṣya mātaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: etāvat abhinīta artham uktvā sa jananīm vacaḥ  trayaḥ śata śata ardhāḥ hi dadarśa avekṣya mātaraḥ
translated: Having spoken these well-worded words to his mother,🔽he saw three hundred and fifty mothers, looking at him with eyes full of tears.

original: tāś cāpi sa tathaivārtā mātḥn daśarathātmajaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ca api sa tathā eva ārtāḥ mātṝn daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: And the son of Dasharatha, afflicted with grief,

original: dharmayuktam idaṃ vākyaṃ nijagāda kṛtāñjaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: dharma yuktam idam vākyam nijagāda kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: spoke these righteous words with folded hands to those mothers:

original: saṃvāsāt paruṣaṃ kiṃcid ajñānād vāpi yat kṛtam /
analyzed: saṃvāsāt paruṣam kiṃcid ajñānāt vā api yat kṛtam
translated: Whatever harsh words I may have spoken out of association, or out of ignorance,

original: tan me samanujānīta sarvāś cāmantrayāmi vaḥ // / / //🔽jajñe 'tha tāsāṃ saṃnādaḥ krauñcīnām iva niḥsvanaḥ /
analyzed: tat me samanujānīta sarvāḥ ca āmantrayāmi vaḥ  jajñe tha tāsām saṃnādaḥ krauñcīnām iva niḥsvanaḥ
translated: I seek your forgiveness for all of them. I take leave of you all.🔽Then there arose a sound from those wives of the lord of men,

original: mānavendrasya bhāryāṇām evaṃ vadati rāghave // / / //
analyzed: mānavendrasya bhāryāṇām evam vadati rāghave
translated: like the cries of female curlews, as Raghava spoke thus.

original: murajapaṇavameghaghoṣavad daśarathaveśma babhūva yat purā /
analyzed: muraja paṇava megha ghoṣavat daśaratha veśma babhūva yat purā
translated: What was formerly like the sound of clouds with Muraja and Panava drums,

original: vilapitaparidevanākulaṃ vyasanagataṃ tad abhūt suduḥkhitam // / / //
analyzed: vilapita paridevanā ākulam vyasana gatam tat abhūt su duḥkhitam
translated: that palace of Dasharatha became filled with grief, agitated by lamentations and wailing.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: atha rāmaś ca sītā ca lakṣmaṇaś ca kṛtāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: atha rāmaḥ ca sītā ca lakṣmaṇaḥ ca kṛta añjaliḥ
translated: Then Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana, with folded hands,

original: upasaṃgṛhya rājānaṃ cakrur dīnāḥ pradakṣiṇam // / / //
analyzed: upasaṃgṛhya rājānam cakruḥ dīnāḥ pradakṣiṇam
translated: approached the king and sorrowfully circumambulated him.

original: taṃ cāpi samanujñāpya dharmajñaḥ sītayā saha /
analyzed: tam ca api samanujñāpya dharma jñaḥ sītayā saha
translated: And having taken leave of him, the one who knew dharma, along with Sita,

original: rāghavaḥ śokasaṃmūḍho jananīm abhyavādayat // / / //
analyzed: rāghavaḥ śoka saṃmūḍhaḥ jananīm abhyavādayat
translated: Raghava, bewildered by grief, greeted his mother.

original: anvakṣaṃ lakṣmaṇo bhrātuḥ kausalyām abhyavādayat /🔽atha mātuḥ sumitrāyā jagrāha caraṇau punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anvakṣam lakṣmaṇaḥ bhrātuḥ kausalyām abhyavādayat  atha mātuḥ sumitrāyāḥ jagrāha caraṇau punar
translated: Lakshmana, following his brother, greeted Kausalya.🔽Then he again grasped the feet of his mother Sumitra.

original: taṃ vandamānaṃ rudatī mātā saumitrim abravīt /
analyzed: tam vandamānam rudatī mātā saumitrim abravīt
translated: As he was bowing down, his mother, weeping, spoke to Sumitra's son,

original: hitakāmā mahābāhuṃ mūrdhny upāghrāya lakṣmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: hita kāmā mahā bāhum mūrdhni upāghrāya lakṣmaṇam
translated: Lakshmana, the mighty-armed one, smelling him on the head, desiring his welfare.

original: sṛṣṭas tvaṃ vanavāsāya svanuraktaḥ suhṛjjane /
analyzed: sṛṣṭaḥ tvam vana vāsāya su anuraktaḥ suhṛd jane
translated: You are sent to the forest, devoted to your loving friends.

original: rāme pramādaṃ mā kārṣīḥ putra bhrātari gacchati // / / //
analyzed: rāme pramādam mā kārṣīḥ putra bhrātari gacchati
translated: Do not be negligent, O son, when your brother Rama goes away.

original: vyasanī vā samṛddho vā gatir eṣa tavānagha /🔽eṣa loke satāṃ dharmo yaj jyeṣṭhavaśago bhavet // / / //
analyzed: vyasanī vā samṛddhaḥ vā gatiḥ eṣa tava anagha  eṣa loke satām dharmaḥ yat jyeṣṭha vaśa gaḥ bhavet
translated: Whether in misfortune or prosperity, O sinless one, he is your refuge.🔽This is the duty of the good in the world, that one should be under the sway of the eldest.

original: idaṃ hi vṛttam ucitaṃ kulasyāsya sanātanam /
analyzed: idam hi vṛttam ucitam kulasya asya sanātanam
translated: This conduct is proper and eternal for this family.

original: dānaṃ dīkṣā ca yajñeṣu tanutyāgo mṛdheṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: dānam dīkṣā ca yajñeṣu tanutyāgaḥ mṛdheṣu ca
translated: Giving, consecration in sacrifices, and giving up one's life in battles.

original: rāmaṃ daśarathaṃ viddhi māṃ viddhi janakātmajām /
analyzed: rāmam daśaratham viddhi mām viddhi janakātmajām
translated: Know Rama to be Dasharatha, know me to be Janaka's daughter.

original: ayodhyām aṭavīṃ viddhi gaccha tāta yathāsukham // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām aṭavīm viddhi gaccha tāta yathāsukham
translated: Know Ayodhya to be the forest, go, dear father, as you please.

original: tataḥ sumantraḥ kākutsthaṃ prāñjalir vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: tatas sumantraḥ kākutstham prāñjaliḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Then Sumantra, with folded hands, spoke to Kakutstha:

original: vinīto vinayajñaś ca mātalir vāsavaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: vinītaḥ vinaya jñaḥ ca mātaliḥ vāsavam yathā
translated: humble and knowing humility, like Matali to Vasava.

original: ratham āroha bhadraṃ te rājaputra mahāyaśaḥ /
analyzed: ratham āroha bhadram te rāja putra mahā yaśaḥ
translated: O fortunate one, O prince of great fame, mount the chariot.

original: kṣipraṃ tvāṃ prāpayiṣyāmi yatra māṃ rāma vakṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: kṣipram tvām prāpayiṣyāmi yatra mām rāma vakṣyasi
translated: I shall quickly take you wherever you wish to go, O Rama.

original: caturdaśa hi varṣāṇi vastavyāni vane tvayā /
analyzed: caturdaśa hi varṣāṇi vastavyāni vane tvayā
translated: You have to live in the forest for fourteen years.

original: tāny upakramitavyāni yāni devyāsi coditaḥ // / / //🔽taṃ rathaṃ sūryasaṃkāśaṃ sītā hṛṣṭena cetasā /
analyzed: tāni upakramitavyāni yāni devyā asi coditaḥ  tam ratham sūrya saṃkāśam sītā hṛṣṭena cetasā
translated: You have been urged by the queen to begin those years.🔽With a delighted mind, the beautiful Sītā,

original: āruroha varārohā kṛtvālaṃkāram ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āruroha varārohā kṛtvā alaṃkāram ātmanaḥ
translated: having adorned herself, ascended the chariot resembling the sun.

original: tathaivāyudhajātāni bhrātṛbhyāṃ kavacāni ca /
analyzed: tathā eva āyudha jātāni bhrātṛbhyām kavacāni ca
translated: And the two brothers placed the weapons and armours,

original: rathopasthe pratinyasya sacarmakaṭhinaṃ ca tat // / / //🔽sītātṛtīyān ārūḍhān dṛṣṭvā dhṛṣṭam acodayat /
analyzed: rathopasthe pratinyasya sa carma kaṭhinam ca tat  sītā tṛtīyān ārūḍhān dṛṣṭvā dhṛṣṭam acodayat
translated: and the hard leather shield on the chariot.

original: sumantraḥ saṃmatān aśvān vāyuvegasamāñ jave // / / //
analyzed: sumantraḥ saṃmatān aśvān vāyu vega samām jave
translated: Seeing them mounted with Sītā as the third, Sumantra fearlessly urged the well-bred horses equal to the speed of wind.

original: prayāte tu mahāraṇyaṃ cirarātrāya rāghave /🔽babhūva nagare mūrchā balamūrchā janasya ca // / / //
analyzed: prayāte tu mahā araṇyam cira rātrāya rāghave  babhūva nagare mūrchā bala mūrchā janasya ca
translated: When Rāghava departed for the great forest for a long time,🔽there was a swoon in the city and a swoon of strength in the people.

original: tat samākulasaṃbhrāntaṃ mattasaṃkupitadvipam /
analyzed: tat samākula saṃbhrāntam matta saṃkupita dvipam
translated: That city was agitated and frightened, with intoxicated and agitated elephants,

original: hayaśiñjitanirghoṣaṃ puram āsīn mahāsvanam // / / //
analyzed: haya śiñjita nirghoṣam puram āsīt mahā svanam
translated: The city resounded with the loud neighing of horses.

original: tataḥ sabālavṛddhā sā purī paramapīḍitā /
analyzed: tatas sa bāla vṛddhā sā purī parama pīḍitā
translated: Then that city, extremely afflicted, with its children and elders,

original: rāmam evābhidudrāva gharmārtaḥ salilaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: rāmam eva abhidudrāva gharma ārtaḥ salilam yathā
translated: ran towards Rama itself, like one tormented by heat towards water.

original: pārśvataḥ pṛṣṭhataś cāpi lambamānās tadunmukhāḥ /
analyzed: pārśvatas pṛṣṭhatas ca api lambamānāḥ tad unmukhāḥ
translated: Hanging on the sides and back, looking up to him,

original: bāṣpapūrṇamukhāḥ sarve tam ūcur bhṛśaduḥkhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bāṣpa pūrṇa mukhāḥ sarve tam ūcuḥ bhṛśa duḥkhitāḥ
translated: with tearful faces, all of them, extremely afflicted, said to him:

original: saṃyaccha vājināṃ raśmīn sūta yāhi śanaiḥ śanaiḥ /
analyzed: saṃyaccha vājinām raśmīn sūta yāhi śanais śanais
translated: Control the reins of the horses, charioteer, go slowly, slowly.

original: mukhaṃ drakṣyāmi rāmasya durdarśaṃ no bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: mukham drakṣyāmi rāmasya durdarśam naḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: I will see Rama's face, which will not be seen by us again.

original: āyasaṃ hṛdayaṃ nūnaṃ rāmamātur asaṃśayam /
analyzed: āyasam hṛdayam nūnam rāma mātuḥ asaṃśayam
translated: Surely the heart of Rama's mother is made of iron, there is no doubt,

original: yad devagarbhapratime vanaṃ yāti na bhidyate // / / //
analyzed: yat deva garbha pratime vanam yāti na bhidyate
translated: since it does not break when the one resembling an offspring of the gods goes to the forest.

original: kṛtakṛtyā hi vaidehī chāyevānugatā patim /
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyā hi vaidehī chāyā iva anugatā patim
translated: Vaidehi has indeed accomplished her purpose, following her husband like a shadow,

original: na jahāti ratā dharme merum arkaprabhā yathā // / / //🔽aho lakṣmaṇa siddhārthaḥ satataṃ priyavādinam /
analyzed: na jahāti ratā dharme merum arka prabhā yathā  aho lakṣmaṇa siddhārthaḥ satatam priya vādinam
translated: devoted to dharma, not leaving him, like the sun's rays [not leaving] Mount Meru.

original: bhrātaraṃ devasaṃkāśaṃ yas tvaṃ paricariṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: bhrātaram deva saṃkāśam yaḥ tvam paricariṣyasi
translated: Ah, Lakshmana, you have attained your goal, you who will serve your brother, who is always pleasant-spoken, who is like a god.

original: mahaty eṣā hi te siddhir eṣa cābhyudayo mahān /
analyzed: mahatī eṣā hi te siddhiḥ eṣa ca abhyudayaḥ mahān
translated: This is indeed your great success, this is your great prosperity,

original: eṣa svargasya mārgaś ca yad enam anugacchasi /
analyzed: eṣa svargasya mārgaḥ ca yat enam anugacchasi
translated: This is the path to heaven, that you are following.

original: evaṃ vadantas te soḍhuṃ na śekur bāṣpam āgatam // / / //
analyzed: evam vadantaḥ te soḍhum na śekuḥ bāṣpam āgatam
translated: Speaking thus, they were unable to bear the tears that came.

original: atha rājā vṛtaḥ strībhir dīnābhir dīnacetanaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā vṛtaḥ strībhiḥ dīnābhiḥ dīna cetanaḥ
translated: Then the king, surrounded by the distressed women, his mind distressed,

original: nirjagāma priyaṃ putraṃ drakṣyāmīti bruvan gṛhāt // / / //
analyzed: nirjagāma priyam putram drakṣyāmi iti bruvan gṛhāt
translated: went out of the house, saying, I will see my beloved son.

original: śuśruve cāgrataḥ strīṇāṃ rudantīnāṃ mahāsvanaḥ /
analyzed: śuśruve ca agratas strīṇām rudantīnām mahā svanaḥ
translated: And he heard the loud wailing of the women in front,

original: yathā nādaḥ kareṇūnāṃ baddhe mahati kuñjare // / / //
analyzed: yathā nādaḥ kareṇūnām baddhe mahati kuñjare
translated: like the cries of she-elephants when a great elephant is bound.

original: pitā ca rājā kākutsthaḥ śrīmān sannas tadā babhau /
analyzed: pitā ca rājā kākutsthaḥ śrīmān sannaḥ tadā babhau
translated: And the father, King Kakutstha, became pale and haggard,

original: paripūrṇaḥ śaśī kāle graheṇopapluto yathā // / / //
analyzed: paripūrṇaḥ śaśī kāle graheṇa upaplutaḥ yathā
translated: like the full moon at the right time, eclipsed by a planet.

original: tato halahalāśabdo jajñe rāmasya pṛṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: tatas halahalā śabdaḥ jajñe rāmasya pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Then there arose a great uproar behind Rama,

original: narāṇāṃ prekṣya rājānaṃ sīdantaṃ bhṛśaduḥkhitam // / / //
analyzed: narāṇām prekṣya rājānam sīdantam bhṛśa duḥkhitam
translated: as the people saw the king sinking in great sorrow.

original: hā rāmeti janāḥ kecid rāmamāteti cāpare /
analyzed: hā rāma iti janāḥ kecid rāma mātā iti ca apare
translated: Some people cried out Alas, Rama! and others Rama's mother!

original: antaḥpuraṃ samṛddhaṃ ca krośantaṃ paryadevayan // / / //🔽anvīkṣamāṇo rāmas tu viṣaṇṇaṃ bhrāntacetasam /
analyzed: antaḥpuram samṛddham ca krośantam paryadevayan  anvīkṣamāṇaḥ rāmaḥ tu viṣaṇṇam bhrānta cetasam
translated: And they lamented the prosperous inner quarters, crying out.🔽Rama, looking back, saw the king and his mother following along the path,

original: rājānaṃ mātaraṃ caiva dadarśānugatau pathi /
analyzed: rājānam mātaram ca eva dadarśa anugatau pathi
translated: distressed and confused in mind.

original: dharmapāśena saṃkṣiptaḥ prakāśaṃ nābhyudaikṣata // / / //
analyzed: dharma pāśena saṃkṣiptaḥ prakāśam na abhyudaikṣata
translated: Bound by the noose of dharma, he did not look at the light.

original: padātinau ca yānārhāv aduḥkhārhau sukhocitau /
analyzed: padātinau ca yāna arhau aduḥkha arhau sukha ucitau
translated: And seeing those two, who deserved a vehicle but were on foot, who deserved no suffering but were fit for happiness,

original: dṛṣṭvā saṃcodayāmāsa śīghraṃ yāhīti sārathim // / / //🔽na hi tat puruṣavyāghro duḥkhadaṃ darśanaṃ pituḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā saṃcodayāmāsa śīghram yāhi iti sārathim  na hi tat puruṣa vyāghraḥ duḥkha dam darśanam pituḥ
translated: he urged the charioteer, saying, Go quickly!🔽For that tiger among men was not able to bear the sight of his father's sorrow,

original: mātuś ca sahituṃ śaktas totrārdita iva dvipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mātuḥ ca sahitum śaktaḥ totra arditaḥ iva dvipaḥ
translated: like an elephant tormented by the goad.

original: tathā rudantīṃ kausalyāṃ rathaṃ tam anudhāvatīm /
analyzed: tathā rudantīm kausalyām ratham tam anudhāvatīm
translated: And seeing Kausalyā weeping, running after the chariot,

original: krośantīṃ rāma rāmeti hā sīte lakṣmaṇeti ca /
analyzed: krośantīm rāma rāma iti hā sīte lakṣmaṇa iti ca
translated: crying out Rama, Rama! and Alas, Sita! and Laksmana!

original: asakṛt praikṣata tadā nṛtyantīm iva mātaram // / / //
analyzed: asakṛt praikṣata tadā nṛtyantīm iva mātaram
translated: he repeatedly looked at his mother, as if she were dancing.

original: tiṣṭheti rājā cukrośa yāhi yāhīti rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭha iti rājā cukrośa yāhi yāhi iti rāghavaḥ
translated: The king cried out, Stop! and Rāghava, Go on!

original: sumantrasya babhūvātmā cakrayor iva cāntarā // / / //
analyzed: sumantrasya babhūva ātmā cakrayoḥ iva ca antarā
translated: Sumantra's heart was torn, as it were, between those two.

original: nāśrauṣam iti rājānam upālabdho 'pi vakṣyasi /
analyzed: na aśrauṣam iti rājānam upālabdhaḥ u pi vakṣyasi
translated: I did not hear, you will say, even when reproached by the king.

original: ciraṃ duḥkhasya pāpiṣṭham iti rāmas tam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: ciram duḥkhasya pāpiṣṭham iti rāmaḥ tam abravīt
translated: For a long time, most miserable of sinners, Rāma said to him.

original: rāmasya sa vacaḥ kurvann anujñāpya ca taṃ janam /
analyzed: rāmasya sa vacaḥ kurvan anujñāpya ca tam janam
translated: Acting on Rāma's words and taking leave of the people,

original: vrajato 'pi hayāñ śīghraṃ codayāmāsa sārathiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vrajataḥ u pi hayām śīghram codayāmāsa sārathiḥ
translated: the charioteer urged the horses on even as they were going away.

original: nyavartata jano rājño rāmaṃ kṛtvā pradakṣiṇam /
analyzed: nyavartata janaḥ rājñaḥ rāmam kṛtvā pradakṣiṇam
translated: The people turned back after circumambulating the king, keeping him to the right.

original: manasāpy aśruvegaiś ca na nyavartata mānuṣam // / / //
analyzed: manasā api aśru vegaiḥ ca na nyavartata mānuṣam
translated: But the tears in their eyes and the sorrow in their hearts did not turn back.

original: yam icchet punar āyāntaṃ nainaṃ dūram anuvrajet /
analyzed: yam icchet punar āyāntam na enam dūram anuvrajet
translated: One should not follow too far one whom one wishes to return.

original: ity amātyā mahārājam ūcur daśarathaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti amātyāḥ mahā rājam ūcuḥ daśaratham vacaḥ
translated: Thus did the ministers speak to the great king Dasharatha.

original: teṣāṃ vacaḥ sarvaguṇopapannaṃ prasvinnagātraḥ praviṣaṇṇarūpaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām vacaḥ sarva guṇa upapannam prasvinna gātraḥ praviṣaṇṇa rūpaḥ
translated: The king, with his body perspiring and his form dejected, heard their words, endowed with all good qualities.

original: niśamya rājā kṛpaṇaḥ sabhāryo vyavasthitas taṃ sutam īkṣamāṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: niśamya rājā kṛpaṇaḥ sa bhāryaḥ vyavasthitaḥ tam sutam īkṣamāṇaḥ
translated: The sorrowful king, along with his wife, stood there, gazing at his son.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tasmiṃs tu puruṣavyāghre niṣkrāmati kṛtāñjalau /
analyzed: tasmin tu puruṣa vyāghre niṣkrāmati kṛta añjalau
