translated: As that tiger among men was leaving with folded hands,

original: ārtaśabdo hi saṃjajñe strīṇām antaḥpure mahān // / / //
analyzed: ārta śabdaḥ hi saṃjajñe strīṇām antaḥpure mahān
translated: a great cry of distress arose from the women in the inner quarters.

original: anāthasya janasyāsya durbalasya tapasvinaḥ /
analyzed: anāthasya janasya asya durbalasya tapasvinaḥ
translated: For this helpless people, weak and suffering,

original: yo gatiḥ śaraṇaṃ cāsīt sa nāthaḥ kva nu gacchati // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ gatiḥ śaraṇam ca āsīt sa nāthaḥ kva nu gacchati
translated: where is that protector, that refuge, going?

original: na krudhyaty abhiśasto 'pi krodhanīyāni varjayan /
analyzed: na krudhyati abhiśastaḥ u pi krodhanīyāni varjayan
translated: He never got angry, even when reviled, avoiding things that might provoke anger.

original: kruddhān prasādayan sarvān samaduḥkhaḥ kva gacchati // / / //
analyzed: kruddhān prasādayan sarvān sama duḥkhaḥ kva gacchati
translated: Where is he going, sharing others' sorrows, pacifying all who are angry?

original: kausalyāyāṃ mahātejā yathā mātari vartate /
analyzed: kausalyāyām mahā tejāḥ yathā mātari vartate
translated: As the greatly effulgent one behaved towards his mother Kausalyā,

original: tathā yo vartate 'smāsu mahātmā kva nu gacchati // / / //
analyzed: tathā yaḥ vartate sma āsu mahātmā kva nu gacchati
translated: so did that high-souled one behave towards us. Where has he gone?

original: kaikeyyā kliśyamānena rājñā saṃcodito vanam /
analyzed: kaikeyyā kliśyamānena rājñā saṃcoditaḥ vanam
translated: Urged on by the king afflicted by Kaikeyi, he has gone to the forest.

original: paritrātā janasyāsya jagataḥ kva nu gacchati // / / //🔽aho niścetano rājā jīvalokasya sampriyam /
analyzed: paritrātā janasya asya jagataḥ kva nu gacchati  aho niścetanaḥ rājā jīva lokasya sampriyam
translated: Where has he gone, the protector of this people and of the world?🔽Alas! the king is senseless, who will send to the forest Rāma, dear to the world of living beings,

original: dharmyaṃ satyavrataṃ rāmaṃ vanavāse pravatsyati // / / //
analyzed: dharmyam satya vratam rāmam vana vāse pravatsyati
translated: who is righteous and firm in truth.

original: iti sarvā mahiṣyas tā vivatsā iva dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: iti sarvāḥ mahiṣyaḥ tāḥ vivatsāḥ iva dhenavaḥ
translated: All the queens, like cows without their calves,

original: ruruduś caiva duḥkhārtāḥ sasvaraṃ ca vicukruśuḥ // / / //🔽sa tam antaḥpure ghoram ārtaśabdaṃ mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: ruruduḥ ca eva duḥkha ārtāḥ sa svaram ca vicukruśuḥ  sa tam antaḥpure ghoram ārta śabdam mahīpatiḥ
translated: weeping and afflicted with grief, cried out in loud voices.🔽The king, afflicted with grief on account of his son,

original: putraśokābhisaṃtaptaḥ śrutvā cāsīt suduḥkhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: putra śoka abhisaṃtaptaḥ śrutvā ca āsīt su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: hearing that terrible cry of distress in the inner apartments, was greatly pained.

original: nāgnihotrāṇy ahūyanta sūryaś cāntaradhīyata /
analyzed: na agnihotrāṇi ahūyanta sūryaḥ ca antaradhīyata
translated: The Agnihotras were not performed, and the sun disappeared;

original: vyasṛjan kavalān nāgā gāvo vatsān na pāyayan // / / //
analyzed: vyasṛjan kavalān nāgāḥ gāvaḥ vatsān na pāyayan
translated: elephants dropped their food, and cows would not suckle their calves.

original: triśaṅkur lohitāṅgaś ca bṛhaspatibudhāv api /
analyzed: triśaṅkuḥ lohitāṅgaḥ ca bṛhaspati budhau api
translated: Trisanku, Lohitanga, Brihaspati, and Budha,

original: dāruṇāḥ somam abhyetya grahāḥ sarve vyavasthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dāruṇāḥ somam abhyetya grahāḥ sarve vyavasthitāḥ
translated: all the planets, terrible, assembled and stood over the moon.

original: nakṣatrāṇi gatārcīṃṣi grahāś ca gatatejasaḥ /
analyzed: nakṣatrāṇi gata arcīṃṣi grahāḥ ca gata tejasaḥ
translated: The stars lost their radiance, the planets their splendor,

original: viśākhāś ca sadhūmāś ca nabhasi pracakāśire // / / //
analyzed: viśākhāḥ ca sa dhūmāḥ ca nabhasi pracakāśire
translated: and the Vishākhā stars appeared in the sky with smoke.

original: akasmān nāgaraḥ sarvo jano dainyam upāgamat /
analyzed: akasmāt nāgaraḥ sarvaḥ janaḥ dainyam upāgamat
translated: Suddenly, all the citizens became despondent.

original: āhāre vā vihāre vā na kaścid akaron manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āhāre vā vihāre vā na kaścid akarot manaḥ
translated: No one paid attention to food or entertainment.

original: bāṣpaparyākulamukho rājamārgagato janaḥ /
analyzed: bāṣpa paryākula mukhaḥ rājamārga gataḥ janaḥ
translated: The people on the royal road, their faces filled with tears,

original: na hṛṣṭo lakṣyate kaścit sarvaḥ śokaparāyaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na hṛṣṭaḥ lakṣyate kaścid sarvaḥ śoka parāyaṇaḥ
translated: no one seemed happy, everyone was overcome with grief.

original: na vāti pavanaḥ śīto na śaśī saumyadarśanaḥ /
analyzed: na vāti pavanaḥ śītaḥ na śaśī saumya darśanaḥ
translated: The wind did not blow cool, the moon did not look pleasant,

original: na sūryas tapate lokaṃ sarvaṃ paryākulaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: na sūryaḥ tapate lokam sarvam paryākulam jagat
translated: the sun did not shine on the world, the entire world was agitated.

original: anarthinaḥ sutāḥ strīṇāṃ bhartāro bhrātaras tathā /
analyzed: anarthinaḥ sutāḥ strīṇām bhartāraḥ bhrātaraḥ tathā
translated: The sons, wives, and brothers of those who had no hope

original: sarve sarvaṃ parityajya rāmam evānvacintayan // / / //
analyzed: sarve sarvam parityajya rāmam eva anvacintayan
translated: all gave up everything and thought only of Rama.

original: ye tu rāmasya suhṛdaḥ sarve te mūḍhacetasaḥ /
analyzed: ye tu rāmasya suhṛdaḥ sarve te mūḍha cetasaḥ
translated: But those who were Rama's friends, all of them with confused minds,

original: śokabhāreṇa cākrāntāḥ śayanaṃ na jahus tadā // / / //
analyzed: śoka bhāreṇa ca ākrāntāḥ śayanam na jahuḥ tadā
translated: overwhelmed by the burden of grief, did not leave their beds.

original: tatas tv ayodhyā rahitā mahātmanā puraṃdareṇeva mahī saparvatā /
analyzed: tatas tu ayodhyā rahitā mahātmanā puraṃdareṇa iva mahī sa parvatā
translated: Then Ayodhyā, devoid of the great one, like the earth with its mountains without Purandara,

original: cacāla ghoraṃ bhayabhārapīḍitā sanāgayodhāśvagaṇā nanāda ca // / / //
analyzed: cacāla ghoram bhaya bhāra pīḍitā sa nāga yodha aśva gaṇā nanāda ca
translated: The earth trembled terribly, oppressed by the weight of fear, along with the multitudes of elephants, warriors, and horses, and roared.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: yāvat tu niryatas tasya rajorūpam adṛśyata /
analyzed: yāvat tu niryataḥ tasya rajaḥ rūpam adṛśyata
translated: As long as the dust-like form of him departing was seen,

original: naivekṣvākuvaras tāvat saṃjahārātmacakṣuṣī // / / //
analyzed: na eva ikṣvāku varaḥ tāvat saṃjahāra ātma cakṣuṣī
translated: The best of the Ikshvakus did not close his eyes.

original: yāvad rājā priyaṃ putraṃ paśyaty atyantadhārmikam /
analyzed: yāvat rājā priyam putram paśyati atyanta dhārmikam
translated: As long as the king sees his beloved son, extremely righteous,

original: tāvad vyavardhatevāsya dharaṇyāṃ putradarśane // / / //
analyzed: tāvat vyavardhata iva asya dharaṇyām putra darśane
translated: To that extent his desire to see his son increases on the ground.

original: na paśyati rajo 'py asya yadā rāmasya bhūmipaḥ /
analyzed: na paśyati rajaḥ pi asya yadā rāmasya bhūmipaḥ
translated: When the king does not see even the dust raised by Rama,

original: tadārtaś ca viṣaṇṇaś ca papāta dharaṇītale // / / //
analyzed: tadā ārtaḥ ca viṣaṇṇaḥ ca papāta dharaṇī tale
translated: Then, afflicted and distressed, he falls down on the ground.

original: tasya dakṣiṇam anvagāt kausalyā bāhum aṅganā /
analyzed: tasya dakṣiṇam anvagāt kausalyā bāhum aṅganā
translated: The lady Kausalya followed his right arm,

original: vāmaṃ cāsyānvagāt pārśvaṃ kaikeyī bharatapriyā // / / //
analyzed: vāmam ca asya anvagāt pārśvam kaikeyī bharata priyā
translated: And Kaikeyi, dear to Bharata, followed his left side.

original: tāṃ nayena ca sampanno dharmeṇa vinayena ca /🔽uvāca rājā kaikeyīṃ samīkṣya vyathitendriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tām nayena ca sampannaḥ dharmeṇa vinayena ca  uvāca rājā kaikeyīm samīkṣya vyathita indriyaḥ
translated: The king, endowed with good conduct, righteousness, and humility,🔽Spoke to Kaikeyi, looking at her with his senses distressed.

original: kaikeyi mā mamāṅgāni sprākṣīs tvaṃ duṣṭacāriṇī /
analyzed: kaikeyi mā mama aṅgāni sprākṣīḥ tvam duṣṭa cāriṇī
translated: O Kaikeyi, do not touch my limbs, you of wicked conduct.

original: na hi tvāṃ draṣṭum icchāmi na bhāryā na ca bāndhavī // / / //
analyzed: na hi tvām draṣṭum icchāmi na bhāryā na ca bāndhavī
translated: I do not wish to see you, neither as a wife nor as a relative.

original: ye ca tvām upajīvanti nāhaṃ teṣāṃ na te mama /
analyzed: ye ca tvām upajīvanti na aham teṣām na te mama
translated: Those who depend on you, they are not mine, nor am I theirs.

original: kevalārthaparāṃ hi tvāṃ tyaktadharmāṃ tyajāmy aham // / / //
analyzed: kevala artha parām hi tvām tyakta dharmām tyajāmi aham
translated: I abandon you, who are solely devoted to wealth and have abandoned dharma.

original: agṛhṇāṃ yac ca te pāṇim agniṃ paryaṇayaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: agṛhṇām yat ca te pāṇim agnim paryaṇayam ca yat
translated: I accept your hand and the fire around which we circumambulated,

original: anujānāmi tat sarvam asmiṃl loke paratra ca // / / //
analyzed: anujānāmi tat sarvam asmin loke paratra ca
translated: I permit all that in this world and the next.

original: bharataś cet pratītaḥ syād rājyaṃ prāpyedam avyayam /
analyzed: bharataḥ ced pratītaḥ syāt rājyam prāpya idam avyayam
translated: If Bharata, having obtained this imperishable kingdom, should be satisfied,

original: yan me sa dadyāt pitrarthaṃ mā mā tad dattam āgamat // / / //
analyzed: yat me sa dadyāt pitṛ artham mā mā tat dattam āgamat
translated: let what he gives me for the sake of my father not come to me.

original: atha reṇusamuddhvastaṃ tam utthāpya narādhipam /
analyzed: atha reṇu samuddhvastam tam utthāpya narādhipam
translated: Then, having raised up the king covered with dust,

original: nyavartata tadā devī kausalyā śokakarśitā // / / //
analyzed: nyavartata tadā devī kausalyā śoka karśitā
translated: the queen Kausalyā, afflicted with grief, turned back.

original: hatveva brāhmaṇaṃ kāmāt spṛṣṭvāgnim iva pāṇinā /
analyzed: hatvā iva brāhmaṇam kāmāt spṛṣṭvā agnim iva pāṇinā
translated: As if having intentionally killed a Brahmin, or touching fire with his hand,

original: anvatapyata dharmātmā putraṃ saṃcintya tāpasam // / / //
analyzed: anvatapyata dharma ātmā putram saṃcintya tāpasam
translated: the righteous one, thinking of his ascetic son, repented.

original: nivṛtyaiva nivṛtyaiva sīdato rathavartmasu /
analyzed: nivṛtya eva nivṛtya eva sīdataḥ ratha vartmasu
translated: Turning back again and again, as he sank down on the chariot path,

original: rājño nātibabhau rūpaṃ grastasyāṃśumato yathā // / / //
analyzed: rājñaḥ na atibabhau rūpam grastasya aṃśumataḥ yathā
translated: the king's form did not shine, like that of the eclipsed sun.

original: vilalāpa ca duḥkhārtaḥ priyaṃ putram anusmaran /
analyzed: vilalāpa ca duḥkha ārtaḥ priyam putram anusmaran
translated: And afflicted with grief, remembering his beloved son, he lamented:

original: nagarāntam anuprāptaṃ buddhvā putram athābravīt // / / //
analyzed: nagara antam anuprāptam buddhvā putram atha abravīt
translated: and having heard that his son had reached the outskirts of the city, he said to him:

original: vāhanānāṃ ca mukhyānāṃ vahatāṃ taṃ mamātmajam /
analyzed: vāhanānām ca mukhyānām vahatām tam mama ātmajam
translated: The footprints of the foremost of vehicles that carried my son

original: padāni pathi dṛśyante sa mahātmā na dṛśyate // / / //🔽sa nūnaṃ kvacid evādya vṛkṣamūlam upāśritaḥ /
analyzed: padāni pathi dṛśyante sa mahātmā na dṛśyate  sa nūnam kvacid evā adya vṛkṣa mūlam upāśritaḥ
translated: are seen on the path, but that magnanimous one is not seen.🔽He is surely somewhere today, having resorted to the foot of a tree,

original: kāṣṭhaṃ vā yadi vāśmānam upadhāya śayiṣyate // / / //
analyzed: kāṣṭham vā yadi vā aśmānam upadhāya śayiṣyate
translated: and will lie down having placed either a piece of wood or a stone.

original: utthāsyati ca medinyāḥ kṛpaṇaḥ pāṃśuguṇṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: utthāsyati ca medinyāḥ kṛpaṇaḥ pāṃśu guṇṭhitaḥ
translated: And he will rise up from the ground, miserable, covered with dust,

original: viniḥśvasan prasravaṇāt kareṇūnām ivarṣabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viniḥśvasan prasravaṇāt kareṇūnām iva ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: sighing like a bull from the mouth of a female elephant.

original: drakṣyanti nūnaṃ puruṣā dīrghabāhuṃ vanecarāḥ /
analyzed: drakṣyanti nūnam puruṣāḥ dīrgha bāhum vanecarāḥ
translated: The men who wander in the forest will surely see

original: rāmam utthāya gacchantaṃ lokanātham anāthavat // / / //
analyzed: rāmam utthāya gacchantam loka nātham anātha vat
translated: Rama, long-armed, rising up and going like a lord of the world without a protector.

original: sakāmā bhava kaikeyi vidhavā rājyam āvasa /
analyzed: sa kāmā bhava kaikeyi vidhavā rājyam āvasa
translated: O Kaikeyi, be satisfied, dwell in the kingdom as a widow.

original: na hi taṃ puruṣavyāghraṃ vinā jīvitum utsahe // / / //🔽ity evaṃ vilapan rājā janaughenābhisaṃvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: na hi tam puruṣa vyāghram vinā jīvitum utsahe  iti evam vilapan rājā jana oghena abhisaṃvṛtaḥ
translated: For without that tiger among men, I am not able to live.🔽Thus lamenting, the king, surrounded by a multitude of people,

original: apasnāta ivāriṣṭaṃ praviveśa purottamam // / / //
analyzed: apasnātaḥ iva ariṣṭam praviveśa pura uttamam
translated: like one whose life is in danger, entered the best of cities.

original: śūnyacatvaraveśmāntāṃ saṃvṛtāpaṇadevatām /
analyzed: śūnya catvara veśma antām saṃvṛta āpaṇa devatām
translated: With its empty crossroads and houses, its closed shops and temples,

original: klāntadurbaladuḥkhārtāṃ nātyākīrṇamahāpathām // / / //
analyzed: klānta durbala duḥkha ārtām na ati ākīrṇa mahāpathām
translated: And which was not crowded with people on the great roads.

original: tām avekṣya purīṃ sarvāṃ rāmam evānucintayan /
analyzed: tām avekṣya purīm sarvām rāmam eva anucintayan
translated: Having seen the entire city, thinking only of Rama,

original: vilapan prāviśad rājā gṛhaṃ sūrya ivāmbudam // / / //
analyzed: vilapan prāviśat rājā gṛham sūryaḥ iva ambudam
translated: The king entered his house lamenting, like the sun entering a cloud.

original: mahāhradam ivākṣobhyaṃ suparṇena hṛtoragam /
analyzed: mahā hradam iva akṣobhyam suparṇena hṛta uragam
translated: Like a great lake undisturbed, from which Suparna has carried off the serpent,

original: rāmeṇa rahitaṃ veśma vaidehyā lakṣmaṇena ca // / / //
analyzed: rāmeṇa rahitam veśma vaidehyā lakṣmaṇena ca
translated: The house was devoid of Rama, Vaidehi, and Lakshmana.

original: kausalyāyā gṛhaṃ śīghraṃ rāmamātur nayantu mām /
analyzed: kausalyāyāḥ gṛham śīghram rāma mātuḥ nayantu mām
translated: Quickly take me to the house of Rama's mother, Kausalya.

original: iti bruvantaṃ rājānam anayan dvāradarśinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti bruvantam rājānam anayan dvāradarśinaḥ
translated: Thus spoke the king, and the doorkeepers led him in.

original: tatas tatra praviṣṭasya kausalyāyā niveśanam /
analyzed: tatas tatra praviṣṭasya kausalyāyāḥ niveśanam
translated: Then, having entered the house of Kausalya,

original: adhiruhyāpi śayanaṃ babhūva lulitaṃ manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: adhiruhya api śayanam babhūva lulitam manaḥ
translated: Though he ascended the bed, his mind was agitated.

original: tac ca dṛṣṭvā mahārājo bhujam udyamya vīryavān /
analyzed: tat ca dṛṣṭvā mahā rājaḥ bhujam udyamya vīryavān
translated: Seeing that, the great king, the powerful one, raised his arm

original: uccaiḥ svareṇa cukrośa hā rāghava jahāsi mām // / / //
analyzed: uccais svareṇa cukrośa hā rāghava jahāsi mām
translated: And cried out in a loud voice, Oh Rama, you are abandoning me!

original: sukhitā bata taṃ kālaṃ jīviṣyanti narottamāḥ /
analyzed: sukhitāḥ bata tam kālam jīviṣyanti nara uttamāḥ
translated: Blessed are those best of men who will live during that time

original: pariṣvajanto ye rāmaṃ drakṣyanti punar āgatam // / / //
analyzed: pariṣvajantaḥ ye rāmam drakṣyanti punar āgatam
translated: And will embrace Rama when he returns.

original: na tvāṃ paśyāmi kausalye sādhu māṃ pāṇinā spṛśa /
analyzed: na tvām paśyāmi kausalye sādhu mām pāṇinā spṛśa
translated: I do not see you, O Kausalya, touch me with your hand.

original: rāmaṃ me 'nugatā dṛṣṭir adyāpi na nivartate // / / //
analyzed: rāmam me nugatā dṛṣṭiḥ adyā api na nivartate
translated: My eyes still follow Rama and do not turn back.

original: taṃ rāmam evānuvicintayantaṃ samīkṣya devī śayane narendram /
analyzed: tam rāmam eva anuvicintayantam samīkṣya devī śayane narendram
translated: Seeing the king lying on the bed, thinking only of Rama,

original: upopaviśyādhikam ārtarūpā viniḥśvasantī vilalāpa kṛcchram // / / //
analyzed: upopaviśya adhikam ārta rūpā viniḥśvasantī vilalāpa kṛcchram
translated: the queen, sitting beside him, her form even more distressed, sighed deeply and lamented piteously.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tataḥ samīkṣya śayane sannaṃ śokena pārthivam /
analyzed: tatas samīkṣya śayane sannam śokena pārthivam
translated: Then, seeing the king lying down, overwhelmed with grief,

original: kausalyā putraśokārtā tam uvāca mahīpatim // / / //
analyzed: kausalyā putra śoka ārtā tam uvāca mahīpatim
translated: Kausalya, afflicted with sorrow for her son, spoke to the lord of the earth.

original: rāghavo naraśārdūla viṣam uptvā dvijihvavat /
analyzed: rāghavaḥ nara śārdūla viṣam uptvā dvijihva vat
translated: Raghava, tiger among men, having cast his poison like a double-tongued serpent,

original: vicariṣyati kaikeyī nirmukteva hi pannagī // / / //
analyzed: vicariṣyati kaikeyī nirmuktā iva hi pannagī
translated: Kaikeyi will roam about as if she were a snake that has cast off its slough.

original: vivāsya rāmaṃ subhagā labdhakāmā samāhitā /
analyzed: vivāsya rāmam subhagā labdha kāmā samāhitā
translated: Having banished Rama, the fortunate one, having obtained her desire, and being intent,

original: trāsayiṣyati māṃ bhūyo duṣṭāhir iva veśmani // / / //
analyzed: trāsayiṣyati mām bhūyas duṣṭa ahiḥ iva veśmani
translated: will frighten me again like a wicked snake in the house.

original: atha sma nagare rāmaś caran bhaikṣaṃ gṛhe vaset /
analyzed: atha sma nagare rāmaḥ caran bhaikṣam gṛhe vaset
translated: If Rama were to wander about the city, begging for alms and staying in people's houses,

original: kāmakāro varaṃ dātum api dāsaṃ mamātmajam // / / //
analyzed: kāma kāraḥ varam dātum api dāsam mama ātmajam
translated: I would be able to bear it, but not the thought that Kaikeyi, having brought about the exile of my son,

original: pātayitvā tu kaikeyyā rāmaṃ sthānād yatheṣṭataḥ /
analyzed: pātayitvā tu kaikeyyāḥ rāmam sthānāt yatheṣṭataḥ
translated: having brought down Rama from his place as she desired,

original: pradiṣṭo rakṣasāṃ bhāgaḥ parvaṇīvāhitāgninā // / / //
analyzed: pradiṣṭaḥ rakṣasām bhāgaḥ parvaṇi iva āhitāgninā
translated: will bestow the boon of sovereignty on my son Bharata, as one who has offered sacrifices bestows the sacrificial portion on the Rakshasas.

original: gajarājagatir vīro mahābāhur dhanurdharaḥ /
analyzed: gaja rāja gatiḥ vīraḥ mahā bāhuḥ dhanuḥ dharaḥ
translated: The hero, the mighty-armed wielder of the bow, with the gait of a king of elephants,

original: vanam āviśate nūnaṃ sabhāryaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vanam āviśate nūnam sa bhāryaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: will surely enter the forest with his wife and Lakshmana.

original: vane tv adṛṣṭaduḥkhānāṃ kaikeyyānumate tvayā /
analyzed: vane tu adṛṣṭa duḥkhānām kaikeyyā anumate tvayā
translated: In the forest, which has not seen sorrow before, at Kaikeyi's bidding,

original: tyaktānāṃ vanavāsāya kā nv avasthā bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tyaktānām vana vāsāya kā nu avasthā bhaviṣyati
translated: what will be the state of those who have been abandoned to dwell in the forest?

original: te ratnahīnās taruṇāḥ phalakāle vivāsitāḥ /
analyzed: te ratna hīnāḥ taruṇāḥ phala kāle vivāsitāḥ
translated: Those young ones, devoid of jewels, banished at the time of fruiting,

original: kathaṃ vatsyanti kṛpaṇāḥ phalamūlaiḥ kṛtāśanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham vatsyanti kṛpaṇāḥ phala mūlaiḥ kṛta aśanāḥ
translated: how will they live, pitiable, with fruits and roots for food?

original: apīdānīṃ sa kālaḥ syān mama śokakṣayaḥ śivaḥ /
analyzed: api idānīm sa kālaḥ syāt mama śoka kṣayaḥ śivaḥ
translated: Now, will that auspicious time come for the destruction of my sorrow,

original: sabhāryaṃ yat saha bhrātrā paśyeyam iha rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: sa bhāryam yat saha bhrātrā paśyeyam iha rāghavam
translated: when I shall see Raghava here with his wife and brother?

original: śrutvaivopasthitau vīrau kadāyodhyā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śrutvā eva upasthitau vīrau kadā ayodhyā bhaviṣyati
translated: When will Ayodhya become like this, hearing that the two heroes have arrived,

original: yaśasvinī hṛṣṭajanā sūcchritadhvajamālinī // / / //
analyzed: yaśasvinī hṛṣṭa janā su ucchrita dhvaja mālinī
translated: glorious, with its people delighted, adorned with raised flags and garlands?

original: kadā prekṣya naravyāghrāv araṇyāt punarāgatau /
analyzed: kadā prekṣya nara vyāghrau araṇyāt punar āgatau
translated: When will the city rejoice, seeing the two tigers among men returned from the forest,

original: nandiṣyati purī hṛṣṭā samudra iva parvaṇi // / / //
analyzed: nandiṣyati purī hṛṣṭā samudraḥ iva parvaṇi
translated: like the ocean on the full moon day?

original: kadāyodhyāṃ mahābāhuḥ purīṃ vīraḥ pravekṣyati /
analyzed: kadā ayodhyām mahā bāhuḥ purīm vīraḥ pravekṣyati
translated: When will the mighty-armed hero enter the city of Ayodhya,

original: puraskṛtya rathe sītāṃ vṛṣabho govadhūm iva // / / //
analyzed: puraskṛtya rathe sītām vṛṣabhaḥ go vadhūm iva
translated: placing Sita in front in the chariot, like a bull with a cow in season?

original: kadā prāṇisahasrāṇi rājamārge mamātmajau /
analyzed: kadā prāṇi sahasrāṇi rājamārge mama ātmajau
translated: When will thousands of people on the royal road strew fried paddy on the path for my two sons,

original: lājair avakariṣyanti praviśantāv ariṃdamau // / / //🔽kadā sumanasaḥ kanyā dvijātīnāṃ phalāni ca /
analyzed: lājaiḥ avakariṣyanti praviśantau ariṃdamau  kadā sumanasaḥ kanyāḥ dvijātīnām phalāni ca
translated: those two subduers of enemies, as they enter the city?🔽When will the delighted maidens of the twice-born class,

original: pradiśantyaḥ purīṃ hṛṣṭāḥ kariṣyanti pradakṣiṇam // / / //🔽kadā pariṇato buddhyā vayasā cāmaraprabhaḥ /
analyzed: pradiśantyaḥ purīm hṛṣṭāḥ kariṣyanti pradakṣiṇam  kadā pariṇataḥ buddhyā vayasā ca amara prabhaḥ
translated: circumambulate the city, offering fruits and flowers?🔽When will that knower of dharma, whose lustre is like that of the immortals,

original: abhyupaiṣyati dharmajñas trivarṣa iva māṃ lalan // / / //
analyzed: abhyupaiṣyati dharma jñaḥ tri varṣe iva mām lalan
translated: come to me, having matured in wisdom and age, as if he were three years old?

original: niḥsaṃśayaṃ mayā manye purā vīra kadaryayā /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam mayā manye purā vīra kadaryayā
translated: O hero, I think that in the past, out of miserliness,

original: pātu kāmeṣu vatseṣu mātḥṇāṃ śātitāḥ stanāḥ // / / //🔽sāhaṃ gaur iva siṃhena vivatsā vatsalā kṛtā /
analyzed: pātu kāmeṣu vatseṣu mātḥṇām śātitāḥ stanāḥ  sā aham gauḥ iva siṃhena vivatsā vatsalā kṛtā
translated: I must have had the udders of the cows, who are like my mothers, cut off, while they were still young and desirous of their calves.🔽Like a cow separated from her calf, I have been made calf-less by Kaikeyi,

original: kaikeyyā puruṣavyāghra bālavatseva gaur balāt // / / //🔽na hi tāvad guṇair juṣṭaṃ sarvaśāstraviśāradam /
analyzed: kaikeyyā puruṣa vyāghra bāla vatsā iva gauḥ balāt  na hi tāvat guṇaiḥ juṣṭam sarva śāstra viśāradam
translated: O tiger among men, as if by force, like a cow with a young calf.🔽I am not able to live without my son, who is endowed with virtues, skilled in all scriptures,

original: ekaputrā vinā putram ahaṃ jīvitum utsahe // / / //
analyzed: eka putrā vinā putram aham jīvitum utsahe
translated: and my only son.

original: na hi me jīvite kiṃcit sāmarthyam iha kalpyate /
analyzed: na hi me jīvite kiṃcid sāmarthyam iha kalpyate
translated: I do not see any purpose in living here,

original: apaśyantyāḥ priyaṃ putraṃ mahābāhuṃ mahābalam // / / //
analyzed: apaśyantyāḥ priyam putram mahā bāhum mahā balam
translated: without seeing my dear son, who has long arms and great strength.

original: ayaṃ hi māṃ dīpayate samutthitas tanūjaśokaprabhavo hutāśanaḥ /
analyzed: ayam hi mām dīpayate samutthitaḥ tanūja śoka prabhavaḥ hutāśanaḥ
translated: This fire of grief arising from the death of my son burns me.

original: mahīm imāṃ raśmibhir uttamaprabho yathā nidāghe bhagavān divākaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahīm imām raśmibhiḥ uttama prabhaḥ yathā nidāghe bhagavān divākaraḥ
translated: As the sun, the lord of excellent radiance, with his rays, illuminates this earth in summer.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: vilapantīṃ tathā tāṃ tu kausalyāṃ pramadottamām /
analyzed: vilapantīm tathā tām tu kausalyām pramadā uttamām
translated: Thus lamenting Kausalya, the best of women,

original: idaṃ dharme sthitā dharmyaṃ sumitrā vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: idam dharme sthitā dharmyam sumitrā vākyam abravīt
translated: Sumanta, who was established in dharma, spoke these righteous words to her.

original: tavārye sadguṇair yuktaḥ putraḥ sa puruṣottamaḥ /
analyzed: tava ārye sat guṇaiḥ yuktaḥ putraḥ sa puruṣa uttamaḥ
translated: O noble lady, your son, the best of men, endowed with good qualities,

original: kiṃ te vilapitenaivaṃ kṛpaṇaṃ ruditena vā // / / //
analyzed: kim te vilapitena evam kṛpaṇam ruditena vā
translated: What is the use of lamenting like this, or weeping pitifully?

original: yas tavārye gataḥ putras tyaktvā rājyaṃ mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tava ārye gataḥ putraḥ tyaktvā rājyam mahā balaḥ
translated: O noble lady, your son, the greatly strong one, who has gone, renouncing the kingdom,

original: sādhu kurvan mahātmānaṃ pitaraṃ satyavādinām // / / //
analyzed: sādhu kurvan mahātmānam pitaram satya vādinām
translated: Doing good, that magnanimous one, the truthful one,

original: śiṣṭair ācarite samyak śaśvat pretya phalodaye /
analyzed: śiṣṭaiḥ ācarite samyak śaśvat pretya phala udaye
translated: In the eternal arising of fruits in the next world, which is well practiced by the virtuous,

original: rāmo dharme sthitaḥ śreṣṭho na sa śocyaḥ kadācana // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ dharme sthitaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ na sa śocyaḥ kadācana
translated: Rama, established in the best dharma, should never be grieved over.

original: vartate cottamāṃ vṛttiṃ lakṣmaṇo 'smin sadānaghaḥ /
analyzed: vartate ca uttamām vṛttim lakṣmaṇaḥ smin sadā anaghaḥ
translated: And the sinless Lakshmana always follows the best conduct towards him.

original: dayāvān sarvabhūteṣu lābhas tasya mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dayāvān sarva bhūteṣu lābhaḥ tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Compassionate towards all beings, that is the gain of that magnanimous one.

original: araṇyavāse yad duḥkhaṃ jānatī vai sukhocitā /
analyzed: araṇya vāse yat duḥkham jānatī vai sukha ucitā
translated: Knowing the hardships of forest life, though she is used to comfort,

original: anugacchati vaidehī dharmātmānaṃ tavātmajam // / / //
analyzed: anugacchati vaidehī dharma ātmānam tava ātmajam
translated: Vaidehi follows your righteous son.

original: kīrtibhūtāṃ patākāṃ yo loke bhrāmayati prabhuḥ /
analyzed: kīrti bhūtām patākām yaḥ loke bhrāmayati prabhuḥ
translated: The lord who waves the banner of fame in the world,

original: damasatyavrataparaḥ kiṃ na prāptas tavātmajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dama satya vrata paraḥ kim na prāptaḥ tava ātmajaḥ
translated: What has not been attained by your son, who is devoted to self-control, truth and vows?

original: vyaktaṃ rāmasya vijñāya śaucaṃ māhātmyam uttamam /
analyzed: vyaktam rāmasya vijñāya śaucam māhātmyam uttamam
translated: Clearly understanding Rama's purity and supreme greatness,

original: na gātram aṃśubhiḥ sūryaḥ saṃtāpayitum arhati // / / //
analyzed: na gātram aṃśubhiḥ sūryaḥ saṃtāpayitum arhati
translated: The sun should not torment his body with its rays.

original: śivaḥ sarveṣu kāleṣu kānanebhyo viniḥsṛtaḥ /
analyzed: śivaḥ sarveṣu kāleṣu kānanebhyaḥ viniḥsṛtaḥ
translated: Auspicious at all times, emerging from the forests,

original: rāghavaṃ yuktaśītoṣṇaḥ seviṣyati sukho 'nilaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāghavam yukta śīta uṣṇaḥ seviṣyati sukhaḥ nilaḥ
translated: A pleasant breeze, neither too cold nor too hot, will serve Raghava.

original: śayānam anaghaṃ rātrau pitevābhipariṣvajan /
analyzed: śayānam anagham rātrau pitā iva abhipariṣvajan
translated: Touching the sinless one at night, as if embracing a father,

original: raśmibhiḥ saṃspṛśañ śītaiś candramā hlādayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: raśmibhiḥ saṃspṛśam śītaiḥ candramāḥ hlādayiṣyati
translated: The moon will delight him with its cool rays.

original: dadau cāstrāṇi divyāni yasmai brahmā mahaujase /
analyzed: dadau ca astrāṇi divyāni yasmai brahmā mahā ojase
translated: To him, of great prowess, Brahma gave divine weapons,

original: dānavendraṃ hataṃ dṛṣṭvā timidhvajasutaṃ raṇe // / / //
analyzed: dānava indram hatam dṛṣṭvā timidhvaja sutam raṇe
translated: Seeing the lord of demons, the son of Timidhvaja, slain in battle.

original: pṛthivyā saha vaidehyā śriyā ca puruṣarṣabhaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyā saha vaidehyā śriyā ca puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: The best of men, along with Vaidehi and the earth,

original: kṣipraṃ tisṛbhir etābhiḥ saha rāmo 'bhiṣekṣyate // / / //
analyzed: kṣipram tisṛbhiḥ etābhiḥ saha rāmaḥ bhiṣekṣyate
translated: Rama will soon be consecrated with all these three.

original: duḥkhajaṃ visṛjanty asraṃ niṣkrāmantam udīkṣya yam /
analyzed: duḥkha jam visṛjanti asram niṣkrāmantam udīkṣya yam
translated: Seeing him, who is about to depart, they shed tears of sorrow.

original: samutsrakṣyasi netrābhyāṃ kṣipram ānandajaṃ payaḥ // / / //
analyzed: samutsrakṣyasi netrābhyām kṣipram ānanda jam payaḥ
translated: You will soon shed tears of joy from your eyes.

original: abhivādayamānaṃ taṃ dṛṣṭvā sasuhṛdaṃ sutam /
analyzed: abhivādayamānam tam dṛṣṭvā sa suhṛdam sutam
translated: Seeing your son, along with his friends, paying homage,

original: mudāśru mokṣyase kṣipraṃ meghalekheva vārṣikī // / / //
analyzed: mudā aśru mokṣyase kṣipram megha lekhā iva vārṣikī
translated: You will quickly release tears of joy, like a rain-bearing cloud in the rainy season.

original: putras te varadaḥ kṣipram ayodhyāṃ punar āgataḥ /
analyzed: putraḥ te vara daḥ kṣipram ayodhyām punar āgataḥ
translated: Your son, the granter of boons, will soon return to Ayodhya,

original: karābhyāṃ mṛdupīnābhyāṃ caraṇau pīḍayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: karābhyām mṛdu pīnābhyām caraṇau pīḍayiṣyati
translated: And with his soft and plump hands, he will press your feet.

original: niśamya tal lakṣmaṇamātṛvākyaṃ rāmasya mātur naradevapatnyāḥ /
analyzed: niśamya tat lakṣmaṇa mātṛ vākyam rāmasya mātuḥ naradeva patnyāḥ
translated: Hearing these words of Lakshmana's mother, the sorrow in the body of Rama's mother, the wife of the king of men,

original: sadyaḥ śarīre vinanāśa śokaḥ śaradgato megha ivālpatoyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sadyas śarīre vinanāśa śokaḥ śarad gataḥ meghaḥ iva alpa toyaḥ
translated: Immediately vanished, like a cloud in autumn with little water.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: anuraktā mahātmānaṃ rāmaṃ satyaparākramam /
analyzed: anuraktāḥ mahātmānam rāmam satya parākramam
translated: The people who were deeply attached to the great Rama, who was true to his promise,

original: anujagmuḥ prayāntaṃ taṃ vanavāsāya mānavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: anujagmuḥ prayāntam tam vana vāsāya mānavāḥ
translated: Followed him as he was leaving for the forest.

original: nivartite 'pi ca balāt suhṛdvarge ca rājani /
analyzed: nivartite ca balāt suhṛd varge ca rājani
translated: Even when the group of friends and the king were forcibly turned back,

original: naiva te saṃnyavartanta rāmasyānugatā ratham // / / //
analyzed: na eva te saṃnyavartanta rāmasya anugatāḥ ratham
translated: They did not return, but followed Rama's chariot.

original: ayodhyānilayānāṃ hi puruṣāṇāṃ mahāyaśāḥ /
analyzed: ayodhyā nilayānām hi puruṣāṇām mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The greatly famous one

original: babhūva guṇasampannaḥ pūrṇacandra iva priyaḥ // / / //🔽sa yācyamānaḥ kākutsthaḥ svābhiḥ prakṛtibhis tadā /
analyzed: babhūva guṇa sampannaḥ pūrṇa candraḥ iva priyaḥ  sa yācyamānaḥ kākutsthaḥ svābhiḥ prakṛtibhiḥ tadā
translated: was endowed with virtues, and was dear to all like the full moon.🔽When Kakutstha was thus requested by his own subjects,

original: kurvāṇaḥ pitaraṃ satyaṃ vanam evānvapadyata // / / //
analyzed: kurvāṇaḥ pitaram satyam vanam eva anvapadyata
translated: fulfilling his father's truth, he set out for the forest.

original: avekṣamāṇaḥ sasnehaṃ cakṣuṣā prapibann iva /
analyzed: avekṣamāṇaḥ sa sneham cakṣuṣā prapiban iva
translated: Looking at them with affection, as if drinking them in with his eyes,

original: uvāca rāmaḥ snehena tāḥ prajāḥ svāḥ prajā iva // / / //
analyzed: uvāca rāmaḥ snehena tāḥ prajāḥ svāḥ prajāḥ iva
translated: Rāma spoke affectionately to those subjects, as if they were his own.

original: yā prītir bahumānaś ca mayy ayodhyānivāsinām /
analyzed: yā prītiḥ bahu mānaḥ ca mayi ayodhyā nivāsinām
translated: The affection and respect that the residents of Ayodhyā have for me,

original: matpriyārthaṃ viśeṣeṇa bharate sā niveśyatām // / / //
analyzed: mad priya artham viśeṣeṇa bharate sā niveśyatām
translated: install that especially in Bharata for my pleasure.

original: sa hi kalyāṇacāritraḥ kaikeyyānandavardhanaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi kalyāṇa cāritraḥ kaikeyī ānanda vardhanaḥ
translated: For he is of virtuous conduct, the enhancer of Kaikeyi's joy,

original: kariṣyati yathāvad vaḥ priyāṇi ca hitāni ca // / / //
analyzed: kariṣyati yathāvat vaḥ priyāṇi ca hitāni ca
translated: he will do what is dear and beneficial to you as it should be done.

original: jñānavṛddho vayobālo mṛdur vīryaguṇānvitaḥ /
analyzed: jñāna vṛddhaḥ vayaḥ bālaḥ mṛduḥ vīrya guṇa anvitaḥ
translated: Though aged in wisdom, young in years, gentle, endowed with the qualities of valor,

original: anurūpaḥ sa vo bhartā bhaviṣyati bhayāpahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anurūpaḥ sa vaḥ bhartā bhaviṣyati bhaya apahaḥ
translated: he will be a suitable lord for you, dispelling your fears.

original: sa hi rājaguṇair yukto yuvarājaḥ samīkṣitaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi rāja guṇaiḥ yuktaḥ yuvarājaḥ samīkṣitaḥ
translated: For he, the prince, is seen to be endowed with the qualities of a king,

original: api cāpi mayā śiṣṭaiḥ kāryaṃ vo bhartṛśāsanam // / / //
analyzed: api ca api mayā śiṣṭaiḥ kāryam vaḥ bhartṛ śāsanam
translated: and moreover, the command of our lord should be carried out by you all as by the virtuous.

original: na ca tapyed yathā cāsau vanavāsaṃ gate mayi /
analyzed: na ca tapyet yathā ca asau vana vāsam gate mayi
translated: And as he would not grieve when I go to the forest,

original: mahārājas tathā kāryo mama priyacikīrṣayā // / / //
analyzed: mahā rājaḥ tathā kāryaḥ mama priya cikīrṣayā
translated: The great king should be treated in the same way, out of a desire to do what is pleasing to me.

original: yathā yathā dāśarathir dharmam evāsthito 'bhavat /
analyzed: yathā yathā dāśarathiḥ dharmam eva āsthitaḥ bhavat
translated: As Dasha Rathi continued to follow dharma,

original: tathā tathā prakṛtayo rāmaṃ patim akāmayan // / / //
analyzed: tathā tathā prakṛtayaḥ rāmam patim akāmayan
translated: the people desired Rama as their lord even more.

original: bāṣpeṇa pihitaṃ dīnaṃ rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha /
analyzed: bāṣpeṇa pihitam dīnam rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha
translated: With his eyes filled with tears, Rama, along with Sumitra's son,

original: cakarṣeva guṇair baddhvā janaṃ punar ivāsanam // / / //
analyzed: cakarṣa iva guṇaiḥ baddhvā janam punar iva āsanam
translated: seemed to be dragging the people back to their seats, as if bound by his virtues.

original: te dvijās trividhaṃ vṛddhā jñānena vayasaujasā /
analyzed: te dvijāḥ trividham vṛddhāḥ jñānena vayasā ojasā
translated: Those Brahmins, aged in three ways - by knowledge, age, and vigor,

original: vayaḥprakampaśiraso dūrād ūcur idaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vayaḥ prakampa śirasaḥ dūrāt ūcuḥ idam vacaḥ
translated: with heads trembling with age, spoke these words from a distance.

original: vahanto javanā rāmaṃ bho bho jātyās turaṃgamāḥ /🔽nivartadhvaṃ na gantavyaṃ hitā bhavata bhartari /
analyzed: vahantaḥ javanāḥ rāmam bho bho jātyāḥ turaṃgamāḥ  nivartadhvam na gantavyam hitāḥ bhavata bhartari
translated: O swift horses of the Dasharha breed, bearing Rama, O friends,🔽turn back! You should not go. Be beneficial to your master.

original: upavāhyas tu vo bhartā nāpavāhyaḥ purād vanam // / / //🔽evam ārtapralāpāṃs tān vṛddhān pralapato dvijān /
analyzed: upavāhyaḥ tu vaḥ bhartā na apavāhyaḥ purāt vanam  evam ārta pralāpān tān vṛddhān pralapataḥ dvijān
translated: Your master should be carried, not taken away from the city to the forest.🔽Having seen those aged Brahmins lamenting in this way, Rama

original: avekṣya sahasā rāmo rathād avatatāra ha // / / //
analyzed: avekṣya sahasā rāmaḥ rathāt avatatāra ha
translated: suddenly descended from the chariot.

original: padbhyām eva jagāmātha sasītaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: padbhyām eva jagāma atha sa sītaḥ saha lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: With Sita and Lakshmana, he proceeded on foot,

original: saṃnikṛṣṭapadanyāso rāmo vanaparāyaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃnikṛṣṭa padanyāsaḥ rāmaḥ vana parāyaṇaḥ
translated: with measured steps, Rama, intent on going to the forest.

original: dvijātīṃs tu padātīṃs tān rāmaś cāritravatsalaḥ /
analyzed: dvijātīn tu padātīn tān rāmaḥ cāritra vatsalaḥ
translated: Rama, who was devoted to the twice-born, could not bear to leave them behind on foot.

original: na śaśāka ghṛṇācakṣuḥ parimoktuṃ rathena saḥ // / / //🔽gacchantam eva taṃ dṛṣṭvā rāmaṃ saṃbhrāntamānasāḥ /
analyzed: na śaśāka ghṛṇā cakṣuḥ parimoktum rathena saḥ  gacchantam eva tam dṛṣṭvā rāmam saṃbhrānta mānasāḥ
translated: With eyes full of compassion, he could not bear to leave them behind on the chariot.🔽Seeing him going away, the twice-born, their minds agitated,

original: ūcuḥ paramasaṃtaptā rāmaṃ vākyam idaṃ dvijāḥ // / / //🔽brāhmaṇyaṃ kṛtsnam etat tvāṃ brahmaṇyam anugacchati /
analyzed: ūcuḥ parama saṃtaptāḥ rāmam vākyam idam dvijāḥ  brāhmaṇyam kṛtsnam etat tvām brahmaṇyam anugacchati
translated: and greatly distressed, spoke these words to Rama.🔽The entire twice-born class, devoted to Brahman, is following you.

original: dvijaskandhādhirūḍhās tvām agnayo 'py anuyānty amī // / / //
analyzed: dvija skandha adhirūḍhāḥ tvām agnayaḥ pi anuyānti amī
translated: These fires, borne on the shoulders of the twice-born, are also following you.

original: vājapeyasamutthāni chattrāṇy etāni paśya naḥ /
analyzed: vājapeya samutthāni chattrāṇi etāni paśya naḥ
translated: Look at these umbrellas raised for the Vajapeya sacrifice,

original: pṛṣṭhato 'nuprayātāni haṃsān iva jalātyaye // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas nuprayātāni haṃsān iva jalātyaye
translated: following us like swans leaving the water.

original: anavāptātapatrasya raśmisaṃtāpitasya te /
analyzed: an avāpta ātapatrasya raśmi saṃtāpitasya te
translated: You have no umbrella, and are scorched by the sun's rays.

original: ebhiś chāyāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ svaiś chattrair vājapeyikaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ebhiḥ chāyām kariṣyāmaḥ svaiḥ chattraiḥ vājapeyikaiḥ
translated: With these umbrellas used for the Vajapeya sacrifice, we will provide shade for you.

original: yā hi naḥ satataṃ buddhir vedamantrānusāriṇī /
analyzed: yā hi naḥ satatam buddhiḥ veda mantra anusāriṇī
translated: The thought that always follows the Vedic mantras,

original: tvatkṛte sā kṛtā vatsa vanavāsānusāriṇī // / / //
analyzed: tvad kṛte sā kṛtā vatsa vana vāsa anusāriṇī
translated: for your sake, O child, has now turned to following you into the forest.

original: hṛdayeṣv avatiṣṭhante vedā ye naḥ paraṃ dhanam /
analyzed: hṛdayeṣu avatiṣṭhante vedāḥ ye naḥ param dhanam
translated: The Vedas, our greatest wealth, reside in our hearts.

original: vatsyanty api gṛheṣv eva dārāś cāritrarakṣitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vatsyanti api gṛheṣu eva dārāḥ cāritra rakṣitāḥ
translated: Their wives will also live in their own houses, protected by their chastity.

original: na punar niścayaḥ kāryas tvadgatau sukṛtā matiḥ /
analyzed: na punar niścayaḥ kāryaḥ tvad gatau su kṛtā matiḥ
translated: You should not make up your mind again, your intention towards me is well-formed.

original: tvayi dharmavyapekṣe tu kiṃ syād dharmam avekṣitum // / / //🔽yācito no nivartasva haṃsaśuklaśiroruhaiḥ /
analyzed: tvayi dharma vyapekṣe tu kim syāt dharmam avekṣitum  yācitaḥ naḥ nivartasva haṃsa śukla śiroruhaiḥ
translated: If you are intent on dharma, what else is there to consider for dharma?🔽We have come to you, our heads white with age, our hair grey like a swan's neck,

original: śirobhir nibhṛtācāra mahīpatanapāṃsulaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śirobhiḥ nibhṛta ācāra mahīpatana pāṃsulaiḥ
translated: our heads heavy with the dust of bowing down to the ground, O you of controlled conduct, we beg you to return.

original: bahūnāṃ vitatā yajñā dvijānāṃ ya ihāgatāḥ /
analyzed: bahūnām vitatāḥ yajñāḥ dvijānām ye iha āgatāḥ
translated: Many Brahmins have come here, their sacrifices spread out.

original: teṣāṃ samāptir āyattā tava vatsa nivartane // / / //
analyzed: teṣām samāptiḥ āyattā tava vatsa nivartane
translated: O child, their completion depends on your return.

original: bhaktimanti hi bhūtāni jaṅgamājaṅgamāni ca /
analyzed: bhaktimanti hi bhūtāni jaṅgama ajaṅgamāni ca
translated: The beings here, moving and unmoving, are full of devotion.

original: yācamāneṣu teṣu tvaṃ bhaktiṃ bhakteṣu darśaya // / / //🔽anugantum aśaktās tvāṃ mūlair uddhṛtaveginaḥ /
analyzed: yācamāneṣu teṣu tvam bhaktim bhakteṣu darśaya  anugantum aśaktāḥ tvām mūlaiḥ uddhṛta veginaḥ
translated: Show your devotion to those who are devoted, who are begging you.🔽Unable to follow you, their roots uprooted, their speed taken away,

original: unnatā vāyuvegena vikrośantīva pādapāḥ // / / //
analyzed: unnatāḥ vāyu vegena vikrośanti iva pādapāḥ
translated: the trees, lifted by the force of the wind, seem to be crying out.

original: niśceṣṭāhārasaṃcārā vṛkṣaikasthānaviṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: niśceṣṭa āhāra saṃcārāḥ vṛkṣa eka sthāna viṣṭhitāḥ
translated: The birds, their movements and food stopped, staying in one place in the tree,

original: pakṣiṇo 'pi prayācante sarvabhūtānukampinam // / / //
analyzed: pakṣiṇaḥ pi prayācante sarva bhūta anukampinam
translated: even they are begging you, O you who have compassion for all beings.

original: evaṃ vikrośatāṃ teṣāṃ dvijātīnāṃ nivartane /
analyzed: evam vikrośatām teṣām dvijātīnām nivartane
translated: Thus those Brahmins are crying out for you to return.

original: dadṛśe tamasā tatra vārayantīva rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: dadṛśe tamasā tatra vārayanti iva rāghavam
translated: seemed to obstruct Rāghava there with darkness.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Rāmāyaṇa. Ayodhyākāṇḍa.

original: tatas tu tamasā tīraṃ ramyam āśritya rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu tamasā tīram ramyam āśritya rāghavaḥ
translated: Then Rāghava, having resorted to the beautiful bank of Tamasā,

original: sītām udvīkṣya saumitrim idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: sītām udvīkṣya saumitrim idam vacanam abravīt
translated: looking at Sītā and Saumitri, spoke these words:

original: iyam adya niśā pūrvā saumitre prasthitā vanam /
analyzed: iyam adya niśā pūrvā saumitre prasthitā vanam
translated: This is the first night, Saumitri, that we have set out for the forest.

original: vanavāsasya bhadraṃ te sa notkaṇṭhitum arhasi // / / //🔽paśya śūnyāny araṇyāni rudantīva samantataḥ /
analyzed: vana vāsasya bhadram te sa nā utkaṇṭhitum arhasi  paśya śūnyāni araṇyāni rudanti iva samantataḥ
translated: May you be fortunate, you should not be anxious about the forest life.🔽Look at the empty forests, as if weeping all around,

original: yathānilayam āyadbhir nilīnāni mṛgadvijaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathānilayam āyadbhiḥ nilīnāni mṛga dvijaiḥ
translated: where the deer and birds have hidden in their own abodes.

original: adyāyodhyā tu nagarī rājadhānī pitur mama /
analyzed: adyā ayodhyā tu nagarī rājadhānī pituḥ mama
translated: Today the city of Ayodhyā, the capital of my father,

original: sastrīpuṃsā gatān asmāñ śociṣyati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa strī puṃsā gatān asmām śociṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: will undoubtedly grieve for us, with the women and men, who have gone away.

original: bharataḥ khalu dharmātmā pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca me /
analyzed: bharataḥ khalu dharma ātmā pitaram mātaram ca me
translated: But the righteous Bharata, indeed, will console my father and mother

original: dharmārthakāmasahitair vākyair āśvāsayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: dharma artha kāma sahitaiḥ vākyaiḥ āśvāsayiṣyati
translated: with words endowed with righteousness, worldly profit, and desire.

original: bharatasyānṛśaṃsatvaṃ saṃcintyāhaṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: bharatasya a nṛśaṃsa tvam saṃcintya aham punar punar
translated: Thinking again and again of Bharata's compassion,

original: nānuśocāmi pitaraṃ mātaraṃ cāpi lakṣmaṇa // / / //
analyzed: na anuśocāmi pitaram mātaram ca api lakṣmaṇa
translated: I do not grieve for my father or mother, O Lakṣmaṇa.

original: tvayā kāryaṃ naravyāghra mām anuvrajatā kṛtam /
analyzed: tvayā kāryam nara vyāghra mām anuvrajatā kṛtam
translated: O best of men, you have done your duty by following me.

original: anveṣṭavyā hi vaidehyā rakṣaṇārthe sahāyatā // / / //
analyzed: anveṣṭavyā hi vaidehyāḥ rakṣaṇa arthe sahāya tā
translated: You should search for a companion for the protection of Vaidehi.

original: adbhir eva tu saumitre vatsyāmy adya niśām imām /
analyzed: adbhiḥ eva tu saumitre vatsyāmi adya niśām imām
translated: O son of Sumitra, I shall spend this night only with water.

original: etaddhi rocate mahyaṃ vanye 'pi vividhe sati // / / //🔽evam uktvā tu saumitraṃ sumantram api rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: etat hi rocate mahyam vanye vividhe sati  evam uktvā tu saumitram sumantram api rāghavaḥ
translated: This is agreeable to me, even though various forest fare is available.🔽Having thus spoken to Sumitra's son, Raghava

original: apramattas tvam aśveṣu bhava saumyety uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: apramattaḥ tvam aśveṣu bhava saumya iti uvāca ha
translated: said to Sumantra, O gentle one, be careful with the horses.

original: so 'śvān sumantraḥ saṃyamya sūrye 'staṃ samupāgate /🔽prabhūtayavasān kṛtvā babhūva pratyanantaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ śvān sumantraḥ saṃyamya sūrye stam samupāgate  prabhūta yavasān kṛtvā babhūva pratyanantaraḥ
translated: When the sun had set, Sumantra, having tethered the horses,🔽having provided them with plenty of fodder, stood in attendance.

original: upāsyatu śivāṃ saṃdhyāṃ dṛṣṭvā rātrim upasthitām /
analyzed: upāsyatu śivām saṃdhyām dṛṣṭvā rātrim upasthitām
translated: Having worshipped the auspicious evening and seeing the night approaching,

original: rāmasya śayanaṃ cakre sūtaḥ saumitriṇā saha // / / //
analyzed: rāmasya śayanam cakre sūtaḥ saumitriṇā saha
translated: the charioteer, along with Sumitra's son, prepared Rama's bed.

original: tāṃ śayyāṃ tamasātīre vīkṣya vṛkṣadalaiḥ kṛtām /
analyzed: tām śayyām tamasā tīre vīkṣya vṛkṣa dalaiḥ kṛtām
translated: Seeing that bed made of tree leaves on the bank of Tamasa,

original: rāmaḥ saumitriṇā sārdhaṃ sabhāryaḥ saṃviveśa ha // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ saumitriṇā sārdham sa bhāryaḥ saṃviveśa ha
translated: Rama, along with Sumitra's son and his wife, lay down.

original: sabhāryaṃ saṃprasuptaṃ taṃ bhrātaraṃ vīkṣya lakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa bhāryam saṃprasuptam tam bhrātaram vīkṣya lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Lakshmana, seeing his brother with his wife asleep,

original: kathayāmāsa sūtāya rāmasya vividhān guṇān // / / //🔽jāgrato hy eva tāṃ rātriṃ saumitrer udito raviḥ /
analyzed: kathayāmāsa sūtāya rāmasya vividhān guṇān  jāgrataḥ hi eva tām rātrim saumitreḥ uditaḥ raviḥ
translated: described to the charioteer the various qualities of Rama.

original: sūtasya tamasātīre rāmasya bruvato guṇān // / / //
analyzed: sūtasya tamasā tīre rāmasya bruvataḥ guṇān
translated: As Rama was describing his qualities to the charioteer on the bank of Tamasa, the sun rose for the son of Sumitra, who was awake all night.

original: gokulākulatīrāyās tamasāyā vidūrataḥ /
analyzed: gokula ākula tīrāyāḥ tamasāyāḥ vidūrataḥ
translated: Not far from Tamasa, with its banks crowded with herds of cows,

original: avasat tatra tāṃ rātriṃ rāmaḥ prakṛtibhiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: avasat tatra tām rātrim rāmaḥ prakṛtibhiḥ saha
translated: Rama spent the night there with his subjects.

original: utthāya tu mahātejāḥ prakṛtīs tā niśāmya ca /
analyzed: utthāya tu mahā tejāḥ prakṛtīḥ tāḥ niśāmya ca
translated: But the greatly radiant one, having risen and observed those subjects,

original: abravīd bhrātaraṃ rāmo lakṣmaṇaṃ puṇyalakṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: abravīt bhrātaram rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam puṇya lakṣaṇam
translated: Rama spoke to his brother Lakshmana, who was auspicious in character.

original: asmadvyapekṣān saumitre nirapekṣān gṛheṣv api /
analyzed: asmad vyapekṣān saumitre nirapekṣān gṛheṣu api
translated: O son of Sumitra, these people, who are indifferent even to their homes, are devoted to us.

original: vṛkṣamūleṣu saṃsuptān paśya lakṣmaṇa sāmpratam // / / //
analyzed: vṛkṣa mūleṣu saṃsuptān paśya lakṣmaṇa sāmpratam
translated: Look, Lakshmana, they are sleeping at the foot of the trees now.

original: yathaite niyamaṃ paurāḥ kurvanty asmannivartane /
analyzed: yathā ete niyamam paurāḥ kurvanti asmad nivartane
translated: As these citizens are making efforts for our return,

original: api prāṇān asiṣyanti na tu tyakṣyanti niścayam // / / //
analyzed: api prāṇān asiṣyanti na tu tyakṣyanti niścayam
translated: they will give up their lives, but will not abandon their resolve.

original: yāvad eva tu saṃsuptās tāvad eva vayaṃ laghu /
analyzed: yāvat eva tu saṃsuptāḥ tāvat eva vayam laghu
translated: But as long as they are sleeping, let us quickly,

original: ratham āruhya gacchāmaḥ panthānam akutobhayam // / / //
analyzed: ratham āruhya gacchāmaḥ panthānam akutobhayam
translated: mount the chariot and go by a path free from danger.

original: ato bhūyo 'pi nedānīm ikṣvākupuravāsinaḥ /
analyzed: atas bhūyas na idānīm ikṣvāku pura vāsinaḥ
translated: Therefore, the citizens of the city of Ikshvaku will not see us again,

original: svapeyur anuraktā māṃ vṛkṣamūlāni saṃśritāḥ // / / //
analyzed: svapeyuḥ anuraktāḥ mām vṛkṣa mūlāni saṃśritāḥ
translated: And would sleep, devoted to me, taking refuge at the foot of trees.

original: paurā hy ātmakṛtād duḥkhād vipramocyā nṛpātmajaiḥ /
analyzed: paurāḥ hi ātma kṛtāt duḥkhāt vipramocyāḥ nṛpa ātmajaiḥ
translated: The princes should free the citizens from suffering caused by themselves.

original: na tu khalv ātmanā yojyā duḥkhena puravāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tu khalu ātmanā yojyāḥ duḥkhena pura vāsinaḥ
translated: But the citizens should not be united with suffering by themselves.

original: abravīl lakṣmaṇo rāmaṃ sākṣād dharmam iva sthitam /
analyzed: abravīt lakṣmaṇaḥ rāmam sākṣāt dharmam iva sthitam
translated: Lakshmana said to Rama, who was like Dharma incarnate,

original: rocate me mahāprājña kṣipram āruhyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: rocate me mahā prājña kṣipram āruhyatām iti
translated: O greatly wise one, it appeals to me. Let us quickly ascend.

original: sūtas tataḥ saṃtvaritaḥ syandanaṃ tair hayottamaiḥ /
analyzed: sūtaḥ tatas saṃtvaritaḥ syandanam taiḥ haya uttamaiḥ
translated: Then the charioteer, having quickly yoked the excellent horses to the chariot,

original: yojayitvātha rāmāya prāñjaliḥ pratyavedayat // / / //
analyzed: yojayitvā atha rāmāya prāñjaliḥ pratyavedayat
translated: and joining his palms, informed Rama.

original: mohanārthaṃ tu paurāṇāṃ sūtaṃ rāmo 'bravīd vacaḥ /
analyzed: mohana artham tu paurāṇām sūtam rāmaḥ bravīt vacaḥ
translated: But to deceive the citizens, Rama said to the charioteer,

original: udaṅmukhaḥ prayāhi tvaṃ ratham āsthāya sārathe // / / //
analyzed: udak mukhaḥ prayāhi tvam ratham āsthāya sārathe
translated: O charioteer, mount the chariot and proceed northwards.

original: muhūrtaṃ tvaritaṃ gatvā nirvartaya rathaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: muhūrtam tvaritam gatvā nirvartaya ratham punar
translated: Having quickly gone for a moment, turn the chariot back again.

original: yathā na vidyuḥ paurā māṃ tathā kuru samāhitaḥ // / / //🔽rāmasya vacanaṃ śrutvā tathā cakre sa sārathiḥ /
analyzed: yathā na vidyuḥ paurāḥ mām tathā kuru samāhitaḥ  rāmasya vacanam śrutvā tathā cakre sa sārathiḥ
translated: Concentrate and do it in such a way that the citizens do not know about me.🔽Having heard Rama's words, the charioteer did just that.

original: pratyāgamya ca rāmasya syandanaṃ pratyavedayat // / / //
analyzed: pratyāgamya ca rāmasya syandanam pratyavedayat
translated: And having returned, he informed Rama about the chariot.

original: taṃ syandanam adhiṣṭhāya rāghavaḥ saparicchadaḥ /
analyzed: tam syandanam adhiṣṭhāya rāghavaḥ sa paricchadaḥ
translated: Raghava, along with his retinue, ascended that chariot.

original: śīghragām ākulāvartāṃ tamasām ataran nadīm // / / //🔽sa saṃtīrya mahābāhuḥ śrīmāñ śivam akaṇṭakam /
analyzed: śīghra gām ākula āvartām tamasām atarat nadīm  sa saṃtīrya mahā bāhuḥ śrīmām śivam akaṇṭakam
translated: He crossed the swift-flowing, turbulent Tamasā river.

original: prāpadyata mahāmārgam abhayaṃ bhayadarśinām // / / //
analyzed: prāpadyata mahā mārgam abhayam bhaya darśinām
translated: Having crossed, the mighty-armed and prosperous one reached the great path, free from fear, for those who see fear.

original: prabhātāyāṃ tu śarvaryāṃ paurās te rāghavaṃ vinā /🔽śokopahataniśceṣṭā babhūvur hatacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prabhātāyām tu śarvaryām paurāḥ te rāghavam vinā  śoka upahata niśceṣṭāḥ babhūvuḥ hatacetasaḥ
translated: But when dawn broke, the citizens, without Raghava,🔽were overcome with grief and lost their senses.

original: śokajāśruparidyūnā vīkṣamāṇās tatas tataḥ /
analyzed: śoka ja aśru paridyūnāḥ vīkṣamāṇāḥ tatas tatas
translated: Overcome with tears of sorrow, they looked here and there,

original: ālokam api rāmasya na paśyanti sma duḥkhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ālokam api rāmasya na paśyanti sma duḥkhitāḥ
translated: and the afflicted ones did not see even the light of Rama.

original: tato mārgānusāreṇa gatvā kiṃcit kṣaṇaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: tatas mārga anusāreṇa gatvā kiṃcid kṣaṇam punar
translated: Then, having gone a little further along the path,

original: mārganāśād viṣādena mahatā samabhiplutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mārga nāśāt viṣādena mahatā samabhiplutaḥ
translated: they were overwhelmed by great sorrow at the loss of the path.

original: rathasya mārganāśena nyavartanta manasvinaḥ /
analyzed: rathasya mārga nāśena nyavartanta manasvinaḥ
translated: The wise ones turned back because of the loss of the path of the chariot,

original: kim idaṃ kiṃ kariṣyāmo daivenopahatā iti // / / //
analyzed: kim idam kim kariṣyāmaḥ daivena upahatāḥ iti
translated: saying, What is this? What shall we do? We are afflicted by fate.

original: tato yathāgatenaiva mārgeṇa klāntacetasaḥ /
analyzed: tatas yathāgatena eva mārgeṇa klānta cetasaḥ
translated: Then, with their minds weary, they returned by the same path as they had come,

original: ayodhyām agaman sarve purīṃ vyathitasajjanām // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām agaman sarve purīm vyathita sat janām
translated: and all of them went to the city of Ayodhyā, where the good people were afflicted with grief.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: anugamya nivṛttānāṃ rāmaṃ nagaravāsinām /
analyzed: anugamya nivṛttānām rāmam nagara vāsinām
translated: The citizens of the city who had followed Rama and returned,

original: udgatānīva sattvāni babhūvur amanasvinām // / / //
analyzed: udgatāni iva sattvāni babhūvuḥ amanasvinām
translated: their spirits seemed to have left them, as if they were lifeless.

original: svaṃ svaṃ nilayam āgamya putradāraiḥ samāvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: svam svam nilayam āgamya putra dāraiḥ samāvṛtāḥ
translated: Having gone to their respective abodes, surrounded by their sons and wives,

original: aśrūṇi mumucuḥ sarve bāṣpeṇa pihitānanāḥ // / / //🔽na cāhṛṣyan na cāmodan vaṇijo na prasārayan /
analyzed: aśrūṇi mumucuḥ sarve bāṣpeṇa pihita ānanāḥ  na ca ahṛṣyat na ca amodan vaṇijaḥ na prasārayan
translated: all of them shed tears, their faces covered with tears.🔽The merchants neither rejoiced nor delighted, nor did they display their wares.

original: na cāśobhanta paṇyāni nāpacan gṛhamedhinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca aśobhanta paṇyāni na apacan gṛhamedhinaḥ
translated: The goods did not shine, nor did the householders cook.

original: naṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭvā nābhyanandan vipulaṃ vā dhanāgamam /
analyzed: naṣṭam dṛṣṭvā na abhyanandan vipulam vā dhana āgamam
translated: Seeing a loss, they did not rejoice, nor did they rejoice at the acquisition of abundant wealth.

original: putraṃ prathamajaṃ labdhvā jananī nābhyanandata // / / //
analyzed: putram prathama jam labdhvā jananī na abhyanandata
translated: The mother did not rejoice at the birth of her firstborn son.

original: gṛhe gṛhe rudantyaś ca bhartāraṃ gṛham āgatam /
analyzed: gṛhe gṛhe rudantyaḥ ca bhartāram gṛham āgatam
translated: In every house, the wives, weeping, reproached their husbands who had come home,

original: vyagarhayanta duḥkhārtā vāgbhis totrair iva dvipān // / / //
analyzed: vyagarhayanta duḥkha ārtāḥ vāgbhiḥ totraiḥ iva dvipān
translated: afflicted with grief, with words like goads on elephants.

original: kiṃ nu teṣāṃ gṛhaiḥ kāryaṃ kiṃ dāraiḥ kiṃ dhanena vā /
analyzed: kim nu teṣām gṛhaiḥ kāryam kim dāraiḥ kim dhanena vā
translated: What need do they have for homes, for wives, for wealth,

original: putrair vā kiṃ sukhair vāpi ye na paśyanti rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: putraiḥ vā kim sukhaiḥ vā api ye na paśyanti rāghavam
translated: for sons, or for happiness, who do not see Raghava?

original: ekaḥ satpuruṣo loke lakṣmaṇaḥ saha sītayā /
analyzed: ekaḥ sat puruṣaḥ loke lakṣmaṇaḥ saha sītayā
translated: Only one good man in the world, Lakshmana, with Sita,

original: yo 'nugacchati kākutsthaṃ rāmaṃ paricaran vane // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ nugacchati kākutstham rāmam paricaran vane
translated: who follows Kakutstha Rama, serving him in the forest.

original: āpagāḥ kṛtapuṇyās tāḥ padminyaś ca sarāṃsi ca /🔽yeṣu snāsyati kākutstho vigāhya salilaṃ śuci // / / //
analyzed: āpagāḥ kṛta puṇyāḥ tāḥ padminyaḥ ca sarāṃsi ca  yeṣu snāsyati kākutsthaḥ vigāhya salilam śuci
translated: The rivers, the lotus-lakes, and the lotus-ponds, have all acquired merit,🔽since Kakutstha will bathe in their pure waters.

original: śobhayiṣyanti kākutstham aṭavyo ramyakānanāḥ /
analyzed: śobhayiṣyanti kākutstham aṭavyaḥ ramya kānanāḥ
translated: The forests and the charming woods will adorn Kakutstha,

original: āpagāś ca mahānūpāḥ sānumantaś ca parvatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: āpagāḥ ca mahā anūpāḥ sānumantaḥ ca parvatāḥ
translated: the great rivers, the lakes, and the mountains with their peaks.

original: kānanaṃ vāpi śailaṃ vā yaṃ rāmo 'bhigamiṣyati /
analyzed: kānanam vā api śailam vā yam rāmaḥ abhigamiṣyati
translated: Whatever forest or mountain Rama will visit,

original: priyātithim iva prāptaṃ nainaṃ śakṣyanty anarcitum // / / //
analyzed: priya atithim iva prāptam na enam śakṣyanti an arcitum
translated: will not be able to fail to honour him, as if he were a dear guest.

original: vicitrakusumāpīḍā bahumañjaridhāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: vicitra kusuma āpīḍāḥ bahu mañjari dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Bearing various garlands of flowers and many clusters of blossoms,

original: akāle cāpi mukhyāni puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca /
analyzed: akāle ca api mukhyāni puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca
translated: and out of season also the best flowers and fruits,

original: darśayiṣyanty anukrośād girayo rāmam āgatam // / / //
analyzed: darśayiṣyanti anukrośāt girayaḥ rāmam āgatam
translated: the mountains will show them to Rama when he comes, out of compassion.

original: vidarśayanto vividhān bhūyaś citrāṃś ca nirjharān /
analyzed: vidarśayantaḥ vividhān bhūyas citrān ca nirjharān
translated: Displaying various and wonderful cascades,

original: pādapāḥ parvatāgreṣu ramayiṣyanti rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: pādapāḥ parvata agreṣu ramayiṣyanti rāghavam
translated: the trees on the mountain peaks will delight Raghava.

original: yatra rāmo bhayaṃ nātra nāsti tatra parābhavaḥ /
analyzed: yatra rāmaḥ bhayam na atra na asti tatra parābhavaḥ
translated: Where Rama is, there is no fear, there is no defeat,

original: sa hi śūro mahābāhuḥ putro daśarathasya ca // / / //
analyzed: sa hi śūraḥ mahā bāhuḥ putraḥ daśarathasya ca
translated: for he is the mighty-armed son of Dasharatha, the hero.

original: purā bhavati no dūrād anugacchāma rāghavam /
analyzed: purā bhavati naḥ dūrāt anugacchāma rāghavam
translated: Let us not be far behind, let us follow Raghava.

original: pādacchāyā sukhā bhartus tādṛśasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: pāda chāyā sukhā bhartuḥ tādṛśasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: The shade of the feet of such a great king is pleasant.

original: sa hi nātho janasyāsya sa gatiḥ sa parāyaṇam // / / //
analyzed: sa hi nāthaḥ janasya asya sa gatiḥ sa parāyaṇam
translated: He is the protector of the people, their refuge and ultimate resort.

original: vayaṃ paricariṣyāmaḥ sītāṃ yūyaṃ tu rāghavam /
analyzed: vayam paricariṣyāmaḥ sītām yūyam tu rāghavam
translated: We will serve Sita, and you will serve Raghava.

original: iti paurastriyo bhartḥn duḥkhārtās tat tad abruvan // / / //
analyzed: iti paura striyaḥ bhartṛ duḥkha ārtāḥ tat tat abruvan
translated: Thus the women of the city, afflicted with grief, spoke to their husbands, each one saying this and that.

original: yuṣmākaṃ rāghavo 'raṇye yogakṣemaṃ vidhāsyati /
analyzed: yuṣmākam rāghavaḥ raṇye yogakṣemam vidhāsyati
translated: Raghava will ensure your safety and well-being in the forest.

original: sītā nārījanasyāsya yogakṣemaṃ kariṣyati // / / //🔽ko nv anenāpratītena sotkaṇṭhitajanena ca /
analyzed: sītā nārī janasya asya yogakṣemam kariṣyati  kaḥ nu anena apratītena sa utkaṇṭhita janena ca
translated: Sita will ensure the safety and well-being of the womenfolk.

original: saṃprīyetāmanojñena vāsena hṛtacetasā // / / //
analyzed: saṃprīyeta amanojñena vāsena hṛta cetasā
translated: Who would be pleased with this disagreeable and cheerless dwelling, where the people are anxious and the mind is taken away?

original: kaikeyyā yadi ced rājyaṃ syād adharmyam anāthavat /
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ yadi ced rājyam syāt adharmyam anātha vat
translated: If the kingdom were to be ruled by Kaikeyi, it would be unrighteous and helpless.

original: na hi no jīvitenārthaḥ kutaḥ putraiḥ kuto dhanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: na hi naḥ jīvitena arthaḥ kutas putraiḥ kutas dhanaiḥ
translated: We have no purpose in life, not to speak of sons or wealth.

original: yayā putraś ca bhartā ca tyaktāv aiśvaryakāraṇāt /
analyzed: yayā putraḥ ca bhartā ca tyaktau aiśvarya kāraṇāt
translated: She who abandoned her son and husband for the sake of sovereignty,

original: kaṃ sā parihared anyaṃ kaikeyī kulapāṃsanī // / / //
analyzed: kam sā pariharet anyam kaikeyī kula pāṃsanī
translated: whom else will Kaikeyi, the defiler of the family, choose?

original: kaikeyyā na vayaṃ rājye bhṛtakā nivasema hi /
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ na vayam rājye bhṛtakāḥ nivasema hi
translated: We will not live as servants in the kingdom as long as Kaikeyi lives.

original: jīvantyā jātu jīvantyaḥ putrair api śapāmahe // / / //
analyzed: jīvantyāḥ jātu jīvantyaḥ putraiḥ api śapāmahe
translated: Even at the cost of our lives, we curse her and her sons.

original: yā putraṃ pārthivendrasya pravāsayati nirghṛṇā /
analyzed: yā putram pārthiva indrasya pravāsayati nirghṛṇā
translated: Who, out of cruelty, banishes the son of the lord of kings,

original: kas tāṃ prāpya sukhaṃ jīved adharmyāṃ duṣṭacāriṇīm // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ tām prāpya sukham jīvet adharmyām duṣṭa cāriṇīm
translated: having obtained that unrighteous and wicked-acting one, who would live happily?

original: na hi pravrajite rāme jīviṣyati mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: na hi pravrajite rāme jīviṣyati mahīpatiḥ
translated: When Rama has been exiled, the lord of the earth will not live.

original: mṛte daśarathe vyaktaṃ vilopas tadanantaram // / / //
analyzed: mṛte daśarathe vyaktam vilopaḥ tad anantaram
translated: When Dasharatha dies, it is clear that we will be destroyed afterwards.

original: te viṣaṃ pibatāloḍya kṣīṇapuṇyāḥ sudurgatāḥ /
analyzed: te viṣam pibata āloḍya kṣīṇa puṇyāḥ su durgatāḥ
translated: Having drunk poison, having mixed it, with our merit exhausted, we are in a very bad state.

original: rāghavaṃ vānugacchadhvam aśrutiṃ vāpi gacchata // / / //
analyzed: rāghavam vā anugacchadhvam aśrutim vā api gacchata
translated: Follow Raghava or go to the land of the dead.

original: mithyā pravrājito rāmaḥ sabhāryaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: mithyā pravrājitaḥ rāmaḥ sa bhāryaḥ saha lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Rama has been falsely exiled with his wife and Lakshmana.

original: bharate saṃnisṛṣṭāḥ smaḥ saunike paśavo yathā // / / //
analyzed: bharate saṃnisṛṣṭāḥ smaḥ saunike paśavaḥ yathā
translated: We have been entrusted to Bharata, like cattle to a butcher.

original: tās tathā vilapantyas tu nagare nāgarastriyaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ tathā vilapantyaḥ tu nagare nāgara striyaḥ
translated: Thus the city women, lamenting in the city,

original: cukruśur bhṛśasaṃtaptā mṛtyor iva bhayāgame // / / //
analyzed: cukruśuḥ bhṛśa saṃtaptāḥ mṛtyoḥ iva bhaya āgame
translated: cried out, greatly afflicted, as if the fear of death had come upon them.

original: tathā striyo rāmanimittam āturā yathā sute bhrātari vā vivāsite /
analyzed: tathā striyaḥ rāma nimittam āturāḥ yathā sute bhrātari vā vivāsite
translated: The women were afflicted on account of Rama, as if their son or brother had been exiled.

original: vilapya dīnā rurudur vicetasaḥ sutair hi tāsām adhiko hi so 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: vilapya dīnāḥ ruruduḥ vicetasaḥ sutaiḥ hi tāsām adhikaḥ hi saḥ bhavat
translated: Lamenting pitifully, they wept, their minds bewildered, for he was more to them than their own sons.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: rāmo 'pi rātriśeṣeṇa tenaiva mahad antaram /
analyzed: rāmaḥ u pi rātri śeṣeṇa tena eva mahat antaram
translated: Rama, the best of men, also covered a great distance during the remaining part of the night.

original: jagāma puruṣavyāghraḥ pitur ājñām anusmaran // / / //
analyzed: jagāma puruṣa vyāghraḥ pituḥ ājñām anusmaran
translated: Remembering his father's command, he proceeded.

original: tathaiva gacchatas tasya vyapāyād rajanī śivā /
analyzed: tathā eva gacchataḥ tasya vyapāyāt rajanī śivā
translated: As he was going along, the auspicious night came to an end.

original: upāsya sa śivāṃ saṃdhyāṃ viṣayāntaṃ vyagāhata // / / //
analyzed: upāsya sa śivām saṃdhyām viṣaya antam vyagāhata
translated: Having worshipped the auspicious evening, he entered the outskirts of the country.

original: grāmān vikṛṣṭasīmāṃs tān puṣpitāni vanāni ca /
analyzed: grāmān vikṛṣṭa sīmān tān puṣpitāni vanāni ca
translated: Seeing those villages with their boundaries well-marked and the flowering forests,

original: paśyann atiyayau śīghraṃ śarair iva hayottamaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: paśyan atiyayau śīghram śaraiḥ iva haya uttamaiḥ
translated: he quickly passed by, as if by excellent horses with arrows.

original: śṛṇvan vāco manuṣyāṇāṃ grāmasaṃvāsavāsinām /
analyzed: śṛṇvan vācaḥ manuṣyāṇām grāma saṃvāsa vāsinām
translated: Hearing the words of the people living in the villages,

original: rājānaṃ dhig daśarathaṃ kāmasya vaśam āgatam // / / //🔽hā nṛśaṃsādya kaikeyī pāpā pāpānubandhinī /
analyzed: rājānam dhik daśaratham kāmasya vaśam āgatam  hā nṛśaṃsā adya kaikeyī pāpā pāpa anubandhinī
translated: they cursed King Dasharatha, who had come under the sway of desire: Alas!🔽Today Kaikeyi, the wicked one, is bound by her own evil deeds,

original: tīkṣṇā saṃbhinnamaryādā tīkṣṇe karmaṇi vartate // / / //
analyzed: tīkṣṇā saṃbhinna maryādā tīkṣṇe karmaṇi vartate
translated: cruel, transgressing all bounds, is engaged in a cruel act.

original: yā putram īdṛśaṃ rājñaḥ pravāsayati dhārmikam /
analyzed: yā putram īdṛśam rājñaḥ pravāsayati dhārmikam
translated: She has exiled such a son of the king, who is righteous,

original: vanavāse mahāprājñaṃ sānukrośam atandritam // / / //
analyzed: vana vāse mahā prājñam sa anukrośam atandritam
translated: wise, compassionate and diligent, to live in the forest.

original: etā vāco manuṣyāṇāṃ grāmasaṃvāsavāsinām /
analyzed: etāḥ vācaḥ manuṣyāṇām grāma saṃvāsa vāsinām
translated: Hearing these words of the people living in the villages,

original: śṛṇvann atiyayau vīraḥ kosalān kosaleśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇvan atiyayau vīraḥ kosalān kosala īśvaraḥ
translated: the hero, the lord of Kosala, quickly passed through Kosala.

original: tato vedaśrutiṃ nāma śivavārivahāṃ nadīm /
analyzed: tatas vedaśrutim nāma śiva vāri vahām nadīm
translated: Then crossing the river Veda-shrutî, the river of the waters of Shiva,

original: uttīryābhimukhaḥ prāyād agastyādhyuṣitāṃ diśam // / / //
analyzed: uttīrya abhimukhaḥ prāyāt agastya adhyuṣitām diśam
translated: he proceeded in the direction inhabited by Agastya.

original: gatvā tu suciraṃ kālaṃ tataḥ śītajalāṃ nadīm /
analyzed: gatvā tu su ciram kālam tatas śīta jalām nadīm
translated: Having gone a long way, he then crossed the river of cold waters,

original: gomatīṃ goyutānūpām atarat sāgaraṃgamām // / / //
analyzed: gomatīm go yuta anūpām atarat sāgaraṃgamām
translated: the Gomati, the abode of herds of cows, which goes to the ocean.

original: gomatīṃ cāpy atikramya rāghavaḥ śīghragair hayaiḥ /
analyzed: gomatīm ca api atikramya rāghavaḥ śīghra gaiḥ hayaiḥ
translated: Having crossed the Gomati, Rama, with his swift horses,

original: mayūrahaṃsābhirutāṃ tatāra syandikāṃ nadīm // / / //
analyzed: mayūra haṃsa abhirutām tatāra syandikām nadīm
translated: crossed the river Syandî, resounding with the cries of peacocks and swans.

original: sa mahīṃ manunā rājñā dattām ikṣvākave purā /
analyzed: sa mahīm manunā rājñā dattām ikṣvākave purā
translated: The earth, given by king Manu in ancient times to Ikshvaku,

original: sphītāṃ rāṣṭrāvṛtāṃ rāmo vaidehīm anvadarśayat // / / //
analyzed: sphītām rāṣṭra āvṛtām rāmaḥ vaidehīm anvadarśayat
translated: prosperous and full of kingdoms, Rama showed to Vaidehi.

original: sūta ity eva cābhāṣya sārathiṃ tam abhīkṣṇaśaḥ /
analyzed: sūta iti eva ca ābhāṣya sārathim tam abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: And addressing the charioteer as Suta again and again,

original: haṃsamattasvaraḥ śrīmān uvāca puruṣarṣabhaḥ // / / //🔽kadāhaṃ punar āgamya sarayvāḥ puṣpite vane /
analyzed: haṃsa matta svaraḥ śrīmān uvāca puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ  kadā aham punar āgamya sarayvāḥ puṣpite vane
translated: the prosperous bull among men, with a voice like that of a swan, said:🔽When shall I again come and roam in the forest in bloom on the banks of the Sarayu,

original: mṛgayāṃ paryaṭiṣyāmi mātrā pitrā ca saṃgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: mṛgayām paryaṭiṣyāmi mātrā pitrā ca saṃgataḥ
translated: together with my mother and father?

original: nātyartham abhikāṅkṣāmi mṛgayāṃ sarayūvane /
analyzed: na atyartham abhikāṅkṣāmi mṛgayām sarayū vane
translated: I do not desire too much to hunt in the forest on the banks of the Sarayu.

original: ratir hy eṣātulā loke rājarṣigaṇasaṃmatā // / / //
analyzed: ratiḥ hi eṣā atulā loke rājarṣi gaṇa saṃmatā
translated: For this delight is incomparable in the world, approved by the royal sages.

original: sa tam adhvānam aikṣvākaḥ sūtaṃ madhurayā girā /
analyzed: sa tam adhvānam aikṣvākaḥ sūtam madhurayā girā
translated: The descendant of Ikshvaku, with sweet words,🔽spoke to the charioteer, looking at the path,

original: taṃ tam artham abhipretya yayau vākyam udīrayan // / / //
analyzed: tam tam artham abhipretya yayau vākyam udīrayan
translated: and as he went along, he spoke these words,🔽having in mind this and that matter.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: viśālān kosalān ramyān yātvā lakṣmaṇapūrvajaḥ /
analyzed: viśālān kosalān ramyān yātvā lakṣmaṇa pūrvajaḥ
translated: Having gone through the vast and beautiful Kosala country, the elder brother of Lakshmana,

original: āsasāda mahābāhuḥ śṛṅgaverapuraṃ prati // / / //🔽tatra tripathagāṃ divyāṃ śivatoyām aśaivalām /
analyzed: āsasāda mahā bāhuḥ śṛṅgavera puram prati  tatra tripathagām divyām śiva toyām a śaivalām
translated: the mighty-armed one, reached near Shringaverapura.🔽There, Raghava saw the divine Ganga, with three paths, whose waters are auspicious and free from moss,

original: dadarśa rāghavo gaṅgāṃ puṇyām ṛṣiniṣevitām // / / //🔽haṃsasārasasaṃghuṣṭāṃ cakravākopakūjitām /
analyzed: dadarśa rāghavaḥ gaṅgām puṇyām ṛṣi niṣevitām  haṃsa sārasa saṃghuṣṭām cakravāka upakūjitām
translated: the sacred river frequented by sages.🔽The river was resounding with the cries of flocks of swans and cranes, and the cackling of ruddy geese,

original: śiśumāraiś ca nakraiś ca bhujaṃgaiś ca niṣevitām // / / //
analyzed: śiśumāraiḥ ca nakraiḥ ca bhujaṃgaiḥ ca niṣevitām
translated: and was inhabited by porpoises, alligators, and serpents.

original: tām ūrmikalilāvartām anvavekṣya mahārathaḥ /
analyzed: tām ūrmi kalila āvartām anvavekṣya mahā rathaḥ
translated: The great chariot-warrior, having observed the river with its waves, eddies, and whirlpools,

original: sumantram abravīt sūtam ihaivādya vasāmahe // / / //🔽avidūrād ayaṃ nadyā bahupuṣpapravālavān /
analyzed: sumantram abravīt sūtam iha eva adya vasāmahe  avidūrāt ayam nadyāḥ bahu puṣpa pravālavān
translated: said to the charioteer Sumantra, Let us stay here today.

original: sumahān iṅgudīvṛkṣo vasāmo 'traiva sārathe // / / //
analyzed: su mahān iṅgudī vṛkṣaḥ vasāmaḥ trā eva sārathe
translated: This river is not far away, and there is a very large Ingudi tree here, with many flowers and sprouts.🔽Let us stay here itself, O charioteer.

original: lakṣaṇaś ca sumantraś ca bāḍham ity eva rāghavam /
analyzed: lakṣaṇaḥ ca sumantraḥ ca bāḍham iti eva rāghavam
translated: Lakshmana and Sumantra said to Raghava, Very well,

original: uktvā tam iṅgudīvṛkṣaṃ tadopayayatur hayaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: uktvā tam iṅgudī vṛkṣam tadā upayayatuḥ hayaiḥ
translated: and then they went to that Ingudi tree with the horses.

original: rāmo 'bhiyāya taṃ ramyaṃ vṛkṣam ikṣvākunandanaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ bhiyāya tam ramyam vṛkṣam ikṣvāku nandanaḥ
translated: Rama, the descendant of Ikshvaku, approached that beautiful tree.

original: rathād avātarat tasmāt sabhāryaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rathāt avātarat tasmāt sa bhāryaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: He descended from the chariot, along with his wife and Lakshmana.

original: sumantro 'py avatīryaiva mocayitvā hayottamān /
analyzed: sumantraḥ pi avatīrya eva mocayitvā haya uttamān
translated: Sumantra also descended and unyoked the excellent horses.

original: vṛkṣamūlagataṃ rāmam upatasthe kṛtāñjaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛkṣa mūla gatam rāmam upatasthe kṛta añjaliḥ
translated: He stood before Rama, who was seated at the foot of the tree, with folded hands.

original: tatra rājā guho nāma rāmasyātmasamaḥ sakhā /
analyzed: tatra rājā guhaḥ nāma rāmasya ātma samaḥ sakhā
translated: There was a king named Guha, Rama's equal in spirit,

original: niṣādajātyo balavān sthapatiś ceti viśrutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: niṣāda jātyaḥ balavān sthapatiḥ ca iti viśrutaḥ
translated: known as the powerful chief of the Nishadas.

original: sa śrutvā puruṣavyāghraṃ rāmaṃ viṣayam āgatam /
analyzed: sa śrutvā puruṣa vyāghram rāmam viṣayam āgatam
translated: Hearing that Rama, the best of men, had come to his realm,

original: vṛddhaiḥ parivṛto 'mātyair jñātibhiś cāpy upāgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛddhaiḥ parivṛtaḥ mātyaiḥ jñātibhiḥ ca api upāgataḥ
translated: he approached with aged ministers and kinsmen.

original: tato niṣādādhipatiṃ dṛṣṭvā dūrād avasthitam /
analyzed: tatas niṣāda adhipatim dṛṣṭvā dūrāt avasthitam
translated: Seeing the lord of the Nishadas standing at a distance,

original: saha saumitriṇā rāmaḥ samāgacchad guhena saḥ // / / //
analyzed: saha saumitriṇā rāmaḥ samāgacchat guhena saḥ
translated: Rama, along with Lakshmana, went to meet Guha.

original: tam ārtaḥ sampariṣvajya guho rāghavam abravīt /
analyzed: tam ārtaḥ sampariṣvajya guhaḥ rāghavam abravīt
translated: Guha, distressed, embraced Raghava and said,

original: yathāyodhyā tathedaṃ te rāma kiṃ karavāṇi te // / / //🔽tato guṇavadannādyam upādāya pṛthagvidham /
analyzed: yathā ayodhyā tathā idam te rāma kim karavāṇi te  tatas guṇavat annādyam upādāya pṛthagvidham
translated: O Rama, this place is like Ayodhya. What can I do for you?🔽Then, taking various kinds of delicious food and drink,

original: arghyaṃ copānayat kṣipraṃ vākyaṃ cedam uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: arghyam ca upānayat kṣipram vākyam ca idam uvāca ha
translated: he quickly offered it as a token of respect and spoke these words:

original: svāgataṃ te mahābāho taveyam akhilā mahī /
analyzed: svāgatam te mahā bāho tava iyam akhilā mahī
translated: Welcome, O mighty-armed one! This entire earth is yours.

original: vayaṃ preṣyā bhavān bhartā sādhu rājyaṃ praśādhi naḥ // / / //
analyzed: vayam preṣyāḥ bhavān bhartā sādhu rājyam praśādhi naḥ
translated: We are your servants, you are our master. Rule this kingdom righteously.

original: bhakṣyaṃ bhojyaṃ ca peyaṃ ca lehyaṃ cedam upasthitam /
analyzed: bhakṣyam bhojyam ca peyam ca lehyam ca idam upasthitam
translated: Food, drink, and other edibles are ready.

original: śayanāni ca mukhyāni vājināṃ khādanaṃ ca te // / / //
analyzed: śayanāni ca mukhyāni vājinām khādanam ca te
translated: And the best of beds and fodder for your horses are also ready.

original: guham eva bruvāṇaṃ taṃ rāghavaḥ pratyuvāca ha /
analyzed: guham eva bruvāṇam tam rāghavaḥ pratyuvāca ha
translated: To Guha, who was speaking thus, Raghava replied,

original: arcitāś caiva hṛṣṭāś ca bhavatā sarvathā vayam // / / //
analyzed: arcitāḥ ca eva hṛṣṭāḥ ca bhavatā sarvathā vayam
translated: We are honored and delighted in every way by you.

original: padbhyām abhigamāc caiva snehasaṃdarśanena ca /
analyzed: padbhyām abhigamāt ca eva sneha saṃdarśanena ca
translated: By your coming on foot and by your display of affection,

original: bhujābhyāṃ sādhuvṛttābhyāṃ pīḍayan vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: bhujābhyām sādhu vṛttābhyām pīḍayan vākyam abravīt
translated: Squeezing him with his well-behaved arms, he spoke these words:

original: diṣṭyā tvāṃ guha paśyāmi arogaṃ saha bāndhavaiḥ /
analyzed: diṣṭyā tvām guha paśyāmi arogam saha bāndhavaiḥ
translated: By good fortune, Guha, I see you well with your relatives.
