original: dvipo 'yam iti matvā hi bāṇenābhihato mayā // / / //🔽gatvā nadyās tatas tīram apaśyam iṣuṇā hṛdi /
analyzed: dvipaḥ yam iti matvā hi bāṇena abhihataḥ mayā  gatvā nadyāḥ tatas tīram apaśyam iṣuṇā hṛdi
translated: Thinking it was an elephant, I struck it with an arrow.

original: vinirbhinnaṃ gataprāṇaṃ śayānaṃ bhuvi tāpasam // / / //🔽bhagavañ śabdam ālakṣya mayā gajajighāṃsunā /
analyzed: vinirbhinnam gata prāṇam śayānam bhuvi tāpasam  śabdam ālakṣya mayā gaja jighāṃsunā
translated: Having gone to the other bank of the river, I saw a sage lying on the ground, his life departed, with an arrow in his chest.

original: visṛṣṭo 'mbhasi nārācas tena te nihataḥ sutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: visṛṣṭaḥ mbhasi nārācaḥ tena te nihataḥ sutaḥ
translated: O Lord, thinking it was the sound of an elephant, I, desiring to kill it, shot an iron arrow into the water, and by that your son was killed.

original: sa coddhṛtena bāṇena tatraiva svargam āsthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca uddhṛtena bāṇena tatra eva svargam āsthitaḥ
translated: And he, with the arrow drawn out, went to heaven right there.

original: bhagavantāv ubhau śocann andhāv iti vilapya ca // / / //
analyzed: bhagavantau ubhau śocan andhau iti vilapya ca
translated: O Lords, lamenting that both of you are blind, I cried out.

original: ajñānād bhavataḥ putraḥ sahasābhihato mayā /
analyzed: ajñānāt bhavataḥ putraḥ sahasā abhihataḥ mayā
translated: Ignorantly, your son was suddenly struck by me.

original: śeṣam evaṃgate yat syāt tat prasīdatu me muniḥ // / / //
analyzed: śeṣam evaṃgate yat syāt tat prasīdatu me muniḥ
translated: Whatever remains to be done in this situation, may the sage be pleased with me.

original: sa tac chrutvā vacaḥ krūraṃ niḥśvasañ śokakarśitaḥ /
analyzed: sa tat śrutvā vacaḥ krūram niḥśvasam śoka karśitaḥ
translated: Having heard those cruel words, he sighed, afflicted with grief,

original: mām uvāca mahātejāḥ kṛtāñjalim upasthitam // / / //
analyzed: mām uvāca mahā tejāḥ kṛta añjalim upasthitam
translated: The greatly powerful one spoke to me, as I stood before him with folded hands:

original: yady etad aśubhaṃ karma na sma me kathayeḥ svayam /
analyzed: yadi etat aśubham karma na sma me kathayeḥ svayam
translated: If you had not yourself told me about this inauspicious act,

original: phalen mūrdhā sma te rājan sadyaḥ śatasahasradhā // / / //
analyzed: phalet mūrdhā sma te rājan sadyas śata sahasradhā
translated: your head would have split into a hundred pieces, O king, as soon as you had spoken.

original: kṣatriyeṇa vadho rājan vānaprasthe viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: kṣatriyeṇa vadhaḥ rājan vānaprasthe viśeṣataḥ
translated: A Kshatriya's killing, O king, especially of one in the forest,

original: jñānapūrvaṃ kṛtaḥ sthānāc cyāvayed api vajriṇam // / / //
analyzed: jñāna pūrvam kṛtaḥ sthānāt cyāvayet api vajriṇam
translated: if done knowingly, would have dislodged even the wielder of the thunderbolt from his place.

original: ajñānāddhi kṛtaṃ yasmād idaṃ tenaiva jīvasi /
analyzed: ajñānāt hi kṛtam yasmāt idam tena eva jīvasi
translated: But since it was done unknowingly, you still live.

original: api hy adya kulaṃ na syād rāghavāṇāṃ kuto bhavān // / / //
analyzed: api hi adya kulam na syāt rāghavāṇām kutas bhavān
translated: For even today, the family of the Raghavas would have been destroyed, not to speak of you.

original: naya nau nṛpa taṃ deśam iti māṃ cābhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: naya nau nṛpa tam deśam iti mām ca abhyabhāṣata
translated: Take us to that place, O king, he said to me.

original: adya taṃ draṣṭum icchāvaḥ putraṃ paścimadarśanam // / / //
analyzed: adya tam draṣṭum icchāvaḥ putram paścima darśanam
translated: We wish to see our son today, for the last time.

original: rudhireṇāvasitāṅgaṃ prakīrṇājinavāsasam /
analyzed: rudhireṇa avasita aṅgam prakīrṇa ajina vāsasam
translated: His limbs covered with blood, his deerskin garment disheveled,

original: śayānaṃ bhuvi niḥsaṃjñaṃ dharmarājavaśaṃ gatam // / / //🔽athāham ekas taṃ deśaṃ nītvā tau bhṛśaduḥkhitau /
analyzed: śayānam bhuvi niḥsaṃjñam dharmarāja vaśam gatam  atha aham ekaḥ tam deśam nītvā tau bhṛśa duḥkhitau
translated: lying unconscious on the ground, under the sway of Yama, the king of righteousness.🔽Then I alone took them to that place, the two of them greatly afflicted with grief,

original: asparśayam ahaṃ putraṃ taṃ muniṃ saha bhāryayā // / / //
analyzed: asparśayam aham putram tam munim saha bhāryayā
translated: and made the sage and his wife touch their son.

original: tau putram ātmanaḥ spṛṣṭvā tam āsādya tapasvinau /
analyzed: tau putram ātmanaḥ spṛṣṭvā tam āsādya tapasvinau
translated: Those two ascetics, having approached their son and touched him,

original: nipetatuḥ śarīre 'sya pitā cāsyedam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: nipetatuḥ śarīre sya pitā ca asya idam abravīt
translated: fell down on his body. His father said to him:

original: na nv ahaṃ te priyaḥ putra mātaraṃ paśya dhārmika /
analyzed: na nu aham te priyaḥ putra mātaram paśya dhārmika
translated: Are you not dear to me, O son? O righteous one, see your mother.

original: kiṃ nu nāliṅgase putra sukumāra vaco vada // / / //
analyzed: kim nu nā āliṅgase putra sukumāra vacaḥ vada
translated: Why do you not embrace me, O son? Speak soft words.

original: kasya vāpararātre 'haṃ śroṣyāmi hṛdayaṃgamam /
analyzed: kasya vā apararātre haṃ śroṣyāmi hṛdayaṃgamam
translated: In the latter part of the night, whose sweet voice will I hear,

original: adhīyānasya madhuraṃ śāstraṃ vānyad viśeṣataḥ // / / //🔽ko māṃ saṃdhyām upāsyaiva snātvā hutahutāśanaḥ /
analyzed: adhīyānasya madhuram śāstram vā anyat viśeṣataḥ  kaḥ mām saṃdhyām upāsya eva snātvā huta hutāśanaḥ
translated: reciting a scripture or something else?🔽Who, having worshipped the evening, bathed, and offered oblations to the fire,

original: ślāghayiṣyaty upāsīnaḥ putraśokabhayārditam // / / //🔽kandamūlaphalaṃ hṛtvā ko māṃ priyam ivātithim /
analyzed: ślāghayiṣyati upāsīnaḥ putra śoka bhaya arditam  kanda mūla phalam hṛtvā kaḥ mām priyam iva atithim
translated: will praise me while seated, afflicted as I am by grief and fear for my son?🔽Who, having taken roots, fruits, and other things, will feed me like a dear guest,

original: bhojayiṣyaty akarmaṇyam apragraham anāyakam // / / //🔽imām andhāṃ ca vṛddhāṃ ca mātaraṃ te tapasvinīm /
analyzed: bhojayiṣyati a karmaṇyam a pragraham a nāyakam  imām andhām ca vṛddhām ca mātaram te tapasvinīm
translated: me who am incapable of work, without a bridle, and without a leader?🔽And how will I, O son, support your old and blind mother, who is afflicted,

original: kathaṃ putra bhariṣyāmi kṛpaṇāṃ putragardhinīm // / / //
analyzed: katham putra bhariṣyāmi kṛpaṇām putra gardhinīm
translated: desiring to see her son, O son?

original: tiṣṭha mā mā gamaḥ putra yamasya sadanaṃ prati /
analyzed: tiṣṭha mā mā gamaḥ putra yamasya sadanam prati
translated: Stay, do not go, O son, to Yama's abode.

original: śvo mayā saha gantāsi jananyā ca samedhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śvas mayā saha gantāsi jananyā ca samedhitaḥ
translated: Tomorrow, together with me, you will go, supported by your mother.

original: ubhāv api ca śokārtāv anāthau kṛpaṇau vane /
analyzed: ubhau api ca śoka ārtau anāthau kṛpaṇau vane
translated: Both of us are afflicted with grief, helpless and miserable in the forest.

original: kṣipram eva gamiṣyāvas tvayā hīnau yamakṣayam // / / //
analyzed: kṣipram eva gamiṣyāvaḥ tvayā hīnau yama kṣayam
translated: Deprived of you, we shall soon go to Yama's abode.

original: tato vaivasvataṃ dṛṣṭvā taṃ pravakṣyāmi bhāratīm /
analyzed: tatas vaivasvatam dṛṣṭvā tam pravakṣyāmi bhāratīm
translated: Then, seeing Vaivasvata, I shall speak these words:

original: kṣamatāṃ dharmarājo me bibhṛyāt pitarāv ayam // / / //
analyzed: kṣamatām dharmarājaḥ me bibhṛyāt pitarau ayam
translated: May Dharmaraja forgive me. Let him support my parents.

original: apāpo 'si yathā putra nihataḥ pāpakarmaṇā /
analyzed: apāpaḥ si yathā putra nihataḥ pāpa karmaṇā
translated: You are innocent, son, killed by one of sinful deeds.

original: tena satyena gacchāśu ye lokāḥ śastrayodhinām // / / //
analyzed: tena satyena gaccha āśu ye lokāḥ śastra yodhinām
translated: By that truth, quickly go to the worlds attained by those who fight with weapons.

original: yānti śūrā gatiṃ yāṃ ca saṃgrāmeṣv anivartinaḥ /
analyzed: yānti śūrāḥ gatim yām ca saṃgrāmeṣu anivartinaḥ
translated: The heroes who do not retreat in battles, to the same destination go.

original: hatās tv abhimukhāḥ putra gatiṃ tāṃ paramāṃ vraja // / / //
analyzed: hatāḥ tu abhimukhāḥ putra gatim tām paramām vraja
translated: O son, killed while facing the enemy, go to that supreme destination.

original: yāṃ gatiṃ sagaraḥ śaibyo dilīpo janamejayaḥ /
analyzed: yām gatim sagaraḥ śaibyaḥ dilīpaḥ janamejayaḥ
translated: The destination attained by Sagara, Shaibya, Dilipa, Janamejaya,

original: nahuṣo dhundhumāraś ca prāptās tāṃ gaccha putraka // / / //
analyzed: nahuṣaḥ dhundhumāraḥ ca prāptāḥ tām gaccha putraka
translated: Nahusha, and Dhundhumara - go to that destination, my son.

original: yā gatiḥ sarvasādhūnāṃ svādhyāyāt tapasā ca yā /
analyzed: yā gatiḥ sarva sādhūnām svādhyāyāt tapasā ca yā
translated: The destination of all the virtuous, attained through self-study and austerity,

original: bhūmidasyāhitāgneś ca ekapatnīvratasya ca // / / //
analyzed: bhūmi dasya āhitāgneḥ ca eka patnī vratasya ca
translated: Of one who gives land, maintains the sacred fires, and observes the vow of having only one wife.

original: gosahasrapradātḥṇāṃ yā yā gurubhṛtām api /
analyzed: go sahasra pradātḥṇām yā yā guru bhṛtām api
translated: The destination of those who give a thousand cows, who serve their teachers,

original: dehanyāsakṛtāṃ yā ca tāṃ gatiṃ gaccha putraka /
analyzed: deha nyāsa kṛtām yā ca tām gatim gaccha putraka
translated: And those who give up their bodies - go to that destination, my son.

original: na hi tv asmin kule jāto gacchaty akuśalāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: na hi tu asmin kule jātaḥ gacchati akuśalām gatim
translated: No one born in this family goes to an inauspicious state.

original: evaṃ sa kṛpaṇaṃ tatra paryadevayatāsakṛt /
analyzed: evam sa kṛpaṇam tatra paryadevayata asakṛt
translated: Thus he lamented piteously there again and again.

original: tato 'smai kartum udakaṃ pravṛttaḥ saha bhāryayā // / / //
analyzed: tatas smai kartum udakam pravṛttaḥ saha bhāryayā
translated: Then he and his wife started to offer water to him.

original: sa tu divyena rūpeṇa muniputraḥ svakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: sa tu divyena rūpeṇa muni putraḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: But the sage's son, with his divine form due to his own actions,

original: āśvāsya ca muhūrtaṃ tu pitarau vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: āśvāsya ca muhūrtam tu pitarau vākyam abravīt
translated: and having comforted his parents for a moment, spoke these words:

original: sthānam asmi mahat prāpto bhavatoḥ paricāraṇāt /
analyzed: sthānam asmi mahat prāptaḥ bhavatoḥ paricāraṇāt
translated: By serving you, I have attained a great state.

original: bhavantāv api ca kṣipraṃ mama mūlam upaiṣyataḥ // / / //🔽evam uktvā tu divyena vimānena vapuṣmatā /
analyzed: bhavantau api ca kṣipram mama mūlam upaiṣyataḥ  evam uktvā tu divyena vimānena vapuṣmatā
translated: And you two will soon come to my presence.🔽Having said this, the sage's son, who had conquered his senses,

original: āruroha divaṃ kṣipraṃ muniputro jitendriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āruroha divam kṣipram muni putraḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: quickly ascended to heaven in a beautiful celestial vehicle.

original: sa kṛtvā tūdakaṃ tūrṇaṃ tāpasaḥ saha bhāryayā /
analyzed: sa kṛtvā tu udakam tūrṇam tāpasaḥ saha bhāryayā
translated: Having quickly offered water, the ascetic along with his wife

original: mām uvāca mahātejāḥ kṛtāñjalim upasthitam // / / //
analyzed: mām uvāca mahā tejāḥ kṛta añjalim upasthitam
translated: said to me, who was standing with folded hands, the greatly energetic one:

original: adyaiva jahi māṃ rājan maraṇe nāsti me vyathā /🔽yac chareṇaikaputraṃ māṃ tvam akārṣīr aputrakam // / / //
analyzed: adyā eva jahi mām rājan maraṇe nā asti me vyathā  yat śareṇa eka putram mām tvam akārṣīḥ aputrakam
translated: Kill me today itself, O king. I have no pain in dying.🔽That you have made me childless by killing my only son with an arrow.

original: tvayā tu yad avijñānān nihato me sutaḥ śuciḥ /
analyzed: tvayā tu yat avijñānāt nihataḥ me sutaḥ śuciḥ
translated: But since you have unknowingly killed my pure son,

original: tena tvām abhiśapsyāmi suduḥkham atidāruṇam // / / //
analyzed: tena tvām abhiśapsyāmi su duḥkham ati dāruṇam
translated: Therefore, I will pronounce a curse on you, extremely painful and terrible.

original: putravyasanajaṃ duḥkhaṃ yad etan mama sāmpratam /
analyzed: putra vyasana jam duḥkham yat etat mama sāmpratam
translated: The sorrow I now have from the calamity befalling my son,

original: evaṃ tvaṃ putraśokena rājan kālaṃ kariṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: evam tvam putra śokena rājan kālam kariṣyasi
translated: O king, you will also die from grief over your son.

original: tasmān mām āgataṃ bhadre tasyodārasya tadvacaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt mām āgatam bhadre tasya udārasya tat vacaḥ
translated: Therefore, O fortunate one, those generous words have come to me,

original: yad ahaṃ putraśokena saṃtyakṣyāmy adya jīvitam // / / //
analyzed: yat aham putra śokena saṃtyakṣyāmi adya jīvitam
translated: that I will now give up my life due to grief over my son.

original: yadi māṃ saṃspṛśed rāmaḥ sakṛd adyālabheta vā /
analyzed: yadi mām saṃspṛśet rāmaḥ sakṛt adya ālabheta vā
translated: If Rama were to touch me once or embrace me,

original: na tan me sadṛśaṃ devi yan mayā rāghave kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: na tat me sadṛśam devi yat mayā rāghave kṛtam
translated: that would not be proper for me, O queen, what I have done to Raghava.

original: cakṣuṣā tvāṃ na paśyāmi smṛtir mama vilupyate /
analyzed: cakṣuṣā tvām na paśyāmi smṛtiḥ mama vilupyate
translated: I do not see you with my eyes, my memory is failing me.

original: dūtā vaivasvatasyaite kausalye tvarayanti mām // / / //
analyzed: dūtāḥ vaivasvatasya ete kausalye tvarayanti mām
translated: These messengers of Vaivasvata (Yama) are urging me, O Kausalya.

original: atas tu kiṃ duḥkhataraṃ yad ahaṃ jīvitakṣaye /
analyzed: atas tu kim duḥkhataram yat aham jīvita kṣaye
translated: What can be more painful than this that I should die

original: na hi paśyāmi dharmajñaṃ rāmaṃ satyaparākramam // / / //🔽na te manuṣyā devās te ye cāruśubhakuṇḍalam /
analyzed: na hi paśyāmi dharma jñam rāmam satya parākramam  na te manuṣyāḥ devāḥ te ye cāru śubha kuṇḍalam
translated: without seeing Rama, who knows dharma and is true to his promise?

original: mukhaṃ drakṣyanti rāmasya varṣe pañcadaśe punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mukham drakṣyanti rāmasya varṣe pañcadaśe punar
translated: Those who will see Rama's face again in the fifteenth year,🔽with beautiful auspicious earrings, are not human, they are gods.

original: padmapattrekṣaṇaṃ subhru sudaṃṣṭraṃ cārunāsikam /
analyzed: padma pattra īkṣaṇam subhru su daṃṣṭram cāru nāsikam
translated: With eyes like lotus petals, beautiful eyebrows, fine teeth, and a beautiful nose,

original: dhanyā drakṣyanti rāmasya tārādhipanibhaṃ mukham // / / //
analyzed: dhanyāḥ drakṣyanti rāmasya tārādhipa nibham mukham
translated: Blessed are they who will see Rama's face resembling the lord of stars.

original: sadṛśaṃ śāradasyendoḥ phullasya kamalasya ca /
analyzed: sadṛśam śāradasya indoḥ phullasya kamalasya ca
translated: Resembling the autumn moon and a full-blown lotus,

original: sugandhi mama nāthasya dhanyā drakṣyanti tanmukham // / / //
analyzed: sugandhi mama nāthasya dhanyāḥ drakṣyanti tat mukham
translated: The fragrant face of my lord, blessed are they who will see it.

original: nivṛttavanavāsaṃ tam ayodhyāṃ punar āgatam /
analyzed: nivṛtta vana vāsam tam ayodhyām punar āgatam
translated: Seeing him return to Ayodhya after completing his exile in the forest,

original: drakṣyanti sukhino rāmaṃ śukraṃ mārgagataṃ yathā // / / //🔽ayam ātmabhavaḥ śoko mām anātham acetanam /
analyzed: drakṣyanti sukhinaḥ rāmam śukram mārga gatam yathā  ayam ātma bhavaḥ śokaḥ mām anātham acetanam
translated: The happy people will see Rama like the moving planet Shukra.🔽This grief born of my own mind, like the current of a river eroding the bank,

original: saṃsādayati vegena yathā kūlaṃ nadīrayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃsādayati vegena yathā kūlam nadī rayaḥ
translated: Overwhelms me, helpless and senseless.

original: hā rāghava mahābāho hā mamāyāsanāśana /
analyzed: hā rāghava mahā bāho hā mama āyāsa nāśana
translated: O mighty-armed Raghava, O destroyer of my sorrow,

original: rājā daśarathaḥ śocañ jīvitāntam upāgamat // / / //
analyzed: rājā daśarathaḥ śocam jīvita antam upāgamat
translated: King Dasharatha, grieving, has met his end.

original: tathā tu dīnaṃ kathayan narādhipaḥ priyasya putrasya vivāsanāturaḥ /
analyzed: tathā tu dīnam kathayan narādhipaḥ priyasya putrasya vivāsana āturaḥ
translated: Thus lamenting pitifully, the king, afflicted by the banishment of his beloved son,

original: gate 'rdharātre bhṛśaduḥkhapīḍitas tadā jahau prāṇam udāradarśanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gate rdharātre bhṛśa duḥkha pīḍitaḥ tadā jahau prāṇam udāra darśanaḥ
translated: When half the night had passed, afflicted by intense sorrow, then gave up his life, the one of magnanimous appearance.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: atha rātryāṃ vyatītāyāṃ prātar evāpare 'hani /
analyzed: atha rātryām vyatītāyām prātar eva apare hani
translated: Then, when the night had passed, in the morning on the next day,

original: bandinaḥ paryupātiṣṭhaṃs tat pārthivaniveśanam // / / //
analyzed: bandinaḥ paryupātiṣṭhan tat pārthiva niveśanam
translated: The bards and panegyrists attended upon that royal residence.

original: tataḥ śucisamācārāḥ paryupasthānakovidāḥ /
analyzed: tatas śuci samācārāḥ paryupasthāna kovidāḥ
translated: Then, those who were pure in conduct and skilled in service,

original: strīvarṣavarabhūyiṣṭhā upatasthur yathāpuram // / / //🔽haricandanasaṃpṛktam udakaṃ kāñcanair ghaṭaiḥ /
analyzed: strī varṣavara bhūyiṣṭhāḥ upatasthuḥ yathāpuram  haricandana saṃpṛktam udakam kāñcanaiḥ ghaṭaiḥ
translated: mostly women and eunuchs, attended as before.🔽The women skilled in bathing brought water mixed with yellow sandalwood paste in golden pots,

original: āninyuḥ snānaśikṣājñā yathākālaṃ yathāvidhi // / / //🔽maṅgalālambhanīyāni prāśanīyān upaskarān /
analyzed: āninyuḥ snāna śikṣā jñāḥ yathākālam yathāvidhi  maṅgala ālambhanīyāni prāśanīyān upaskarān
translated: at the proper time and in the proper manner.

original: upaninyus tathāpy anyāḥ kumārībahulāḥ striyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: upaninyuḥ tathā api anyāḥ kumārī bahulāḥ striyaḥ
translated: Other women, mostly young girls, brought auspicious articles for bathing and other requisites.

original: atha yāḥ kosalendrasya śayanaṃ pratyanantarāḥ /
analyzed: atha yāḥ kosala indrasya śayanam pratyanantarāḥ
translated: Then, those women who were closest to the bed of the lord of Kosala,

original: tāḥ striyas tu samāgamya bhartāraṃ pratyabodhayan // / / //
analyzed: tāḥ striyaḥ tu samāgamya bhartāram pratyabodhayan
translated: they gathered together and woke up their husband.

original: tā vepathuparītāś ca rājñaḥ prāṇeṣu śaṅkitāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ vepathu parītāḥ ca rājñaḥ prāṇeṣu śaṅkitāḥ
translated: They trembled with fear and suspected danger to the king's life,

original: pratisrotas tṛṇāgrāṇāṃ sadṛśaṃ saṃcakampire // / / //
analyzed: pratisrotas tṛṇa agrāṇām sadṛśam saṃcakampire
translated: and trembled like the tips of grass against the current.

original: atha saṃvepamānānāṃ strīṇāṃ dṛṣṭvā ca pārthivam /
analyzed: atha saṃvepamānānām strīṇām dṛṣṭvā ca pārthivam
translated: Then, seeing the king while the women trembled,

original: yat tad āśaṅkitaṃ pāpaṃ tasya jajñe viniścayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat tat āśaṅkitam pāpam tasya jajñe viniścayaḥ
translated: the evil that was suspected became certain.

original: tataḥ pracukruśur dīnāḥ sasvaraṃ tā varāṅganāḥ /
analyzed: tatas pracukruśuḥ dīnāḥ sa svaram tāḥ vara aṅganāḥ
translated: Then, those beautiful women wailed piteously in loud voices.

original: kareṇava ivāraṇye sthānapracyutayūthapāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kareṇavaḥ iva araṇye sthāna pracyuta yūthapāḥ
translated: Like she-elephants in the forest, their leaders fallen and their herds scattered.

original: tāsām ākrandaśabdena sahasodgatacetane /
analyzed: tāsām ākranda śabdena sahasā udgata cetane
translated: Their consciousness suddenly awakened by the sound of their cries,

original: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca tyaktanidre babhūvatuḥ // / / //
analyzed: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca tyakta nidre babhūvatuḥ
translated: Kausalya and Sumitra abandoned their sleep.

original: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca dṛṣṭvā spṛṣṭvā ca pārthivam /
analyzed: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca dṛṣṭvā spṛṣṭvā ca pārthivam
translated: Kausalya and Sumitra, seeing and touching the king,

original: hā nātheti parikruśya petatur dharaṇītale // / / //
analyzed: hā nātha iti parikruśya petatuḥ dharaṇī tale
translated: cried out, Alas, lord! and fell down on the ground.

original: sā kosalendraduhitā veṣṭamānā mahītale /
analyzed: sā kosala indra duhitā veṣṭamānā mahī tale
translated: The daughter of the lord of Kosala, rolling on the ground,

original: na babhrāja rajodhvastā tāreva gaganacyutā // / / //
analyzed: na babhrāja rajaḥ dhvastā tārā iva gagana cyutā
translated: did not shine, covered with dust, like a star fallen from the sky.

original: tat samuttrastasaṃbhrāntaṃ paryutsukajanākulam /
analyzed: tat samuttrasta saṃbhrāntam paryutsuka jana ākulam
translated: That place, with its people frightened, agitated, and anxious,

original: sarvatas tumulākrandaṃ paritāpārtabāndhavam // / / //
analyzed: sarvatas tumula ākrandam paritāpa ārta bāndhavam
translated: with loud cries everywhere, and relatives afflicted with grief,

original: sadyo nipatitānandaṃ dīnaviklavadarśanam /🔽babhūva naradevasya sadma diṣṭāntam īyuṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sadyas nipatita ānandam dīna viklava darśanam  babhūva naradevasya sadma diṣṭāntam īyuṣaḥ
translated: with joy suddenly fallen, and a distressed and bewildered appearance,🔽was the palace of the king who had reached the end of his life.

original: atītam ājñāya tu pārthivarṣabhaṃ yaśasvinaṃ saṃparivārya patnayaḥ /
analyzed: atītam ājñāya tu pārthiva ṛṣabham yaśasvinam saṃparivārya patnayaḥ
translated: The illustrious bull among kings having passed away, his wives, surrounding him,

original: bhṛśaṃ rudantyaḥ karuṇaṃ suduḥkhitāḥ pragṛhya bāhū vyalapann anāthavat // / / //
analyzed: bhṛśam rudantyaḥ karuṇam su duḥkhitāḥ pragṛhya bāhū vyalapan anātha vat
translated: greatly wept, crying out piteously and sorrowfully, with their arms raised, lamenting like helpless ones.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tam agnim iva saṃśāntam ambuhīnam ivārṇavam /
analyzed: tam agnim iva saṃśāntam ambu hīnam iva arṇavam
translated: Like a fire that has gone out, like an ocean devoid of water,

original: hataprabham ivādityaṃ svargasthaṃ prekṣya bhūmipam // / / //
analyzed: hata prabham iva ādityam svarga stham prekṣya bhūmipam
translated: like the sun robbed of its radiance, the king was seen in heaven.

original: kausalyā bāṣpapūrṇākṣī vividhaṃ śokakarśitā /
analyzed: kausalyā bāṣpa pūrṇa akṣī vividham śoka karśitā
translated: Kausalya, her eyes filled with tears, emaciated with various sorrows,

original: upagṛhya śiro rājñaḥ kaikeyīṃ pratyabhāṣata // / / //🔽sakāmā bhava kaikeyi bhuṅkṣva rājyam akaṇṭakam /
analyzed: upagṛhya śiraḥ rājñaḥ kaikeyīm pratyabhāṣata  sa kāmā bhava kaikeyi bhuṅkṣva rājyam akaṇṭakam
translated: embracing the head of the king, spoke to Kaikeyi:🔽Be satisfied, O Kaikeyi! Enjoy the kingdom free from thorns,

original: tyaktvā rājānam ekāgrā nṛśaṃse duṣṭacāriṇi // / / //
analyzed: tyaktvā rājānam ekāgrā nṛśaṃse duṣṭa cāriṇi
translated: having abandoned the king, O cruel one, O you of wicked conduct, with undivided attention!

original: vihāya māṃ gato rāmo bhartā ca svargato mama /
analyzed: vihāya mām gataḥ rāmaḥ bhartā ca svargataḥ mama
translated: Rama has left me and gone, and my husband has gone to heaven.

original: vipathe sārthahīneva nāhaṃ jīvitum utsahe // / / //
analyzed: vipathe sārtha hīnā iva na aham jīvitum utsahe
translated: Like one on a desert path without a caravan, I do not desire to live.

original: bhartāraṃ taṃ parityajya kā strī daivatam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: bhartāram tam parityajya kā strī daivatam ātmanaḥ
translated: What woman, having abandoned that husband who is her own deity,

original: icchej jīvitum anyatra kaikeyyās tyaktadharmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: icchet jīvitum anyatra kaikeyyāḥ tyakta dharmaṇaḥ
translated: would wish to live elsewhere, except Kaikeyi, who has abandoned dharma?

original: na lubdho budhyate doṣān kiṃ pākam iva bhakṣayan /
analyzed: na lubdhaḥ budhyate doṣān kim pākam iva bhakṣayan
translated: A greedy person does not understand faults, as if eating poison.

original: kubjānimittaṃ kaikeyyā rāghavāṇāṃ kulaṃ hatam // / / //
analyzed: kubjā nimittam kaikeyyā rāghavāṇām kulam hatam
translated: For the sake of the hunchback, the Raghu dynasty has been destroyed by Kaikeyi.

original: aniyoge niyuktena rājñā rāmaṃ vivāsitam /
analyzed: aniyoge niyuktena rājñā rāmam vivāsitam
translated: The king, having appointed one who should not be appointed, has exiled Rama,

original: sabhāryaṃ janakaḥ śrutvā paritapsyaty ahaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: sa bhāryam janakaḥ śrutvā paritapsyati aham yathā
translated: having heard that Rama has gone to the forest with his wife, Janaka will grieve as I do now.

original: rāmaḥ kamalapattrākṣo jīvanāśam ito gataḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ kamala pattra akṣaḥ jīva nāśam itas gataḥ
translated: Rama, having eyes like lotus petals, has gone from here to destruction.

original: videharājasya sutā tathā sītā tapasvinī /
analyzed: videha rājasya sutā tathā sītā tapasvinī
translated: And the daughter of the king of Videha, the unfortunate Sita,

original: duḥkhasyānucitā duḥkhaṃ vane paryudvijiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: duḥkhasya anucitā duḥkham vane paryudvijiṣyati
translated: unaccustomed to sorrow, will be disgusted with the forest.

original: nadatāṃ bhīmaghoṣāṇāṃ niśāsu mṛgapakṣiṇām /
analyzed: nadatām bhīma ghoṣāṇām niśāsu mṛga pakṣiṇām
translated: Hearing the terrible cries of the birds and beasts at night,

original: niśamya nūnaṃ saṃtrastā rāghavaṃ saṃśrayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: niśamya nūnam saṃtrastā rāghavam saṃśrayiṣyati
translated: she will surely be frightened and will seek refuge with Raghava.

original: vṛddhaś caivālpaputraś ca vaidehīm anucintayan /
analyzed: vṛddhaḥ ca eva alpa putraḥ ca vaidehīm anucintayan
translated: And the old king, having few sons, thinking of Vaidehi,

original: so 'pi śokasamāviṣṭo nanu tyakṣyati jīvitam // / / //🔽tāṃ tataḥ sampariṣvajya vilapantīṃ tapasvinīm /
analyzed: saḥ pi śoka samāviṣṭaḥ nanu tyakṣyati jīvitam  tām tatas sampariṣvajya vilapantīm tapasvinīm
translated: overcome with grief, will surely give up his life.🔽Then the officials, having comforted that lamenting unfortunate one,

original: vyapaninyuḥ suduḥkhārtāṃ kausalyāṃ vyāvahārikāḥ // / / //🔽tailadroṇyām athāmātyāḥ saṃveśya jagatīpatim /
analyzed: vyapaninyuḥ su duḥkha ārtām kausalyām vyāvahārikāḥ  taila droṇyām atha amātyāḥ saṃveśya jagatīpatim
translated: took away the grief-stricken Kausalya.🔽Then the ministers, having laid the lord of the earth on a bed of oil,

original: rājñaḥ sarvāṇy athādiṣṭāś cakruḥ karmāṇy anantaram // / / //🔽na tu saṃkālanaṃ rājño vinā putreṇa mantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ sarvāṇi atha ādiṣṭāḥ cakruḥ karmāṇi anantaram  na tu saṃkālanam rājñaḥ vinā putreṇa mantriṇaḥ
translated: ordered all the rites to be performed for the king.🔽But the ministers, knowing all, did not wish to cremate the king without his son,

original: sarvajñāḥ kartum īṣus te tato rakṣanti bhūmipam // / / //
analyzed: sarva jñāḥ kartum īṣuḥ te tatas rakṣanti bhūmipam
translated: so they kept the king alive.

original: tailadroṇyāṃ tu sacivaiḥ śāyitaṃ taṃ narādhipam /
analyzed: taila droṇyām tu sacivaiḥ śāyitam tam narādhipam
translated: The ministers laid the king on a bed of oil,

original: hā mṛto 'yam iti jñātvā striyas tāḥ paryadevayan // / / //🔽bāhūn udyamya kṛpaṇā netraprasravaṇair mukhaiḥ /
analyzed: hā mṛtaḥ yam iti jñātvā striyaḥ tāḥ paryadevayan  bāhūn udyamya kṛpaṇāḥ netra prasravaṇaiḥ mukhaiḥ
translated: Thinking He is dead, those women lamented.🔽 Raising their arms, miserable, with faces streaming with tears,

original: rudantyaḥ śokasaṃtaptāḥ kṛpaṇaṃ paryadevayan // / / //
analyzed: rudantyaḥ śoka saṃtaptāḥ kṛpaṇam paryadevayan
translated: weeping, tormented by grief, they piteously lamented.

original: niśā nakṣatrahīneva strīva bhartṛvivarjitā /
analyzed: niśā nakṣatra hīnā iva strī iva bhartṛ vivarjitā
translated: The city was as if without stars in the night, or a woman abandoned by her husband.

original: purī nārājatāyodhyā hīnā rājñā mahātmanā // / / //
analyzed: purī nā arājata ayodhyā hīnā rājñā mahātmanā
translated: The city of Ayodhya was not radiant without the great king.

original: bāṣpaparyākulajanā hāhābhūtakulāṅganā /🔽śūnyacatvaraveśmāntā na babhrāja yathāpuram // / / //
analyzed: bāṣpa paryākula janā hāhā bhūta kula aṅganā  śūnya catvara veśma antā na babhrāja yathāpuram
translated: With people's faces covered in tears, and women wailing,🔽the empty crossroads and houses did not shine as before.

original: gataprabhā dyaur iva bhāskaraṃ vinā vyapetanakṣatragaṇeva śarvarī /
analyzed: gata prabhā dyauḥ iva bhāskaram vinā vyapeta nakṣatra gaṇā iva śarvarī
translated: The city was as if without the sun, the night without a multitude of stars,

original: purī babhāse rahitā mahātmanā na cāsrakaṇṭhākulamārgacatvarā // / / //
analyzed: purī babhāse rahitā mahātmanā na ca asra kaṇṭha ākula mārga catvarā
translated: deprived of the great one, with its roads and crossroads crowded with tearful people.

original: narāś ca nāryaś ca sametya saṃghaśo vigarhamāṇā bharatasya mātaram /
analyzed: narāḥ ca nāryaḥ ca sametya saṃghaśas vigarhamāṇāḥ bharatasya mātaram
translated: Men and women, having assembled in groups, censured Bharata's mother,

original: tadā nagaryāṃ naradevasaṃkṣaye babhūvur ārtā na ca śarma lebhire // / / //
analyzed: tadā nagaryām naradeva saṃkṣaye babhūvuḥ ārtāḥ na ca śarma lebhire
translated: then in the city, at the destruction of the god among men, they were afflicted and found no peace.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: vyatītāyāṃ tu śarvaryām ādityasyodaye tataḥ /
analyzed: vyatītāyām tu śarvaryām ādityasya udaye tatas
translated: But when the night had passed and the sun rose,

original: sametya rājakartāraḥ sabhām īyur dvijātayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sametya rājakartāraḥ sabhām īyuḥ dvijātayaḥ
translated: Having assembled, the royal officials and the twice-born ones went to the assembly hall.

original: mārkaṇḍeyo 'tha maudgalyo vāmadevaś ca kāśyapaḥ /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ tha maudgalyaḥ vāmadevaḥ ca kāśyapaḥ
translated: Markandeya, Maudgala, Vamadeva, Kashyapa,

original: kātyāyano gautamaś ca jābāliś ca mahāyaśāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kātyāyanaḥ gautamaḥ ca jābāliḥ ca mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Katyayana, Gautama, and the greatly illustrious Jabali,

original: ete dvijāḥ sahāmātyaiḥ pṛthag vācam udīrayan /
analyzed: ete dvijāḥ saha amātyaiḥ pṛthak vācam udīrayan
translated: these Brahmanas, together with the ministers, spoke separately,

original: vasiṣṭham evābhimukhāḥ śreṣṭhaṃ rājapurohitam // / / //🔽atītā śarvarī duḥkhaṃ yā no varṣaśatopamā /
analyzed: vasiṣṭham eva abhimukhāḥ śreṣṭham rāja purohitam  atītā śarvarī duḥkham yā naḥ varṣa śata upamā
translated: facing Vasishtha, the best of the royal priests.🔽The night that was so painful for us, as if it lasted for a hundred years, has passed.

original: asmin pañcatvam āpanne putraśokena pārthive // / / //🔽svargataś ca mahārājo rāmaś cāraṇyam āśritaḥ /
analyzed: asmin pañcatvam āpanne putra śokena pārthive  svargataḥ ca mahā rājaḥ rāmaḥ ca araṇyam āśritaḥ
translated: When the king died from grief over his son,🔽and the great king went to heaven, and Rama resorted to the forest,

original: lakṣmaṇaś cāpi tejasvī rāmeṇaiva gataḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca api tejasvī rāmeṇa eva gataḥ saha
translated: and the energetic Lakshmana also went with Rama,

original: ubhau bharataśatrughnau kekayeṣu paraṃtapau /
analyzed: ubhau bharata śatrughnau kekayeṣu paraṃtapau
translated: and both Bharata and Shatrughna, the scorchers of enemies, in the land of the Kekayas,

original: pure rājagṛhe ramye mātāmahaniveśane // / / //
analyzed: pure rāja gṛhe ramye mātāmaha niveśane
translated: in the beautiful city of Rajagriha, the residence of their maternal grandfather,

original: ikṣvākūṇām ihādyaiva kaścid rājā vidhīyatām /🔽arājakaṃ hi no rāṣṭraṃ na vināśam avāpnuyāt // / / //
analyzed: ikṣvākūṇām iha adya eva kaścid rājā vidhīyatām  arājakam hi naḥ rāṣṭram na vināśam avāpnuyāt
translated: let someone be appointed as king of the Ikshvakus here today itself.🔽For a kingdom without a king cannot escape destruction.

original: nārājake janapade vidyunmālī mahāsvanaḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade vidyut mālī mahā svanaḥ
translated: In a kingdom without a king, the thunder-wreathed (cloud) does not roar mightily,

original: abhivarṣati parjanyo mahīṃ divyena vāriṇā // / / //🔽nārājake janapade bījamuṣṭiḥ prakīryate /
analyzed: abhivarṣati parjanyaḥ mahīm divyena vāriṇā  na arājake janapade bīja muṣṭiḥ prakīryate
translated: The clouds shower rain on the earth with divine water.🔽In a country without a king, a handful of seeds is not sown.

original: nārājake pituḥ putro bhāryā vā vartate vaśe // / / //
analyzed: na arājake pituḥ putraḥ bhāryā vā vartate vaśe
translated: In a country without a king, a son does not obey his father, nor does a wife obey her husband.

original: arājake dhanaṃ nāsti nāsti bhāryāpy arājake /
analyzed: arājake dhanam na asti na asti bhāryā api arājake
translated: In a country without a king, there is no wealth, nor is there a wife.

original: idam atyāhitaṃ cānyat kutaḥ satyam arājake // / / //
analyzed: idam atyāhitam ca anyat kutas satyam arājake
translated: This is another great evil. How can there be truth in a country without a king?

original: nārājake janapade kārayanti sabhāṃ narāḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade kārayanti sabhām narāḥ
translated: In a country without a king, men do not build assembly halls.

original: udyānāni ca ramyāṇi hṛṣṭāḥ puṇyagṛhāṇi ca // / / //🔽nārājake janapade yajñaśīlā dvijātayaḥ /
analyzed: udyānāni ca ramyāṇi hṛṣṭāḥ puṇya gṛhāṇi ca  na arājake janapade yajña śīlāḥ dvijātayaḥ
translated: Delighted people do not build beautiful gardens and auspicious houses.🔽In a country without a king, twice-born people who are devoted to sacrifices,

original: sattrāṇy anvāsate dāntā brāhmaṇāḥ saṃśitavratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sattrāṇi anvāsate dāntāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ saṃśita vratāḥ
translated: controlled Brahmins of rigid vows do not perform sacrificial sessions.

original: nārājake janapade prabhūtanaṭanartakāḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade prabhūta naṭa nartakāḥ
translated: In a country without a king, there are many actors and dancers.

original: utsavāś ca samājāś ca vardhante rāṣṭravardhanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: utsavāḥ ca samājāḥ ca vardhante rāṣṭra vardhanāḥ
translated: Festivals and gatherings, which promote the growth of the kingdom, flourish.

original: nārājake janapade siddhārthā vyavahāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade siddhārthāḥ vyavahāriṇaḥ
translated: In a country without a king, successful litigants,

original: kathābhir anurajyante kathāśīlāḥ kathāpriyaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kathābhiḥ anurajyante kathā śīlāḥ kathā priyaiḥ
translated: addicted to stories, are not delighted with stories by those who love stories.

original: nārājake janapade vāhanaiḥ śīghragāmibhiḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade vāhanaiḥ śīghra gāmibhiḥ
translated: In a country without a king, people do not travel on swift vehicles.

original: narā niryānty araṇyāni nārībhiḥ saha kāminaḥ // / / //
analyzed: narāḥ niryānti araṇyāni nārībhiḥ saha kāminaḥ
translated: Men, fond of women, go out into the forest.

original: nārājake janapade dhanavantaḥ surakṣitāḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade dhanavantaḥ su rakṣitāḥ
translated: In a country without a king, the wealthy are not well protected.

original: śerate vivṛtadvārāḥ kṛṣigorakṣajīvinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śerate vivṛta dvārāḥ kṛṣi gorakṣa jīvinaḥ
translated: Those who live by agriculture and cattle-rearing sleep with their doors open.

original: nārājake janapade vaṇijo dūragāminaḥ /
analyzed: na arājake janapade vaṇijaḥ dūra gāminaḥ
translated: In a country without a king, merchants who travel far

original: gacchanti kṣemam adhvānaṃ bahupuṇyasamācitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gacchanti kṣemam adhvānam bahu puṇya samācitāḥ
translated: Go safely on their way, being full of great merit.

original: nārājake janapade caraty ekacaro vaśī /
analyzed: na arājake janapade carati ekacaraḥ vaśī
translated: In a country without a king, a self-controlled man who wanders alone,

original: bhāvayann ātmanātmānaṃ yatra sāyaṃgṛho muniḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāvayan ātmanā ātmānam yatra sāyaṃgṛhaḥ muniḥ
translated: Meditating on his own self, where the sage makes his evening home,

original: nārājake janapade yogakṣemaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: na arājake janapade yogakṣemam pravartate
translated: In a country without a king, the protection of what is to be protected is not carried out.

original: na cāpy arājake senā śatrūn viṣahate yudhi // / / //
analyzed: na ca api arājake senā śatrūn viṣahate yudhi
translated: And an army without a king cannot withstand the enemy in battle.

original: yathā hy anudakā nadyo yathā vāpy atṛṇaṃ vanam /
analyzed: yathā hi anudakāḥ nadyaḥ yathā vā api atṛṇam vanam
translated: Just as rivers are without water, or a forest without grass,

original: agopālā yathā gāvas tathā rāṣṭram arājakam // / / //
analyzed: a gopālāḥ yathā gāvaḥ tathā rāṣṭram arājakam
translated: So a country is without a king, if there are no cows protected by cowherds.

original: nārājake janapade svakaṃ bhavati kasyacit /
analyzed: na arājake janapade svakam bhavati kasyacid
translated: In a country without a king, no one's own property is secure.

original: matsyā iva narā nityaṃ bhakṣayanti parasparam // / / //
analyzed: matsyāḥ iva narāḥ nityam bhakṣayanti parasparam
translated: Men always devour each other, like fish.

original: ye hi saṃbhinnamaryādā nāstikāś chinnasaṃśayāḥ /
analyzed: ye hi saṃbhinna maryādāḥ nāstikāḥ chinna saṃśayāḥ
translated: Those whose boundaries are violated, who are atheists, whose doubts are cut off,

original: te 'pi bhāvāya kalpante rājadaṇḍanipīḍitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: te pi bhāvāya kalpante rāja daṇḍa nipīḍitāḥ
translated: They too, oppressed by the king's punishment, are fit for destruction.

original: aho tama ivedaṃ syān na prajñāyeta kiṃcana /
analyzed: aho tamaḥ iva idam syāt na prajñāyeta kiṃcana
translated: Oh, this would be like darkness, nothing would be known at all.

original: rājā cen na bhavel loke vibhajan sādhvasādhunī // / / //
analyzed: rājā ced na bhavet loke vibhajan sādhu asādhunī
translated: If there were no king in the world, distinguishing good from bad.

original: jīvaty api mahārāje tavaiva vacanaṃ vayam /
analyzed: jīvati api mahā rāje tava eva vacanam vayam
translated: Even while the great king lives, we do not transgress your words,

original: nātikramāmahe sarve velāṃ prāpyeva sāgaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: na atikramāmahe sarve velām prāpya iva sāgaraḥ
translated: just as the ocean does not overstep its shore.

original: sa naḥ samīkṣya dvijavaryavṛttaṃ nṛpaṃ vinā rājyam araṇyabhūtam /
analyzed: sa naḥ samīkṣya dvija varya vṛttam nṛpam vinā rājyam araṇya bhūtam
translated: Having seen our conduct, best among the twice-born, the kingdom without a king has become a forest.

original: kumāram ikṣvākusutaṃ vadānyaṃ tvam eva rājānam ihābhiṣiñca // / / //
analyzed: kumāram ikṣvāku sutam vadānyam tvam eva rājānam iha abhiṣiñca
translated: You yourself consecrate here the generous prince, the son of Ikshvaku, as the king.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: teṣāṃ tadvacanaṃ śrutvā vasiṣṭhaḥ pratyuvāca ha /
analyzed: teṣām tat vacanam śrutvā vasiṣṭhaḥ pratyuvāca ha
translated: Having heard their words, Vasishtha replied,

original: mitrāmātyagaṇān sarvān brāhmaṇāṃs tān idaṃ vacaḥ // / / //🔽yad asau mātulakule pure rājagṛhe sukhī /
analyzed: mitra amātya gaṇān sarvān brāhmaṇān tān idam vacaḥ  yat asau mātula kule pure rāja gṛhe sukhī
translated: to all those Brahmins, the groups of friends and ministers, these words.🔽That Bharata is happily residing in the city of Rajagriha, in his maternal uncle's house,

original: bharato vasati bhrātrā śatrughnena samanvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ vasati bhrātrā śatrughnena samanvitaḥ
translated: along with his brother Shatrughna.

original: tac chīghraṃ javanā dūtā gacchantu tvaritair hayaiḥ /
analyzed: tat śīghram javanāḥ dūtāḥ gacchantu tvaritaiḥ hayaiḥ
translated: Let swift messengers go there on swift horses.

original: ānetuṃ bhrātarau vīrau kiṃ samīkṣāmahe vayam // / / //
analyzed: ānetum bhrātarau vīrau kim samīkṣāmahe vayam
translated: To bring back the two heroic brothers. What else should we consider?

original: gacchantv iti tataḥ sarve vasiṣṭhaṃ vākyam abruvan /
analyzed: gacchantu iti tatas sarve vasiṣṭham vākyam abruvan
translated: Then all of them said to Vashishtha, Let them go.

original: teṣāṃ tadvacanaṃ śrutvā vasiṣṭho vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: teṣām tat vacanam śrutvā vasiṣṭhaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Having heard their words, Vashishtha spoke these words:

original: ehi siddhārtha vijaya jayantāśokanandana /
analyzed: ehi siddhārtha vijaya jayanta aśoka nandana
translated: Come, Siddhartha, Vijaya, Jayanta, Ashokanandana,

original: śrūyatām itikartavyaṃ sarvān eva bravīmi vaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrūyatām itikartavyam sarvān eva bravīmi vaḥ
translated: Listen to what should be done, I am telling all of you.

original: puraṃ rājagṛhaṃ gatvā śīghraṃ śīghrajavair hayaiḥ /
analyzed: puram rāja gṛham gatvā śīghram śīghra javaiḥ hayaiḥ
translated: Having gone to the city of Rajagriha on swift horses,

original: tyaktaśokair idaṃ vācyaḥ śāsanād bharato mama // / / //
analyzed: tyakta śokaiḥ idam vācyaḥ śāsanāt bharataḥ mama
translated: Those who have given up sorrow should say this by my order to Bharata:

original: purohitas tvāṃ kuśalaṃ prāha sarve ca mantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: purohitaḥ tvām kuśalam prāha sarve ca mantriṇaḥ
translated: The priest and all the ministers wish you well.

original: tvaramāṇaś ca niryāhi kṛtyam ātyayikaṃ tvayā // / / //
analyzed: tvaramāṇaḥ ca niryāhi kṛtyam ātyayikam tvayā
translated: And quickly set out, for there is an urgent matter for you.

original: mā cāsmai proṣitaṃ rāmaṃ mā cāsmai pitaraṃ mṛtam /
analyzed: mā ca asmai proṣitam rāmam mā ca asmai pitaram mṛtam
translated: And do not tell him that Rama has gone away, nor that his father has died.

original: bhavantaḥ śaṃsiṣur gatvā rāghavāṇām imaṃ kṣayam // / / //
analyzed: bhavantaḥ śaṃsiṣuḥ gatvā rāghavāṇām imam kṣayam
translated: You should go and tell him this destruction of the Raghus.

original: kauśeyāni ca vastrāṇi bhūṣaṇāni varāṇi ca /
analyzed: kauśeyāni ca vastrāṇi bhūṣaṇāni varāṇi ca
translated: And quickly take silken garments and excellent ornaments

original: kṣipram ādāya rājñaś ca bharatasya ca gacchata /
analyzed: kṣipram ādāya rājñaḥ ca bharatasya ca gacchata
translated: and go to the king and Bharata.

original: vasiṣṭhenābhyanujñātā dūtāḥ saṃtvaritā yayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: vasiṣṭhena abhyanujñātāḥ dūtāḥ saṃtvaritāḥ yayuḥ
translated: and having obtained the permission of Vashishtha, the messengers quickly departed.

original: te hastinapure gaṅgāṃ tīrtvā pratyaṅmukhā yayuḥ /
analyzed: te hastinapure gaṅgām tīrtvā pratyak mukhāḥ yayuḥ
translated: Having crossed the Ganga at Hastinapura, they proceeded westward,

original: pāñcāladeśam āsādya madhyena kurujāṅgalam // / / //🔽te prasannodakāṃ divyāṃ nānāvihagasevitām /
analyzed: pāñcāla deśam āsādya madhyena kurujāṅgalam  te prasanna udakām divyām nānā vihaga sevitām
translated: reaching the Panchala country and the middle of Kurujangala.

original: upātijagmur vegena śaradaṇḍāṃ janākulām // / / //
analyzed: upātijagmuḥ vegena śaradaṇḍām jana ākulām
translated: They swiftly approached the divine Sharadanda, filled with clear water and frequented by various birds, crowded with people.

original: nikūlavṛkṣam āsādya divyaṃ satyopayācanam /
analyzed: nikūlavṛkṣam āsādya divyam satya upayācanam
translated: Having reached the divine Nikula tree, the fulfiller of wishes,

original: abhigamyābhivādyaṃ taṃ kuliṅgāṃ prāviśan purīm // / / //
analyzed: abhigamya abhivādyam tam kuliṅgām prāviśan purīm
translated: they approached it, paid homage to it, and entered the city of Kulinga.

original: abhikālaṃ tataḥ prāpya tejo'bhibhavanāc cyutāḥ /🔽yayur madhyena vāhlīkān sudāmānaṃ ca parvatam /
analyzed: abhikālam tatas prāpya tejaḥ abhibhavanāt cyutāḥ  yayuḥ madhyena vāhlīkān sudāmānam ca parvatam
translated: Having reached Abhikala, they left Tejobhibhavana,🔽and proceeded through the middle of the Valhikas to Mount Sudama.

original: viṣṇoḥ padaṃ prekṣamāṇā vipāśāṃ cāpi śālmalīm // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ padam prekṣamāṇāḥ vipāśām ca api śālmalīm
translated: Gazing at Vishnu's footprint and the Shalmali tree of bondage,

original: te śrāntavāhanā dūtā vikṛṣṭena satā pathā /
analyzed: te śrānta vāhanāḥ dūtāḥ vikṛṣṭena satā pathā
translated: the messengers, with their mounts exhausted, traveled a long distance.

original: girivrajaṃ puravaraṃ śīghram āsedur añjasā // / / //
analyzed: girivrajam pura varam śīghram āseduḥ añjasā
translated: They quickly reached Girivraja, the best of cities.

original: bhartuḥ priyārthaṃ kularakṣaṇārthaṃ bhartuś ca vaṃśasya parigrahārtham /
analyzed: bhartuḥ priya artham kula rakṣaṇa artham bhartuḥ ca vaṃśasya parigraha artham
translated: For the sake of pleasing their master, for the sake of protecting the family, and for the sake of upholding their master's lineage,

original: aheḍamānās tvarayā sma dūtā rātryāṃ tu te tat puram eva yātāḥ // / / //
analyzed: a heḍamānāḥ tvarayā sma dūtāḥ rātryām tu te tat puram eva yātāḥ
translated: The messengers, without delay and without hesitation, went to that very city during the night.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: yām eva rātriṃ te dūtāḥ praviśanti sma tāṃ purīm /
analyzed: yām eva rātrim te dūtāḥ praviśanti sma tām purīm
translated: On the very night that the messengers entered that city,

original: bharatenāpi tāṃ rātriṃ svapno dṛṣṭo 'yam apriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharatena api tām rātrim svapnaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ yam apriyaḥ
translated: Bharata also had an unpleasant dream that night.

original: vyuṣṭām eva tu tāṃ rātriṃ dṛṣṭvā taṃ svapnam apriyam /
analyzed: vyuṣṭām eva tu tām rātrim dṛṣṭvā tam svapnam apriyam
translated: But having seen that unpleasant dream during that very night,

original: putro rājādhirājasya subhṛśaṃ paryatapyata // / / //🔽tapyamānaṃ samājñāya vayasyāḥ priyavādinaḥ /
analyzed: putraḥ rāja adhirājasya su bhṛśam paryatapyata  tapyamānam samājñāya vayasyāḥ priya vādinaḥ
translated: the son of the king of kings, the king, was greatly tormented.🔽Knowing him to be tormented, his friends, who spoke pleasantly,

original: āyāsaṃ hi vineṣyantaḥ sabhāyāṃ cakrire kathāḥ // / / //
analyzed: āyāsam hi vineṣyantaḥ sabhāyām cakrire kathāḥ
translated: in order to dispel his distress, engaged in conversation in the assembly hall.

original: vādayanti tathā śāntiṃ lāsayanty api cāpare /
analyzed: vādayanti tathā śāntim lāsayanti api ca apare
translated: Some played musical instruments, others danced for peace,

original: nāṭakāny apare prāhur hāsyāni vividhāni ca // / / //🔽sa tair mahātmā bharataḥ sakhibhiḥ priyavādibhiḥ /
analyzed: nāṭakāni apare prāhuḥ hāsyāni vividhāni ca  sa taiḥ mahātmā bharataḥ sakhibhiḥ priya vādibhiḥ
translated: others recited various dramatic and humorous stories.🔽The great-souled Bharata, the descendant of Raghu, was not delighted by those friends who spoke pleasantly

original: goṣṭhīhāsyāni kurvadbhir na prāhṛṣyata rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: goṣṭhī hāsyāni kurvadbhiḥ na prāhṛṣyata rāghavaḥ
translated: and engaged in humorous conversations.

original: tam abravīt priyasakho bharataṃ sakhibhir vṛtam /
analyzed: tam abravīt priya sakhaḥ bharatam sakhibhiḥ vṛtam
translated: His dear friend spoke to Bharata, who was surrounded by his friends:🔽O Bharata, why are you so sad?

original: suhṛdbhiḥ paryupāsīnaḥ kiṃ sakhe nānumodase // / / //
analyzed: suhṛdbhiḥ paryupāsīnaḥ kim sakhe na anumodase
translated: Seated with your friends, why do you not rejoice, friend?

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ suhṛdaṃ bharataḥ pratyuvāca ha /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam suhṛdam bharataḥ pratyuvāca ha
translated: Bharata replied to the friend who spoke thus:

original: śṛṇu tvaṃ yannimittaṃ me dainyam etad upāgatam // / / //🔽svapne pitaram adrākṣaṃ malinaṃ muktamūrdhajam /
analyzed: śṛṇu tvam yad nimittam me dainyam etat upāgatam  svapne pitaram adrākṣam malinam mukta mūrdhajam
translated: Listen to the reason why this sorrow has befallen me.🔽In a dream I saw my father, soiled, with disheveled hair,

original: patantam adriśikharāt kaluṣe gomayahrade // / / //
analyzed: patantam adri śikharāt kaluṣe gomaya hrade
translated: Falling from the peak of a mountain into a muddy cow-dung pond.

original: plavamānaś ca me dṛṣṭaḥ sa tasmin gomayahrade /
analyzed: plavamānaḥ ca me dṛṣṭaḥ sa tasmin gomaya hrade
translated: And I saw him floating in that cow-dung pond,

original: pibann añjalinā tailaṃ hasann iva muhur muhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: piban añjalinā tailam hasan iva muhur muhur
translated: Drinking oil with his cupped hands, as if laughing again and again.

original: tatas tilodanaṃ bhuktvā punaḥ punar adhaḥśirāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tilodanam bhuktvā punar punar adhaḥśirāḥ
translated: Then, having eaten sesame porridge again and again with his head down,

original: tailenābhyaktasarvāṅgas tailam evāvagāhata // / / //
analyzed: tailena abhyakta sarva aṅgaḥ tailam eva avagāhata
translated: With his entire body anointed with oil, he plunged into the oil itself.

original: svapne 'pi sāgaraṃ śuṣkaṃ candraṃ ca patitaṃ bhuvi /
analyzed: svapne pi sāgaram śuṣkam candram ca patitam bhuvi
translated: In a dream I saw the ocean dried up, and the moon fallen to the ground,

original: sahasā cāpi saṃśāntaṃ jvalitaṃ jātavedasam // / / //🔽avadīrṇāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ śuṣkāṃś ca vividhān drumān /🔽ahaṃ paśyāmi vidhvastān sadhūmāṃś caiva parvatān // / / //
analyzed: sahasā ca api saṃśāntam jvalitam jātavedasam  avadīrṇām ca pṛthivīm śuṣkān ca vividhān drumān  aham paśyāmi vidhvastān sa dhūmān ca eva parvatān
translated: And suddenly extinguished a blazing fire.🔽I saw the earth torn apart, and various dry trees,🔽And the mountains shattered, with smoke.

original: pīṭhe kārṣṇāyase cainaṃ niṣaṇṇaṃ kṛṣṇavāsasam /
analyzed: pīṭhe kārṣṇāyase ca enam niṣaṇṇam kṛṣṇa vāsasam
translated: I saw him seated on a black iron throne, dressed in black garments,

original: prahasanti sma rājānaṃ pramadāḥ kṛṣṇapiṅgalāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prahasanti sma rājānam pramadāḥ kṛṣṇa piṅgalāḥ
translated: The women, with black and tawny hair, laughed at the king.

original: tvaramāṇaś ca dharmātmā raktamālyānulepanaḥ /
analyzed: tvaramāṇaḥ ca dharma ātmā rakta mālya anulepanaḥ
translated: And the righteous one, adorned with red garlands and unguents,

original: rathena kharayuktena prayāto dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rathena khara yuktena prayātaḥ dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ
translated: hurriedly departed facing south in a chariot drawn by asses.

original: evam etan mayā dṛṣṭam imāṃ rātriṃ bhayāvahām /
analyzed: evam etat mayā dṛṣṭam imām rātrim bhaya āvahām
translated: Thus I saw this terrifying night.

original: ahaṃ rāmo 'tha vā rājā lakṣmaṇo vā mariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: aham vā rājā lakṣmaṇaḥ vā mariṣyati
translated: Either I, Rama, the king, or Lakshmana will die.

original: naro yānena yaḥ svapne kharayuktena yāti hi /
analyzed: naraḥ yānena yaḥ svapne khara yuktena yāti hi
translated: A man who goes in a dream by a vehicle drawn by asses,

original: acirāt tasya dhūmāgraṃ citāyāṃ sampradṛśyate /
analyzed: acirāt tasya dhūma agram citāyām sampradṛśyate
translated: before long the top of his funeral pyre is seen.

original: etannimittaṃ dīno 'haṃ tan na vaḥ pratipūjaye // / / //
analyzed: etad nimittam dīnaḥ ham tat na vaḥ pratipūjaye
translated: For this reason I am distressed, therefore I do not honor you.

original: śuṣyatīva ca me kaṇṭho na svastham iva me manaḥ /
analyzed: śuṣyati iva ca me kaṇṭhaḥ na svastham iva me manaḥ
translated: My throat is drying up, my mind is not at ease,

original: jugupsann iva cātmānaṃ na ca paśyāmi kāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: jugupsan iva ca ātmānam na ca paśyāmi kāraṇam
translated: as if disgusted with myself, but I do not see the reason.

original: imāṃ hi duḥsvapnagatiṃ niśāmya tām anekarūpām avitarkitāṃ purā /
analyzed: imām hi duḥsvapna gatim niśāmya tām aneka rūpām a vitarkitām purā
translated: Having seen this course of bad dreams, with many forms, never before thought of,

original: bhayaṃ mahat taddhṛdayān na yāti me vicintya rājānam acintyadarśanam // / / //🔽Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: bhayam mahat tat hṛdayāt na yāti me vicintya rājānam acintya darśanam 🔽rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: that great fear does not leave my heart, thinking of the king of inconceivable appearance.

original: bharate bruvati svapnaṃ dūtās te klāntavāhanāḥ /
analyzed: bharate bruvati svapnam dūtāḥ te klānta vāhanāḥ
translated: When Bharata was describing the dream, the messengers, with their tired animals,

original: praviśyāsahyaparikhaṃ ramyaṃ rājagṛhaṃ puram // / / //
analyzed: praviśya asahya parikham ramyam rājagṛham puram
translated: entered the beautiful city of Rajagriha, with its impassable ramparts.

original: samāgamya tu rājñā ca rājaputreṇa cārcitāḥ /
analyzed: samāgamya tu rājñā ca rāja putreṇa ca arcitāḥ
translated: Having met with the king and the prince and been honored by them,

original: rājñaḥ pādau gṛhītvā tu tam ūcur bharataṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rājñaḥ pādau gṛhītvā tu tam ūcuḥ bharatam vacaḥ
translated: they grasped the king's feet and spoke these words to Bharata:

original: purohitas tvā kuśalaṃ prāha sarve ca mantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: purohitaḥ tvā kuśalam prāha sarve ca mantriṇaḥ
translated: The priest and all the ministers wish you well.

original: tvaramāṇaś ca niryāhi kṛtyam ātyayikaṃ tvayā // / / //
analyzed: tvaramāṇaḥ ca niryāhi kṛtyam ātyayikam tvayā
translated: Hurry and set out, for there is an urgent matter for you.

original: atra viṃśatikoṭyas tu nṛpater mātulasya te /
analyzed: atra viṃśati koṭyaḥ tu nṛpateḥ mātulasya te
translated: Here are twenty kotis belonging to the king, your maternal uncle,🔽and ten complete kotis, O prince,

original: daśakoṭyas tu sampūrṇās tathaiva ca nṛpātmaja // / / //🔽pratigṛhya ca tat sarvaṃ svanuraktaḥ suhṛjjane /
analyzed: daśa koṭyaḥ tu sampūrṇāḥ tathā eva ca nṛpa ātmaja  pratigṛhya ca tat sarvam su anuraktaḥ suhṛd jane
translated: and also ten kotis belonging to the king, your father.🔽Having accepted all that, Bharata, devoted to his well-wishing people,

original: dūtān uvāca bharataḥ kāmaiḥ sampratipūjya tān // / / //
analyzed: dūtān uvāca bharataḥ kāmaiḥ sampratipūjya tān
translated: spoke to the messengers after honoring them with gifts:

original: kaccit sukuśalī rājā pitā daśaratho mama /
analyzed: kaccit su kuśalī rājā pitā daśarathaḥ mama
translated: Is my father, King Dasharatha, well?

original: kaccic cārogatā rāme lakṣmaṇe vā mahātmani // / / //
analyzed: kaccit ca arogatāḥ rāme lakṣmaṇe vā mahātmani
translated: Are Rama and the great-souled Lakshmana well?

original: āryā ca dharmaniratā dharmajñā dharmadarśinī /
analyzed: āryā ca dharma niratā dharma jñā dharma darśinī
translated: And is the noble Kausalyā, devoted to dharma, who knows dharma and sees dharma,

original: arogā cāpi kausalyā mātā rāmasya dhīmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: arogā ca api kausalyā mātā rāmasya dhīmataḥ
translated: and the mother of the wise Rama, free from illness?

original: kaccit sumitrā dharmajñā jananī lakṣmaṇasya yā /
analyzed: kaccit sumitrā dharma jñā jananī lakṣmaṇasya yā
translated: I hope Sumitra, the mother of Lakshmana, who knows dharma, is well, along with her son, and the king's daughter-in-law, the daughter of the king of Videha.

original: śatrughnasya ca vīrasya sārogā cāpi madhyamā // / / //🔽ātmakāmā sadā caṇḍī krodhanā prājñamāninī /
analyzed: śatrughnasya ca vīrasya sārogā ca api madhyamā  ātma kāmā sadā caṇḍī krodhanā prājña māninī
translated: Is Sumitra, the mother of Lakshmana, who knows the ways of righteousness, and the middle one, the mother of the heroic Shatrughna, free from disease?

original: arogā cāpi kaikeyī mātā me kim uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: arogā ca api kaikeyī mātā me kim uvāca ha
translated: Is Kaikeyi, my mother, who is always self-willed, fierce, wrathful, and proud of her wisdom, free from disease? What did she say to you?

original: evam uktās tu te dūtā bharatena mahātmanā /
analyzed: evam uktāḥ tu te dūtāḥ bharatena mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great Bharata, the messengers,

original: ūcuḥ sampraśritaṃ vākyam idaṃ taṃ bharataṃ tadā /
analyzed: ūcuḥ sampraśritam vākyam idam tam bharatam tadā
translated: with folded hands, spoke these words to Bharata:

original: kuśalās te naravyāghra yeṣāṃ kuśalam icchasi // / / //
analyzed: kuśalāḥ te nara vyāghra yeṣām kuśalam icchasi
translated: O tiger among men, we wish you well, and those for whom you inquire are all well.

original: bharataś cāpi tān dūtān evam ukto 'bhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: bharataḥ ca api tān dūtān evam uktaḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: Bharata, thus addressed, replied to the messengers:

original: āpṛcche 'haṃ mahārājaṃ dūtāḥ saṃtvarayanti mām // / / //
analyzed: āpṛcche ham mahā rājam dūtāḥ saṃtvarayanti mām
translated: I take leave of the great king, the messengers urge me to haste.

original: evam uktvā tu tān dūtān bharataḥ pārthivātmajaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā tu tān dūtān bharataḥ pārthiva ātmajaḥ
translated: Having thus spoken to the messengers, Bharata, the son of the king,

original: dūtaiḥ saṃcodito vākyaṃ mātāmaham uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: dūtaiḥ saṃcoditaḥ vākyam mātāmaham uvāca ha
translated: urged by the messengers, spoke to his maternal grandfather:

original: rājan pitur gamiṣyāmi sakāśaṃ dūtacoditaḥ /
analyzed: rājan pituḥ gamiṣyāmi sakāśam dūta coditaḥ
translated: O king, urged by the messengers, I am going to my father.

original: punar apy aham eṣyāmi yadā me tvaṃ smariṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: punar api aham eṣyāmi yadā me tvam smariṣyasi
translated: I shall return again when you remember me.

original: bharatenaivam uktas tu nṛpo mātāmahas tadā /
analyzed: bharatena evam uktaḥ tu nṛpaḥ mātāmahaḥ tadā
translated: Thus addressed by Bharata, the king, the maternal grandfather,

original: tam uvāca śubhaṃ vākyaṃ śirasy āghrāya rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: tam uvāca śubham vākyam śirasi āghrāya rāghavam
translated: And having smelt the head of Rāghava, spoke to him these auspicious words:

original: gaccha tātānujāne tvāṃ kaikeyī suprajās tvayā /
analyzed: gaccha tāta anujāne tvām kaikeyī su prajāḥ tvayā
translated: Go, my son, I give you leave. Kaikeyi is well-favored by you.

original: mātaraṃ kuśalaṃ brūyāḥ pitaraṃ ca paraṃtapa // / / //
analyzed: mātaram kuśalam brūyāḥ pitaram ca paraṃtapa
translated: And tell my mother and father, O scorcher of enemies, that all is well with you.

original: purohitaṃ ca kuśalaṃ ye cānye dvijasattamāḥ /
analyzed: purohitam ca kuśalam ye ca anye dvijasattamāḥ
translated: And tell the priest that all is well with you, and the other best of Brahmanas.

original: tau ca tāta maheṣvāsau bhrātarau rāmalakṣmaṇau // / / //🔽tasmai hastyuttamāṃś citrān kambalān ajināni ca /
analyzed: tau ca tāta mahā iṣvāsau bhrātarau rāma lakṣmaṇau  tasmai hasti uttamān citrān kambalān ajināni ca
translated: And, my son, those two great bowmen, your brothers Rama and Lakshmana,

original: abhisatkṛtya kaikeyo bharatāya dhanaṃ dadau // / / //🔽rukmaniṣkasahasre dve ṣoḍaśāśvaśatāni ca /
analyzed: abhisatkṛtya kaikeyaḥ bharatāya dhanam dadau  rukma niṣka sahasre dve ṣoḍaśa aśva śatāni ca
translated: Having honored him, Kaikeya gave Bharata wealth, excellent and colorful elephants, blankets and deer-skins.

original: satkṛtya kaikeyī putraṃ kekayo dhanam ādiśat // / / //🔽tathāmātyān abhipretān viśvāsyāṃś ca guṇānvitān /
analyzed: satkṛtya kaikeyī putram kekayaḥ dhanam ādiśat  tathā amātyān abhipretān viśvāsyān ca guṇa anvitān
translated: And having honored his son, Kaikeya gave wealth, two thousand gold coins and sixteen hundred horses.

original: dadāv aśvapatiḥ śīghraṃ bharatāyānuyāyinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dadau aśvapatiḥ śīghram bharatāya anuyāyinaḥ
translated: And Aśvapati quickly gave to Bharata's followers the trusted and virtuous ministers he had chosen,

original: airāvatān aindraśirān nāgān vai priyadarśanān /
analyzed: airāvatān aindraśirān nāgān vai priya darśanān
translated: And elephants from Airāvata and Indra's stable, lovely elephants,

original: kharāñ śīghrān susaṃyuktān mātulo 'smai dhanaṃ dadau // / / //
analyzed: kharām śīghrān su saṃyuktān mātulaḥ smai dhanam dadau
translated: swift and well-harnessed, his maternal uncle gave as wealth to him.

original: antaḥpure 'tisaṃvṛddhān vyāghravīryabalānvitān /
analyzed: antaḥpure ti saṃvṛddhān vyāghra vīrya bala anvitān
translated: And the huge tigers, grown up in the inner apartments, endowed with the prowess and strength of tigers,

original: daṃṣṭrāyudhān mahākāyāñ śunaś copāyanaṃ dadau // / / //
analyzed: daṃṣṭra āyudhān mahā kāyām śunaḥ ca upāyanam dadau
translated: And gave as presents dogs with tusks for weapons and huge bodies.

original: sa mātāmaham āpṛcchya mātulaṃ ca yudhājitam /
analyzed: sa mātāmaham āpṛcchya mātulam ca yudhājitam
translated: Having taken leave of his maternal grandfather and maternal uncle Yudhajit,

original: ratham āruhya bharataḥ śatrughnasahito yayau // / / //
analyzed: ratham āruhya bharataḥ śatrughna sahitaḥ yayau
translated: Bharata, accompanied by Shatrughna, ascended the chariot and departed.

original: rathān maṇḍalacakrāṃś ca yojayitvā paraḥśatam /
analyzed: rathān maṇḍala cakrān ca yojayitvā paraḥśatam
translated: Having yoked one hundred and one chariots with circular wheels,

original: uṣṭrago'śvakharair bhṛtyā bharataṃ yāntam anvayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: uṣṭra go śva kharaiḥ bhṛtyāḥ bharatam yāntam anvayuḥ
translated: The servants followed Bharata as he departed on camels, cows, horses and donkeys.

original: balena gupto bharato mahātmā sahāryakasyātmasamair amātyaiḥ /
analyzed: balena guptaḥ bharataḥ mahātmā saha āryakasya ātma samaiḥ amātyaiḥ
translated: The great-souled Bharata, protected by his army, together with his ministers who were equal to him in spirit,

original: ādāya śatrughnam apetaśatrur gṛhād yayau siddha ivendralokāt // / / //
analyzed: ādāya śatrughnam apeta śatruḥ gṛhāt yayau siddhaḥ iva indra lokāt
translated: Taking Shatrughna with him, departed from the house like a perfected being from Indra's world, with his enemies destroyed.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: sa prāṅmukho rājagṛhād abhiniryāya vīryavān /
analyzed: sa prāc mukhaḥ rājagṛhāt abhiniryāya vīryavān
translated: The valiant one, facing east, departed from the royal palace.

original: hrādinīṃ dūrapārāṃ ca pratyaksrotastaraṃgiṇīm /
analyzed: hrādinīm dūrapārām ca pratyak srotaḥ taraṃgiṇīm
translated: The roaring, far-reaching, swift-flowing river with waves,

original: śatadrūm atarac chrīmān nadīm ikṣvākunandanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śatadrūm atarat śrīmān nadīm ikṣvāku nandanaḥ
translated: The prosperous descendant of the Ikshvaku lineage crossed the Shatadru river.

original: elādhāne nadīṃ tīrtvā prāpya cāparaparpaṭān /
analyzed: elādhāne nadīm tīrtvā prāpya ca apara parpaṭān
translated: Having crossed the river at Eladhana and reached the Aparaparpata mountains,

original: śilām ākurvatīṃ tīrtvā āgneyaṃ śalyakartanam // / / //
analyzed: śilām ākurvatīm tīrtvā āgneyam śalya kartanam
translated: Having crossed the Shila-akurvati river, the southern Shalyakartana mountain,

original: satyasaṃdhaḥ śuciḥ śrīmān prekṣamāṇaḥ śilāvahām /
analyzed: satya saṃdhaḥ śuciḥ śrīmān prekṣamāṇaḥ śilāvahām
translated: The truth-bound, pure and prosperous one, looking at the Shila-vaha mountain,

original: atyayāt sa mahāśailān vanaṃ caitrarathaṃ prati // / / //
analyzed: atyayāt sa mahā śailān vanam caitraratham prati
translated: Crossing the great mountains, he reached the forest of Chitraratha.

original: veginīṃ ca kuliṅgākhyāṃ hrādinīṃ parvatāvṛtām /
analyzed: veginīm ca kuliṅga ākhyām hrādinīm parvata āvṛtām
translated: The swift river called Kulinga, resounding, surrounded by mountains,

original: yamunāṃ prāpya saṃtīrṇo balam āśvāsayat tadā // / / //
analyzed: yamunām prāpya saṃtīrṇaḥ balam āśvāsayat tadā
translated: Having reached the Yamuna and crossed it, he comforted the army then.

original: śītīkṛtya tu gātrāṇi klāntān āśvāsya vājinaḥ /
analyzed: śītīkṛtya tu gātrāṇi klāntān āśvāsya vājinaḥ
translated: Having cooled his limbs and comforted the tired horses,

original: tatra snātvā ca pītvā ca prāyād ādāya codakam // / / //
analyzed: tatra snātvā ca pītvā ca prāyāt ādāya ca udakam
translated: Having bathed there, drunk, and taken water, he proceeded.

original: rājaputro mahāraṇyam anabhīkṣṇopasevitam /
analyzed: rāja putraḥ mahā araṇyam anabhīkṣṇa upasevitam
translated: The prince, in a great forest rarely visited,

original: bhadro bhadreṇa yānena mārutaḥ kham ivātyayāt // / / //
analyzed: bhadraḥ bhadreṇa yānena mārutaḥ kham iva atyayāt
translated: The fortunate one, in a fortunate vehicle, passed through the sky like the wind.

original: toraṇaṃ dakṣiṇārdhena jambūprastham upāgamat /
analyzed: toraṇam dakṣiṇa ardhena jambūprastham upāgamat
translated: To the south of the gateway, he reached Jambuprastha,

original: varūthaṃ ca yayau ramyaṃ grāmaṃ daśarathātmajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: varūtham ca yayau ramyam grāmam daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: And Dasha Ratha's son went to the beautiful village of Varutha.

original: tatra ramye vane vāsaṃ kṛtvāsau prāṅmukho yayau /
analyzed: tatra ramye vane vāsam kṛtvā asau prāc mukhaḥ yayau
translated: Having dwelt there in the beautiful forest, he proceeded east,

original: udyānam ujjihānāyāḥ priyakā yatra pādapāḥ // / / //🔽sālāṃs tu priyakān prāpya śīghrān āsthāya vājinaḥ /
analyzed: udyānam ujjihānāyāḥ priyakāḥ yatra pādapāḥ  sālān tu priyakān prāpya śīghrān āsthāya vājinaḥ
translated: To the garden of Ujjihvana, where there were priyaka trees.🔽Having reached the priyaka trees, and mounting the swift horses,

original: anujñāpyātha bharato vāhinīṃ tvarito yayau // / / //
analyzed: anujñāpya atha bharataḥ vāhinīm tvaritaḥ yayau
translated: Bharata, having taken leave of the army, proceeded quickly.

original: vāsaṃ kṛtvā sarvatīrthe tīrtvā cottānikāṃ nadīm /
analyzed: vāsam kṛtvā sarva tīrthe tīrtvā ca uttānikām nadīm
translated: Having dwelt at Sarvatirtha and crossed the river Uttanika,

original: anyā nadīś ca vividhāḥ pārvatīyais turaṃgamaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: anyāḥ nadīḥ ca vividhāḥ pārvatīyaiḥ turaṃgamaiḥ
translated: And other rivers of various kinds with horses from the mountains.

original: hastipṛṣṭhakam āsādya kuṭikām atyavartata /
analyzed: hastipṛṣṭhakam āsādya kuṭikām atyavartata
translated: And having reached Hastīpṛṣṭhaka, he crossed the Kuṭikā.

original: tatāra ca naravyāghro lauhitye sa kapīvatīm /
analyzed: tatāra ca nara vyāghraḥ lauhitye sa kapīvatīm
translated: And the tiger among men crossed the Lohitā and Kapīvatī,

original: ekasāle sthāṇumatīṃ vinate gomatīṃ nadīm // / / //
analyzed: ekasāle sthāṇumatīm vinate gomatīm nadīm
translated: The Ekasaṃsthāna, Sthāṇumati, and the river Gomati that flows to the south.

original: kaliṅganagare cāpi prāpya sālavanaṃ tadā /
analyzed: kaliṅga nagare ca api prāpya sāla vanam tadā
translated: And having reached the Sāla forest in the city of Kaliṅga,

original: bharataḥ kṣipram āgacchat supariśrāntavāhanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ kṣipram āgacchat su pariśrānta vāhanaḥ
translated: Bharata quickly arrived, his mounts greatly exhausted.

original: vanaṃ ca samatītyāśu śarvaryām aruṇodaye /
analyzed: vanam ca samatītya āśu śarvaryām aruṇa udaye
translated: And having quickly crossed the forest at dawn, at sunrise,

original: ayodhyāṃ manunā rājñā nirmitāṃ sa dadarśa ha // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām manunā rājñā nirmitām sa dadarśa ha
translated: he saw Ayodhyā, built by King Manu.

original: tāṃ purīṃ puruṣavyāghraḥ saptarātroṣiṭaḥ pathi /
analyzed: tām purīm puruṣa vyāghraḥ sapta rātra uṣiṭaḥ pathi
translated: Having stayed on the road for seven nights, the tiger among men,

original: ayodhyām agrato dṛṣṭvā rathe sārathim abravīt // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām agratas dṛṣṭvā rathe sārathim abravīt
translated: seeing Ayodhyā in front, spoke to the charioteer in the chariot:

original: eṣā nātipratītā me puṇyodyānā yaśasvinī /
analyzed: eṣā na ati pratītā me puṇya udyānā yaśasvinī
translated: This illustrious city with auspicious gardens,

original: ayodhyā dṛśyate dūrāt sārathe pāṇḍumṛttikā // / / //🔽yajvabhir guṇasampannair brāhmaṇair vedapāragaiḥ /
analyzed: ayodhyā dṛśyate dūrāt sārathe pāṇḍu mṛttikā  yajvabhiḥ guṇa sampannaiḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ vedapāragaiḥ
translated: Ayodhyā is seen from afar, O charioteer, with its pale soil.🔽It is mostly crowded with prosperous sacrificers, virtuous Brahmins who have mastered the Vedas,

original: bhūyiṣṭham ṛddhair ākīrṇā rājarṣivarapālitā // / / //
analyzed: bhūyiṣṭham ṛddhaiḥ ākīrṇā rājarṣi vara pālitā
translated: and is ruled by the best of royal sages.

original: ayodhyāyāṃ purā śabdaḥ śrūyate tumulo mahān /
analyzed: ayodhyāyām purā śabdaḥ śrūyate tumulaḥ mahān
translated: In the past, a great and tumultuous sound was heard in Ayodhya,

original: samantān naranārīṇāṃ tam adya na śṛṇomy aham // / / //
analyzed: samantāt nara nārīṇām tam adya na śṛṇomi aham
translated: of men and women all around. But today I do not hear it.

original: udyānāni hi sāyāhne krīḍitvoparatair naraiḥ /🔽samantād vipradhāvadbhiḥ prakāśante mamānyadā // / / //
analyzed: udyānāni hi sāyāhne krīḍitvā uparataiḥ naraiḥ  samantāt vipradhāvadbhiḥ prakāśante mama anyadā
translated: In the past, the gardens shone with men who had finished playing in the evening,🔽running around in all directions.

original: tāny adyānurudantīva parityaktāni kāmibhiḥ /
analyzed: tāni adyā anurudanti iva parityaktāni kāmibhiḥ
translated: But today, abandoned by lovers, they seem to be weeping.

original: araṇyabhūteva purī sārathe pratibhāti me // / / //🔽na hy atra yānair dṛśyante na gajair na ca vājibhiḥ /
analyzed: araṇya bhūtā iva purī sārathe pratibhāti me  na hi atra yānaiḥ dṛśyante na gajaiḥ na ca vājibhiḥ
translated: O charioteer, the city appears to me like a wilderness.🔽For here, as before, the foremost men are not seen going out or coming in,

original: niryānto vābhiyānto vā naramukhyā yathāpuram // / / //
analyzed: niryāntaḥ vā abhiyāntaḥ vā nara mukhyāḥ yathāpuram
translated: either by vehicles or by elephants or by horses.

original: aniṣṭāni ca pāpāni paśyāmi vividhāni ca /
analyzed: aniṣṭāni ca pāpāni paśyāmi vividhāni ca
translated: I see various inauspicious and evil omens,

original: nimittāny amanojñāni tena sīdati me manaḥ // / / //🔽dvāreṇa vaijayantena prāviśac chrāntavāhanaḥ /
analyzed: nimittāni amanojñāni tena sīdati me manaḥ  dvāreṇa vaijayantena prāviśat śrānta vāhanaḥ
translated: unpleasant signs. Therefore my mind is sinking.🔽With his vehicles tired, he entered through the Vaijayanta gate.

original: dvāḥsthair utthāya vijayaṃ pṛṣṭas taiḥ sahito yayau // / / //🔽sa tv anekāgrahṛdayo dvāḥsthaṃ pratyarcya taṃ janam /
analyzed: dvāḥsthaiḥ utthāya vijayam pṛṣṭaḥ taiḥ sahitaḥ yayau  sa tu aneka agra hṛdayaḥ dvāḥstham pratyarcya tam janam
translated: Having been asked about his victory by the gatekeepers, he went with them.🔽But with a distracted heart, Raghava, having greeted the people at the gate,

original: sūtam aśvapateḥ klāntam abravīt tatra rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sūtam aśvapateḥ klāntam abravīt tatra rāghavaḥ
translated: spoke to the tired charioteer of Ashvapati there.

original: śrutā no yādṛśāḥ pūrvaṃ nṛpatīnāṃ vināśane /
analyzed: śrutāḥ naḥ yādṛśāḥ pūrvam nṛpatīnām vināśane
translated: I have heard what the omens were in the past when kings were destroyed,

original: ākārās tān ahaṃ sarvān iha paśyāmi sārathe // / / //🔽malinaṃ cāśrupūrṇākṣaṃ dīnaṃ dhyānaparaṃ kṛśam /
analyzed: ākārāḥ tān aham sarvān iha paśyāmi sārathe  malinam ca aśru pūrṇa akṣam dīnam dhyāna param kṛśam
translated: and I see all those same signs here, charioteer.

original: sastrīpuṃsaṃ ca paśyāmi janam utkaṇṭhitaṃ pure // / / //
analyzed: sa strī puṃsam ca paśyāmi janam utkaṇṭhitam pure
translated: I see people in the city, both men and women, with dirty faces, eyes full of tears, dejected, absorbed in thought, and emaciated.

original: ity evam uktvā bharataḥ sūtaṃ taṃ dīnamānasaḥ /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā bharataḥ sūtam tam dīna mānasaḥ
translated: Having said this, Bharata, with a sorrowful mind,

original: tāny aniṣṭāny ayodhyāyāṃ prekṣya rājagṛhaṃ yayau /🔽tāṃ śūnyaśṛṅgāṭakaveśmarathyāṃ rajo'ruṇadvārakapāṭayantrām // / / //
analyzed: tāni aniṣṭāni ayodhyāyām prekṣya rāja gṛham yayau  tām śūnya śṛṅgāṭaka veśma rathyām raja uruṇa dvāra kapāṭa yantrām
translated: seeing those inauspicious things in Ayodhya, went to the royal palace.🔽Seeing that city, which was like Indra's city, with its empty crossroads, houses, and streets, its doors and bolts reddened with dust,

original: dṛṣṭvā purīm indrapurīprakāśāṃ duḥkhena sampūrṇataro babhūva /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā purīm indra purī prakāśām duḥkhena sampūrṇataraḥ babhūva
translated: he became even more filled with sorrow.

original: bahūni paśyan manaso 'priyāṇi yāny anyadā nāsya pure babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: bahūni paśyan manasaḥ priyāṇi yāni anyadā na asya pure babhūvuḥ
translated: Seeing many things that were unpleasant to the mind, which had not existed in the city before,

original: avākśirā dīnamanā na hṛṣṭaḥ pitur mahātmā praviveśa veśma // / / //
analyzed: avākśirāḥ dīna manāḥ na hṛṣṭaḥ pituḥ mahātmā praviveśa veśma
translated: with his head hanging down, his mind dejected, and not rejoicing, the great-souled one entered his father's palace.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽apaśyaṃs tu tatas tatra pitaraṃ pitur ālaye /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  apaśyān tu tatas tatra pitaram pituḥ ālaye
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.🔽Not seeing his father there in his father's abode,

original: jagāma bharato draṣṭuṃ mātaraṃ mātur ālaye // / / //
analyzed: jagāma bharataḥ draṣṭum mātaram mātuḥ ālaye
translated: Bharata went to see his mother in his mother's abode.

original: anuprāptaṃ tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā kaikeyī proṣitaṃ sutam /
analyzed: anuprāptam tu tam dṛṣṭvā kaikeyī proṣitam sutam
translated: Seeing her son returned from exile, Kaikeyi

original: utpapāta tadā hṛṣṭā tyaktvā sauvarṇamānasam // / / //🔽sa praviśyaiva dharmātmā svagṛhaṃ śrīvivarjitam /
analyzed: utpapāta tadā hṛṣṭā tyaktvā sauvarṇa mānasam  sa praviśya eva dharma ātmā sva gṛham śrī vivarjitam
translated: rose up in delight, leaving her golden seat.🔽The righteous Bharata, entering his own house, which was shorn of prosperity,

original: bharataḥ prekṣya jagrāha jananyāś caraṇau śubhau // / / //🔽taṃ mūrdhni samupāghrāya pariṣvajya yaśasvinam /
analyzed: bharataḥ prekṣya jagrāha jananyāḥ caraṇau śubhau  tam mūrdhni samupāghrāya pariṣvajya yaśasvinam
translated: saw his mother and embraced her feet.🔽She smelt the head of the illustrious Bharata and embraced him,

original: aṅke bharatam āropya praṣṭuṃ samupacakrame // / / //
analyzed: aṅke bharatam āropya praṣṭum samupacakrame
translated: and placing him on her lap, began to question him.

original: adya te katicid rātryaś cyutasyāryakaveśmanaḥ /
analyzed: adya te katicid rātryaḥ cyutasya āryaka veśmanaḥ
translated: How many nights have passed since you left the house of your noble brother?

original: api nādhvaśramaḥ śīghraṃ rathenāpatatas tava // / / //
analyzed: api na adhva śramaḥ śīghram rathena āpatataḥ tava
translated: Have you not been fatigued by the journey, coming so quickly in the chariot?

original: āryakas te sukuśalī yudhājin mātulas tava /
analyzed: āryakaḥ te su kuśalī yudhājit mātulaḥ tava
translated: Is your noble brother well, and your maternal uncle Yudhajit?

original: pravāsāc ca sukhaṃ putra sarvaṃ me vaktum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: pravāsāt ca sukham putra sarvam me vaktum arhasi
translated: And are you happy, my son, since you left home? You should tell me all.

original: evaṃ pṛṣṭas tu kaikeyyā priyaṃ pārthivanandanaḥ /
analyzed: evam pṛṣṭaḥ tu kaikeyyā priyam pārthiva nandanaḥ
translated: Thus questioned by Kaikeyi, the lotus-eyed son of the king,

original: ācaṣṭa bharataḥ sarvaṃ mātre rājīvalocanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ācaṣṭa bharataḥ sarvam mātre rājīva locanaḥ
translated: Bharata, related everything to his mother.

original: adya me saptamī rātriś cyutasyāryakaveśmanaḥ /
analyzed: adya me saptamī rātriḥ cyutasya āryaka veśmanaḥ
translated: This is my seventh night away from my noble brother's house.

original: ambāyāḥ kuśalī tāto yudhājin mātulaś ca me // / / //
analyzed: ambāyāḥ kuśalī tātaḥ yudhājit mātulaḥ ca me
translated: My father and my maternal uncle Yudhajit are well.

original: yan me dhanaṃ ca ratnaṃ ca dadau rājā paraṃtapaḥ /
analyzed: yat me dhanam ca ratnam ca dadau rājā paraṃtapaḥ
translated: The wealth and jewels that the king, the scorcher of enemies, gave me,

original: pariśrāntaṃ pathy abhavat tato 'haṃ pūrvam āgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pariśrāntam pathi abhavat tatas ham pūrvam āgataḥ
translated: I became tired on the road, so I came here first.

original: rājavākyaharair dūtais tvaryamāṇo 'ham āgataḥ /
analyzed: rāja vākya haraiḥ dūtaiḥ tvaryamāṇaḥ ham āgataḥ
translated: Urged on by messengers who carry the king's words, I have come.

original: yad ahaṃ praṣṭum icchāmi tad ambā vaktum arhati // / / //
analyzed: yat aham praṣṭum icchāmi tat ambā vaktum arhati
translated: What I wish to ask, mother, you should tell me.

original: śūnyo 'yaṃ śayanīyas te paryaṅko hemabhūṣitaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyaḥ yam śayanīyaḥ te paryaṅkaḥ hema bhūṣitaḥ
translated: This your golden bed is empty.

original: na cāyam ikṣvākujanaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ pratibhāti me // / / //
analyzed: na ca ayam ikṣvāku janaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ pratibhāti me
translated: And this people of the Ikshvaku dynasty does not appear delighted to me.

original: rājā bhavati bhūyiṣṭham ihāmbāyā niveśane /
analyzed: rājā bhavati bhūyiṣṭham iha ambāyāḥ niveśane
translated: The king was mostly in the residence of mother (Kaikeyi).

original: tam ahaṃ nādya paśyāmi draṣṭum icchann ihāgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam aham na adya paśyāmi draṣṭum icchan iha āgataḥ
translated: I have come here desiring to see him, but I do not see him today.

original: pitur grahīṣye caraṇau taṃ mamākhyāhi pṛcchataḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ grahīṣye caraṇau tam mama ākhyāhi pṛcchataḥ
translated: I will touch the feet of my father. Tell me that, when I ask.

original: āhosvid amba jyeṣṭhāyāḥ kausalyāyā niveśane // / / //
analyzed: āhosvit amba jyeṣṭhāyāḥ kausalyāyāḥ niveśane
