translated: Or is he in the residence of my eldest mother, Kausalya?

original: taṃ pratyuvāca kaikeyī priyavad ghoram apriyam /
analyzed: tam pratyuvāca kaikeyī priya vat ghoram apriyam
translated: Kaikeyi replied to him in a pleasant but terrible way,

original: ajānantaṃ prajānantī rājyalobhena mohitā /
analyzed: a jānantam prajānantī rājya lobhena mohitā
translated: knowing (the truth) but pretending not to know, deluded by greed for the kingdom.

original: yā gatiḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ tāṃ gatiṃ te pitā gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yā gatiḥ sarva bhūtānām tām gatim te pitā gataḥ
translated: Your father has gone to the end that is the destiny of all beings.

original: tac chrutvā bharato vākyaṃ dharmābhijanavāñ śuciḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā bharataḥ vākyam dharma abhijanavān śuciḥ
translated: Hearing those words, the pure and righteous Bharata,

original: papāta sahasā bhūmau pitṛśokabalārditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: papāta sahasā bhūmau pitṛ śoka bala arditaḥ
translated: afflicted with the grief for his father, suddenly fell down on the ground.

original: tataḥ śokena saṃvītaḥ pitur maraṇaduḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas śokena saṃvītaḥ pituḥ maraṇa duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Then, overwhelmed with grief, afflicted with the sorrow of his father's death,

original: vilalāpa mahātejā bhrāntākulitacetanaḥ // / / //🔽etat suruciraṃ bhāti pitur me śayanaṃ purā /
analyzed: vilalāpa mahā tejāḥ bhrānta ākulita cetanaḥ  etat su ruciram bhāti pituḥ me śayanam purā
translated: the greatly energetic one lamented, his mind confused and agitated.

original: tad idaṃ na vibhāty adya vihīnaṃ tena dhīmatā // / / //
analyzed: tat idam na vibhāti adya vihīnam tena dhīmatā
translated: This very beautiful bed of mine used to shine in the past, but now that it is devoid of that wise one, it does not shine today.

original: tam ārtaṃ devasaṃkāśaṃ samīkṣya patitaṃ bhuvi /
analyzed: tam ārtam deva saṃkāśam samīkṣya patitam bhuvi
translated: Seeing him, resembling a god, afflicted and fallen on the ground,

original: utthāpayitvā śokārtaṃ vacanaṃ cedam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: utthāpayitvā śoka ārtam vacanam ca idam abravīt
translated: he raised him up, and to the one afflicted with grief, he spoke these words:

original: uttiṣṭhottiṣṭha kiṃ śeṣe rājaputra mahāyaśaḥ /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha uttiṣṭha kim śeṣe rāja putra mahā yaśaḥ
translated: Rise up, rise up! Why do you lie down, prince of great fame?

original: tvadvidhā na hi śocanti santaḥ sadasi saṃmatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvadvidhāḥ na hi śocanti santaḥ sadasi saṃmatāḥ
translated: For those like you, who are esteemed in the assembly, do not grieve.

original: sa ruditvā ciraṃ kālaṃ bhūmau viparivṛtya ca /
analyzed: sa ruditvā ciram kālam bhūmau viparivṛtya ca
translated: Having wept for a long time and rolled around on the ground,

original: jananīṃ pratyuvācedaṃ śokair bahubhir āvṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jananīm pratyuvāca idam śokaiḥ bahubhiḥ āvṛtaḥ
translated: he, overwhelmed with many sorrows, spoke to his mother:

original: abhiṣekṣyati rāmaṃ tu rājā yajñaṃ nu yakṣyati /
analyzed: abhiṣekṣyati rāmam tu rājā yajñam nu yakṣyati
translated: The king will consecrate Rama or perform a sacrifice.

original: ity ahaṃ kṛtasaṃkalpo hṛṣṭo yātrām ayāsiṣam // / / //
analyzed: iti aham kṛta saṃkalpaḥ hṛṣṭaḥ yātrām ayāsiṣam
translated: Thinking this, I set out on the journey with a delighted mind.

original: tad idaṃ hy anyathā bhūtaṃ vyavadīrṇaṃ mano mama /
analyzed: tat idam hi anyathā bhūtam vyavadīrṇam manaḥ mama
translated: But this has turned out otherwise, and my mind is torn apart.

original: pitaraṃ yo na paśyāmi nityaṃ priyahite ratam // / / //
analyzed: pitaram yaḥ na paśyāmi nityam priya hite ratam
translated: I do not see my father who was always engaged in my welfare and happiness.

original: amba kenātyagād rājā vyādhinā mayy anāgate /
analyzed: amba kena atyagāt rājā vyādhinā mayi anāgate
translated: O mother, by what disease was the king afflicted before my return?

original: dhanyā rāmādayaḥ sarve yaiḥ pitā saṃskṛtaḥ svayam // / / //
analyzed: dhanyāḥ rāma ādayaḥ sarve yaiḥ pitā saṃskṛtaḥ svayam
translated: Blessed are all the Rāma and others who have themselves performed the funeral rites of their father.

original: na nūnaṃ māṃ mahārājaḥ prāptaṃ jānāti kīrtimān /
analyzed: na nūnam mām mahā rājaḥ prāptam jānāti kīrtimān
translated: The illustrious great king certainly does not know that I have come.

original: upajighreddhi māṃ mūrdhni tātaḥ saṃnamya satvaram // / / //
analyzed: upajighret hi mām mūrdhni tātaḥ saṃnamya sa tvaram
translated: My father would have quickly bent down and smelt my head.

original: kva sa pāṇiḥ sukhasparśas tātasyākliṣṭakarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: kva sa pāṇiḥ sukha sparśaḥ tātasya akliṣṭa karmaṇaḥ
translated: Where is that hand of my father of unwearied action, which is so soft to the touch,

original: yena māṃ rajasā dhvastam abhīkṣṇaṃ parimārjati // / / //
analyzed: yena mām rajasā dhvastam abhīkṣṇam parimārjati
translated: with which he would often wipe me when I was covered with dust?

original: yo me bhrātā pitā bandhur yasya dāso 'smi dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ me bhrātā pitā bandhuḥ yasya dāsaḥ smi dhīmataḥ
translated: He who is my brother, father, and kinsman, to whom I am a slave, that wise one,

original: tasya māṃ śīghram ākhyāhi rāmasyākliṣṭakarmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya mām śīghram ākhyāhi rāmasya akliṣṭa karmaṇaḥ
translated: quickly inform him of me, Rāma of unwearied action.

original: pitā hi bhavati jyeṣṭho dharmam āryasya jānataḥ /
analyzed: pitā hi bhavati jyeṣṭhaḥ dharmam āryasya jānataḥ
translated: For the elder brother is a father to an Ārya who knows the law.

original: tasya pādau grahīṣyāmi sa hīdānīṃ gatir mama // / / //
analyzed: tasya pādau grahīṣyāmi sa hi idānīm gatiḥ mama
translated: I will seize his feet, for he is now my refuge.

original: ārye kim abravīd rājā pitā me satyavikramaḥ /
analyzed: ārye kim abravīt rājā pitā me satya vikramaḥ
translated: O noble one, what did the king, my father of true prowess, say?

original: paścimaṃ sādhusaṃdeśam icchāmi śrotum ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: paścimam sādhu saṃdeśam icchāmi śrotum ātmanaḥ
translated: I wish to hear the last good message of my father to me.

original: iti pṛṣṭā yathātattvaṃ kaikeyī vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: iti pṛṣṭā yathātattvam kaikeyī vākyam abravīt
translated: Thus asked, Kaikeyi spoke the truth,

original: rāmeti rājā vilapan hā sīte lakṣmaṇeti ca /
analyzed: rāma iti rājā vilapan hā sīte lakṣmaṇa iti ca
translated: The king, lamenting, cried out Rama! Alas Sita! Lakshmana!

original: sa mahātmā paraṃ lokaṃ gato gatimatāṃ varaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa mahātmā param lokam gataḥ gatimatām varaḥ
translated: That great soul, the best of the mobile and immobile, has gone to the supreme world.

original: imāṃ tu paścimāṃ vācaṃ vyājahāra pitā tava /
analyzed: imām tu paścimām vācam vyājahāra pitā tava
translated: But your father spoke these last words,

original: kāladharmaparikṣiptaḥ pāśair iva mahāgajaḥ // / / //🔽siddhārthās tu narā rāmam āgataṃ sītayā saha /
analyzed: kāladharma parikṣiptaḥ pāśaiḥ iva mahā gajaḥ  siddhārthāḥ tu narāḥ rāmam āgatam sītayā saha
translated: As if bound by the noose of the law of time, like a great elephant.🔽But those who have attained their goal will see Rama, who has come with Sita,

original: lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mahābāhuṃ drakṣyanti punar āgatam // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇam ca mahā bāhum drakṣyanti punar āgatam
translated: And the mighty-armed Lakshmana, who has returned.

original: tac chrutvā viṣasādaiva dvitīyāpriyaśaṃsanāt /
analyzed: tat śrutvā viṣasāda eva dvitīya apriya śaṃsanāt
translated: Hearing that, he was despondent, because of the second unpleasant news.

original: viṣaṇṇavadano bhūtvā bhūyaḥ papraccha mātaram // / / //
analyzed: viṣaṇṇa vadanaḥ bhūtvā bhūyas papraccha mātaram
translated: With a sorrowful face, he again asked his mother,

original: kva cedānīṃ sa dharmātmā kausalyānandavardhanaḥ /
analyzed: kva ca idānīm sa dharma ātmā kausalyā ānanda vardhanaḥ
translated: Where has that righteous one, the enhancer of Kausalya's joy,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā sītayā ca samaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā sītayā ca samam gataḥ
translated: Gone with his brother Lakshmana and Sita?

original: tathā pṛṣṭā yathātattvam ākhyātum upacakrame /
analyzed: tathā pṛṣṭā yathātattvam ākhyātum upacakrame
translated: Thus asked, she began to tell the truth,

original: mātāsya yugapad vākyaṃ vipriyaṃ priyaśaṅkayā // / / //
analyzed: mātā asya yugapad vākyam vipriyam priya śaṅkayā
translated: The mother, suspecting the unpleasant news to be pleasant, spoke the words together.

original: sa hi rājasutaḥ putra cīravāsā mahāvanam /
analyzed: sa hi rāja sutaḥ putra cīra vāsāḥ mahā vanam
translated: O son, that prince, wearing bark garments, has gone to the great forest,🔽 along with his wife and brother.

original: daṇḍakān saha vaidehyā lakṣmaṇānucaro gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: daṇḍakān saha vaidehyā lakṣmaṇa anucaraḥ gataḥ
translated: with Vaidehi and followed by Lakshmana, has gone to the Dandaka forest.

original: tac chrutvā bharatas trasto bhrātuś cāritraśaṅkayā /
analyzed: tat śrutvā bharataḥ trastaḥ bhrātuḥ cāritra śaṅkayā
translated: Hearing this, Bharata, fearing for his brother's character,

original: svasya vaṃśasya māhātmyāt praṣṭuṃ samupacakrame // / / //
analyzed: svasya vaṃśasya māhātmyāt praṣṭum samupacakrame
translated: began to ask out of the greatness of his own lineage.

original: kaccin na brāhmaṇadhanaṃ hṛtaṃ rāmeṇa kasyacit /
analyzed: kaccit na brāhmaṇa dhanam hṛtam rāmeṇa kasyacid
translated: Has Rama taken away the wealth of any brahmin?

original: kaccin nāḍhyo daridro vā tenāpāpo vihiṃsitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaccit nā āḍhyaḥ daridraḥ vā tena apāpaḥ vihiṃsitaḥ
translated: Has he harmed anyone innocent, whether rich or poor?

original: kaccin na paradārān vā rājaputro 'bhimanyate /
analyzed: kaccit na para dārān vā rāja putraḥ bhimanyate
translated: Has the prince coveted the wives of others?

original: kasmāt sa daṇḍakāraṇye bhrūṇaheva vivāsitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kasmāt sa daṇḍaka araṇye bhrūṇa hā iva vivāsitaḥ
translated: Why has he been exiled to the Dandaka forest like a child-killer?

original: athāsya capalā mātā tat svakarma yathātatham /
analyzed: athā asya capalā mātā tat sva karma yathātatham
translated: Then his fickle mother, as it really was,

original: tenaiva strīsvabhāvena vyāhartum upacakrame // / / //
analyzed: tena eva strī svabhāvena vyāhartum upacakrame
translated: began to speak out of that very feminine nature of hers.

original: na brāhmaṇadhanaṃ kiṃciddhṛtaṃ rāmeṇa kasyacit /
analyzed: na brāhmaṇa dhanam kiṃcid hṛtam rāmeṇa kasyacid
translated: Rama has not taken away the wealth of any brahmin from anyone.

original: kaścin nāḍhyo daridro vā tenāpāpo vihiṃsitaḥ /
analyzed: kaścid na āḍhyaḥ daridraḥ vā tena apāpaḥ vihiṃsitaḥ
translated: No rich or poor person has been harmed by him.

original: na rāmaḥ paradārāṃś ca cakṣurbhyām api paśyati // / / //🔽mayā tu putra śrutvaiva rāmasyaivābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: na rāmaḥ para dārān ca cakṣurbhyām api paśyati  mayā tu putra śrutvā eva rāmasya eva abhiṣecanam
translated: Rama does not even look at the wives of others with his eyes.🔽O son, having heard only about Rama's consecration,

original: yācitas te pitā rājyaṃ rāmasya ca vivāsanam // / / //
analyzed: yācitaḥ te pitā rājyam rāmasya ca vivāsanam
translated: I asked your father for the kingdom and for Rama's banishment.

original: sa svavṛttiṃ samāsthāya pitā te tat tathākarot /
analyzed: sa sva vṛttim samāsthāya pitā te tat tathā akarot
translated: Your father, following his own conduct, did the same.

original: rāmaś ca sahasaumitriḥ preṣitaḥ saha sītayā // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ ca sahasaumitriḥ preṣitaḥ saha sītayā
translated: And Rama, along with Lakshmana, was sent away with Sita.

original: tam apaśyan priyaṃ putraṃ mahīpālo mahāyaśāḥ /
analyzed: tam apaśyan priyam putram mahīpālaḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The greatly illustrious king, not seeing his beloved son,

original: putraśokaparidyūnaḥ pañcatvam upapedivān // / / //
analyzed: putra śoka paridyūnaḥ pañcatvam upapedivān
translated: Overcome with grief for his son, attained the state of the five elements.

original: tvayā tv idānīṃ dharmajña rājatvam avalambyatām /
analyzed: tvayā tu idānīm dharma jña rāja tvam avalambyatām
translated: But now, O knower of dharma, you should assume the kingship.

original: tvatkṛte hi mayā sarvam idam evaṃvidhaṃ kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: tvad kṛte hi mayā sarvam idam evaṃvidham kṛtam
translated: For it was for you that I did all this in this way.

original: tat putra śīghraṃ vidhinā vidhijñair vasiṣṭhamukhyaiḥ sahito dvijendraiḥ /
analyzed: tat putra śīghram vidhinā vidhi jñaiḥ vasiṣṭha mukhyaiḥ sahitaḥ dvijendraiḥ
translated: Therefore, O son, quickly, along with the best of Brahmins headed by Vasishtha, who know the rituals,

original: saṃkālya rājānam adīnasattvam ātmānam urvyām abhiṣecayasva // / / //
analyzed: saṃkālya rājānam adīna sattvam ātmānam urvyām abhiṣecayasva
translated: Having assembled the king of undiminished spirit, consecrate yourself on the earth.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: śrutvā tu pitaraṃ vṛttaṃ bhrātarau ca vivāsitau /
analyzed: śrutvā tu pitaram vṛttam bhrātarau ca vivāsitau
translated: Having heard about the death of his father and the exile of his brothers,

original: bharato duḥkhasaṃtapta idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ duḥkha saṃtaptaḥ idam vacanam abravīt
translated: Bharata, tormented by grief, spoke these words:

original: kiṃ nu kāryaṃ hatasyeha mama rājyena śocataḥ /
analyzed: kim nu kāryam hatasya iha mama rājyena śocataḥ
translated: What is the use of the kingdom for me, who am dead, grieving,

original: vihīnasyātha pitrā ca bhrātrā pitṛsamena ca // / / //
analyzed: vihīnasya atha pitrā ca bhrātrā pitṛ samena ca
translated: deprived of my father and brother who is like a father?

original: duḥkhe me duḥkham akaror vraṇe kṣāram ivādadhāḥ /
analyzed: duḥkhe me duḥkham akaroḥ vraṇe kṣāram iva adadhāḥ
translated: You have caused me grief in my grief, as if you were pouring salt into a wound.

original: rājānaṃ pretabhāvasthaṃ kṛtvā rāmaṃ ca tāpasam // / / //
analyzed: rājānam preta bhāva stham kṛtvā rāmam ca tāpasam
translated: Having caused the king to go to the other world and made Rama an ascetic,

original: kulasya tvam abhāvāya kālarātrir ivāgatā /
analyzed: kulasya tvam abhāvāya kālarātriḥ iva āgatā
translated: you have come like the night of destruction for the destruction of the family.

original: aṅgāram upagūhya sma pitā me nāvabuddhavān // / / //
analyzed: aṅgāram upagūhya sma pitā me na avabuddhavān
translated: My father did not realize that he was embracing a burning coal.

original: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca putraśokābhipīḍite /
analyzed: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca putra śoka abhipīḍite
translated: Kausalya and Sumitra, afflicted by grief for their sons,

original: duṣkaraṃ yadi jīvetāṃ prāpya tvāṃ jananīṃ mama // / / //🔽nanu tv āryo 'pi dharmātmā tvayi vṛttim anuttamām /
analyzed: duṣkaram yadi jīvetām prāpya tvām jananīm mama  nanu tu āryaḥ pi dharma ātmā tvayi vṛttim anuttamām
translated: if they can somehow manage to live, having obtained you as their mother,🔽but surely the noble one, righteous,

original: vartate guruvṛttijño yathā mātari vartate // / / //
analyzed: vartate guru vṛtti jñaḥ yathā mātari vartate
translated: behaves towards you in an unsurpassed way, knowing the conduct towards a guru, as he does towards his mother.

original: tathā jyeṣṭhā hi me mātā kausalyā dīrghadarśinī /
analyzed: tathā jyeṣṭhā hi me mātā kausalyā dīrgha darśinī
translated: In the same way, my eldest mother Kausalya, far-sighted,

original: tvayi dharmaṃ samāsthāya bhaginyām iva vartate // / / //
analyzed: tvayi dharmam samāsthāya bhaginyām iva vartate
translated: resorts to righteousness towards you, as if towards a sister.

original: tasyāḥ putraṃ kṛtātmānaṃ cīravalkalavāsasam /
analyzed: tasyāḥ putram kṛtātmānam cīra valkala vāsasam
translated: Having sent away her son, who has attained self-control, wearing bark garments,

original: prasthāpya vanavāsāya kathaṃ pāpe na śocasi // / / //
analyzed: prasthāpya vana vāsāya katham pāpe na śocasi
translated: to live in the forest, O sinful one, why do you not grieve?

original: apāpadarśinaṃ śūraṃ kṛtātmānaṃ yaśasvinam /
analyzed: a pāpa darśinam śūram kṛtātmānam yaśasvinam
translated: Seeing no sin, heroic, self-controlled, famous,

original: pravrājya cīravasanaṃ kiṃ nu paśyasi kāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: pravrājya cīra vasanam kim nu paśyasi kāraṇam
translated: having exiled him, wearing bark garments, what reason do you see?

original: lubdhāyā vidito manye na te 'haṃ rāghavaṃ prati /
analyzed: lubdhāyāḥ viditaḥ manye na te ham rāghavam prati
translated: I think you are not aware of my love for Rāghava.

original: tathā hy anartho rājyārthaṃ tvayā nīto mahān ayam // / / //
analyzed: tathā hi anarthaḥ rājya artham tvayā nītaḥ mahān ayam
translated: For, on his account, you have brought about this great calamity.

original: ahaṃ hi puruṣavyāghrāv apaśyan rāmalakṣmaṇau /
analyzed: aham hi puruṣa vyāghrau a paśyan rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: I am not able to see those two tigers among men, Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa.

original: kena śaktiprabhāvena rājyaṃ rakṣitum utsahe // / / //
analyzed: kena śakti prabhāvena rājyam rakṣitum utsahe
translated: By what power and influence shall I venture to govern the kingdom?

original: taṃ hi nityaṃ mahārājo balavantaṃ mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: tam hi nityam mahā rājaḥ balavantam mahā balaḥ
translated: The mighty king, of great strength, always relied on that mighty one,

original: apāśrito 'bhūd dharmātmā merur meruvanaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: apāśritaḥ bhūt dharma ātmā meruḥ meru vanam yathā
translated: the righteous one, as the Meru mountain relies on the Meru forest.

original: so 'haṃ katham imaṃ bhāraṃ mahādhuryasamudyatam /
analyzed: saḥ ham katham imam bhāram mahā dhurya samudyatam
translated: How shall I, then, bear this burden, raised by a great yoke,

original: damyo dhuram ivāsādya saheyaṃ kena caujasā // / / //
analyzed: damyaḥ dhuram iva āsādya saheyam kena ca ojasā
translated: like a young ox encountering a yoke, by what power?

original: atha vā me bhavec chaktir yogair buddhibalena vā /
analyzed: atha vā me bhavet śaktiḥ yogaiḥ buddhi balena vā
translated: Or if I have the power, by means of spells or the strength of intellect,

original: sakāmāṃ na kariṣyāmi tvām ahaṃ putragardhinīm /
analyzed: sa kāmām na kariṣyāmi tvām aham putra gardhinīm
translated: I will not fulfill your desire, you who are greedy for your son.

original: nivartayiṣyāmi vanād bhrātaraṃ svajanapriyam // / / //
analyzed: nivartayiṣyāmi vanāt bhrātaram sva jana priyam
translated: I will bring back from the forest my brother, dear to his kinsmen.

original: ity evam uktvā bharato mahātmā priyetarair vākyagaṇais tudaṃs tām /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā bharataḥ mahātmā priya itaraiḥ vākya gaṇaiḥ tudan tām
translated: Having thus spoken, the high-souled Bharata, wounding her with unpleasant words,

original: śokāturaś cāpi nanāda bhūyaḥ siṃho yathā parvatagahvarasthaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śoka āturaḥ ca api nanāda bhūyas siṃhaḥ yathā parvata gahvara sthaḥ
translated: and afflicted with grief, again roared like a lion in a mountain cave.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Canto.

original: tāṃ tathā garhayitvā tu mātaraṃ bharatas tadā /
analyzed: tām tathā garhayitvā tu mātaram bharataḥ tadā
translated: Having thus rebuked his mother, Bharata,

original: roṣeṇa mahatāviṣṭaḥ punar evābravīd vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: roṣeṇa mahatā āviṣṭaḥ punar eva abravīt vacaḥ
translated: overcome with great anger, again spoke these words:

original: rājyād bhraṃśasva kaikeyi nṛśaṃse duṣṭacāriṇi /
analyzed: rājyāt bhraṃśasva kaikeyi nṛśaṃse duṣṭa cāriṇi
translated: O Kaikeyi, be banished from the kingdom, O cruel one, O you of wicked conduct!

original: parityaktā ca dharmeṇa mā mṛtaṃ rudatī bhava // / / //
analyzed: parityaktā ca dharmeṇa mā mṛtam rudatī bhava
translated: Forsaken by righteousness, do not weep over the dead.

original: kiṃ nu te 'dūṣayad rājā rāmo vā bhṛśadhārmikaḥ /
analyzed: kim nu te dūṣayat rājā rāmaḥ vā bhṛśa dhārmikaḥ
translated: What wrong did the king or the exceedingly righteous Rama do to you,

original: yayor mṛtyur vivāsaś ca tvatkṛte tulyam āgatau // / / //
analyzed: yayoḥ mṛtyuḥ vivāsaḥ ca tvad kṛte tulyam āgatau
translated: for whose sake death and exile have equally come upon them?

original: bhrūṇahatyām asi prāptā kulasyāsya vināśanāt /
analyzed: bhrūṇa hatyām asi prāptā kulasya asya vināśanāt
translated: O Kaikeyi, you have incurred the sin of foeticide by destroying this dynasty.

original: kaikeyi narakaṃ gaccha mā ca bhartuḥ salokatām // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyi narakam gaccha mā ca bhartuḥ salokatām
translated: Go to hell, do not attain the same world as your husband.

original: yat tvayā hīdṛśaṃ pāpaṃ kṛtaṃ ghoreṇa karmaṇā /
analyzed: yat tvayā hi īdṛśam pāpam kṛtam ghoreṇa karmaṇā
translated: The sin you have committed by this terrible deed,

original: sarvalokapriyaṃ hitvā mamāpy āpāditaṃ bhayam // / / //
analyzed: sarva loka priyam hitvā mama api āpāditam bhayam
translated: abandoning one dear to all the worlds, has brought fear upon me too.

original: tvatkṛte me pitā vṛtto rāmaś cāraṇyam āśritaḥ /
analyzed: tvad kṛte me pitā vṛttaḥ rāmaḥ ca araṇyam āśritaḥ
translated: For your sake, my father has passed away and Rama has resorted to the forest,

original: ayaśo jīvaloke ca tvayāhaṃ pratipāditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayaśaḥ jīva loke ca tvayā aham pratipāditaḥ
translated: and you have brought me infamy in the world of men.

original: mātṛrūpe mamāmitre nṛśaṃse rājyakāmuke /
analyzed: mātṛ rūpe mama amitre nṛśaṃse rājya kāmuke
translated: O mother-like one to me, O cruel one, O you who desire the kingdom,

original: na te 'ham abhibhāṣyo 'smi durvṛtte patighātini // / / //
analyzed: na te ham abhibhāṣyaḥ smi durvṛtte pati ghātini
translated: I am not fit to be spoken to by you, O you of wicked conduct, O you that are the destroyer of your husband.

original: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca yāś cānyā mama mātaraḥ /
analyzed: kausalyā ca sumitrā ca yāḥ ca anyāḥ mama mātaraḥ
translated: Kausalya and Sumitra, and all my other mothers,

original: duḥkhena mahatāviṣṭās tvāṃ prāpya kuladūṣiṇīm // / / //
analyzed: duḥkhena mahatā āviṣṭāḥ tvām prāpya kula dūṣiṇīm
translated: are overwhelmed with great grief, having obtained you, the defiler of the family.

original: na tvam aśvapateḥ kanyā dharmarājasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: na tvam aśvapateḥ kanyā dharmarājasya dhīmataḥ
translated: You are not the daughter of Aswapati, nor of the righteous and wise king.

original: rākṣasī tatra jātāsi kulapradhvaṃsinī pituḥ // / / //
analyzed: rākṣasī tatra jātā asi kula pradhvaṃsinī pituḥ
translated: You are a Rakshasi born there, the destroyer of your father's race.

original: yat tvayā dhārmiko rāmo nityaṃ satyaparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yat tvayā dhārmikaḥ rāmaḥ nityam satya parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Since you have exiled the righteous Rama, ever devoted to truth,

original: vanaṃ prasthāpito duḥkhāt pitā ca tridivaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: vanam prasthāpitaḥ duḥkhāt pitā ca tridivam gataḥ
translated: and caused his father to go to heaven in grief,

original: yatpradhānāsi tat pāpaṃ mayi pitrā vinākṛte /
analyzed: yad pradhānā asi tat pāpam mayi pitrā vinākṛte
translated: since you have caused that sin, in which I have been deprived of my father,

original: bhrātṛbhyāṃ ca parityakte sarvalokasya cāpriye // / / //
analyzed: bhrātṛbhyām ca parityakte sarva lokasya ca apriye
translated: and abandoned by my brothers, to be mine, and which is disagreeable to all the world,

original: kausalyāṃ dharmasaṃyuktāṃ viyuktāṃ pāpaniścaye /
analyzed: kausalyām dharma saṃyuktām viyuktām pāpa niścaye
translated: having caused Kausalya, who is devoted to virtue, to be deprived of her son, O you of wicked resolve,

original: kṛtvā kaṃ prāpsyase tv adya lokaṃ nirayagāminī // / / //🔽kiṃ nāvabudhyase krūre niyataṃ bandhusaṃśrayam /
analyzed: kṛtvā kam prāpsyase tu adya lokam niraya gāminī  kim na avabudhyase krūre niyatam bandhu saṃśrayam
translated: what world will you attain today, O you that are going to hell?

original: jyeṣṭhaṃ pitṛsamaṃ rāmaṃ kausalyāyā ātmasambhavam // / / //
analyzed: jyeṣṭham pitṛ samam rāmam kausalyāyāḥ ātmasambhavam
translated: O cruel one, do you not understand that Rama, the eldest, who is like a father,🔽the son of Kausalya, is ever devoted to his kinsmen?

original: aṅgapratyaṅgajaḥ putro hṛdayāc cāpi jāyate /
analyzed: aṅga pratyaṅga jaḥ putraḥ hṛdayāt ca api jāyate
translated: A son is born from the limbs and minor limbs, and also from the heart.

original: tasmāt priyataro mātuḥ priyatvān na tu bāndhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt priyataraḥ mātuḥ priya tvāt na tu bāndhavaḥ
translated: Therefore, he is dearer to the mother because of his affection, not because of kinship.

original: anyadā kila dharmajñā surabhiḥ surasaṃmatā /🔽vahamānau dadarśorvyāṃ putrau vigatacetasau // / / //
analyzed: anyadā kila dharma jñā surabhiḥ sura saṃmatā  vahamānau dadarśa urvyām putrau vigata cetasau
translated: Once upon a time, it is said, Surabhi, who knows dharma and is revered by the gods,🔽saw her two sons, who had lost consciousness, being carried on the ground.

original: tāv ardhadivase śrāntau dṛṣṭvā putrau mahītale /
analyzed: tau ardha divase śrāntau dṛṣṭvā putrau mahī tale
translated: Seeing her two sons, exhausted, on the ground at midday,

original: ruroda putraśokena bāṣpaparyākulekṣaṇā // / / //🔽adhastād vrajatas tasyāḥ surarājño mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: ruroda putra śokena bāṣpa paryākula īkṣaṇā  adhastāt vrajataḥ tasyāḥ surarājñaḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: she wept with grief for her sons, her eyes filled with tears.

original: bindavaḥ patitā gātre sūkṣmāḥ surabhigandhinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bindavaḥ patitāḥ gātre sūkṣmāḥ surabhi gandhinaḥ
translated: As she was going below, tiny drops of the fragrance of Surabhi fell on the body of the great-souled king of the gods.

original: tāṃ dṛṣṭvā śokasaṃtaptāṃ vajrapāṇir yaśasvinīm /
analyzed: tām dṛṣṭvā śoka saṃtaptām vajrapāṇiḥ yaśasvinīm
translated: Seeing the illustrious one afflicted with grief,

original: indraḥ prāñjalir udvignaḥ surarājo 'bravīd vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: indraḥ prāñjaliḥ udvignaḥ surarājaḥ bravīt vacaḥ
translated: Indra, the lord of the gods, with folded hands and agitated, spoke these words:

original: bhayaṃ kaccin na cāsmāsu kutaścid vidyate mahat /
analyzed: bhayam kaccit na ca asmāsu kutaścid vidyate mahat
translated: Is there any great danger to us from anywhere?

original: kutonimittaḥ śokas te brūhi sarvahitaiṣiṇi // / / //🔽evam uktā tu surabhiḥ surarājena dhīmatā /
analyzed: kutonimittaḥ śokaḥ te brūhi sarva hita eṣiṇi  evam uktā tu surabhiḥ surarājena dhīmatā
translated: Tell me, O one who wishes the welfare of all, what is the cause of your grief?🔽Thus addressed by the wise king of the gods,

original: pratyuvāca tato dhīrā vākyaṃ vākyaviśāradā // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca tatas dhīrā vākyam vākya viśāradā
translated: Surabhi, the patient one, skilled in speech, replied:

original: śāntaṃ pāpaṃ na vaḥ kiṃcit kutaścid amarādhipa /
analyzed: śāntam pāpam na vaḥ kiṃcid kutaścid amara adhipa
translated: O lord of the immortals, no sin has been committed by you.

original: ahaṃ tu magnau śocāmi svaputrau viṣame sthitau // / / //
analyzed: aham tu magnau śocāmi sva putrau viṣame sthitau
translated: But I grieve for my two sons who are in a difficult situation.

original: etau dṛṣṭvā kṛṣau dīnau sūryaraśmipratāpinau /
analyzed: etau dṛṣṭvā kṛṣau dīnau sūrya raśmi pratāpinau
translated: Seeing these two miserable ones in the field, scorched by the sun's rays,

original: ardyamānau balīvardau karṣakeṇa surādhipa // / / //
analyzed: ardyamānau balīvardau karṣakeṇa surādhipa
translated: and being oppressed by the farmer, O lord of the gods,

original: mama kāyāt prasūtau hi duḥkhitau bhārapīḍitau /
analyzed: mama kāyāt prasūtau hi duḥkhitau bhāra pīḍitau
translated: born from my body, suffering and burdened with work,

original: yau dṛṣṭvā paritapye 'haṃ nāsti putrasamaḥ priyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yau dṛṣṭvā paritapye ham nā asti putra samaḥ priyaḥ
translated: seeing them I am tormented, there is no one dearer than a son.

original: yasyāḥ putrasahasrāṇi sāpi śocati kāmadhuk /
analyzed: yasyāḥ putra sahasrāṇi sā api śocati kāmadhuk
translated: Even she who has a thousand sons grieves, being addicted to desire,

original: kiṃ punar yā vinā rāmaṃ kausalyā vartayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: kim punar yā vinā rāmam kausalyā vartayiṣyati
translated: how much more so will Kausalyā, who is without Rāma, live?

original: ekaputrā ca sādhvī ca vivatseyaṃ tvayā kṛtā /
analyzed: eka putrā ca sādhvī ca vivatsā iyam tvayā kṛtā
translated: You have made this virtuous one, who has only one son, childless.

original: tasmāt tvaṃ satataṃ duḥkhaṃ pretya ceha ca lapsyase // / / //🔽ahaṃ hy apacitiṃ bhrātuḥ pituś ca sakalām imām /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam satatam duḥkham pretya ca iha ca lapsyase  aham hi apacitim bhrātuḥ pituḥ ca sakalām imām
translated: Therefore, you will always obtain sorrow in this world and the next.🔽I will certainly repay the entire debt to my brother and father,

original: vardhanaṃ yaśasaś cāpi kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vardhanam yaśasaḥ ca api kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: and will undoubtedly increase my fame.

original: ānāyayitvā tanayaṃ kausalyāyā mahādyutim /
analyzed: ānāyayitvā tanayam kausalyāyāḥ mahā dyutim
translated: Without bringing back the greatly radiant son of Kausalyā,

original: svayam eva pravekṣyāmi vanaṃ muniniṣevitam // / / //
analyzed: svayam eva pravekṣyāmi vanam muni niṣevitam
translated: I myself will enter the forest inhabited by sages.

original: iti nāga ivāraṇye tomarāṅkuśacoditaḥ /
analyzed: iti nāgaḥ iva araṇye tomara aṅkuśa coditaḥ
translated: Thus, like an elephant in the forest goaded by a lance and goad,

original: papāta bhuvi saṃkruddho niḥśvasann iva pannagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: papāta bhuvi saṃkruddhaḥ niḥśvasan iva pannagaḥ
translated: he fell down on the ground, enraged, hissing like a serpent.

original: saṃraktanetraḥ śithilāmbaras tadā vidhūtasarvābharaṇaḥ paraṃtapaḥ /
analyzed: saṃrakta netraḥ śithila ambaraḥ tadā vidhūta sarva ābharaṇaḥ paraṃtapaḥ
translated: With eyes red, his garments loose, all his ornaments cast aside, that scorcher of enemies,

original: babhūva bhūmau patito nṛpātmajaḥ śacīpateḥ ketur ivotsavakṣaye // / / //
analyzed: babhūva bhūmau patitaḥ nṛpa ātmajaḥ śacīpateḥ ketuḥ iva utsava kṣaye
translated: the prince fell down on the ground, like the banner of Indra at the end of a festival.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tathaiva krośatas tasya bharatasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva krośataḥ tasya bharatasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Even as the great soul Bharata was lamenting thus,

original: kausalyā śabdam ājñāya sumitrām idam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: kausalyā śabdam ājñāya sumitrām idam abravīt
translated: Kausalya, hearing his voice, said this to Sumitra.

original: āgataḥ krūrakāryāyāḥ kaikeyyā bharataḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: āgataḥ krūra kāryāyāḥ kaikeyyāḥ bharataḥ sutaḥ
translated: The son of Kaikeyi, the doer of cruel deeds, Bharata has come.

original: tam ahaṃ draṣṭum icchāmi bharataṃ dīrghadarśinam // / / //
analyzed: tam aham draṣṭum icchāmi bharatam dīrgha darśinam
translated: I wish to see that far-sighted Bharata.

original: evam uktvā sumitrāṃ sā vivarṇā malināmbarā /
analyzed: evam uktvā sumitrām sā vivarṇā malina ambarā
translated: Having said this to Sumitra, she, pale and wearing soiled garments,

original: pratasthe bharato yatra vepamānā vicetanā // / / //
analyzed: pratasthe bharataḥ yatra vepamānā vicetanā
translated: set out trembling, unconscious, to where Bharata was.

original: sa tu rāmānujaś cāpi śatrughnasahitas tadā /
analyzed: sa tu rāma anujaḥ ca api śatrughna sahitaḥ tadā
translated: And then the younger brother of Rama, along with Shatrughna,

original: pratasthe bharato yatra kausalyāyā niveśanam // / / //
analyzed: pratasthe bharataḥ yatra kausalyāyāḥ niveśanam
translated: set out to where Bharata was, to Kausalya's abode.

original: tataḥ śatrughnabharatau kausalyāṃ prekṣya duḥkhitau /
analyzed: tatas śatrughna bharatau kausalyām prekṣya duḥkhitau
translated: Then Shatrughna and Bharata, seeing Kausalya, were stricken with grief.

original: paryaṣvajetāṃ duḥkhārtāṃ patitāṃ naṣṭacetanām // / / //
analyzed: paryaṣvajetām duḥkha ārtām patitām naṣṭa cetanām
translated: And embraced her, who was afflicted with grief and had fallen down, deprived of consciousness.

original: bharataṃ pratyuvācedaṃ kausalyā bhṛśaduḥkhitā /
analyzed: bharatam pratyuvāca idam kausalyā bhṛśa duḥkhitā
translated: Kausalya, greatly afflicted with grief, said this to Bharata:

original: idaṃ te rājyakāmasya rājyaṃ prāptam akaṇṭakam /
analyzed: idam te rājya kāmasya rājyam prāptam akaṇṭakam
translated: This kingdom, free from thorns, has been obtained by you who desired the kingdom.

original: samprāptaṃ bata kaikeyyā śīghraṃ krūreṇa karmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: samprāptam bata kaikeyyā śīghram krūreṇa karmaṇā
translated: Alas! It has been quickly obtained by Kaikeyi through her cruel deed.

original: prasthāpya cīravasanaṃ putraṃ me vanavāsinam /
analyzed: prasthāpya cīra vasanam putram me vana vāsinam
translated: Having exiled my son, clad in bark garments, to dwell in the forest,

original: kaikeyī kaṃ guṇaṃ tatra paśyati krūradarśinī // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyī kam guṇam tatra paśyati krūra darśinī
translated: What good does the cruel-sighted Kaikeyi see in that?

original: kṣipraṃ mām api kaikeyī prasthāpayitum arhati /
analyzed: kṣipram mām api kaikeyī prasthāpayitum arhati
translated: Kaikeyi should quickly send me away too.

original: hiraṇyanābho yatrāste suto me sumahāyaśāḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyanābhaḥ yatra āste sutaḥ me su mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Where my son, of great fame, having golden navel, resides.

original: atha vā svayam evāhaṃ sumitrānucarā sukham /
analyzed: atha vā svayam eva aham sumitrā anucarā sukham
translated: Or I myself, following Sumitra, will happily

original: agnihotraṃ puraskṛtya prasthāsye yatra rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: agnihotram puraskṛtya prasthāsye yatra rāghavaḥ
translated: Depart, placing the Agnihotra in front, to where Raghava is.

original: kāmaṃ vā svayam evādya tatra māṃ netum arhasi /
analyzed: kāmam vā svayam evā adya tatra mām netum arhasi
translated: Or you should take me there today yourself,

original: yatrāsau puruṣavyāghras tapyate me tapaḥ sutaḥ // / / //🔽idaṃ hi tava vistīrṇaṃ dhanadhānyasamācitam /
analyzed: yatra asau puruṣa vyāghraḥ tapyate me tapaḥ sutaḥ  idam hi tava vistīrṇam dhana dhānya samācitam
translated: Where that best of men, my son, is tormenting himself with austerities.🔽This extensive kingdom of yours, filled with wealth and grain,

original: hastyaśvarathasampūrṇaṃ rājyaṃ niryātitaṃ tayā // / / //
analyzed: hasti aśva ratha sampūrṇam rājyam niryātitam tayā
translated: Complete with elephants, horses and chariots, has been offered by her.

original: evaṃ vilapamānāṃ tāṃ bharataḥ prāñjalis tadā /
analyzed: evam vilapamānām tām bharataḥ prāñjaliḥ tadā
translated: Bharata, with folded hands, then said to her who was lamenting thus:

original: kausalyāṃ pratyuvācedaṃ śokair bahubhir āvṛtām // / / //
analyzed: kausalyām pratyuvāca idam śokaiḥ bahubhiḥ āvṛtām
translated: Bharata, with folded hands, thus replied to Kausalyā, who was lamenting in this wise, and who was overwhelmed with grief.

original: ārye kasmād ajānantaṃ garhase mām akilbiṣam /
analyzed: ārye kasmāt a jānantam garhase mām akilbiṣam
translated: O noble lady, why do you reprove me, who am innocent and who know not (the reason of your grief)?

original: vipulāṃ ca mama prītiṃ sthirāṃ jānāsi rāghave // / / //
analyzed: vipulām ca mama prītim sthirām jānāsi rāghave
translated: You know well my great and firm affection for Rāghava.

original: kṛtā śāstrānugā buddhir mā bhūt tasya kadācana /
analyzed: kṛtā śāstra anugā buddhiḥ mā bhūt tasya kadācana
translated: May he never have his understanding turned away from the scriptures.

original: satyasaṃdhaḥ satāṃ śreṣṭho yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: satya saṃdhaḥ satām śreṣṭhaḥ yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: He, who is firm in truth, the best of the pious, and who has gone away with the noble one's consent,

original: praiṣyaṃ pāpīyasāṃ yātu sūryaṃ ca prati mehatu /
analyzed: praiṣyam pāpīyasām yātu sūryam ca prati mehatu
translated: May he go to the service of the sinful, and may he pass urine facing the sun.

original: hantu pādena gāṃ suptāṃ yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: hantu pādena gām suptām yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: May he kick with his foot a sleeping cow, who has gone away with the noble one's consent.

original: kārayitvā mahat karma bhartā bhṛtyam anarthakam /
analyzed: kārayitvā mahat karma bhartā bhṛtyam anarthakam
translated: May he, who has caused a great work to be done, and who has rendered his servant useless,

original: adharmo yo 'sya so 'syās tu yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: adharmaḥ yaḥ sya saḥ syāḥ tu yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: May the sin which he has, be his, who has gone away with the noble one's consent.

original: paripālayamānasya rājño bhūtāni putravat /
analyzed: paripālayamānasya rājñaḥ bhūtāni putra vat
translated: The king, who protects all creatures as his children,

original: tatas tu druhyatāṃ pāpaṃ yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas tu druhyatām pāpam yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: May the sin which he has, be his, who has gone away with the noble one's consent.

original: baliṣaḍbhāgam uddhṛtya nṛpasyārakṣataḥ prajāḥ /
analyzed: bali ṣaṣ bhāgam uddhṛtya nṛpasya arakṣataḥ prajāḥ
translated: The king, who takes the sixth part of the produce, and who does not protect the people,

original: adharmo yo 'sya so 'syāstu yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: adharmaḥ yaḥ sya saḥ sya astu yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: Let him have the sin of him who has approved the noble one's departure.

original: saṃśrutya ca tapasvibhyaḥ sattre vai yajñadakṣiṇām /
analyzed: saṃśrutya ca tapasvibhyaḥ sattre vai yajña dakṣiṇām
translated: Having promised the sacrificial fee to the ascetics at the Sattra sacrifice,

original: tāṃ vipralapatāṃ pāpaṃ yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tām vipralapatām pāpam yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: let the sin of him who has approved the noble one's departure be on him who breaks that promise.

original: hastyaśvarathasambādhe yuddhe śastrasamākule /
analyzed: hasti aśva ratha sambādhe yuddhe śastra samākule
translated: In a battle crowded with elephants, horses and chariots, in a turmoil of weapons,

original: mā sma kārṣīt satāṃ dharmaṃ yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: mā sma kārṣīt satām dharmam yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: may he not follow the dharma of the virtuous, he who has approved the noble one's departure.

original: upadiṣṭaṃ susūkṣmārthaṃ śāstraṃ yatnena dhīmatā /
analyzed: upadiṣṭam su sūkṣma artham śāstram yatnena dhīmatā
translated: The treatise that was carefully taught by the wise one with subtle meaning,

original: sa nāśayatu duṣṭātmā yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa nāśayatu duṣṭa ātmā yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: may that evil-minded one destroy it, he who has approved the noble one's departure.

original: pāyasaṃ kṛsaraṃ chāgaṃ vṛthā so 'śnātu nirghṛṇaḥ /
analyzed: pāyasam kṛsaram chāgam vṛthā saḥ śnātu nirghṛṇaḥ
translated: May the merciless one eat in vain the rice-milk, porridge and goat meat,

original: gurūṃś cāpy avajānātu yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: gurūn ca api avajānātu yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: and may he disrespect his elders, he who has approved the noble one's departure.

original: putrair dāraiś ca bhṛtyaiś ca svagṛhe parivāritaḥ /
analyzed: putraiḥ dāraiḥ ca bhṛtyaiḥ ca sva gṛhe parivāritaḥ
translated: Surrounded in his own house by sons, wives and servants,

original: sa eko mṛṣṭam aśnātu yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //🔽rājastrībālavṛddhānāṃ vadhe yat pāpam ucyate /
analyzed: saḥ ekaḥ mṛṣṭam aśnātu yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ  rāja strī bāla vṛddhānām vadhe yat pāpam ucyate
translated: may he alone eat delicious food, he who has approved the noble one's departure.🔽May he incur the sin said to be incurred by killing the king's women, children and elders,

original: bhṛtyatyāge ca yat pāpaṃ tat pāpaṃ pratipadyatām // / / //
analyzed: bhṛtya tyāge ca yat pāpam tat pāpam pratipadyatām
translated: and the sin incurred by abandoning servants, he who has approved the noble one's departure.

original: ubhe saṃdhye śayānasya yat pāpaṃ parikalpyate /
analyzed: ubhe saṃdhye śayānasya yat pāpam parikalpyate
translated: The sin that is thought to accrue from lying down during both twilights,

original: tac ca pāpaṃ bhavet tasya yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat ca pāpam bhavet tasya yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: may that sin be his who gave consent to the noble one's departure.

original: yad agnidāyake pāpaṃ yat pāpaṃ gurutalpage /
analyzed: yat agni dāyake pāpam yat pāpam guru talpa ge
translated: The sin that is in giving fire, the sin that is in violating one's Guru's bed,

original: mitradrohe ca yat pāpaṃ tat pāpaṃ pratipadyatām // / / //
analyzed: mitra drohe ca yat pāpam tat pāpam pratipadyatām
translated: and the sin that is in betraying a friend, may that sin be his who gave consent to the noble one's departure.

original: devatānāṃ pitḥṇāṃ ca mātāpitros tathaiva ca /
analyzed: devatānām pitḥṇām ca mātā pitroḥ tathā eva ca
translated: May he never serve the gods, the ancestors, or his mother and father,

original: mā sma kārṣīt sa śuśrūṣāṃ yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //🔽satāṃ lokāt satāṃ kīrtyāḥ sajjuṣṭāt karmaṇas tathā /
analyzed: mā sma kārṣīt sa śuśrūṣām yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ  satām lokāt satām kīrtyāḥ sat juṣṭāt karmaṇaḥ tathā
translated: who gave consent to the noble one's departure.🔽May he be quickly deprived today of the world of the virtuous, the fame of the virtuous, and the rites approved by the virtuous,

original: bhraśyatu kṣipram adyaiva yasyāryo 'numate gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhraśyatu kṣipram adyā eva yasya āryaḥ numate gataḥ
translated: who gave consent to the noble one's departure.

original: vihīnāṃ patiputrābhyāṃ kausalyāṃ pārthivātmajaḥ /
analyzed: vihīnām pati putrābhyām kausalyām pārthiva ātmajaḥ
translated: The son of the king, consoling Kausālya, who was bereft of her husband and son,

original: evam āśvāsayann eva duḥkhārto nipapāta ha // / / //🔽tathā tu śapathaiḥ kaṣṭaiḥ śapamānam acetanam /
analyzed: evam āśvāsayan eva duḥkha ārtaḥ nipapāta ha  tathā tu śapathaiḥ kaṣṭaiḥ śapamānam acetanam
translated: fell down in grief, even as he was consoling her.🔽Thus, Bharata, senseless and tormented by grief, was cursing himself with these terrible oaths,

original: bharataṃ śokasaṃtaptaṃ kausalyā vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: bharatam śoka saṃtaptam kausalyā vākyam abravīt
translated: when Kausālya addressed him in these words:

original: mama duḥkham idaṃ putra bhūyaḥ samupajāyate /
analyzed: mama duḥkham idam putra bhūyaḥ samupajāyate
translated: My son, this grief of mine is now redoubled.

original: śapathaiḥ śapamāno hi prāṇān uparuṇatsi me // / / //
analyzed: śapathaiḥ śapamānaḥ hi prāṇān uparuṇatsi me
translated: By swearing oaths, you are obstructing my life.

original: diṣṭyā na calito dharmād ātmā te sahalakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: diṣṭyā na calitaḥ dharmāt ātmā te sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Fortunate it is that your soul, along with that of Lakshmana, has not deviated from dharma.

original: vatsa satyapratijño me satāṃ lokān avāpsyasi // / / //🔽evaṃ vilapamānasya duḥkhārtasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: vatsa satya pratijñaḥ me satām lokān avāpsyasi  evam vilapamānasya duḥkha ārtasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: O child, true to your promise, you will attain the worlds of the virtuous.🔽Thus lamented the great one, afflicted with grief.

original: mohāc ca śokasaṃrodhād babhūva lulitaṃ manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mohāt ca śoka saṃrodhāt babhūva lulitam manaḥ
translated: And from delusion and the obstruction of sorrow, his mind became unsteady.

original: lālapyamānasya vicetanasya pranaṣṭabuddheḥ patitasya bhūmau /
analyzed: lālapyamānasya vicetanasya pranaṣṭa buddheḥ patitasya bhūmau
translated: Of him who lamented, who was unconscious, whose understanding was lost, who had fallen on the ground,

original: muhur muhur niḥśvasataś ca dīrghaṃ sā tasya śokena jagāma rātriḥ // / / //
analyzed: muhur muhur niḥśvasataḥ ca dīrgham sā tasya śokena jagāma rātriḥ
translated: and who was sighing deeply again and again, that night passed away with his grief.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tam evaṃ śokasaṃtaptaṃ bharataṃ kekayīsutam /
analyzed: tam evam śoka saṃtaptam bharatam kekayī sutam
translated: To that Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi, who was thus tormented with grief,

original: uvāca vadatāṃ śreṣṭho vasiṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭhavāg ṛṣiḥ // / / //🔽alaṃ śokena bhadraṃ te rājaputra mahāyaśaḥ /
analyzed: uvāca vadatām śreṣṭhaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭha vāc ṛṣiḥ  alam śokena bhadram te rāja putra mahā yaśaḥ
translated: the best of speakers, the sage Vasishtha, spoke with excellent words.🔽Enough of grief, O fortunate one, O prince of great fame.

original: prāptakālaṃ narapateḥ kuru saṃyānam uttaram // / / //
analyzed: prāpta kālam narapateḥ kuru saṃyānam uttaram
translated: Do the funeral rites of the king, which are proper at this time.

original: vasiṣṭhasya vacaḥ śrutvā bharato dhāraṇāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhasya vacaḥ śrutvā bharataḥ dhāraṇām gataḥ
translated: Hearing the words of Vasishtha, Bharata, who was self-possessed,

original: pretakāryāṇi sarvāṇi kārayāmāsa dharmavit // / / //
analyzed: preta kāryāṇi sarvāṇi kārayāmāsa dharma vid
translated: and who knew his duty, caused all the funeral rites to be performed.

original: uddhṛtaṃ tailasaṃkledāt sa tu bhūmau niveśitam /
analyzed: uddhṛtam taila saṃkledāt sa tu bhūmau niveśitam
translated: It was lifted out of the oil and placed on the ground.

original: āpītavarṇavadanaṃ prasuptam iva bhūmipam // / / //
analyzed: āpīta varṇa vadanam prasuptam iva bhūmipam
translated: The king's face was pale, as if he were asleep.

original: niveśya śayane cāgrye nānāratnapariṣkṛte /
analyzed: niveśya śayane ca agrye nānā ratna pariṣkṛte
translated: He was placed on a fine bed adorned with various jewels.

original: tato daśarathaṃ putro vilalāpa suduḥkhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas daśaratham putraḥ vilalāpa su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Then the son lamented over Dasharatha, deeply afflicted.

original: kiṃ te vyavasitaṃ rājan proṣite mayy anāgate /
analyzed: kim te vyavasitam rājan proṣite mayi anāgate
translated: What have you done, O king, when I was away and had not returned?

original: vivāsya rāmaṃ dharmajñaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mahābalam // / / //
analyzed: vivāsya rāmam dharma jñam lakṣmaṇam ca mahā balam
translated: Having banished Rama, who knows dharma, and the greatly powerful Lakshmana,

original: kva yāsyasi mahārāja hitvemaṃ duḥkhitaṃ janam /
analyzed: kva yāsyasi mahā rāja hitvā imam duḥkhitam janam
translated: where will you go, great king, leaving this afflicted people?

original: hīnaṃ puruṣasiṃhena rāmeṇākliṣṭakarmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: hīnam puruṣa siṃhena rāmeṇa akliṣṭa karmaṇā
translated: Deprived of Rama, the lion among men, of unwearied action,

original: yogakṣemaṃ tu te rājan ko 'smin kalpayitā pure /
analyzed: yogakṣemam tu te rājan kaḥ smin kalpayitā pure
translated: who will arrange for your welfare and security in this city, O king,

original: tvayi prayāte svas tāta rāme ca vanam āśrite // / / //
analyzed: tvayi prayāte svar tāta rāme ca vanam āśrite
translated: when you have departed, O father, and Rama has resorted to the forest?

original: vidhavā pṛthivī rājaṃs tvayā hīnā na rājate /
analyzed: vidhavā pṛthivī rājan tvayā hīnā na rājate
translated: The earth is a widow, O king, it does not shine without you.

original: hīnacandreva rajanī nagarī pratibhāti mām // / / //
analyzed: hīna candrā iva rajanī nagarī pratibhāti mām
translated: The city appears to me like the night without the moon.

original: evaṃ vilapamānaṃ taṃ bharataṃ dīnamānasam /
analyzed: evam vilapamānam tam bharatam dīna mānasam
translated: Thus Bharata lamented, his mind distressed.

original: abravīd vacanaṃ bhūyo vasiṣṭhas tu mahān ṛṣiḥ // / / //
analyzed: abravīt vacanam bhūyas vasiṣṭhaḥ tu mahān ṛṣiḥ
translated: The great sage Vasishtha then spoke these words to him:

original: pretakāryāṇi yāny asya kartavyāni viśāṃpateḥ /
analyzed: pretakāryāṇi yāni asya kartavyāni viśām pateḥ
translated: The funeral rites that are to be performed for that lord of the people,

original: tāny avyagraṃ mahābāho kriyantām avicāritam // / / //
analyzed: tāni avyagram mahā bāho kriyantām avicāritam
translated: The funeral rites of the king should be performed without delay.

original: tatheti bharato vākyaṃ vasiṣṭhasyābhipūjya tat /
analyzed: tathā iti bharataḥ vākyam vasiṣṭhasya abhipūjya tat
translated: So be it, said Bharata, and reverentially accepting the words of Vasishtha,

original: ṛtvikpurohitācāryāṃs tvarayāmāsa sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṛtvij purohita ācāryān tvarayāmāsa sarvaśas
translated: he speedily summoned all the Ritvijas, priests and preceptors.

original: ye tv agrato narendrasya agnyagārād bahiṣkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ye tu agratas narendrasya agnyagārāt bahiṣkṛtāḥ
translated: Those who were in front of the king, excluded from the fire-chamber,

original: ṛtvigbhir yājakaiś caiva te hriyante yathāvidhi // / / //
analyzed: ṛtvigbhiḥ yājakaiḥ ca eva te hriyante yathāvidhi
translated: were carried out by the Ritvijas and priests according to the prescribed rites.

original: śibikāyām athāropya rājānaṃ gatacetanam /
analyzed: śibikāyām atha āropya rājānam gata cetanam
translated: Then, having placed the king, who had lost his senses, on a palanquin,

original: bāṣpakaṇṭhā vimanasas tam ūhuḥ paricārakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bāṣpa kaṇṭhāḥ vimanasaḥ tam ūhuḥ paricārakāḥ
translated: his attendants, their throats choked with tears and dejected, carried him.

original: hiraṇyaṃ ca suvarṇaṃ ca vāsāṃsi vividhāni ca /
analyzed: hiraṇyam ca suvarṇam ca vāsāṃsi vividhāni ca
translated: Scattering gold, silver and various garments,

original: prakiranto janā mārgaṃ nṛpater agrato yayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: prakirantaḥ janāḥ mārgam nṛpateḥ agratas yayuḥ
translated: the people went ahead of the king on the road.

original: candanāguruniryāsān saralaṃ padmakaṃ tathā /
analyzed: candana aguru niryāsān saralam padmakam tathā
translated: Others brought sandalwood, aloe resin, sarala wood, padmaka,

original: devadārūṇi cāhṛtya citāṃ cakrus tathāpare // / / //
analyzed: devadārūṇi ca āhṛtya citām cakruḥ tathā apare
translated: and devadaru wood and made a funeral pyre.

original: gandhān uccāvacāṃś cānyāṃs tatra dattvātha bhūmipam /
analyzed: gandhān uccāvacān ca anyān tatra dattvā atha bhūmipam
translated: Having offered various fragrant substances there to the king,

original: tataḥ saṃveśayāmāsuś citāmadhye tam ṛtvijaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas saṃveśayāmāsuḥ citā madhye tam ṛtvijaḥ
translated: the Ritvijas then placed him in the middle of the pyre.

original: tathā hutāśanaṃ hutvā jepus tasya tadartvijaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hutāśanam hutvā jepuḥ tasya tadā ṛtvijaḥ
translated: Having offered oblations into the sacrificial fire, the priests chanted the mantras.

original: jaguś ca te yathāśāstraṃ tatra sāmāni sāmagāḥ // / / //🔽śibikābhiś ca yānaiś ca yathārhaṃ tasya yoṣitaḥ /🔽nagarān niryayus tatra vṛddhaiḥ parivṛtās tadā // / / //
analyzed: jaguḥ ca te yathāśāstram tatra sāmāni sāmagāḥ  śibikābhiḥ ca yānaiḥ ca yathārham tasya yoṣitaḥ  nagarāt niryayuḥ tatra vṛddhaiḥ parivṛtāḥ tadā
translated: The chanters of Sama hymns sang the Sama hymns according to the scriptures.🔽The women of the king, according to their rank, went out of the city in palanquins and vehicles, surrounded by the elders.

original: prasavyaṃ cāpi taṃ cakrur ṛtvijo 'gnicitaṃ nṛpam /🔽striyaś ca śokasaṃtaptāḥ kausalyāpramukhās tadā // / / //
analyzed: prasavyam ca api tam cakruḥ ṛtvijaḥ gni citam nṛpam  striyaḥ ca śoka saṃtaptāḥ kausalyā pramukhāḥ tadā
translated: The priests performed the funeral rites for the king who had built the sacrificial fire.🔽The women, led by Kausalya, who were tormented by grief,

original: krauñcīnām iva nārīṇāṃ ninādas tatra śuśruve /
analyzed: krauñcīnām iva nārīṇām ninādaḥ tatra śuśruve
translated: The cries of the women, like the cries of female curlews, were heard there.

original: ārtānāṃ karuṇaṃ kāle krośantīnāṃ sahasraśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ārtānām karuṇam kāle krośantīnām sahasraśas
translated: The cries of thousands of afflicted women lamenting piteously at the time were heard.

original: tato rudantyo vivaśā vilapya ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rudantyaḥ vivaśāḥ vilapya ca punar punar
translated: Then, weeping helplessly and lamenting again and again,

original: yānebhyaḥ sarayūtīram avaterur varāṅganāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yānebhyaḥ sarayū tīram avateruḥ vara aṅganāḥ
translated: The beautiful women descended from their vehicles to the banks of the Sarayu.

original: kṛtodakaṃ te bharatena sārdhaṃ nṛpāṅganā mantripurohitāś ca /
analyzed: kṛta udakam te bharatena sārdham nṛpa aṅganāḥ mantri purohitāḥ ca
translated: Having offered water libations along with Bharata, the king's wives, ministers, and priests,

original: puraṃ praviśyāśruparītanetrā bhūmau daśāhaṃ vyanayanta duḥkham // / / //
analyzed: puram praviśya aśru parīta netrāḥ bhūmau daśa aham vyanayanta duḥkham
translated: Entered the city with eyes filled with tears and spent ten days of grief on the ground.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tato daśāhe 'tigate kṛtaśauco nṛpātmajaḥ /
analyzed: tatas daśa ahe ti gate kṛta śaucaḥ nṛpa ātmajaḥ
translated: Then, after ten days had passed, the prince had performed the purification rites,

original: dvādaśe 'hani samprāpte śrāddhakarmāṇy akārayat // / / //
analyzed: dvādaśe hani samprāpte śrāddha karmāṇi akārayat
translated: On the twelfth day, he performed the funeral rites.

original: brāhmaṇebhyo dadau ratnaṃ dhanam annaṃ ca puṣkalam /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dadau ratnam dhanam annam ca puṣkalam
translated: To the Brahmins, he gave jewels, wealth, and abundant food.

original: bāstikaṃ bahuśuklaṃ ca gāś cāpi śataśas tathā // / / //
analyzed: bāstikam bahu śuklam ca gāḥ ca api śataśas tathā
translated: He gave many white cows, and also hundreds of goats and sheep.

original: dāsīdāsaṃ ca yānaṃ ca veśmāni sumahānti ca /
analyzed: dāsī dāsam ca yānam ca veśmāni su mahānti ca
translated: He gave servants, vehicles, and very large houses.

original: brāhmaṇebhyo dadau putro rājñas tasyaurdhvadaihikam // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dadau putraḥ rājñaḥ tasya aurdhvadaihikam
translated: The son of that king gave these to the Brahmins as part of the funeral rites.

original: tataḥ prabhātasamaye divase 'tha trayodaśe /
analyzed: tatas prabhāta samaye divase tha trayodaśe
translated: Then, on the thirteenth day, at dawn,

original: vilalāpa mahābāhur bharataḥ śokamūrchitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vilalāpa mahā bāhuḥ bharataḥ śoka mūrchitaḥ
translated: the mighty-armed Bharata, overwhelmed with grief, lamented.

original: śabdāpihitakaṇṭhaś ca śodhanārtham upāgataḥ /
analyzed: śabda apihita kaṇṭhaḥ ca śodhana artham upāgataḥ
translated: With his throat choked with sobs, he came to perform the purification.

original: citāmūle pitur vākyam idam āha suduḥkhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: citā mūle pituḥ vākyam idam āha su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: At the foot of the funeral pyre, he spoke these words to his father, deeply distressed:

original: tāta yasmin nisṛṣṭo 'haṃ tvayā bhrātari rāghave /🔽tasmin vanaṃ pravrajite śūnye tyakto 'smy ahaṃ tvayā // / / //
analyzed: tāta yasmin nisṛṣṭaḥ ham tvayā bhrātari rāghave  tasmin vanam pravrajite śūnye tyaktaḥ smi aham tvayā
translated: Father, when you entrusted me to my brother Rama,🔽when he went to the forest, you abandoned me in an empty place.

original: yathāgatir anāthāyāḥ putraḥ pravrājito vanam /
analyzed: yathā gatiḥ anāthāyāḥ putraḥ pravrājitaḥ vanam
translated: My mother, who had no one else, was left with only her son.

original: tām ambāṃ tāta kausalyāṃ tyaktvā tvaṃ kva gato nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: tām ambām tāta kausalyām tyaktvā tvam kva gataḥ nṛpa
translated: O father, where have you gone, leaving that helpless mother, Queen Kausalyā?

original: dṛṣṭvā bhasmāruṇaṃ tac ca dagdhāsthisthānamaṇḍalam /🔽pituḥ śarīranirvāṇaṃ niṣṭanan viṣasāda ha // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā bhasma aruṇam tat ca dagdha asthi sthāna maṇḍalam  pituḥ śarīra nirvāṇam niṣṭanan viṣasāda ha
translated: And beholding that circle of ashes and reddened bones, the place where his father's body was burnt,🔽he lamented, and was overwhelmed with grief.

original: sa tu dṛṣṭvā rudan dīnaḥ papāta dharaṇītale /
analyzed: sa tu dṛṣṭvā rudan dīnaḥ papāta dharaṇī tale
translated: And beholding it, he wept piteously, and fell down on the earth.

original: utthāpyamānaḥ śakrasya yantradhvaja iva cyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utthāpyamānaḥ śakrasya yantra dhvajaḥ iva cyutaḥ
translated: And as he was being raised up, he was like the banner of Indra fallen down.

original: abhipetus tataḥ sarve tasyāmātyāḥ śucivratam /
analyzed: abhipetuḥ tatas sarve tasya amātyāḥ śuci vratam
translated: Then all the counsellors of that virtuous king

original: antakāle nipatitaṃ yayātim ṛṣayo yathā // / / //
analyzed: antakāle nipatitam yayātim ṛṣayaḥ yathā
translated: rushed to him, as the Rishis did to Yayati when he fell at the end of his life.

original: śatrughnaś cāpi bharataṃ dṛṣṭvā śokapariplutam /
analyzed: śatrughnaḥ ca api bharatam dṛṣṭvā śoka pariplutam
translated: And Satrughna also, beholding Bharata overwhelmed with grief,

original: visaṃjño nyapatad bhūmau bhūmipālam anusmaran // / / //
analyzed: visaṃjñaḥ nyapatat bhūmau bhūmipālam anusmaran
translated: fell down on the earth, deprived of his senses, remembering the lord of earth.

original: unmatta iva niścetā vilalāpa suduḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: unmattaḥ iva niścetāḥ vilalāpa su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: And like one distracted, he lamented in great sorrow,

original: smṛtvā pitur guṇāṅgāni tāni tāni tadā tadā // / / //🔽mantharāprabhavas tīvraḥ kaikeyīgrāhasaṃkulaḥ /
analyzed: smṛtvā pituḥ guṇa aṅgāni tāni tāni tadā tadā  mantharā prabhavaḥ tīvraḥ kaikeyī grāha saṃkulaḥ
translated: remembering again and again the various virtues of his father.🔽The terrible one caused by Manthara, filled with the crocodile of Kaikeyi,

original: varadānamayo 'kṣobhyo 'majjayac chokasāgaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: vara dāna mayaḥ kṣobhyaḥ majjayat śoka sāgaraḥ
translated: the irresistible one caused by the boon, overwhelmed me with the ocean of grief.

original: sukumāraṃ ca bālaṃ ca satataṃ lālitaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: sukumāram ca bālam ca satatam lālitam tvayā
translated: You have always cherished your delicate and young son Bharata.

original: kva tāta bharataṃ hitvā vilapantaṃ gato bhavān // / / //
analyzed: kva tāta bharatam hitvā vilapantam gataḥ bhavān
translated: O father, where have you gone, leaving Bharata lamenting?

original: nanu bhojyeṣu pāneṣu vastreṣv ābharaṇeṣu ca /
analyzed: nanu bhojyeṣu pāneṣu vastreṣu ābharaṇeṣu ca
translated: But in regard to food, drinks, clothes, and ornaments,🔽🔽

original: pravārayasi naḥ sarvāṃs tan naḥ ko 'dya kariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: pravārayasi naḥ sarvān tat naḥ kaḥ dya kariṣyati
translated: But who will now give us all the food, drinks, clothes and ornaments?

original: avadāraṇakāle tu pṛthivī nāvadīryate /
analyzed: avadāraṇa kāle tu pṛthivī na avadīryate
translated: When the earth is being tilled, it does not break,

original: vihīnā yā tvayā rājñā dharmajñena mahātmanā // / / //
analyzed: vihīnā yā tvayā rājñā dharma jñena mahātmanā
translated: though deprived of you, the righteous and great king.

original: pitari svargam āpanne rāme cāraṇyam āśrite /
analyzed: pitari svargam āpanne rāme ca araṇyam āśrite
translated: When my father has gone to heaven and Rama has resorted to the forest,

original: kiṃ me jīvitasāmarthyaṃ pravekṣyāmi hutāśanam // / / //
analyzed: kim me jīvita sāmarthyam pravekṣyāmi hutāśanam
translated: what is the use of my life? I will enter the sacrificial fire.

original: hīno bhrātrā ca pitrā ca śūnyām ikṣvākupālitām /
analyzed: hīnaḥ bhrātrā ca pitrā ca śūnyām ikṣvāku pālitām
translated: Deprived of my brother and father, and Ayodhya bereft of its protector,

original: ayodhyāṃ na pravekṣyāmi pravekṣyāmi tapovanam // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām na pravekṣyāmi pravekṣyāmi tapaḥ vanam
translated: I will not enter Ayodhya, I will enter the forest of ascetics.

original: tayor vilapitaṃ śrutvā vyasanaṃ cānvavekṣya tat /
analyzed: tayoḥ vilapitam śrutvā vyasanam ca anvavekṣya tat
translated: Hearing their lamentations and beholding their distress,

original: bhṛśam ārtatarā bhūyaḥ sarva evānugāminaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhṛśam ārtatarāḥ bhūyas sarve eva anugāminaḥ
translated: all the followers became even more deeply afflicted.

original: tato viṣaṇṇau śrāntau ca śatrughnabharatāv ubhau /
analyzed: tatas viṣaṇṇau śrāntau ca śatrughna bharatau ubhau
translated: Then both Shatrughna and Bharata, despondent and exhausted,

original: dharaṇyāṃ saṃvyaceṣṭetāṃ bhagnaśṛṅgāv ivarṣabhau // / / //🔽tataḥ prakṛtimān vaidyaḥ pitur eṣāṃ purohitaḥ /
analyzed: dharaṇyām saṃvyaceṣṭetām bhagna śṛṅgau iva ṛṣabhau  tatas prakṛtimān vaidyaḥ pituḥ eṣām purohitaḥ
translated: rolled about on the ground like bulls with broken horns.🔽Then the family priest of their father, the physician Vashishtha,

original: vasiṣṭho bharataṃ vākyam utthāpya tam uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ bharatam vākyam utthāpya tam uvāca ha
translated: having raised Bharata, spoke to him these words:

original: trīṇi dvaṃdvāni bhūteṣu pravṛttāny aviśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi dvaṃdvāni bhūteṣu pravṛttāni aviśeṣatas
translated: The three pairs of opposites operate in beings without distinction.

original: teṣu cāparihāryeṣu naivaṃ bhavitum arhati // / / //
analyzed: teṣu ca aparihāryeṣu na evam bhavitum arhati
translated: And in those that cannot be avoided, one should not act in this way.

original: sumantraś cāpi śatrughnam utthāpyābhiprasādya ca /
analyzed: sumantraḥ ca api śatrughnam utthāpya abhiprasādya ca
translated: And Sumantra also raised Shatrughna and comforted him,

original: śrāvayāmāsa tattvajñaḥ sarvabhūtabhavābhavau // / / //
analyzed: śrāvayāmāsa tattva jñaḥ sarva bhūta bhava abhavau
translated: and the knower of truth made him hear about the rise and fall of all beings.

original: utthitau tau naravyāghrau prakāśete yaśasvinau /
analyzed: utthitau tau nara vyāghrau prakāśete yaśasvinau
translated: Those two illustrious tigers among men, who had risen, shone forth,

original: varṣātapapariklinnau pṛthag indradhvajāv iva // / / //
analyzed: varṣa ātapa pariklinnau pṛthak indra dhvajau iva
translated: like two separate Indra's banners, wet from the rain and sun.

original: aśrūṇi parimṛdnantau raktākṣau dīnabhāṣiṇau /
analyzed: aśrūṇi parimṛdnantau rakta akṣau dīna bhāṣiṇau
translated: Wiping away their tears, their eyes red, speaking in a dejected voice,

original: amātyās tvarayanti sma tanayau cāparāḥ kriyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: amātyāḥ tvarayanti sma tanayau ca aparāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: the ministers hastened them and other rites for their sons.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: atra yātrāṃ samīhantaṃ śatrughno lakṣmaṇānujaḥ /
analyzed: atra yātrām samīhantam śatrughnaḥ lakṣmaṇa anujaḥ
translated: Here, Shatrughna, Lakshmana's younger brother,

original: bharataṃ śokasaṃtaptam idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: bharatam śoka saṃtaptam idam vacanam abravīt
translated: spoke these words to Bharata, who was eager to set out and was tormented by grief.

original: gatir yaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ duḥkhe kiṃ punar ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: gatiḥ yaḥ sarva bhūtānām duḥkhe kim punar ātmanaḥ
translated: The one who is the refuge of all beings in sorrow, what to speak of himself,

original: sa rāmaḥ sattvasampannaḥ striyā pravrājito vanam // / / //
analyzed: sa rāmaḥ sattva sampannaḥ striyā pravrājitaḥ vanam
translated: that Rama, endowed with goodness, was exiled to the forest by a woman.

original: balavān vīryasampanno lakṣmaṇo nāma yo 'py asau /
analyzed: balavān vīrya sampannaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ nāma yaḥ pi asau
translated: And that powerful one endowed with valor, named Lakshmana,

original: kiṃ na mocayate rāmaṃ kṛtvāpi pitṛnigraham // / / //
analyzed: kim na mocayate rāmam kṛtvā api pitṛ nigraham
translated: Having punished his father, why does he not release Rama?

original: pūrvam eva tu nigrāhyaḥ samavekṣya nayānayau /
analyzed: pūrvam eva tu nigrāhyaḥ samavekṣya naya anayau
translated: But having considered the right and wrong ways, he should have been punished earlier.

original: utpathaṃ yaḥ samārūḍho nāryā rājā vaśaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: utpatham yaḥ samārūḍhaḥ nāryāḥ rājā vaśam gataḥ
translated: The king who has fallen under the control of a woman and has gone astray,

original: iti sambhāṣamāṇe tu śatrughne lakṣmaṇānuje /
analyzed: iti sambhāṣamāṇe tu śatrughne lakṣmaṇa anuje
translated: While Shatrughna, Lakshmana's younger brother, was speaking thus,

original: prāgdvāre 'bhūt tadā kubjā sarvābharaṇabhūṣitā // / / //🔽liptā candanasāreṇa rājavastrāṇi bibhratī /
analyzed: prāgdvāre tadā kubjā sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitā  liptā candana sāreṇa rāja vastrāṇi bibhratī
translated: At the eastern gate there was then a hunchback adorned with all ornaments.🔽Smeared with the essence of sandalwood and wearing royal garments,

original: mekhalādāmabhiś citrai rajjubaddheva vānarī // / / //
analyzed: mekhalā dāmabhiḥ citraiḥ rajju baddhā iva vānarī
translated: With colorful garlands and bracelets, like a female monkey bound with ropes.

original: tāṃ samīkṣya tadā dvāḥstho bhṛśaṃ pāpasya kāriṇīm /
analyzed: tām samīkṣya tadā dvāḥsthaḥ bhṛśam pāpasya kāriṇīm
translated: Seeing her, the doorkeeper, who had done great evil,

original: gṛhītvākaruṇāṃ kubjāṃ śatrughnāya nyavedayat // / / //🔽yasyāḥ kṛte vane rāmo nyastadehaś ca vaḥ pitā /
analyzed: gṛhītvā akaruṇām kubjām śatrughnāya nyavedayat  yasyāḥ kṛte vane rāmaḥ nyasta dehaḥ ca vaḥ pitā
translated: Seized the pitiful hunchback and reported to Shatrughna.🔽For whose sake Rama left his body in the forest and your father passed away,

original: seyaṃ pāpā nṛśaṃsā ca tasyāḥ kuru yathāmati // / / //
analyzed: sā iyam pāpā nṛśaṃsā ca tasyāḥ kuru yathāmati
translated: This sinful and cruel woman - do as you think fit.

original: śatrughnaś ca tad ājñāya vacanaṃ bhṛśaduḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: śatrughnaḥ ca tat ājñāya vacanam bhṛśa duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Shatrughna, having heard those words, was greatly distressed.

original: antaḥpuracarān sarvān ity uvāca dhṛtavrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: antaḥpuracarān sarvān iti uvāca dhṛta vrataḥ
translated: The one who upheld his vows, spoke thus to all the attendants in the inner quarters:

original: tīvram utpāditaṃ duḥkhaṃ bhrātḥṇāṃ me tathā pituḥ /
analyzed: tīvram utpāditam duḥkham bhrātḥṇām me tathā pituḥ
translated: The grief caused to my brothers and father is intense.

original: yayā seyaṃ nṛśaṃsasya karmaṇaḥ phalam aśnutām // / / //
analyzed: yayā sā iyam nṛśaṃsasya karmaṇaḥ phalam aśnutām
translated: May she reap the fruit of her own wickedness.

original: evam uktā ca tenāśu sakhījanasamāvṛtā /
analyzed: evam uktā ca tena āśu sakhī jana samāvṛtā
translated: Thus addressed by him, she, surrounded by her female companions,

original: gṛhītā balavat kubjā sā tadgṛham anādayat // / / //
analyzed: gṛhītā balavat kubjā sā tat gṛham anādayat
translated: was forcibly seized by him, and she cried out in his house.

original: tataḥ subhṛśasaṃtaptas tasyāḥ sarvaḥ sakhījanaḥ /
analyzed: tatas su bhṛśa saṃtaptaḥ tasyāḥ sarvaḥ sakhī janaḥ
translated: Then all her female companions, greatly afflicted,

original: kruddham ājñāya śatrughnaṃ vyapalāyata sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kruddham ājñāya śatrughnam vyapalāyata sarvaśas
translated: knowing that Satrughna was angry, fled away in all directions.

original: amantrayata kṛtsnaś ca tasyāḥ sarvasakhījanaḥ /
analyzed: amantrayata kṛtsnaḥ ca tasyāḥ sarva sakhī janaḥ
translated: And all her female companions consulted together,

original: yathāyaṃ samupakrānto niḥśeṣaṃ naḥ kariṣyati // / / //🔽sānukrośāṃ vadānyāṃ ca dharmajñāṃ ca yaśasvinīm /
analyzed: yathā ayam samupakrāntaḥ niḥśeṣam naḥ kariṣyati  sa anukrośām vadānyām ca dharma jñām ca yaśasvinīm
translated: saying, As he has begun, he will surely destroy us all.

original: kausalyāṃ śaraṇaṃ yāmaḥ sā hi no 'stu dhruvā gatiḥ // / / //🔽sa ca roṣeṇa tāmrākṣaḥ śatrughnaḥ śatrutāpanaḥ /
analyzed: kausalyām śaraṇam yāmaḥ sā hi naḥ stu dhruvā gatiḥ  sa ca roṣeṇa tāmra akṣaḥ śatrughnaḥ śatru tāpanaḥ
translated: Let us go for refuge to Kausalyā, who is compassionate, generous, righteous, and famous. She shall be our sure refuge.🔽And that Satrughna, the scorcher of enemies, with eyes red with anger,

original: vicakarṣa tadā kubjāṃ krośantīṃ pṛthivītale // / / //
analyzed: vicakarṣa tadā kubjām krośantīm pṛthivī tale
translated: dragged the crying hunchback along the ground.

original: tasyā hy ākṛṣyamāṇāyā mantharāyās tatas tataḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ hi ākṛṣyamāṇāyāḥ mantharāyāḥ tatas tatas
translated: And as that Mantharā was being dragged along here and there,

original: citraṃ bahuvidhaṃ bhāṇḍaṃ pṛthivyāṃ tad vyaśīryata // / / //
analyzed: citram bahuvidham bhāṇḍam pṛthivyām tat vyaśīryata
translated: her various ornaments were scattered on the ground.

original: tena bhāṇḍena saṃkīrṇaṃ śrīmadrājaniveśanam /
analyzed: tena bhāṇḍena saṃkīrṇam śrīmat rāja niveśanam
translated: The splendid royal palace was strewn with those ornaments,

original: aśobhata tadā bhūyaḥ śāradaṃ gaganaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: aśobhata tadā bhūyas śāradam gaganam yathā
translated: looked resplendent like the autumnal sky.

original: sa balī balavat krodhād gṛhītvā puruṣarṣabhaḥ /
analyzed: sa balī balavat krodhāt gṛhītvā puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: That powerful one, the best of men, seized her with great force in anger.

original: kaikeyīm abhinirbhartsya babhāṣe paruṣaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaikeyīm abhinirbhartsya babhāṣe paruṣam vacaḥ
translated: And rebuking Kaikeyi, he spoke harsh words.

original: tair vākyaiḥ paruṣair duḥkhaiḥ kaikeyī bhṛśaduḥkhitā /
analyzed: taiḥ vākyaiḥ paruṣaiḥ duḥkhaiḥ kaikeyī bhṛśa duḥkhitā
translated: With those harsh and painful words, Kaikeyi was greatly afflicted.

original: śatrughnabhayasaṃtrastā putraṃ śaraṇam āgatā // / / //
analyzed: śatrughna bhaya saṃtrastā putram śaraṇam āgatā
translated: Terrified by the fear of Shatrughna, she sought refuge with her son.

original: tāṃ prekṣya bharataḥ kruddhaṃ śatrughnam idam abravīt /
analyzed: tām prekṣya bharataḥ kruddham śatrughnam idam abravīt
translated: Seeing her, Bharata said this to the angry Shatrughna:

original: avadhyāḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ pramadāḥ kṣamyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: avadhyāḥ sarva bhūtānām pramadāḥ kṣamyatām iti
translated: Women should be forgiven, they cannot be killed by any creature. Let her be spared.🔽If the righteous Rama does not hate me as a matricide,

original: hanyām aham imāṃ pāpāṃ kaikeyīṃ duṣṭacāriṇīm /🔽yadi māṃ dhārmiko rāmo nāsūyen mātṛghātakam // / / //
analyzed: hanyām aham imām pāpām kaikeyīm duṣṭa cāriṇīm  yadi mām dhārmikaḥ rāmaḥ na asūyet mātṛ ghātakam
translated: I would have killed this sinful Kaikeyi of wicked conduct.

original: imām api hatāṃ kubjāṃ yadi jānāti rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: imām api hatām kubjām yadi jānāti rāghavaḥ
translated: If Raghava knows that this hunchback is also killed,

original: tvāṃ ca māṃ caiva dharmātmā nābhibhāṣiṣyate dhruvam // / / //
analyzed: tvām ca mām ca eva dharma ātmā na abhibhāṣiṣyate dhruvam
translated: the righteous one will certainly not speak to you or me.

original: bharatasya vacaḥ śrutvā śatrughno lakṣmaṇānujaḥ /
analyzed: bharatasya vacaḥ śrutvā śatrughnaḥ lakṣmaṇa anujaḥ
translated: Hearing Bharata's words, Shatrughna, Lakshmana's younger brother,

original: nyavartata tato roṣāt tāṃ mumoca ca mantharām // / / //
analyzed: nyavartata tatas roṣāt tām mumoca ca mantharām
translated: desisted from his anger and released Manthara.

original: sā pādamūle kaikeyyā mantharā nipapāta ha /
analyzed: sā pāda mūle kaikeyyāḥ mantharā nipapāta ha
translated: That hunchback Manthara fell down at the feet of Kaikeyi,

original: niḥśvasantī suduḥkhārtā kṛpaṇaṃ vilalāpa ca // / / //🔽śatrughnavikṣepavimūḍhasaṃjñāṃ samīkṣya kubjāṃ bharatasya mātā /
analyzed: niḥśvasantī su duḥkha ārtā kṛpaṇam vilalāpa ca  śatrughna vikṣepa vimūḍha saṃjñām samīkṣya kubjām bharatasya mātā
translated: sighing deeply, afflicted with great sorrow, and lamented pitifully.🔽Seeing the hunchback confused and senseless from the shock of Shatrughna's departure, Bharata's mother,

original: śanaiḥ samāśvāsayad ārtarūpāṃ krauñcīṃ vilagnām iva vīkṣamāṇām // / / //
analyzed: śanais samāśvāsayat ārta rūpām krauñcīm vilagnām iva vīkṣamāṇām
translated: slowly comforted the distressed one, who looked like a female curlew clinging to her.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tataḥ prabhātasamaye divase 'tha caturdaśe /
analyzed: tatas prabhāta samaye divase tha caturdaśe
translated: Then, on the fourteenth day, at dawn,

original: sametya rājakartāro bharataṃ vākyam abruvan // / / //
analyzed: sametya rājakartāraḥ bharatam vākyam abruvan
translated: the royal officials gathered and spoke to Bharata, saying:

original: gato daśarathaḥ svargaṃ yo no gurutaro guruḥ /
analyzed: gataḥ daśarathaḥ svargam yaḥ naḥ gurutaraḥ guruḥ
translated: Dasharatha, our most venerable guru, has gone to heaven,

original: rāmaṃ pravrājya vai jyeṣṭhaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mahābalam // / / //
analyzed: rāmam pravrājya vai jyeṣṭham lakṣmaṇam ca mahā balam
translated: having exiled Rama, his eldest son, and the mighty Lakshmana.

original: tvam adya bhava no rājā rājaputra mahāyaśaḥ /
analyzed: tvam adya bhava naḥ rājā rāja putra mahā yaśaḥ
translated: O prince of great fame, you should be our king today.

original: saṃgatyā nāparādhnoti rājyam etad anāyakam // / / //
analyzed: saṃgatyā na aparādhnoti rājyam etat anāyakam
translated: This kingdom cannot function without a leader.

original: ābhiṣecanikaṃ sarvam idam ādāya rāghava /🔽pratīkṣate tvāṃ svajanaḥ śreṇayaś ca nṛpātmaja // / / //
analyzed: ābhiṣecanikam sarvam idam ādāya rāghava  pratīkṣate tvām sva janaḥ śreṇayaḥ ca nṛpa ātmaja
translated: O Raghava, take all these articles for the consecration,🔽and your own people and the guilds await you, prince.

original: rājyaṃ gṛhāṇa bharata pitṛpaitāmahaṃ mahat /
analyzed: rājyam gṛhāṇa bharata pitṛpaitāmaham mahat
translated: O Bharata, take up the great kingdom of your father and grandfather.

original: abhiṣecaya cātmānaṃ pāhi cāsmān nararṣabha // / / //
analyzed: abhiṣecaya ca ātmānam pāhi ca asmān nara ṛṣabha
translated: And consecrate yourself and protect us, O best of men.

original: ābhiṣecanikaṃ bhāṇḍaṃ kṛtvā sarvaṃ pradakṣiṇam /
analyzed: ābhiṣecanikam bhāṇḍam kṛtvā sarvam pradakṣiṇam
translated: Having circumambulated all the articles for the consecration,

original: bharatas taṃ janaṃ sarvaṃ pratyuvāca dhṛtavrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ tam janam sarvam pratyuvāca dhṛta vrataḥ
translated: Bharata, firm in his vows, replied to all those people:

original: jyeṣṭhasya rājatā nityam ucitā hi kulasya naḥ /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhasya rāja tā nityam ucitā hi kulasya naḥ
translated: The eldest is always fit to rule in our family.

original: naivaṃ bhavanto māṃ vaktum arhanti kuśalā janāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na evam bhavantaḥ mām vaktum arhanti kuśalāḥ janāḥ
translated: You wise people should not speak to me like this.

original: rāmaḥ pūrvo hi no bhrātā bhaviṣyati mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ pūrvaḥ hi naḥ bhrātā bhaviṣyati mahīpatiḥ
translated: Rama is our eldest brother and will be the lord of the earth.

original: ahaṃ tv araṇye vatsyāmi varṣāṇi nava pañca ca // / / //
analyzed: aham tu araṇye vatsyāmi varṣāṇi nava pañca ca
translated: But I will live in the forest for fourteen years.

original: yujyatāṃ mahatī senā caturaṅgamahābalā /
analyzed: yujyatām mahatī senā catur aṅga mahā balā
translated: Let a great army with the four divisions be equipped.

original: ānayiṣyāmy ahaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ bhrātaraṃ rāghavaṃ vanāt // / / //
analyzed: ānayiṣyāmi aham jyeṣṭham bhrātaram rāghavam vanāt
translated: I will bring back my eldest brother Rama from the forest.

original: ābhiṣecanikaṃ caiva sarvam etad upaskṛtam /
analyzed: ābhiṣecanikam ca eva sarvam etat upaskṛtam
translated: And all these articles prepared for the consecration,

original: puraskṛtya gamiṣyāmi rāmahetor vanaṃ prati // / / //
analyzed: puraskṛtya gamiṣyāmi rāma hetoḥ vanam prati
translated: Placing them in front, I will go to the forest for Rama's sake.

original: tatraiva taṃ naravyāghram abhiṣicya puraskṛtam /
analyzed: tatra eva tam nara vyāghram abhiṣicya puraskṛtam
translated: There, having consecrated that best of men, placing him in front,

original: āneṣyāmi tu vai rāmaṃ havyavāham ivādhvarāt // / / //
analyzed: āneṣyāmi tu vai rāmam havyavāham iva adhvarāt
translated: I will bring back Rama like the sacrificial fire from the sacrificial ground.

original: na sakāmāṃ kariṣyāmi svām imāṃ mātṛgandhinīm /
analyzed: na sa kāmām kariṣyāmi svām imām mātṛgandhinīm
translated: I will not fulfill this desire of my mother, who smells like a goat.

original: vane vatsyāmy ahaṃ durge rāmo rājā bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: vane vatsyāmi aham durge rāmaḥ rājā bhaviṣyati
translated: I shall dwell in the desolate forest, Rama shall be the king.

original: kriyatāṃ śilpibhiḥ panthāḥ samāni viṣamāṇi ca /
analyzed: kriyatām śilpibhiḥ panthāḥ samāni viṣamāṇi ca
translated: Let the path be made by the artisans, both level and uneven.

original: rakṣiṇaś cānusaṃyāntu pathi durgavicārakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rakṣiṇaḥ ca anusaṃyāntu pathi durga vicārakāḥ
translated: And let the guards go along the path, examining the difficult terrain.

original: evaṃ sambhāṣamāṇaṃ taṃ rāmahetor nṛpātmajam /
analyzed: evam sambhāṣamāṇam tam rāma hetoḥ nṛpa ātmajam
translated: To the prince who was speaking thus for the sake of Rama,

original: pratyuvāca janaḥ sarvaḥ śrīmadvākyam anuttamam // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca janaḥ sarvaḥ śrīmat vākyam anuttamam
translated: all the people replied with these excellent and prosperous words.

original: evaṃ te bhāṣamāṇasya padmā śrīr upatiṣṭhatām /
analyzed: evam te bhāṣamāṇasya padmā śrīḥ upatiṣṭhatām
translated: As you speak thus, may prosperity in the form of Lakshmi attend upon you,

original: yas tvaṃ jyeṣṭhe nṛpasute pṛthivīṃ dātum icchasi // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ tvam jyeṣṭhe nṛpa sute pṛthivīm dātum icchasi
translated: since you wish to give the earth to the elder prince.

original: anuttamaṃ tad vacanaṃ nṛpātmaja prabhāṣitaṃ saṃśravaṇe niśamya ca /
analyzed: anuttamam tat vacanam nṛpa ātmaja prabhāṣitam saṃśravaṇe niśamya ca
translated: Having heard those excellent words spoken by the prince,

original: praharṣajās taṃ prati bāṣpabindavo nipetur āryānananetrasambhavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: praharṣa jāḥ tam prati bāṣpa bindavaḥ nipetuḥ ārya ānana netra sambhavāḥ
