analyzed: ikṣvākoḥ tu sutaḥ śrīmān kukṣiḥ eva iti viśrutaḥ
translated: Ikshvaku's son was the illustrious Kukshi.

original: kukṣer athātmajo vīro vikukṣir udapadyata // / / //🔽vikukṣes tu mahātejā bāṇaḥ putraḥ pratāpavān /
analyzed: kukṣeḥ atha ātmajaḥ vīraḥ vikukṣiḥ udapadyata  vikukṣeḥ tu mahā tejāḥ bāṇaḥ putraḥ pratāpavān
translated: Kukshi's son was the heroic Vikukshi.🔽Vikukshi's son was the greatly powerful and energetic Bana.

original: bāṇasya tu mahābāhur anaraṇyo mahāyaśāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bāṇasya tu mahā bāhuḥ anaraṇyaḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Bana's son was the mighty-armed and greatly illustrious Anaranya.

original: nānāvṛṣṭir babhūvāsmin na durbhikṣaṃ satāṃ vare /
analyzed: na anāvṛṣṭiḥ babhūva asmin na durbhikṣam satām vare
translated: During the reign of Anaranya, the best of the virtuous, there was no famine and no rain.

original: anaraṇye mahārāje taskaro vāpi kaścana // / / //
analyzed: anaraṇye mahā rāje taskaraḥ vā api kaścana
translated: There was no thief or any other evil in the kingdom of the great king Anaranya.

original: anaraṇyān mahābāhuḥ pṛthū rājā babhūva ha /
analyzed: anaraṇyāt mahā bāhuḥ pṛthuḥ rājā babhūva ha
translated: From Anaranya was born the mighty-armed king Prithu.

original: tasmāt pṛthor mahārājas triśaṅkur udapadyata /
analyzed: tasmāt pṛthoḥ mahā rājaḥ triśaṅkuḥ udapadyata
translated: From Prithu was born the great king Trisanku.

original: sa satyavacanād vīraḥ saśarīro divaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa satya vacanāt vīraḥ sa śarīraḥ divam gataḥ
translated: The heroic Trisanku went to heaven in his own body for his truthfulness.

original: triśaṅkor abhavat sūnur dhundhumāro mahāyaśāḥ /
analyzed: triśaṅkoḥ abhavat sūnuḥ dhundhumāraḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Trisanku's son was the greatly illustrious Dhundhumara.

original: dhundhumārān mahātejā yuvanāśvo vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: dhundhumārāt mahā tejāḥ yuvanāśvaḥ vyajāyata
translated: From Dhundhumara was born the greatly powerful Yuvanashva.

original: yuvanāśvasutaḥ śrīmān māndhātā samapadyata /
analyzed: yuvanāśva sutaḥ śrīmān māndhātā samapadyata
translated: Yuvanashva's son was the illustrious Mandhatri.

original: māndhātus tu mahātejāḥ susaṃdhir udapadyata // / / //
analyzed: māndhātuḥ tu mahā tejāḥ susaṃdhiḥ udapadyata
translated: From Mandhatri was born the greatly powerful Susandhi.

original: susaṃdher api putrau dvau dhruvasaṃdhiḥ prasenajit /
analyzed: susaṃdheḥ api putrau dvau dhruvasaṃdhiḥ prasenajit
translated: Susandhi had two sons, Dhruvasandhi and Prasenjit.

original: yaśasvī dhruvasaṃdhes tu bharato ripusūdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaśasvī dhruvasaṃdheḥ tu bharataḥ ripu sūdanaḥ
translated: Dhruvasandhi's son was the illustrious Bharata, the slayer of foes.

original: bharatāt tu mahābāhor asito nāma jāyata /
analyzed: bharatāt tu mahā bāhoḥ asitaḥ nāma jāyata
translated: O mighty-armed one, from Bharata was born one named Asita.

original: yasyaite pratirājāna udapadyanta śatravaḥ /
analyzed: yasya ete pratirājānaḥ udapadyanta śatravaḥ
translated: He had these kings as his enemies:

original: haihayās tālajaṅghāś ca śūrāś ca śaśabindavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: haihayāḥ tālajaṅghāḥ ca śūrāḥ ca śaśabindavaḥ
translated: The Haihayas, the Tālajaṅghas, the heroic Śaśabindu, and others.

original: tāṃs tu sarvān prativyūhya yuddhe rājā pravāsitaḥ /
analyzed: tān tu sarvān prativyūhya yuddhe rājā pravāsitaḥ
translated: Having repulsed them all in battle, the king was exiled.

original: sa ca śailavare ramye babhūvābhirato muniḥ /
analyzed: sa ca śailavare ramye babhūva abhirataḥ muniḥ
translated: And he became a devoted sage on a beautiful and excellent mountain.

original: dve cāsya bhārye garbhiṇyau babhūvatur iti śrutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dve ca asya bhārye garbhiṇyau babhūvatuḥ iti śrutiḥ
translated: It is heard that he had two pregnant wives.

original: bhārgavaś cyavano nāma himavantam upāśritaḥ /
analyzed: bhārgavaḥ cyavanaḥ nāma himavantam upāśritaḥ
translated: The Bhargava sage named Cyavana resorted to the Himalayas.

original: tam ṛṣiṃ samupāgamya kālindī tv abhyavādayat // / / //
analyzed: tam ṛṣim samupāgamya kālindī tu abhyavādayat
translated: Kaliṅsī approached that sage and paid homage.

original: sa tām abhyavadad vipro varepsuṃ putrajanmani /
analyzed: sa tām abhyavadat vipraḥ vara īpsum putra janmani
translated: The brahmin blessed her, desiring a boon for the birth of a son.

original: tataḥ sā gṛham āgamya devī putraṃ vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: tatas sā gṛham āgamya devī putram vyajāyata
translated: Then the queen returned home and gave birth to a son.

original: sapatnyā tu garas tasyai datto garbhajighāṃsayā /
analyzed: sapatnyā tu garaḥ tasyai dattaḥ garbha jighāṃsayā
translated: But out of a desire to destroy the fetus, her co-wife gave her poison.

original: gareṇa saha tenaiva jātaḥ sa sagaro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: gareṇa saha tena eva jātaḥ sa sagaraḥ bhavat
translated: He was born with that poison and became Sagara.

original: sa rājā sagaro nāma yaḥ samudram akhānayat /
analyzed: sa rājā sagaraḥ nāma yaḥ samudram akhānayat
translated: That king named Sagara who dug the ocean,

original: iṣṭvā parvaṇi vegena trāsayantam imāḥ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: iṣṭvā parvaṇi vegena trāsayantam imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: and at the Parva time, with great speed, terrified all creatures.

original: asamañjas tu putro 'bhūt sagarasyeti naḥ śrutam /
analyzed: asamañjaḥ tu putraḥ bhūt sagarasya iti naḥ śrutam
translated: We have heard that Asamanja was the son of Sagara.

original: jīvann eva sa pitrā tu nirastaḥ pāpakarmakṛt // / / //
analyzed: jīvan eva sa pitrā tu nirastaḥ pāpa karma kṛt
translated: Even while alive, he was banished by his father, the perpetrator of evil deeds.

original: aṃśumān iti putro 'bhūd asamañjasya vīryavān /
analyzed: aṃśumān iti putraḥ bhūt asamañjasya vīryavān
translated: Asamanja had a valiant son named Amshuman.

original: dilīpo 'ṃśumataḥ putro dilīpasya bhagīrathaḥ // / / //🔽bhagīrathāt kakutsthas tu kākutsthā yena tu smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: dilīpaḥ ṃśumataḥ putraḥ dilīpasya bhagīrathaḥ  bhagīrathāt kakutsthaḥ tu kākutsthāḥ yena tu smṛtāḥ
translated: Amshuman's son was Dilipa, and Dilipa's son was Bhagiratha.🔽Bhagiratha's son was Kakutstha, after whom the Kakutsthas are known.

original: kakutsthasya tu putro 'bhūd raghur yena tu rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kakutsthasya tu putraḥ bhūt raghuḥ yena tu rāghavaḥ
translated: Kakutstha's son was Raghu, after whom the Raghavas are known.

original: raghos tu putras tejasvī pravṛddhaḥ puruṣādakaḥ /
analyzed: raghoḥ tu putraḥ tejasvī pravṛddhaḥ puruṣādakaḥ
translated: Raghu's son was the energetic and powerful man-eater.

original: kalmāṣapādaḥ saudāsa ity evaṃ prathito bhuvi // / / //
analyzed: kalmāṣapādaḥ saudāsaḥ iti evam prathitaḥ bhuvi
translated: He was known on earth as Kalmashapada Saudasa.

original: kalmāṣapādaputro 'bhūc chaṅkhaṇas tv iti viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: kalmāṣapāda putraḥ bhūt śaṅkhaṇaḥ tu iti viśrutaḥ
translated: Kalmashapada's son was known as Shankhana.

original: yas tu tad vīryam āsādya sahaseno vyanīnaśat // / / //🔽śaṅkhaṇasya tu putro 'bhūc chūraḥ śrīmān sudarśanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu tat vīryam āsādya saha senaḥ vyanīnaśat  śaṅkhaṇasya tu putraḥ bhūt śūraḥ śrīmān sudarśanaḥ
translated: He, having attained his valour, destroyed him along with his army.🔽Shankhana's son was the heroic and prosperous Sudarshana.

original: sudarśanasyāgnivarṇa agnivarṇasya śīghragaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sudarśanasya agnivarṇaḥ agnivarṇasya śīghragaḥ
translated: Sudarshana's son was Agnivarna, and Agnivarna's son was Shighraga.

original: śīghragasya maruḥ putro maroḥ putraḥ praśuśrukaḥ /
analyzed: śīghragasya maruḥ putraḥ maroḥ putraḥ praśuśrukaḥ
translated: Marut was the son of Shighraga, and Marut's son was Prati-Shrutaka.

original: praśuśrukasya putro 'bhūd ambarīṣo mahādyutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: praśuśrukasya putraḥ bhūt ambarīṣaḥ mahā dyutiḥ
translated: Prati-Shrutaka's son was the greatly effulgent Ambarisha.

original: ambarīṣasya putro 'bhūn nahuṣaḥ satyavikramaḥ /
analyzed: ambarīṣasya putraḥ bhūt nahuṣaḥ satya vikramaḥ
translated: Ambarisha's son was Nahusha of true prowess.

original: nahuṣasya ca nābhāgaḥ putraḥ paramadhārmikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nahuṣasya ca nābhāgaḥ putraḥ parama dhārmikaḥ
translated: Nahusha's son was the highly virtuous Nabhaga.

original: ajaś ca suvrataś caiva nābhāgasya sutāv ubhau /
analyzed: ajaḥ ca suvrataḥ ca eva nābhāgasya sutau ubhau
translated: Nabhaga had two sons, Aja and Suvrata.

original: ajasya caiva dharmātmā rājā daśarathaḥ sutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ajasya ca eva dharma ātmā rājā daśarathaḥ sutaḥ
translated: And Aja's son was the righteous king Dasharatha.

original: tasya jyeṣṭho 'si dāyādo rāma ity abhiviśrutaḥ /
analyzed: tasya jyeṣṭhaḥ si dāyādaḥ rāmaḥ iti abhiviśrutaḥ
translated: You are his eldest son and are known as Rama.

original: tad gṛhāṇa svakaṃ rājyam avekṣasva jagan nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: tat gṛhāṇa svakam rājyam avekṣasva jagat nṛpa
translated: Therefore, accept your own kingdom and rule the world, O king.

original: ikṣvākūṇāṃ hi sarveṣāṃ rājā bhavati pūrvajaḥ /
analyzed: ikṣvākūṇām hi sarveṣām rājā bhavati pūrvajaḥ
translated: For all the Ikshvakus, the eldest becomes the king.

original: pūrvajenāvaraḥ putro jyeṣṭho rājye 'bhiṣicyate // / / //
analyzed: pūrvajena avaraḥ putraḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ rājye abhiṣicyate
translated: The younger son is consecrated in the kingdom by the eldest.

original: sa rāghavāṇāṃ kuladharmam ātmanaḥ sanātanaṃ nādya vihātum arhasi /
analyzed: sa rāghavāṇām kula dharmam ātmanaḥ sanātanam na adya vihātum arhasi
translated: You should not abandon today the eternal family dharma of the Raghavas.

original: prabhūtaratnām anuśādhi medinīṃ prabhūtarāṣṭrāṃ pitṛvan mahāyaśāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prabhūta ratnām anuśādhi medinīm prabhūta rāṣṭrām pitṛ vat mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Rule the earth, rich in jewels and with a large kingdom, like your father, O greatly illustrious one.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: vasiṣṭhas tu tadā rāmam uktvā rājapurohitaḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ tu tadā rāmam uktvā rāja purohitaḥ
translated: Then, having spoken to Rama, the royal priest Vashishtha,

original: abravīd dharmasaṃyuktaṃ punar evāparaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: abravīt dharma saṃyuktam punar eva aparam vacaḥ
translated: Again spoke these words, which were full of righteousness:

original: puruṣasyeha jātasya bhavanti guravas trayaḥ /
analyzed: puruṣasya iha jātasya bhavanti guravaḥ trayaḥ
translated: For a man born here, there are three gurus:

original: ācāryaś caiva kākutstha pitā mātā ca rāghava // / / //
analyzed: ācāryaḥ ca eva kākutstha pitā mātā ca rāghava
translated: The preceptor, O Kakutstha, and the father and mother, O Raghava.

original: pitā hy enaṃ janayati puruṣaṃ puruṣarṣabha /
analyzed: pitā hi enam janayati puruṣam puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: The father begets the man, O best of men,

original: prajñāṃ dadāti cācāryas tasmāt sa gurur ucyate // / / //
analyzed: prajñām dadāti ca ācāryaḥ tasmāt sa guruḥ ucyate
translated: And the preceptor bestows wisdom; therefore he is called the guru.

original: sa te 'haṃ pitur ācāryas tava caiva paraṃtapa /
analyzed: sa te ham pituḥ ācāryaḥ tava ca eva paraṃtapa
translated: I am your father's preceptor, and also yours, O scorcher of enemies.

original: mama tvaṃ vacanaṃ kurvan nātivarteḥ satāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: mama tvam vacanam kurvan na ativarteḥ satām gatim
translated: By obeying my words, you will not transgress the path of the virtuous.

original: imā hi te pariṣadaḥ śreṇayaś ca samāgatāḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ hi te pariṣadaḥ śreṇayaḥ ca samāgatāḥ
translated: These your assemblies and guilds have assembled.

original: eṣu tāta caran dharmaṃ nātivarteḥ satāṃ gatim // / / //🔽vṛddhāyā dharmaśīlāyā mātur nārhasy avartitum /
analyzed: eṣu tāta caran dharmam na ativarteḥ satām gatim  vṛddhāyāḥ dharma śīlāyāḥ mātuḥ na arhasi a vartitum
translated: By acting righteously towards them, O child, you will not transgress the path of the virtuous.🔽You should not disobey the words of your aged mother, who is righteous in conduct.

original: asyās tu vacanaṃ kurvan nātivarteḥ satāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: asyāḥ tu vacanam kurvat na ativarteḥ satām gatim
translated: By obeying her words, you will not transgress the path of the virtuous.

original: bharatasya vacaḥ kurvan yācamānasya rāghava /
analyzed: bharatasya vacaḥ kurvan yācamānasya rāghava
translated: By obeying the words of Bharata, who is beseeching you, O Raghava,

original: ātmānaṃ nātivartes tvaṃ satyadharmaparākrama // / / //
analyzed: ātmānam na ativarteḥ tvam satya dharma parākrama
translated: You will not transgress your own self, O one whose strength is truth and righteousness.

original: evaṃ madhuram uktas tu guruṇā rāghavaḥ svayam /
analyzed: evam madhuram uktaḥ tu guruṇā rāghavaḥ svayam
translated: Thus addressed in sweet words by his preceptor,

original: pratyuvāca samāsīnaṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ puruṣarṣabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca samāsīnam vasiṣṭham puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: the best of men, Raghava, replied to Vasishtha, who was seated before him.

original: yan mātāpitarau vṛttaṃ tanaye kurutaḥ sadā /
analyzed: yat mātā pitarau vṛttam tanaye kurutaḥ sadā
translated: Whatever the mother and father always do for their son,

original: na supratikaraṃ tat tu mātrā pitrā ca yat kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: na su pratikaram tat tu mātrā pitrā ca yat kṛtam
translated: that cannot be easily repaid by the son to his mother and father.

original: yathāśakti pradānena snāpanāc chādanena ca /
analyzed: yathāśakti pradānena snāpanāt chādanena ca
translated: By giving to the best of one's ability, by bathing and clothing,

original: nityaṃ ca priyavādena tathā saṃvardhanena ca // / / //
analyzed: nityam ca priya vādena tathā saṃvardhanena ca
translated: and always by speaking pleasantly and by nourishing,

original: sa hi rājā janayitā pitā daśaratho mama /
analyzed: sa hi rājā janayitā pitā daśarathaḥ mama
translated: that king, my father Dasharatha, who begot me,

original: ājñātaṃ yan mayā tasya na tan mithyā bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: ājñātam yat mayā tasya na tat mithyā bhaviṣyati
translated: whatever he has commanded me to do, that will not be false for me.

original: evam uktas tu rāmeṇa bharataḥ pratyanantaram /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rāmeṇa bharataḥ pratyanantaram
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Bharata, the most generous,

original: uvāca paramodāraḥ sūtaṃ paramadurmanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca parama udāraḥ sūtam parama durmanāḥ
translated: in great dejection, replied to the charioteer.

original: iha me sthaṇḍile śīghraṃ kuśān āstara sārathe /
analyzed: iha me sthaṇḍile śīghram kuśān āstara sārathe
translated: O charioteer, quickly spread kusha grass on this ground for me.

original: āryaṃ pratyupavekṣyāmi yāvan me na prasīdati // / / //
analyzed: āryam pratyupavekṣyāmi yāvat me na prasīdati
translated: I will sit facing my elder brother until he is pleased with me.

original: anāhāro nirāloko dhanahīno yathā dvijaḥ /
analyzed: anāhāraḥ nirālokaḥ dhana hīnaḥ yathā dvijaḥ
translated: Like a brahmin devoid of wealth, without food and without light,

original: śeṣye purastāc chālāyā yāvan na pratiyāsyati // / / //
analyzed: śeṣye purastāt śālāyāḥ yāvat na pratiyāsyati
translated: I will lie down in front of the hall until he returns.

original: sa tu rāmam avekṣantaṃ sumantraṃ prekṣya durmanāḥ /
analyzed: sa tu rāmam avekṣantam sumantram prekṣya durmanāḥ
translated: Seeing Sumantra looking at Rama, he became dispirited.

original: kuśottaram upasthāpya bhūmāv evāstarat svayam // / / //
analyzed: kuśa uttaram upasthāpya bhūmau eva astarat svayam
translated: Placing a pillow of Kusha grass, he himself lay down on the ground.

original: tam uvāca mahātejā rāmo rājarṣisattamāḥ /
analyzed: tam uvāca mahā tejāḥ rāmaḥ rāja ṛṣi sattamāḥ
translated: Then the greatly energetic Rama, the best of royal sages, said to him:

original: kiṃ māṃ bharata kurvāṇaṃ tāta pratyupavekṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: kim mām bharata kurvāṇam tāta pratyupavekṣyasi
translated: O Bharata, what am I to do that you sit before me like this?

original: brāhmaṇo hy ekapārśvena narān roddhum ihārhati /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ hi eka pārśvena narān roddhum iha arhati
translated: For a Brahmana is worthy to restrain men by sitting on one side,

original: na tu mūrdhāvasiktānāṃ vidhiḥ pratyupaveśane // / / //
analyzed: na tu mūrdhāvasiktānām vidhiḥ pratyupaveśane
translated: but the rule is not for those whose heads are anointed to sit in return.

original: uttiṣṭha naraśārdūla hitvaitad dāruṇaṃ vratam /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha nara śārdūla hitvā etat dāruṇam vratam
translated: Rise up, O tiger among men, abandoning this terrible vow.

original: puravaryām itaḥ kṣipram ayodhyāṃ yāhi rāghava // / / //
analyzed: pura varyām itas kṣipram ayodhyām yāhi rāghava
translated: O Raghava, go quickly from here to Ayodhya, the best of cities.

original: āsīnas tv eva bharataḥ paurajānapadaṃ janam /
analyzed: āsīnaḥ tu eva bharataḥ paura jānapadam janam
translated: But Bharata, sitting down, said to the people of the city and the country:

original: uvāca sarvataḥ prekṣya kim āryaṃ nānuśāsatha // / / //
analyzed: uvāca sarvatas prekṣya kim āryam na anuśāsatha
translated: Why do you not instruct me in what is proper?

original: te tam ūcur mahātmānaṃ paurajānapadā janāḥ /
analyzed: te tam ūcuḥ mahātmānam paura jānapadāḥ janāḥ
translated: The people of the city and the country said to that high-souled one:

original: kākutstham abhijānīmaḥ samyag vadati rāghavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kākutstham abhijānīmaḥ samyak vadati rāghavaḥ
translated: We recognize Kakutstha; Raghava speaks rightly.

original: eṣo 'pi hi mahābhāgaḥ pitur vacasi tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u pi hi mahābhāgaḥ pituḥ vacasi tiṣṭhati
translated: This greatly fortunate one also stands in his father's word,

original: ata eva na śaktāḥ smo vyāvartayitum añjasā // / / //
analyzed: atas eva na śaktāḥ smaḥ vyāvartayitum añjasā
translated: and therefore we are not able to turn him away directly.

original: teṣām ājñāya vacanaṃ rāmo vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: teṣām ājñāya vacanam rāmaḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: Having understood their words, Rama spoke these words:

original: evaṃ nibodha vacanaṃ suhṛdāṃ dharmacakṣuṣām // / / //
analyzed: evam nibodha vacanam suhṛdām dharma cakṣuṣām
translated: Listen to the words of these well-wishers who are like eyes of dharma.

original: etac caivobhayaṃ śrutvā samyak saṃpaśya rāghava /
analyzed: etat ca evā ubhayam śrutvā samyak saṃpaśya rāghava
translated: Having heard both of these, properly consider them, O Raghava.

original: uttiṣṭha tvaṃ mahābāho māṃ ca spṛśa tathodakam // / / //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha tvam mahā bāho mām ca spṛśa tathā udakam
translated: Rise up, O mighty-armed one, and touch me and the water.

original: athotthāya jalaṃ spṛṣṭvā bharato vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: athā utthāya jalam spṛṣṭvā bharataḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Then, having risen and touched the water, Bharata spoke these words:

original: śṛṇvantu me pariṣado mantriṇaḥ śreṇayas tathā // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇvantu me pariṣadaḥ mantriṇaḥ śreṇayaḥ tathā
translated: Let the assembly, the ministers, and the guilds listen to me.

original: na yāce pitaraṃ rājyaṃ nānuśāsāmi mātaram /
analyzed: na yāce pitaram rājyam na anuśāsāmi mātaram
translated: I do not beg the kingdom from my father, nor do I command my mother.

original: āryaṃ paramadharmajñam abhijānāmi rāghavam // / / //
analyzed: āryam parama dharma jñam abhijānāmi rāghavam
translated: I acknowledge the noble Raghava, who knows the highest dharma.

original: yadi tv avaśyaṃ vastavyaṃ kartavyaṃ ca pitur vacaḥ /
analyzed: yadi tu avaśyam vastavyam kartavyam ca pituḥ vacaḥ
translated: But if one must dwell and the father's word must be done,

original: aham eva nivatsyāmi caturdaśa vane samāḥ // / / //
analyzed: aham eva nivatsyāmi caturdaśa vane samāḥ
translated: I myself will dwell in the forest for fourteen years.

original: dharmātmā tasya tathyena bhrātur vākyena vismitaḥ /
analyzed: dharma ātmā tasya tathyena bhrātuḥ vākyena vismitaḥ
translated: The righteous one was amazed by his brother's true words.

original: uvāca rāmaḥ samprekṣya paurajānapadaṃ janam // / / //🔽vikrītam āhitaṃ krītaṃ yat pitrā jīvatā mama /
analyzed: uvāca rāmaḥ samprekṣya paura jānapadam janam  vikrītam āhitam krītam yat pitrā jīvatā mama
translated: Rama spoke, looking at the people of the city and countryside.🔽What my living father sold, mortgaged, or bought,

original: na tal lopayituṃ śakyaṃ mayā vā bharatena vā // / / //
analyzed: na tat lopayitum śakyam mayā vā bharatena vā
translated: that cannot be revoked by me or Bharata.

original: upadhir na mayā kāryo vanavāse jugupsitaḥ /
analyzed: upadhiḥ na mayā kāryaḥ vana vāse jugupsitaḥ
translated: I should not create obstacles for dwelling in the forest, which is detestable.

original: yuktam uktaṃ ca kaikeyyā pitrā me sukṛtaṃ kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: yuktam uktam ca kaikeyyā pitrā me sukṛtam kṛtam
translated: Kaikeyi has spoken rightly, and my father has done what is well done.

original: jānāmi bharataṃ kṣāntaṃ gurusatkārakāriṇam /
analyzed: jānāmi bharatam kṣāntam guru satkāra kāriṇam
translated: I know Bharata to be patient and respectful towards elders.

original: sarvam evātra kalyāṇaṃ satyasaṃdhe mahātmani // / / //
analyzed: sarvam eva atra kalyāṇam satya saṃdhe mahātmani
translated: Everything here is auspicious in the magnanimous one who is true to his promise.

original: anena dharmaśīlena vanāt pratyāgataḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: anena dharma śīlena vanāt pratyāgataḥ punar
translated: Having returned from the forest with this righteous brother,

original: bhrātrā saha bhaviṣyāmi pṛthivyāḥ patir uttamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhrātrā saha bhaviṣyāmi pṛthivyāḥ patiḥ uttamaḥ
translated: I will become the excellent lord of the earth along with my brother.

original: vṛto rājā hi kaikeyyā mayā tadvacanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: vṛtaḥ rājā hi kaikeyyā mayā tad vacanam kṛtam
translated: The king was chosen by Kaikeyi, and I have carried out her words.

original: anṛtān mocayānena pitaraṃ taṃ mahīpatim // / / //
analyzed: anṛtāt mocaya anena pitaram tam mahīpatim
translated: By this truth, may I free my father, the lord of the earth, from his falsehood.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽tam apratimatejobhyāṃ bhrātṛbhyāṃ romaharṣaṇam /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  tam apratima tejobhyām bhrātṛbhyām romaharṣaṇam
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: vismitāḥ saṃgamaṃ prekṣya samavetā maharṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vismitāḥ saṃgamam prekṣya samavetāḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The great sages assembled, amazed to see the union of those two brothers, whose splendor was unmatched and who made the hair stand on end.

original: antarhitās tv ṛṣigaṇāḥ siddhāś ca paramarṣayaḥ /
analyzed: antarhitāḥ tu ṛṣi gaṇāḥ siddhāḥ ca parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The groups of sages, the perfected beings, and the supreme sages disappeared.

original: tau bhrātarau mahātmānau kākutsthau praśaśaṃsire // / / //
analyzed: tau bhrātarau mahātmānau kākutsthau praśaśaṃsire
translated: They praised those two magnanimous Kakutstha brothers.

original: sa dhanyo yasya putrau dvau dharmajñau dharmavikramau /
analyzed: sa dhanyaḥ yasya putrau dvau dharma jñau dharma vikramau
translated: He is fortunate who has two sons who know dharma and whose valor is dharma.🔽 Having heard the words of the sages, the king, the lord of the earth, said this to Kaikeyee:🔽O Kaikeyee, you have done well. You have accomplished your own welfare and that of your son.

original: śrutvā vayaṃ hi sambhāṣām ubhayoḥ spṛhayāmahe // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā vayam hi sambhāṣām ubhayoḥ spṛhayāmahe
translated: Having heard the conversation between the two, we desire to hear it again.

original: tatas tv ṛṣigaṇāḥ kṣipraṃ daśagrīvavadhaiṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu ṛṣi gaṇāḥ kṣipram daśagrīva vadha eṣiṇaḥ
translated: Then the groups of sages, desiring the death of the ten-headed one,

original: bharataṃ rājaśārdūlam ity ūcuḥ saṃgatā vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharatam rāja śārdūlam iti ūcuḥ saṃgatāḥ vacaḥ
translated: spoke these words to Bharata, the tiger among kings, having assembled together.

original: kule jāta mahāprājña mahāvṛtta mahāyaśaḥ /
analyzed: kule jāta mahā prājña mahā vṛtta mahā yaśaḥ
translated: Born in a noble family, greatly wise, of great conduct, and of great fame,

original: grāhyaṃ rāmasya vākyaṃ te pitaraṃ yady avekṣase // / / //
analyzed: grāhyam rāmasya vākyam te pitaram yadi avekṣase
translated: if you consider your father, you should accept Rama's words.

original: sadānṛṇam imaṃ rāmaṃ vayam icchāmahe pituḥ /
analyzed: sadā anṛṇam imam rāmam vayam icchāmahe pituḥ
translated: We desire this Rama to be free from debt to his father.

original: anṛṇatvāc ca kaikeyyāḥ svargaṃ daśaratho gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: anṛṇa tvāt ca kaikeyyāḥ svargam daśarathaḥ gataḥ
translated: And by being free from debt to Kaikeyi, Dasharatha has gone to heaven.

original: etāvad uktvā vacanaṃ gandharvāḥ samaharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: etāvat uktvā vacanam gandharvāḥ sa mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Having spoken these words, the Gandharvas, the great sages,

original: rājarṣayaś caiva tathā sarve svāṃ svāṃ gatiṃ gatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rājarṣayaḥ ca eva tathā sarve svām svām gatim gatāḥ
translated: and the royal sages, all went to their own respective destinations.

original: hlāditas tena vākyena śubhena śubhadarśanaḥ /
analyzed: hlāditaḥ tena vākyena śubhena śubha darśanaḥ
translated: Delighted by those auspicious words, the one of auspicious appearance,

original: rāmaḥ saṃhṛṣṭavadanas tān ṛṣīn abhyapūjayat // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ saṃhṛṣṭa vadanaḥ tān ṛṣīn abhyapūjayat
translated: Rama, with a delighted face, honored those sages.

original: srastagātras tu bharataḥ sa vācā sajjamānayā /
analyzed: srasta gātraḥ tu bharataḥ sa vācā sajjamānayā
translated: But Bharata, with trembling limbs and faltering speech,

original: kṛtāñjalir idaṃ vākyaṃ rāghavaṃ punar abravīt // / / //
analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ idam vākyam rāghavam punar abravīt
translated: with folded hands, again spoke these words to Raghava:

original: rājadharmam anuprekṣya kuladharmānusaṃtatim /
analyzed: rāja dharmam anuprekṣya kula dharma anusaṃtatim
translated: Considering the duties of a king and the continuity of family duties,

original: kartum arhasi kākutstha mama mātuś ca yācanām // / / //
analyzed: kartum arhasi kākutstha mama mātuḥ ca yācanām
translated: You should do what I and my mother ask, O Kakutstha.

original: rakṣituṃ sumahad rājyam aham ekas tu notsahe /
analyzed: rakṣitum su mahat rājyam aham ekaḥ tu nā utsahe
translated: I alone am not able to protect this great kingdom,

original: paurajānapadāṃś cāpi raktān rañjayituṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: paura jānapadān ca api raktān rañjayitum tathā
translated: and to please the citizens and the people who are attached to me.

original: jñātayaś ca hi yodhāś ca mitrāṇi suhṛdaś ca naḥ /
analyzed: jñātayaḥ ca hi yodhāḥ ca mitrāṇi suhṛdaḥ ca naḥ
translated: Our relatives, warriors, friends and well-wishers,

original: tvām eva pratikāṅkṣante parjanyam iva karṣakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvām eva pratikāṅkṣante parjanyam iva karṣakāḥ
translated: they all look up to you, like farmers to the rain-bearing clouds.

original: idaṃ rājyaṃ mahāprājña sthāpaya pratipadya hi /
analyzed: idam rājyam mahā prājña sthāpaya pratipadya hi
translated: O greatly wise one, take up this kingdom and establish it.

original: śaktimān asi kākutstha lokasya paripālane // / / //
analyzed: śaktimān asi kākutstha lokasya paripālane
translated: You are capable, O Kakutstha, of protecting the people.

original: ity uktvā nyapatad bhrātuḥ pādayor bharatas tadā /
analyzed: iti uktvā nyapatat bhrātuḥ pādayoḥ bharataḥ tadā
translated: Having said this, Bharata fell at his brother's feet,

original: bhṛśaṃ samprārthayāmāsa rāmam evaṃ priyaṃvadaḥ // / / //🔽tam aṅke bhrātaraṃ kṛtvā rāmo vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: bhṛśam samprārthayāmāsa rāmam evam priyaṃvadaḥ  tam aṅke bhrātaram kṛtvā rāmaḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: and with sweet words, he earnestly entreated Rama.

original: śyāmaṃ nalinapattrākṣaṃ mattahaṃsasvaraṃ svayam // / / //
analyzed: śyāmam nalina pattra akṣam matta haṃsa svaram svayam
translated: Rama took his dark brother, with eyes like lotus petals, and a voice like a trumpeting elephant, on his lap, and spoke to him:

original: āgatā tvām iyaṃ buddhiḥ svajā vainayikī ca yā /
analyzed: āgatā tvām iyam buddhiḥ svajā vainayikī ca yā
translated: This natural and disciplined thought has come to you,

original: bhṛśam utsahase tāta rakṣituṃ pṛthivīm api // / / //
analyzed: bhṛśam utsahase tāta rakṣitum pṛthivīm api
translated: that you are greatly eager, O child, to protect even the earth.

original: amātyaiś ca suhṛdbhiś ca buddhimadbhiś ca mantribhiḥ /
analyzed: amātyaiḥ ca suhṛdbhiḥ ca buddhimadbhiḥ ca mantribhiḥ
translated: And with ministers, friends, and wise counselors,

original: sarvakāryāṇi saṃmantrya sumahānty api kāraya // / / //
analyzed: sarva kāryāṇi saṃmantrya su mahānti api kāraya
translated: Having consulted on all matters, even very great ones, one should carry them out.

original: lakṣmīś candrād apeyād vā himavān vā himaṃ tyajet /
analyzed: lakṣmīḥ candrāt apeyāt vā himavān vā himam tyajet
translated: Lakshmi may leave the moon, or the Himalayas may abandon snow,

original: atīyāt sāgaro velāṃ na pratijñām ahaṃ pituḥ // / / //
analyzed: atīyāt sāgaraḥ velām na pratijñām aham pituḥ
translated: The ocean may overstep its shore, but I will not transgress my father's vow.

original: kāmād vā tāta lobhād vā mātrā tubhyam idaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: kāmāt vā tāta lobhāt vā mātrā tubhyam idam kṛtam
translated: This was done by your mother out of love or greed, dear brother.

original: na tan manasi kartavyaṃ vartitavyaṃ ca mātṛvat // / / //
analyzed: na tat manasi kartavyam vartitavyam ca mātṛ vat
translated: You should not keep it in mind, but behave as if she were your mother.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ bharataḥ kausalyāsutam abravīt /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam bharataḥ kausalyā sutam abravīt
translated: When the son of Kausalya said this, Bharata replied to him,

original: tejasādityasaṃkāśaṃ pratipaccandradarśanam // / / //
analyzed: tejasā āditya saṃkāśam pratipad candra darśanam
translated: Shining like the sun, with the appearance of the new moon.

original: adhirohārya pādābhyāṃ pāduke hemabhūṣite /
analyzed: adhiroha ārya pādābhyām pāduke hema bhūṣite
translated: Mount these sandals adorned with gold, O noble one,

original: ete hi sarvalokasya yogakṣemaṃ vidhāsyataḥ // / / //
analyzed: ete hi sarva lokasya yogakṣemam vidhāsyataḥ
translated: For they will ensure the welfare of the entire world.

original: so 'dhiruhya naravyāghraḥ pāduke hy avaruhya ca /
analyzed: saḥ dhiruhya nara vyāghraḥ pāduke hi avaruhya ca
translated: Having mounted, that best of men, having taken off the sandals,

original: prāyacchat sumahātejā bharatāya mahātmane // / / //
analyzed: prāyacchat su mahā tejāḥ bharatāya mahātmane
translated: Gave them to the great-souled Bharata, the one of great splendor.

original: sa pāduke te bharataḥ pratāpavān svalaṃkṛte samparigṛhya dharmavit /
analyzed: sa pāduke te bharataḥ pratāpavān su alaṃkṛte samparigṛhya dharma vid
translated: Bharata, the righteous one, took those well-adorned sandals,

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ caiva cakāra rāghavaṃ cakāra caivottamanāgamūrdhani // / / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam ca eva cakāra rāghavam cakāra ca eva uttama nāga mūrdhani
translated: And circumambulated Raghava, and placed it on the head of the excellent elephant.

original: athānupūrvyāt pratipūjya taṃ janaṃ gurūṃś ca mantriprakṛtīs tathānujau /
analyzed: atha ānupūrvyāt pratipūjya tam janam gurūn ca mantri prakṛtīḥ tathā anujau
translated: Then, in due order, having honored that people, the elders, the ministers and his younger brothers,

original: vyasarjayad rāghavavaṃśavardhanaḥ sthitaḥ svadharme himavān ivācalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyasarjayat rāghava vaṃśa vardhanaḥ sthitaḥ svadharme himavān iva acalaḥ
translated: The extender of the Raghu dynasty, firm in his own duty like the immovable Himalayas, dismissed them.

original: taṃ mātaro bāṣpagṛhītakaṇṭhyo duḥkhena nāmantrayituṃ hi śekuḥ /
analyzed: tam mātaraḥ bāṣpa gṛhīta kaṇṭhyaḥ duḥkhena nā āmantrayitum hi śekuḥ
translated: Then the mothers, their throats choked with tears, were unable to say anything to him out of sorrow.

original: sa tv eva mātḥn abhivādya sarvā rudan kuṭīṃ svāṃ praviveśa rāmaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa tu eva abhivādya sarvāḥ rudan kuṭīm svām praviveśa rāmaḥ
translated: But Rama, having paid homage to all the mothers, entered his own hut, weeping.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tataḥ śirasi kṛtvā tu pāduke bharatas tadā /
analyzed: tatas śirasi kṛtvā tu pāduke bharataḥ tadā
translated: Then Bharata placed the sandals on his head and

original: āruroha rathaṃ hṛṣṭaḥ śatrughnena samanvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āruroha ratham hṛṣṭaḥ śatrughnena samanvitaḥ
translated: joyfully ascended the chariot along with Shatrughna.

original: vasiṣṭho vāmadevaś ca jābāliś ca dṛḍhavrataḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ vāmadevaḥ ca jābāliḥ ca dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Vasishtha, Vamadeva, Jabali of firm vows,

original: agrataḥ prayayuḥ sarve mantriṇo mantrapūjitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: agratas prayayuḥ sarve mantriṇaḥ mantra pūjitāḥ
translated: and all the ministers honored with counsel went ahead.

original: mandākinīṃ nadīṃ ramyāṃ prāṅmukhās te yayus tadā /
analyzed: mandākinīm nadīm ramyām prāc mukhāḥ te yayuḥ tadā
translated: Facing east, they went to the beautiful river Mandakini,

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ ca kurvāṇāś citrakūṭaṃ mahāgirim // / / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam ca kurvāṇāḥ citrakūṭam mahā girim
translated: and circumambulated the great mountain Chitrakuta.

original: paśyan dhātusahasrāṇi ramyāṇi vividhāni ca /
analyzed: paśyan dhātu sahasrāṇi ramyāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: And beholding thousands of beautiful and various minerals,

original: prayayau tasya pārśvena sasainyo bharatas tadā // / / //
analyzed: prayayau tasya pārśvena sa sainyaḥ bharataḥ tadā
translated: Bharata proceeded along with his army by the side of that mountain.

original: adūrāc citrakūṭasya dadarśa bharatas tadā /🔽āśramaṃ yatra sa munir bharadvājaḥ kṛtālayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: adūrāt citrakūṭasya dadarśa bharataḥ tadā  āśramam yatra sa muniḥ bharadvājaḥ kṛta ālayaḥ
translated: Not far from Chitrakuta, Bharata then saw🔽The hermitage where the sage Bharadvaja had made his abode.

original: sa tam āśramam āgamya bharadvājasya buddhimān /
analyzed: sa tam āśramam āgamya bharadvājasya buddhimān
translated: Having arrived at that hermitage of Bharadvaja, the wise one,

original: avatīrya rathāt pādau vavande kulanandanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: avatīrya rathāt pādau vavande kula nandanaḥ
translated: The delighter of the family, descended from the chariot and paid homage at his feet.

original: tato hṛṣṭo bharadvājo bharataṃ vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: tatas hṛṣṭaḥ bharadvājaḥ bharatam vākyam abravīt
translated: Then Bharadvaja, delighted, spoke these words to Bharata:

original: api kṛtyaṃ kṛtaṃ tāta rāmeṇa ca samāgatam // / / //
analyzed: api kṛtyam kṛtam tāta rāmeṇa ca samāgatam
translated: O son, have you accomplished your purpose and met with Rama?

original: evam uktas tu bharato bharadvājena dhīmatā /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu bharataḥ bharadvājena dhīmatā
translated: Thus addressed by the wise Bharadvaja,

original: pratyuvāca bharadvājaṃ bharato dharmavatsalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca bharadvājam bharataḥ dharma vatsalaḥ
translated: Bharata, devoted to dharma, replied to Bharadvaja:

original: sa yācyamāno guruṇā mayā ca dṛḍhavikramaḥ /
analyzed: sa yācyamānaḥ guruṇā mayā ca dṛḍha vikramaḥ
translated: When the preceptor and I entreated him, that one of firm prowess,

original: rāghavaḥ paramaprīto vasiṣṭhaṃ vākyam abravīt // / / //🔽pituḥ pratijñāṃ tām eva pālayiṣyāmi tattvataḥ /
analyzed: rāghavaḥ parama prītaḥ vasiṣṭham vākyam abravīt  pituḥ pratijñām tām eva pālayiṣyāmi tattvataḥ
translated: Raghava, greatly delighted, spoke these words to Vasishtha:🔽I shall truly fulfill that vow of my father,

original: caturdaśa hi varṣāṇi yā pratijñā pitur mama // / / //
analyzed: caturdaśa hi varṣāṇi yā pratijñā pituḥ mama
translated: For fourteen years is the vow of my father.

original: evam ukto mahāprājño vasiṣṭhaḥ pratyuvāca ha /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ mahā prājñaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ pratyuvāca ha
translated: Thus addressed, the greatly wise Vashishtha replied,

original: vākyajño vākyakuśalaṃ rāghavaṃ vacanaṃ mahat // / / //
analyzed: vākya jñaḥ vākya kuśalam rāghavam vacanam mahat
translated: The eloquent one, skilled in speech, spoke these great words to Raghava:

original: ete prayaccha saṃhṛṣṭaḥ pāduke hemabhūṣite /
analyzed: ete prayaccha saṃhṛṣṭaḥ pāduke hema bhūṣite
translated: Cheerfully give these sandals adorned with gold,

original: ayodhyāyāṃ mahāprājña yogakṣemakare tava // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyāyām mahā prājña yogakṣema kare tava
translated: To Ayodhya, O greatly wise one, to ensure your welfare and security.

original: evam ukto vasiṣṭhena rāghavaḥ prāṅmukhaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ vasiṣṭhena rāghavaḥ prāc mukhaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Vashishtha, Raghava stood facing east,

original: pāduke hemavikṛte mama rājyāya te dadau // / / //
analyzed: pāduke hema vikṛte mama rājyāya te dadau
translated: And gave me his golden sandals for the sake of my kingship.

original: nivṛtto 'ham anujñāto rāmeṇa sumahātmanā /
analyzed: nivṛttaḥ ham anujñātaḥ rāmeṇa su mahātmanā
translated: I have returned, permitted by the great Rama,

original: ayodhyām eva gacchāmi gṛhītvā pāduke śubhe // / / //
analyzed: ayodhyām eva gacchāmi gṛhītvā pāduke śubhe
translated: And taking the auspicious sandals, I am going to Ayodhya.

original: etac chrutvā śubhaṃ vākyaṃ bharatasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: etat śrutvā śubham vākyam bharatasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Hearing these auspicious words of the great-souled Bharata,

original: bharadvājaḥ śubhataraṃ munir vākyam udāharat // / / //
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ śubhataram muniḥ vākyam udāharat
translated: The sage Bharadvaja spoke these even more auspicious words:

original: naitac citraṃ naravyāghra śīlavṛttavatāṃ vara /
analyzed: na etat citram nara vyāghra śīla vṛttavatām vara
translated: O tiger among men, O best among those of good conduct, it is not surprising,

original: yad āryaṃ tvayi tiṣṭhet tu nimne vṛṣṭim ivodakam // / / //
analyzed: yat āryam tvayi tiṣṭhet tu nimne vṛṣṭim iva udakam
translated: That what is noble should dwell in you, like water in a low-lying area during the rains.

original: amṛtaḥ sa mahābāhuḥ pitā daśarathas tava /
analyzed: amṛtaḥ sa mahā bāhuḥ pitā daśarathaḥ tava
translated: Your father Dasharatha, the mighty-armed one, is immortal,

original: yasya tvam īdṛśaḥ putro dharmātmā dharmavatsalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasya tvam īdṛśaḥ putraḥ dharma ātmā dharma vatsalaḥ
translated: Whose son you are, righteous and devoted to dharma.

original: tam ṛṣiṃ tu mahātmānam uktavākyaṃ kṛtāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: tam ṛṣim tu mahātmānam ukta vākyam kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: To that great Rishi who had spoken thus, he (Bharata) with folded hands,

original: āmantrayitum ārebhe caraṇāv upagṛhya ca // / / //🔽tataḥ pradakṣiṇaṃ kṛtvā bharadvājaṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: āmantrayitum ārebhe caraṇau upagṛhya ca  tatas pradakṣiṇam kṛtvā bharadvājam punar punar
translated: began to take leave, clasping his feet.🔽Then the prosperous Bharata, having circumambulated Bharadvaja again and again,

original: bharatas tu yayau śrīmān ayodhyāṃ saha mantribhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ tu yayau śrīmān ayodhyām saha mantribhiḥ
translated: went to Ayodhya with the counsellors.

original: yānaiś ca śakaṭaiś caiva hayair nāgaiś ca sā camūḥ /
analyzed: yānaiḥ ca śakaṭaiḥ ca eva hayaiḥ nāgaiḥ ca sā camūḥ
translated: That vast army, with chariots, carts, horses and elephants,

original: punar nivṛttā vistīrṇā bharatasyānuyāyinī // / / //
analyzed: punar nivṛttā vistīrṇā bharatasya anuyāyinī
translated: again turned back, following Bharata.

original: tatas te yamunāṃ divyāṃ nadīṃ tīrtvormimālinīm /
analyzed: tatas te yamunām divyām nadīm tīrtvā ūrmi mālinīm
translated: Then they crossed the divine Yamuna river, with its garland of waves,

original: dadṛśus tāṃ punaḥ sarve gaṅgāṃ śivajalāṃ nadīm // / / //🔽tāṃ ramyajalasampūrṇāṃ saṃtīrya sahabāndhavaḥ /
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ tām punar sarve gaṅgām śiva jalām nadīm  tām ramya jala sampūrṇām saṃtīrya sahabāndhavaḥ
translated: and all of them again saw the Ganga river with its auspicious waters.🔽Having crossed that river full of beautiful water with his relatives,

original: śṛṅgaverapuraṃ ramyaṃ praviveśa sasainikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śṛṅgavera puram ramyam praviveśa sa sainikaḥ
translated: he, with his army, entered the beautiful Shringaverapura.

original: śṛṅgaverapurād bhūya ayodhyāṃ saṃdadarśa ha /
analyzed: śṛṅgavera purāt ayodhyām saṃdadarśa ha
translated: From Shringaverapura, Bharata again saw Ayodhya,

original: bharato duḥkhasaṃtaptaḥ sārathiṃ cedam abravīt // / / //🔽sārathe paśya vidhvastā ayodhyā na prakāśate /
analyzed: bharataḥ duḥkha saṃtaptaḥ sārathim ca idam abravīt  sārathe paśya vidhvastā ayodhyā na prakāśate
translated: and being tormented by grief, he said this to the charioteer:🔽Charioteer, see, Ayodhya is destroyed and does not shine,

original: nirākārā nirānandā dīnā pratihatasvanā // / / //
analyzed: nirākārā nirānandā dīnā pratihata svanā
translated: devoid of form, joyless, distressed, with its sounds obstructed.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /🔽snigdhagambhīraghoṣeṇa syandanenopayān prabhuḥ /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa  snigdha gambhīra ghoṣeṇa prabhuḥ
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: ayodhyāṃ bharataḥ kṣipraṃ praviveśa mahāyaśāḥ // / / //🔽biḍālolūkacaritām ālīnanaravāraṇām /
analyzed: ayodhyām bharataḥ kṣipram praviveśa mahā yaśāḥ  biḍāla ulūka caritām ālīna nara vāraṇām
translated: The lord, the greatly illustrious Bharata, quickly entered Ayodhya in a chariot with a smooth and deep sound.

original: timirābhyāhatāṃ kālīm aprakāśāṃ niśām iva // / / //🔽rāhuśatroḥ priyāṃ patnīṃ śriyā prajvalitaprabhām /
analyzed: timira abhyāhatām kālīm aprakāśām niśām iva  rāhu śatroḥ priyām patnīm śriyā prajvalita prabhām
translated: The city was like a night enveloped in darkness, with cats and owls roaming about, with people and elephants hiding, struck by darkness, and without any light.

original: graheṇābhyutthitenaikāṃ rohiṇīm iva pīḍitām // / / //🔽alpoṣṇakṣubdhasalilāṃ gharmottaptavihaṃgamām /🔽līnamīnajhaṣagrāhāṃ kṛśāṃ girinadīm iva // / / //🔽vidhūmām iva hemābhām adhvarāgnisamutthitām /
analyzed: graheṇa abhyutthitena ekām rohiṇīm iva pīḍitām  alpa uṣṇa kṣubdha salilām gharma uttapta vihaṃgamām  līna mīna jhaṣa grāhām kṛśām giri nadīm iva  vidhūmām iva hema ābhām adhvara agni samutthitām
translated: It was like the beloved wife of Rahu's enemy, shining with the brilliance of Shri, afflicted by Rahu rising up, like the single Rohini star.🔽It was like a mountain stream, with little warm and disturbed water, with birds scorched by the heat, with fish, alligators, and crocodiles hiding, and thin.

original: havirabhyukṣitāṃ paścāc chikhāṃ vipralayaṃ gatām // / / //🔽vidhvastakavacāṃ rugṇagajavājirathadhvajām /
analyzed: haviḥ abhyukṣitām paścāt śikhām vipralayam gatām  vidhvasta kavacām rugṇa gaja vāji ratha dhvajām
translated: It was like a golden flame rising from the sacrificial fire, without smoke, sprinkled with oblations, and later its flame extinguished.

original: hatapravīrām āpannāṃ camūm iva mahāhave // / / //🔽saphenāṃ sasvanāṃ bhūtvā sāgarasya samutthitām /
analyzed: hata pravīrām āpannām camūm iva mahā āhave  sa phenām sa svanām bhūtvā sāgarasya samutthitām
translated: It was like a great army in a great battle, with its armor destroyed, its elephants, horses, chariots, and standards crushed, its best warriors killed, and itself in distress.

original: praśāntamārutoddhūtāṃ jalormim iva niḥsvanām // / / //
analyzed: praśānta māruta uddhūtām jala ūrmim iva niḥsvanām
translated: It was like a wave in the ocean, rising with foam and sound, but later becoming silent, with the wind that raised it having subsided.

original: tyaktāṃ yajñāyudhaiḥ sarvair abhirūpaiś ca yājakaiḥ /
analyzed: tyaktām yajñāyudhaiḥ sarvaiḥ abhirūpaiḥ ca yājakaiḥ
translated: Abandoned by all the sacrificial implements and the handsome priests,

original: sutyākāle vinirvṛtte vediṃ gataravām iva // / / //
analyzed: sutyā kāle vinirvṛtte vedim gata ravām iva
translated: like an altar devoid of life when the time for the Soma libation has passed.

original: goṣṭhamadhye sthitām ārtām acarantīṃ navaṃ tṛṇam /
analyzed: goṣṭha madhye sthitām ārtām a carantīm navam tṛṇam
translated: Standing in the midst of the cowpen, distressed, not grazing fresh grass,

original: govṛṣeṇa parityaktāṃ gavāṃ patnīm ivotsukām // / / //
analyzed: go vṛṣeṇa parityaktām gavām patnīm iva utsukām
translated: deserted by the bull, like a cow in heat separated from her husband.

original: prabhākarālaiḥ susnigdhaiḥ prajvaladbhir ivottamaiḥ /
analyzed: prabhā karālaiḥ su snigdhaiḥ prajvaladbhiḥ iva uttamaiḥ
translated: With its extremely glossy and radiant jewels scattered about,

original: viyuktāṃ maṇibhir jātyair navāṃ muktāvalīm iva // / / //
analyzed: viyuktām maṇibhiḥ jātyaiḥ navām muktā āvalīm iva
translated: like a new pearl necklace separated from its natural gems.

original: sahasā calitāṃ sthānān mahīṃ puṇyakṣayād gatām /
analyzed: sahasā calitām sthānāt mahīm puṇya kṣayāt gatām
translated: Suddenly displaced from its place, the earth has lost its merit,

original: saṃhṛtadyutivistārāṃ tārām iva divaś cyutām // / / //
analyzed: saṃhṛta dyuti vistārām tārām iva divaḥ cyutām
translated: its splendor and expanse withdrawn, like a star fallen from the sky.

original: puṣpanaddhāṃ vasantānte mattabhramaraśālinīm /
analyzed: puṣpa naddhām vasanta ante matta bhramara śālinīm
translated: Adorned with flowers, filled with humming bees, at the end of spring,

original: drutadāvāgnivipruṣṭāṃ klāntāṃ vanalatām iva // / / //
analyzed: druta dāva agni vipruṣṭām klāntām vana latām iva
translated: like a forest creeper scorched by a swiftly spreading forest fire.

original: saṃmūḍhanigamāṃ sarvāṃ saṃkṣiptavipaṇāpaṇām /🔽pracchannaśaśinakṣatrāṃ dyām ivāmbudharair vṛtām // / / //
analyzed: saṃmūḍha nigamām sarvām saṃkṣipta vipaṇa āpaṇām  pracchanna śaśi nakṣatrām dyām iva ambudharaiḥ vṛtām
translated: All the cities in confusion, the markets and shops closed,🔽like the sky covered with clouds, with the moon and stars hidden.

original: kṣīṇapānottamair bhinnaiḥ śarāvair abhisaṃvṛtām /
analyzed: kṣīṇa pāna uttamaiḥ bhinnaiḥ śarāvaiḥ abhisaṃvṛtām
translated: Covered with broken and empty vessels for drinking the best liquor,

original: hataśauṇḍām ivākāśe pānabhūmim asaṃskṛtām // / / //🔽vṛkṇabhūmitalāṃ nimnāṃ vṛkṇapātraiḥ samāvṛtām /
analyzed: hata śauṇḍām iva ākāśe pāna bhūmim a saṃskṛtām  vṛkṇa bhūmi talām nimnām vṛkṇa pātraiḥ samāvṛtām
translated: Like a drinking place in the sky, bereft of its beauty,🔽Like a well with its bottom broken, low, surrounded by broken vessels,

original: upayuktodakāṃ bhagnāṃ prapāṃ nipatitām iva // / / //
analyzed: upayukta udakām bhagnām prapām nipatitām iva
translated: With its water used up, broken, fallen down,

original: vipulāṃ vitatāṃ caiva yuktapāśāṃ tarasvinām /🔽bhūmau bāṇair viniṣkṛttāṃ patitāṃ jyām ivāyudhāt // / / //🔽sahasā yuddhaśauṇḍena hayāroheṇa vāhitām /
analyzed: vipulām vitatām ca eva yukta pāśām tarasvinām  bhūmau bāṇaiḥ viniṣkṛttām patitām jyām iva āyudhāt  sahasā yuddha śauṇḍena haya āroheṇa vāhitām
translated: Vast and extensive, with its ropes attached, of the swift ones,🔽Cut down on the ground with arrows, fallen down, like a bowstring from a weapon,🔽Suddenly carried by a horseman fond of battle,

original: nikṣiptabhāṇḍām utsṛṣṭāṃ kiśorīm iva durbalām // / / //
analyzed: nikṣipta bhāṇḍām utsṛṣṭām kiśorīm iva durbalām
translated: Like a weak young girl, her belongings thrown away, abandoned,

original: prāvṛṣi pravigāḍhāyāṃ praviṣṭasyābhramaṇḍalam /
analyzed: prāvṛṣi pravigāḍhāyām praviṣṭasya abhra maṇḍalam
translated: In the deep rainy season, entered by a circle of clouds,

original: pracchannāṃ nīlajīmūtair bhāskarasya prabhām iva // / / //
analyzed: pracchannām nīla jīmūtaiḥ bhāskarasya prabhām iva
translated: Concealed by dark clouds, like the light of the sun,

original: bharatas tu rathasthaḥ sañ śrīmān daśarathātmajaḥ /
analyzed: bharataḥ tu ratha sthaḥ sam śrīmān daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: But the prosperous Bharata, Dasharatha's son, standing on the chariot,

original: vāhayantaṃ rathaśreṣṭhaṃ sārathiṃ vākyam abravīt // / / //🔽kiṃ nu khalv adya gambhīro mūrchito na niśamyate /
analyzed: vāhayantam ratha śreṣṭham sārathim vākyam abravīt  kim nu khalu adya gambhīraḥ mūrchitaḥ na niśamyate
translated: Spoke these words to the charioteer who was driving the best chariot:🔽Why is the deep sound not heard today, as before, in Ayodhya,

original: yathāpuram ayodhyāyāṃ gītavāditraniḥsvanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathāpuram ayodhyāyām gīta vāditra niḥsvanaḥ
translated: The sound of singing and musical instruments?

original: vāruṇīmadagandhāś ca mālyagandhaś ca mūrchitaḥ /
analyzed: vāruṇī mada gandhāḥ ca mālya gandhaḥ ca mūrchitaḥ
translated: The smell of liquor and the smell of garlands are overpowered,

original: dhūpitāgarugandhaś ca na pravāti samantataḥ // / / //🔽yānapravaraghoṣaś ca snigdhaś ca hayaniḥsvanaḥ /
analyzed: dhūpita agaru gandhaḥ ca na pravāti samantataḥ  yāna pravara ghoṣaḥ ca snigdhaḥ ca haya niḥsvanaḥ
translated: Nor does the fragrance of incense and aloes-wood spread around.🔽The sound of the best of vehicles, and the smooth neighing of horses,

original: pramattagajanādaś ca mahāṃś ca rathaniḥsvanaḥ /
analyzed: pramatta gaja nādaḥ ca mahān ca ratha niḥsvanaḥ
translated: The loud trumpeting of intoxicated elephants, and the great sound of chariots,

original: nedānīṃ śrūyate puryām asyāṃ rāme vivāsite // / / //
analyzed: na idānīm śrūyate puryām asyām rāme vivāsite
translated: Are no longer heard in this city now that Rama has been exiled.

original: taruṇaiś cāruveṣaiś ca narair unnatagāmibhiḥ /
analyzed: taruṇaiḥ cāru veṣaiḥ ca naraiḥ unnata gāmibhiḥ
translated: With young men dressed in beautiful garments, walking with dignity,

original: saṃpatadbhir ayodhyāyāṃ na vibhānti mahāpathāḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃpatadbhiḥ ayodhyāyām na vibhānti mahā pathāḥ
translated: Flying about in Ayodhya, the great roads do not shine.

original: evaṃ bahuvidhaṃ jalpan viveśa vasatiṃ pituḥ /
analyzed: evam bahuvidham jalpan viveśa vasatim pituḥ
translated: Speaking in this way in many ways, he entered his father's residence,

original: tena hīnāṃ narendreṇa siṃhahīnāṃ guhām iva // / / //
analyzed: tena hīnām narendreṇa siṃha hīnām guhām iva
translated: Deprived of that lord of men, like a cave deprived of a lion.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: tato nikṣipya mātḥn sa ayodhyāyāṃ dṛḍhavrataḥ /
analyzed: tatas nikṣipya sa ayodhyāyām dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Then, firmly resolved, he left his mothers in Ayodhya,

original: bharataḥ śokasaṃtapto gurūn idam athābravīt // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ śoka saṃtaptaḥ gurūn idam atha abravīt
translated: And Bharata, tormented by grief, spoke to his elders:

original: nandigrāmaṃ gamiṣyāmi sarvān āmantraye 'dya vaḥ /
analyzed: nandigrāmam gamiṣyāmi sarvān āmantraye vaḥ
translated: I will go to Nandigrama. I invite all of you today.

original: tatra duḥkham idaṃ sarvaṃ sahiṣye rāghavaṃ vinā // / / //
analyzed: tatra duḥkham idam sarvam sahiṣye rāghavam vinā
translated: There, without Rama, I will bear all this sorrow.

original: gataś ca hi divaṃ rājā vanasthaś ca gurur mama /
analyzed: gataḥ ca hi divam rājā vana sthaḥ ca guruḥ mama
translated: The king has gone to heaven, and my elder brother is in the forest.

original: rāmaṃ pratīkṣe rājyāya sa hi rājā mahāyaśāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmam pratīkṣe rājyāya sa hi rājā mahā yaśāḥ
translated: I am waiting for Rama to return to the kingdom, for he is the king of great fame.

original: etac chrutvā śubhaṃ vākyaṃ bharatasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: etat śrutvā śubham vākyam bharatasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard these auspicious words of the great-souled Bharata,

original: abruvan mantriṇaḥ sarve vasiṣṭhaś ca purohitaḥ // / / //🔽sadṛśaṃ ślāghanīyaṃ ca yad uktaṃ bharata tvayā /
analyzed: abruvan mantriṇaḥ sarve vasiṣṭhaḥ ca purohitaḥ  sadṛśam ślāghanīyam ca yat uktam bharata tvayā
translated: all the ministers and the priest Vasishtha🔽said, The words spoken by you, O Bharata, are befitting and praiseworthy.

original: vacanaṃ bhrātṛvātsalyād anurūpaṃ tavaiva tat // / / //
analyzed: vacanam bhrātṛ vātsalyāt anurūpam tava eva tat
translated: The words spoken out of affection for your brother are indeed appropriate for you.

original: nityaṃ te bandhulubdhasya tiṣṭhato bhrātṛsauhṛde /
analyzed: nityam te bandhu lubdhasya tiṣṭhataḥ bhrātṛ sauhṛde
translated: You who are always attached to your relatives and abide in fraternal affection,

original: āryamārgaṃ prapannasya nānumanyeta kaḥ pumān // / / //
analyzed: ārya mārgam prapannasya na anumanyeta kaḥ pumān
translated: what man would not approve of you who have taken the noble path?

original: mantriṇāṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā yathābhilaṣitaṃ priyam /
analyzed: mantriṇām vacanam śrutvā yathā abhilaṣitam priyam
translated: Having heard the words of the ministers, which were agreeable and desired by him,

original: abravīt sārathiṃ vākyaṃ ratho me yujyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: abravīt sārathim vākyam rathaḥ me yujyatām iti
translated: he said to the charioteer, Let my chariot be yoked.

original: prahṛṣṭavadanaḥ sarvā mātḥn samabhivādya saḥ /🔽āruroha rathaṃ śrīmāñ śatrughnena samanvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prahṛṣṭa vadanaḥ sarvāḥ mātṝn samabhivādya saḥ  āruroha ratham śrīmām śatrughnena samanvitaḥ
translated: With a delighted face, he paid his respects to all the mothers,🔽and the glorious one, accompanied by Shatrughna, ascended the chariot.

original: āruhya tu rathaṃ śīghraṃ śatrughnabharatāv ubhau /
analyzed: āruhya tu ratham śīghram śatrughna bharatau ubhau
translated: Having quickly ascended the chariot, both Shatrughna and Bharata,

original: yayatuḥ paramaprītau vṛtau mantripurohitaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yayatuḥ parama prītau vṛtau mantri purohitaiḥ
translated: surrounded by the ministers and priests, departed in great joy.

original: agrato guravas tatra vasiṣṭhapramukhā dvijāḥ /
analyzed: agratas guravaḥ tatra vasiṣṭha pramukhāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: In front of them were the Brahmanas with Vashishtha at their head.

original: prayayuḥ prāṅmukhāḥ sarve nandigrāmo yato 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: prayayuḥ prāc mukhāḥ sarve nandigrāmaḥ yatas bhavat
translated: All of them went eastwards, towards Nandigrama.

original: balaṃ ca tad anāhūtaṃ gajāśvarathasaṃkulam /
analyzed: balam ca tat anāhūtam gaja aśva ratha saṃkulam
translated: And that army, unsummoned, filled with elephants, horses and chariots,

original: prayayau bharate yāte sarve ca puravāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prayayau bharate yāte sarve ca pura vāsinaḥ
translated: went forth when Bharata had gone, as also all the citizens.

original: rathasthaḥ sa tu dharmātmā bharato bhrātṛvatsalaḥ /
analyzed: ratha sthaḥ sa tu dharma ātmā bharataḥ bhrātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: And that virtuous Bharata, devoted to his brother, mounted on a chariot,

original: nandigrāmaṃ yayau tūrṇaṃ śirasy ādhāya pāduke // / / //
analyzed: nandigrāmam yayau tūrṇam śirasi ādhāya pāduke
translated: hurried to Nandigrama, placing the sandals on his head.

original: tatas tu bharataḥ kṣipraṃ nandigrāmaṃ praviśya saḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu bharataḥ kṣipram nandigrāmam praviśya saḥ
translated: Then Bharata quickly entered Nandigrama,

original: avatīrya rathāt tūrṇaṃ gurūn idam uvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: avatīrya rathāt tūrṇam gurūn idam uvāca ha
translated: and alighting from the chariot, quickly said to his elders:

original: etad rājyaṃ mama bhrātrā dattaṃ saṃnyāsavat svayam /
analyzed: etat rājyam mama bhrātrā dattam saṃnyāsa vat svayam
translated: This kingdom has been given to me by my brother as a trust.

original: yogakṣemavahe ceme pāduke hemabhūṣite /
analyzed: yogakṣema vahe ca ime pāduke hema bhūṣite
translated: And these golden sandals will bear the burden of protection.

original: tam imaṃ pālayiṣyāmi rāghavāgamanaṃ prati // / / //
analyzed: tam imam pālayiṣyāmi rāghava āgamanam prati
translated: I shall rule this until the return of Raghava.

original: kṣipraṃ saṃyojayitvā tu rāghavasya punaḥ svayam /
analyzed: kṣipram saṃyojayitvā tu rāghavasya punar svayam
translated: Quickly uniting them again with Raghava,

original: caraṇau tau tu rāmasya drakṣyāmi sahapādukau // / / //
analyzed: caraṇau tau tu rāmasya drakṣyāmi saha pādukau
translated: I shall see Rama's feet with the sandals on.

original: tato nikṣiptabhāro 'haṃ rāghaveṇa samāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas nikṣipta bhāraḥ ham rāghaveṇa samāgataḥ
translated: Then, having laid down the burden, I shall be united with Raghava.

original: nivedya gurave rājyaṃ bhajiṣye guruvṛttitām // / / //
analyzed: nivedya gurave rājyam bhajiṣye guru vṛtti tām
translated: Having offered the kingdom to my elder brother, I shall serve him as my guru.

original: rāghavāya ca saṃnyāsaṃ dattveme varapāduke /
analyzed: rāghavāya ca saṃnyāsam dattvā ime vara pāduke
translated: And having given these excellent sandals to Raghava,

original: rājyaṃ cedam ayodhyāṃ ca dhūtapāpo bhavāmi ca // / / //
analyzed: rājyam ca idam ayodhyām ca dhūta pāpaḥ bhavāmi ca
translated: and this kingdom and Ayodhya, I shall be free from sin.

original: abhiṣikte tu kākutsthe prahṛṣṭamudite jane /
analyzed: abhiṣikte tu kākutsthe prahṛṣṭa mudite jane
translated: But when Kakutstha is consecrated, and the people are delighted and joyful,

original: prītir mama yaśaś caiva bhaved rājyāc caturguṇam // / / //
analyzed: prītiḥ mama yaśaḥ ca eva bhavet rājyāt caturguṇam
translated: my joy and fame will be four times that of the kingdom.

original: evaṃ tu vilapan dīno bharataḥ sa mahāyaśāḥ /
analyzed: evam tu vilapan dīnaḥ bharataḥ sa mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Thus lamenting pitifully, the illustrious Bharata,

original: nandigrāme 'karod rājyaṃ duḥkhito mantribhiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: nandigrāme karot rājyam duḥkhitaḥ mantribhiḥ saha
translated: together with the ministers, ruled the kingdom in Nandigrama, being sorrowful.

original: sa valkalajaṭādhārī muniveṣadharaḥ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: sa valkala jaṭā dhārī muni veṣa dharaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: The lord, the hero Bharata, wearing bark garments and matted hair, dressed as an ascetic,

original: nandigrāme 'vasad vīraḥ sasainyo bharatas tadā // / / //
analyzed: nandigrāme vasat vīraḥ sa sainyaḥ bharataḥ tadā
translated: dwelt in Nandigrama with his army at that time.

original: rāmāgamanam ākāṅkṣan bharato bhrātṛvatsalaḥ /
analyzed: rāma āgamanam ākāṅkṣan bharataḥ bhrātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: Bharata, devoted to his brother, longing for Rama's return,

original: bhrātur vacanakārī ca pratijñāpāragas tadā // / / //
analyzed: bhrātuḥ vacana kārī ca pratijñā pāragaḥ tadā
translated: and fulfilling his brother's words and his own vow at that time,

original: pāduke tv abhiṣicyātha nandigrāme 'vasat tadā /
analyzed: pāduke tu abhiṣicya atha nandigrāme vasat tadā
translated: having consecrated the sandals, dwelt in Nandigrama.

original: bharataḥ śāsanaṃ sarvaṃ pādukābhyāṃ nyavedayat // / / //
analyzed: bharataḥ śāsanam sarvam pādukābhyām nyavedayat
translated: Bharata reported all the instructions to the sandals.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: pratiprayāte bharate vasan rāmas tapovane /
analyzed: pratiprayāte bharate vasan rāmaḥ tapaḥ vane
translated: When Bharata had gone away, Rama, dwelling in the penance grove,

original: lakṣayāmāsa sodvegam athautsukyaṃ tapasvinām // / / //🔽ye tatra citrakūṭasya purastāt tāpasāśrame /
analyzed: lakṣayāmāsa sa udvegam atha autsukyam tapasvinām  ye tatra citrakūṭasya purastāt tāpasa āśrame
translated: observed anxiety and eagerness among the ascetics.🔽Those who were devoted to Rama in the hermitage of ascetics in front of Chitrakuta,

original: rāmam āśritya niratās tān alakṣayad utsukān // / / //
analyzed: rāmam āśritya niratāḥ tān alakṣayat utsukān
translated: he noticed them to be eager.

original: nayanair bhṛkuṭībhiś ca rāmaṃ nirdiśya śaṅkitāḥ /
analyzed: nayanaiḥ bhṛkuṭībhiḥ ca rāmam nirdiśya śaṅkitāḥ
translated: With eyes and frowns, suspecting Rama,

original: anyonyam upajalpantaḥ śanaiś cakrur mithaḥ kathāḥ // / / //
analyzed: anyonyam upajalpantaḥ śanais cakruḥ mithas kathāḥ
translated: they whispered to each other and slowly held conversations among themselves.

original: teṣām autsukyam ālakṣya rāmas tv ātmani śaṅkitaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām autsukyam ālakṣya rāmaḥ tu ātmani śaṅkitaḥ
translated: Noticing their eagerness, Rama suspected himself,

original: kṛtāñjalir uvācedam ṛṣiṃ kulapatiṃ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ uvāca idam ṛṣim kula patim tatas
translated: and with folded hands, he then spoke to the sage, the head of the community.

original: na kaccid bhagavan kiṃcit pūrvavṛttam idaṃ mayi /
analyzed: na kaccit bhagavan kiṃcid pūrva vṛttam idam mayi
translated: O revered one, have I done anything in the past

original: dṛśyate vikṛtaṃ yena vikriyante tapasvinaḥ // / / //🔽pramādāc caritaṃ kaccit kiṃcin nāvarajasya me /
analyzed: dṛśyate vikṛtam yena vikriyante tapasvinaḥ  pramādāt caritam kaccit kiṃcid na avarajasya me
translated: that would cause the ascetics to be disturbed, seeing some change in me?🔽Have the sages seen my younger brother Lakshmana acting improperly,

original: lakṣmaṇasyarṣibhir dṛṣṭaṃ nānurūpam ivātmanaḥ // / / //🔽kaccic chuśrūṣamāṇā vaḥ śuśrūṣaṇaparā mayi /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇasya ṛṣibhiḥ dṛṣṭam na anurūpam iva ātmanaḥ  kaccit śuśrūṣamāṇāḥ vaḥ śuśrūṣaṇa parāḥ mayi
translated: not in keeping with himself, out of carelessness?🔽Is Sita, who is devoted to serving you and is intent on serving me,

original: pramadābhyucitāṃ vṛttiṃ sītā yuktaṃ na vartate // / / //
analyzed: pramadā abhyucitām vṛttim sītā yuktam na vartate
translated: not conducting herself in a manner befitting a woman?

original: atharṣir jarayā vṛddhas tapasā ca jarāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: atha ṛṣiḥ jarayā vṛddhaḥ tapasā ca jarām gataḥ
translated: Then the Rishi, old in age and decrepitude,

original: vepamāna ivovāca rāmaṃ bhūtadayāparam // / / //
analyzed: vepamānaḥ iva uvāca rāmam bhūta dayā param
translated: trembling, spoke to Rama, who was ever kind to all creatures.🔽O child, whence is the agitation of Vaidehi, who is of a virtuous nature and is devoted to virtue,

original: kutaḥ kalyāṇasattvāyāḥ kalyāṇābhirates tathā /🔽calanaṃ tāta vaidehyās tapasviṣu viśeṣataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kutas kalyāṇa sattvāyāḥ kalyāṇa abhirateḥ tathā  calanam tāta vaidehyāḥ tapasviṣu viśeṣataḥ
translated: especially towards the ascetics?

original: tvannimittam idaṃ tāvat tāpasān prati vartate /
analyzed: tvad nimittam idam tāvat tāpasān prati vartate
translated: This is all on account of you, O child, that this is going on towards the ascetics,

original: rakṣobhyas tena saṃvignāḥ kathayanti mithaḥ kathāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rakṣobhyaḥ tena saṃvignāḥ kathayanti mithas kathāḥ
translated: and therefore they are anxious and are conversing with one another.

original: rāvaṇāvarajaḥ kaścit kharo nāmeha rākṣasaḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇa avarajaḥ kaścid kharaḥ nāma iha rākṣasaḥ
translated: There is a Rakshasa named Khara, the younger brother of Ravana,

original: utpāṭya tāpasān sarvāñ janasthānaniketanān // / / //
analyzed: utpāṭya tāpasān sarvām janasthāna niketanān
translated: who has uprooted all the ascetics living in Janasthana.

original: dhṛṣṭaś ca jitakāśī ca nṛśaṃsaḥ puruṣādakaḥ /
analyzed: dhṛṣṭaḥ ca jitakāśī ca nṛśaṃsaḥ puruṣādakaḥ
translated: He is haughty, boastful, cruel, a man-eater,

original: avaliptaś ca pāpaś ca tvāṃ ca tāta na mṛṣyate // / / //
analyzed: avaliptaḥ ca pāpaḥ ca tvām ca tāta na mṛṣyate
translated: and O child, he is insolent and wicked and cannot bear you.

original: tvaṃ yadā prabhṛti hy asminn āśrame tāta vartase /
analyzed: tvam yadā prabhṛti hi asmin āśrame tāta vartase
translated: Since you have been living in this hermitage, O child,🔽since then the Rakshasas have been harassing the ascetics.

translated: They show themselves in disgusting, cruel, fearful,🔽and various misshapen forms, unpleasant to behold.🔽 They are seen in the hermitages, in the woods, in the sky,🔽and in the water, O child, by the ascetics.

original: nānā rūpair virūpaiś ca rūpair asukhadarśanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: nānā rūpaiḥ virūpaiḥ ca rūpaiḥ asukha darśanaiḥ
