original: apraśastair aśucibhiḥ saṃprayojya ca tāpasān /
analyzed: apraśastaiḥ aśucibhiḥ saṃprayojya ca tāpasān
translated: And associating with the ascetics impure and inauspicious persons,

original: pratighnanty aparān kṣipram anāryāḥ purataḥ sthitāḥ // / / //🔽teṣu teṣv āśramasthāneṣv abuddham avalīya ca /
analyzed: pratighnanti aparān kṣipram anāryāḥ puratas sthitāḥ  teṣu teṣu āśrama sthāneṣu abuddham avalīya ca
translated: The ignoble ones, standing in front, quickly destroy the others.🔽And in those hermitages, unseen, they lurk,

original: ramante tāpasāṃs tatra nāśayanto 'lpacetasaḥ // / / //🔽apakṣipanti srugbhāṇḍān agnīn siñcanti vāriṇā /
analyzed: ramante tāpasān tatra nāśayantaḥ lpa cetasaḥ  apakṣipanti sruc bhāṇḍān agnīn siñcanti vāriṇā
translated: And delight in destroying the ascetics there, those of little understanding.🔽They throw down the sacrificial ladles and vessels, and pour water on the fires,

original: kalaśāṃś ca pramṛdnanti havane samupasthite // / / //
analyzed: kalaśān ca pramṛdnanti havane samupasthite
translated: And crush the water-pots, when the offering is about to be made.

original: tair durātmabhir āviṣṭān āśramān prajihāsavaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ durātmabhiḥ āviṣṭān āśramān prajihāsavaḥ
translated: Possessed by those evil ones, the hermits, desiring to abandon those hermitages,

original: gamanāyānyadeśasya codayanty ṛṣayo 'dya mām // / / //🔽tat purā rāma śārīrām upahiṃsāṃ tapasviṣu /
analyzed: gamanāya anya deśasya codayanti ṛṣayaḥ dya mām  tat purā rāma śārīrām upahiṃsām tapasviṣu
translated: The sages are urging me to go to another country today.🔽O Rama, before those wicked ones show physical harm to the ascetics,

original: darśayanti hi duṣṭās te tyakṣyāma imam āśramam // / / //
analyzed: darśayanti hi duṣṭāḥ te tyakṣyāmaḥ imam āśramam
translated: We will abandon this hermitage.

original: bahumūlaphalaṃ citram avidūrād ito vanam /
analyzed: bahu mūla phalam citram avidūrāt itas vanam
translated: There is a forest not far from here, with many roots and fruits,

original: purāṇāśramam evāhaṃ śrayiṣye sagaṇaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: purāṇa āśramam eva aham śrayiṣye sa gaṇaḥ punar
translated: I will again go to the ancient hermitage with my followers.

original: kharas tvayy api cāyuktaṃ purā tāta pravartate /
analyzed: kharaḥ tvayi api ca ayuktam purā tāta pravartate
translated: O son, Khara has been acting improperly towards you too.

original: sahāsmābhir ito gaccha yadi buddhiḥ pravartate // / / //
analyzed: saha asmābhiḥ itas gaccha yadi buddhiḥ pravartate
translated: If you have the inclination, go from here with us.

original: sakalatrasya saṃdeho nityaṃ yat tasya rāghava /
analyzed: sa kalatrasya saṃdehaḥ nityam yat tasya rāghava
translated: O Raghava! You are always doubtful about your wife.

original: samarthasyāpi hi sato vāso duḥkham ihādya te // / / //🔽ity uktavantaṃ rāmas taṃ rājaputras tapasvinam /
analyzed: samarthasya api hi sataḥ vāsaḥ duḥkham iha adya te  iti uktavantam rāmaḥ tam rāja putraḥ tapasvinam
translated: Even though you are capable, your stay here is difficult today.🔽When the ascetic king said this,

original: na śaśākottarair vākyair avaroddhuṃ samutsukam // / / //
analyzed: na śaśāka uttaraiḥ vākyaiḥ avaroddhum samutsukam
translated: Rama, the prince, was unable to restrain him with his words, as he was eager.

original: abhinandya samāpṛcchya samādhāya ca rāghavam /
analyzed: abhinandya samāpṛcchya samādhāya ca rāghavam
translated: Having greeted, taken leave of, and instructed Raghava,

original: sa jagāmāśramaṃ tyaktvā kulaiḥ kulapatiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: sa jagāma āśramam tyaktvā kulaiḥ kula patiḥ saha
translated: the head of the family, leaving the hermitage, went away with the families.

original: rāmaḥ saṃsādhya tv ṛṣigaṇam anugamanād deśāt tasmāt kulapatim abhivādyarṣim /
analyzed: rāmaḥ saṃsādhya tu ṛṣi gaṇam anugamanāt deśāt tasmāt kula patim abhivādya ṛṣim
translated: Rama, having attended to the group of sages and having taken leave of the sage, the head of the family, from that place,

original: samyakprītais tair anumata upadiṣṭārthaḥ puṇyaṃ vāsāya svanilayam upasaṃpede // / / //
analyzed: samyak prītaiḥ taiḥ anumataḥ upadiṣṭa arthaḥ puṇyam vāsāya sva nilayam upasaṃpede
translated: having been permitted by them who were well-pleased, having been instructed in the meaning, went to his own abode, the sacred one, to dwell.

original: āśramaṃ tv ṛṣivirahitaṃ prabhuḥ kṣaṇam api na jahau sa rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: āśramam tu ṛṣi virahitam prabhuḥ kṣaṇam api na jahau sa rāghavaḥ
translated: But the lord Raghava did not leave the hermitage, devoid of sages, even for a moment.

original: rāghavaṃ hi satatam anugatās tāpasāś cārṣacaritadhṛtaguṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāghavam hi satatam anugatāḥ tāpasāḥ ca ārṣa carita dhṛta guṇāḥ
translated: For the ascetics who always followed Raghava, who had taken up the qualities of the conduct of sages,

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: rāghavas tv apayāteṣu tapasviṣu vicintayan /
analyzed: rāghavaḥ tu apayāteṣu tapasviṣu vicintayan
translated: But when the ascetics had departed, Raghava, reflecting,

original: na tatrārocayad vāsaṃ kāraṇair bahubhis tadā // / / //
analyzed: na tatra arocayat vāsam kāraṇaiḥ bahubhiḥ tadā
translated: for many reasons, he did not like to stay there.

original: iha me bharato dṛṣṭo mātaraś ca sanāgarāḥ /
analyzed: iha me bharataḥ dṛṣṭaḥ mātaraḥ ca sa nāgarāḥ
translated: Here I saw Bharata and my mothers with the citizens.

original: sā ca me smṛtir anveti tān nityam anuśocataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sā ca me smṛtiḥ anveti tān nityam anuśocataḥ
translated: That memory always follows me, as I constantly grieve for them.

original: skandhāvāraniveśena tena tasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: skandhāvāra niveśena tena tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: By the encampment of that great soul,

original: hayahastikarīṣaiś ca upamardaḥ kṛto bhṛśam // / / //
analyzed: haya hasti karīṣaiḥ ca upamardaḥ kṛtaḥ bhṛśam
translated: the ground was greatly trampled by horses, elephants and dung.

original: tasmād anyatra gacchāma iti saṃcintya rāghavaḥ /🔽prātiṣṭhata sa vaidehyā lakṣmaṇena ca saṃgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt anyatra gacchāmaḥ iti saṃcintya rāghavaḥ  prātiṣṭhata sa vaidehyā lakṣmaṇena ca saṃgataḥ
translated: Therefore, thinking of going elsewhere, Raghava,🔽together with Vaidehi and Lakshmana, set out.

original: so 'trer āśramam āsādya taṃ vavande mahāyaśāḥ /
analyzed: saḥ treḥ āśramam āsādya tam vavande mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Having reached the hermitage of Atri, the greatly illustrious one paid homage to him.

original: taṃ cāpi bhagavān atriḥ putravat pratyapadyata // / / //
analyzed: tam ca api bhagavān atriḥ putra vat pratyapadyata
translated: And the revered Atri accepted him like a son.

original: svayam ātithyam ādiśya sarvam asya susatkṛtam /
analyzed: svayam ātithyam ādiśya sarvam asya su satkṛtam
translated: Having himself offered hospitality, he was well honored in every way.

original: saumitriṃ ca mahābhāgāṃ sītāṃ ca samasāntvayat // / / //
analyzed: saumitrim ca mahābhāgām sītām ca samasāntvayat
translated: He comforted Sumitra's son and the greatly fortunate Sita.

original: patnīṃ ca samanuprāptāṃ vṛddhām āmantrya satkṛtām /
analyzed: patnīm ca samanuprāptām vṛddhām āmantrya satkṛtām
translated: And having greeted his aged wife who had come with him and who was well honored,

original: sāntvayāmāsa dharmajñaḥ sarvabhūtahite rataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāntvayāmāsa dharma jñaḥ sarva bhūta hite rataḥ
translated: the one who knew dharma and was devoted to the welfare of all beings comforted her.

original: anasūyāṃ mahābhāgāṃ tāpasīṃ dharmacāriṇīm /
analyzed: anasūyām mahābhāgām tāpasīm dharma cāriṇīm
translated: The greatly fortunate ascetic woman Anasuya, who was devoted to dharma,

original: pratigṛhṇīṣva vaidehīm abravīd ṛṣisattamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratigṛhṇīṣva vaidehīm abravīt ṛṣi sattamaḥ
translated: Accept Vaidehi, said the best of sages.

original: rāmāya cācacakṣe tāṃ tāpasīṃ dharmacāriṇīm /
analyzed: rāmāya ca ācacakṣe tām tāpasīm dharma cāriṇīm
translated: And he told Rama about that ascetic woman who practiced dharma,

original: daśa varṣāṇy anāvṛṣṭyā dagdhe loke nirantaram // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣāṇi anāvṛṣṭyāḥ dagdhe loke nirantaram
translated: For ten years, during an uninterrupted drought that scorched the world,

original: yayā mūlaphale sṛṣṭe jāhnavī ca pravartitā /
analyzed: yayā mūla phale sṛṣṭe jāhnavī ca pravartitā
translated: By whom roots and fruits were created and the Jāhnavī river was made to flow,

original: ugreṇa tapasā yuktā niyamaiś cāpy alaṃkṛtā // / / //
analyzed: ugreṇa tapasā yuktā niyamaiḥ ca api alaṃkṛtā
translated: Endowed with fierce austerities and adorned with vows,

original: daśavarṣasahasrāṇi yayā taptaṃ mahat tapaḥ /
analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi yayā taptam mahat tapaḥ
translated: By whom great austerities were performed for ten thousand years,

original: anasūyāvratais tāta pratyūhāś ca nibarhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: anasūyā vrataiḥ tāta pratyūhāḥ ca nibarhitāḥ
translated: By the vows of Anasūyā, O son, obstacles were removed,

original: devakāryanimittaṃ ca yayā saṃtvaramāṇayā /
analyzed: deva kārya nimittam ca yayā saṃtvaramāṇayā
translated: And for the sake of a divine purpose, by whom, acting swiftly,

original: daśarātraṃ kṛtvā rātriḥ seyaṃ māteva te 'nagha // / / //
analyzed: daśa rātram kṛtvā rātriḥ sā iyam mātā iva te nagha
translated: The night was made to last for ten nights. This is your mother, O sinless one.

original: tām imāṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ namaskāryāṃ yaśasvinīm /
analyzed: tām imām sarva bhūtānām namaskāryām yaśasvinīm
translated: This illustrious one, who is to be revered by all beings,

original: abhigacchatu vaidehī vṛddhām akrodhanāṃ sadā // / / //
analyzed: abhigacchatu vaidehī vṛddhām a krodhanām sadā
translated: Let Vaidehī approach the old one, who is always free from anger.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ tam ṛṣiṃ tathety uktvā sa rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam tam ṛṣim tathā iti uktvā sa rāghavaḥ
translated: Having said this, the sage, the Rāghava said, So be it,

original: sītām uvāca dharmajñām idaṃ vacanam uttamam // / / //
analyzed: sītām uvāca dharma jñām idam vacanam uttamam
translated: And spoke these excellent words to Sītā, who knew dharma:

original: rājaputri śrutaṃ tv etan muner asya samīritam /
analyzed: rāja putri śrutam tu etat muneḥ asya samīritam
translated: Princess, this has been heard by you, spoken by this sage.

original: śreyo'rtham ātmanaḥ śīghram abhigaccha tapasvinīm // / / //
analyzed: śreyaḥ rtham ātmanaḥ śīghram abhigaccha tapasvinīm
translated: For the sake of your own welfare, quickly go to that ascetic lady.

original: anasūyeti yā loke karmabhiḥ khyātim āgatā /
analyzed: anasūyā iti yā loke karmabhiḥ khyātim āgatā
translated: She who is known in the world by the name of Anasūyā, due to her deeds,

original: tāṃ śīghram abhigaccha tvam abhigamyāṃ tapasvinīm // / / //
analyzed: tām śīghram abhigaccha tvam abhigamyām tapasvinīm
translated: quickly go to her, that ascetic lady who is worthy of being approached.

original: sītā tv etad vacaḥ śrutvā rāghavasya hitaiṣiṇī /
analyzed: sītā tu etat vacaḥ śrutvā rāghavasya hita eṣiṇī
translated: Having heard these words of Rāghava, Sītā, who was desirous of his welfare,

original: tām atripatnīṃ dharmajñām abhicakrāma maithilī // / / //
analyzed: tām atri patnīm dharma jñām abhicakrāma maithilī
translated: the daughter of the king of Mithilā, approached that wife of Atri, who was conversant with dharma.

original: śithilāṃ valitāṃ vṛddhāṃ jarāpāṇḍuramūrdhajām /
analyzed: śithilām valitām vṛddhām jarā pāṇḍura mūrdhajām
translated: She was loose, wrinkled, old, with hair white due to old age,

original: satataṃ vepamānāṅgīṃ pravāte kadalī yathā // / / //
analyzed: satatam vepamāna aṅgīm pravāte kadalī yathā
translated: her limbs trembling constantly, like a plantain tree in a storm.

original: tāṃ tu sītā mahābhāgām anasūyāṃ pativratām /
analyzed: tām tu sītā mahābhāgām anasūyām pativratām
translated: But Sītā, the greatly fortunate one, Anasūyā, who was devoted to her husband,

original: abhyavādayad avyagrā svaṃ nāma samudāharat // / / //🔽abhivādya ca vaidehī tāpasīṃ tām aninditām /
analyzed: abhyavādayat avyagrā svam nāma samudāharat  abhivādya ca vaidehī tāpasīm tām aninditām
translated: without distraction, paid homage to her, proclaiming her own name.🔽And having paid homage to that faultless ascetic woman, Vaidehī,

original: baddhāñjalipuṭā hṛṣṭā paryapṛcchad anāmayam // / / //🔽tataḥ sītāṃ mahābhāgāṃ dṛṣṭvā tāṃ dharmacāriṇīm /
analyzed: baddha añjali puṭā hṛṣṭā paryapṛcchat anāmayam  tatas sītām mahābhāgām dṛṣṭvā tām dharma cāriṇīm
translated: with folded hands, delighted, inquired about her welfare.🔽Then, having seen that greatly fortunate Sītā, who was devoted to dharma,

original: sāntvayanty abravīd dhṛṣṭā diṣṭyā dharmam avekṣase // / / //
analyzed: sāntvayantī abravīt dhṛṣṭā diṣṭyā dharmam avekṣase
translated: she, delighted, spoke to her, comforting her, By good fortune, you are looking towards dharma.

original: tyaktvā jñātijanaṃ sīte mānam ṛddhiṃ ca mānini /
analyzed: tyaktvā jñāti janam sīte mānam ṛddhim ca mānini
translated: Having abandoned your kinsmen, O Sītā, and your honor, O you who are honored,

original: avaruddhaṃ vane rāmaṃ diṣṭyā tvam anugacchasi // / / //
analyzed: avaruddham vane rāmam diṣṭyā tvam anugacchasi
translated: It is fortunate that you follow Rama who is confined in the forest.

original: nagarastho vanastho vā pāpo vā yadi vāśubhaḥ /
analyzed: nagara sthaḥ vana sthaḥ vā pāpaḥ vā yadi vā aśubhaḥ
translated: Whether he is in the city or in the forest, whether he is sinful or inauspicious,

original: yāsāṃ strīṇāṃ priyo bhartā tāsāṃ lokā mahodayāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yāsām strīṇām priyaḥ bhartā tāsām lokāḥ mahā udayāḥ
translated: those women whose husband is dear, for them the worlds are of great prosperity.

original: duḥśīlaḥ kāmavṛtto vā dhanair vā parivarjitaḥ /
analyzed: duḥśīlaḥ kāma vṛttaḥ vā dhanaiḥ vā parivarjitaḥ
translated: Whether he is of bad conduct, given to desire, or devoid of wealth,

original: strīṇām āryasvabhāvānāṃ paramaṃ daivataṃ patiḥ // / / //
analyzed: strīṇām ārya svabhāvānām paramam daivatam patiḥ
translated: for women of noble nature, the husband is the supreme deity.

original: nāto viśiṣṭaṃ paśyāmi bāndhavaṃ vimṛśanty aham /
analyzed: na atas viśiṣṭam paśyāmi bāndhavam vimṛśantī aham
translated: I do not see any relative superior to him, even when I reflect.

original: sarvatra yogyaṃ vaidehi tapaḥ kṛtam ivāvyayam // / / //
analyzed: sarvatra yogyam vaidehi tapaḥ kṛtam iva avyayam
translated: O Vaidehi, I see him as suitable everywhere, like austerity performed is imperishable.

original: na tv evam avagacchanti guṇadoṣam asatstriyaḥ /
analyzed: na tu evam avagacchanti guṇa doṣam asat striyaḥ
translated: But evil women do not understand the distinction between good qualities and faults.

original: kāmavaktavyahṛdayā bhartṛnāthāś caranti yāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāma vaktavyahṛdayāḥ bhartṛ nāthāḥ caranti yāḥ
translated: Those who wander with hearts and speech controlled by desire, dependent on their husbands,

original: prāpnuvanty ayaśaś caiva dharmabhraṃśaṃ ca maithili /
analyzed: prāpnuvanti ayaśaḥ ca eva dharma bhraṃśam ca maithili
translated: attain infamy and loss of virtue, O Maithili,

original: akāryavaśam āpannāḥ striyo yāḥ khalu tadvidhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: akārya vaśam āpannāḥ striyaḥ yāḥ khalu tadvidhāḥ
translated: those women who come under the sway of what should not be done.

original: tvadvidhās tu guṇair yuktā dṛṣṭalokaparāvarāḥ /
analyzed: tvadvidhāḥ tu guṇaiḥ yuktāḥ dṛṣṭa loka parāvarāḥ
translated: But those endowed with qualities like you, who have seen this world and the next,

original: striyaḥ svarge cariṣyanti yathā puṇyakṛtas tathā // / / //
analyzed: striyaḥ svarge cariṣyanti yathā puṇya kṛtaḥ tathā
translated: women will roam in heaven like those who have performed meritorious deeds.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: sā tv evam uktā vaidehī anasūyānasūyayā /
analyzed: sā tu evam uktā vaidehī anasūyā anasūyayā
translated: Thus addressed by Anasūyā, Vaidehī,

original: pratipūjya vaco mandaṃ pravaktum upacakrame // / / //
analyzed: pratipūjya vacaḥ mandam pravaktum upacakrame
translated: having duly honoured her words, began to speak slowly.

original: naitad āścaryam āryāyā yan māṃ tvam anubhāṣase /
analyzed: na etat āścaryam āryāyāḥ yat mām tvam anubhāṣase
translated: This is not at all surprising that you should speak to me in this way, noble lady,

original: viditaṃ tu mamāpy etad yathā nāryāḥ patir guruḥ // / / //
analyzed: viditam tu mama api etat yathā nāryāḥ patiḥ guruḥ
translated: for I too know that a husband is the guru of a woman.

original: yady apy eṣa bhaved bhartā mamārye vṛttavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api eṣa bhavet bhartā mama ārye vṛtta varjitaḥ
translated: Even if this husband of mine, noble lady, were devoid of good conduct,

original: advaidham upacartavyas tathāpy eṣa mayā bhavet // / / //
analyzed: advaidham upacartavyaḥ tathā api eṣa mayā bhavet
translated: I would still have to serve him without a second thought.

original: kiṃ punar yo guṇaślāghyaḥ sānukrośo jitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: kim punar yaḥ guṇa ślāghyaḥ sa anukrośaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: What to speak of him who is praised for his virtues, who is compassionate, who has conquered his senses,

original: sthirānurāgo dharmātmā mātṛvartī pitṛpriyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sthira anurāgaḥ dharma ātmā mātṛ vartī pitṛ priyaḥ
translated: who is steadfast in his affection, who has dharma in his soul, who is devoted to his mother and dear to his father?

original: yāṃ vṛttiṃ vartate rāmaḥ kausalyāyāṃ mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: yām vṛttim vartate rāmaḥ kausalyāyām mahā balaḥ
translated: The way the mighty Rama behaves towards Kausalyā,

original: tām eva nṛpanārīṇām anyāsām api vartate // / / //
analyzed: tām eva nṛpa nārīṇām anyāsām api vartate
translated: he behaves in the same way towards the other queens of the king.

original: sakṛd dṛṣṭāsv api strīṣu nṛpeṇa nṛpavatsalaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛt dṛṣṭāsu api strīṣu nṛpeṇa nṛpa vatsalaḥ
translated: The hero, who is devoted to the king, even towards women he has seen only once,

original: mātṛvad vartate vīro mānam utsṛjya dharmavit // / / //
analyzed: mātṛ vat vartate vīraḥ mānam utsṛjya dharma vid
translated: behaves like a mother, setting aside pride, knowing dharma.

original: āgacchantyāś ca vijanaṃ vanam evaṃ bhayāvaham /
analyzed: āgacchantyāḥ ca vijanam vanam evam bhaya āvaham
translated: When I was coming to this desolate and fearful forest,

original: samāhitaṃ hi me śvaśrvā hṛdaye yat sthitaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: samāhitam hi me śvaśrvā hṛdaye yat sthitam mama
translated: my mother-in-law's words, which are in my heart, are as follows:🔽Rama is devoted to dharma, he is compassionate, he is self-controlled, he is steadfast in his affection, he is devoted to his mother and dear to his father.

original: pāṇipradānakāle ca yat purā tv agnisaṃnidhau /
analyzed: pāṇi pradāna kāle ca yat purā tu agni saṃnidhau
translated: And at the time of giving my hand in marriage, in the presence of the fire,

original: anuśiṣṭā jananyāsmi vākyaṃ tad api me dhṛtam // / / //
analyzed: anuśiṣṭā jananyā asmi vākyam tat api me dhṛtam
translated: I was instructed by my mother, and I have remembered those words.

original: navīkṛtaṃ tu tat sarvaṃ vākyais te dharmacāriṇi /
analyzed: navīkṛtam tu tat sarvam vākyaiḥ te dharma cāriṇi
translated: But all that has been renewed by your words, O you who follow dharma.

original: patiśuśrūṣaṇān nāryās tapo nānyad vidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: pati śuśrūṣaṇāt nāryāḥ tapaḥ na anyat vidhīyate
translated: For a woman, there is no austerity prescribed other than serving her husband.

original: sāvitrī patiśuśrūṣāṃ kṛtvā svarge mahīyate /
analyzed: sāvitrī pati śuśrūṣām kṛtvā svarge mahīyate
translated: Savitri, by serving her husband, is honored in heaven.

original: tathā vṛttiś ca yātā tvaṃ patiśuśrūṣayā divam // / / //
analyzed: tathā vṛttiḥ ca yātā tvam pati śuśrūṣayā divam
translated: In the same way, you have gone to heaven by serving your husband.

original: variṣṭhā sarvanārīṇām eṣā ca divi devatā /
analyzed: variṣṭhā sarva nārīṇām eṣā ca divi devatā
translated: She is the best of all women, and she is a goddess in heaven.

original: rohiṇī ca vinā candraṃ muhūrtam api dṛśyate // / / //
analyzed: rohiṇī ca vinā candram muhūrtam api dṛśyate
translated: Rohini is never seen for even a moment without the moon.

original: evaṃvidhāś ca pravarāḥ striyo bhartṛdṛḍhavratāḥ /
analyzed: evaṃvidhāḥ ca pravarāḥ striyaḥ bhartṛ dṛḍha vratāḥ
translated: Such are the foremost women, firm in their vows to their husbands.

original: devaloke mahīyante puṇyena svena karmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: deva loke mahīyante puṇyena svena karmaṇā
translated: They are honored in the world of the gods by their own meritorious deeds.

original: tato 'nasūyā saṃhṛṣṭā śrutvoktaṃ sītayā vacaḥ /
analyzed: tatas nasūyā saṃhṛṣṭā śrutvā uktam sītayā vacaḥ
translated: Then Anasūya, delighted to hear what Sita had said,

original: śirasy āghrāya covāca maithilīṃ harṣayanty uta // / / //
analyzed: śirasi āghrāya ca uvāca maithilīm harṣayantī uta
translated: smelled the crown of Maithili's head and spoke, delighting her.

original: niyamair vividhair āptaṃ tapo hi mahad asti me /
analyzed: niyamaiḥ vividhaiḥ āptam tapaḥ hi mahat asti me
translated: I have great austerities obtained through various observances.

original: tat saṃśritya balaṃ sīte chandaye tvāṃ śucivrate // / / //
analyzed: tat saṃśritya balam sīte chandaye tvām śuci vrate
translated: Relying on that strength, O Sita, O you of pure vows, I urge you.

original: upapannaṃ ca yuktaṃ ca vacanaṃ tava maithili /🔽prītā cāsmy ucitaṃ kiṃ te karavāṇi bravīhi me /
analyzed: upapannam ca yuktam ca vacanam tava maithili  prītā ca asmi ucitam kim te karavāṇi bravīhi me
translated: O Maithili, your words are appropriate and proper.🔽I am pleased with you. Tell me what suitable thing I can do for you.

original: kṛtam ity abravīt sītā tapobalasamanvitām // / / //
analyzed: kṛtam iti abravīt sītā tapaḥ bala samanvitām
translated: Sita said, It is done.

original: sā tv evam uktā dharmajñā tayā prītatarābhavat /
analyzed: sā tu evam uktā dharma jñā tayā prītatarā abhavat
translated: Thus addressed, the one who knew dharma became even more pleased with her.

original: saphalaṃ ca praharṣaṃ te hanta sīte karomy aham // / / //
analyzed: saphalam ca praharṣam te hanta sīte karomi aham
translated: O Sita, I will do something to make your joy fruitful.

original: idaṃ divyaṃ varaṃ mālyaṃ vastram ābharaṇāni ca /
analyzed: idam divyam varam mālyam vastram ābharaṇāni ca
translated: This divine, excellent garland, clothes, ornaments,

original: aṅgarāgaṃ ca vaidehi mahārham anulepanam // / / //
analyzed: aṅgarāgam ca vaidehi mahārham anulepanam
translated: and unguent, O Vaidehi, this very valuable ointment,

original: mayā dattam idaṃ sīte tava gātrāṇi śobhayet /
analyzed: mayā dattam idam sīte tava gātrāṇi śobhayet
translated: given by me, O Sita, will adorn your limbs.

original: anurūpam asaṃkliṣṭaṃ nityam eva bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: anurūpam asaṃkliṣṭam nityam eva bhaviṣyati
translated: It will always be suitable and unadulterated.

original: aṅgarāgeṇa divyena liptāṅgī janakātmaje /
analyzed: aṅgarāgeṇa divyena lipta aṅgī janakātmaje
translated: O daughter of Janaka, anointed with this divine unguent,

original: śobhayiṣyāmi bhartāraṃ yathā śrīr viṣṇum avyayam // / / //🔽sā vastram aṅgarāgaṃ ca bhūṣaṇāni srajas tathā /
analyzed: śobhayiṣyāmi bhartāram yathā śrīḥ viṣṇum avyayam  sā vastram aṅgarāgam ca bhūṣaṇāni srajaḥ tathā
translated: I will adorn my husband, just as Shri adorns the imperishable Vishnu.

original: maithilī pratijagrāha prītidānam anuttamam // / / //
analyzed: maithilī pratijagrāha prīti dānam anuttamam
translated: Maithili accepted the excellent gift of affection - the clothes, unguents, ornaments, and garlands.

original: pratigṛhya ca tat sītā prītidānaṃ yaśasvinī /
analyzed: pratigṛhya ca tat sītā prīti dānam yaśasvinī
translated: And the illustrious Sita, having accepted that gift of affection,

original: śliṣṭāñjalipuṭā dhīrā samupāsta tapodhanām // / / //
analyzed: śliṣṭa añjali puṭā dhīrā samupāsta tapodhanām
translated: with folded hands, worshipped that ascetic lady.

original: tathā sītām upāsīnām anasūyā dṛḍhavratā /
analyzed: tathā sītām upāsīnām anasūyā dṛḍha vratā
translated: Similarly, when Sita was seated, Anasūyā of firm vows,

original: vacanaṃ praṣṭum ārebhe kathāṃ kāṃcid anupriyām // / / //🔽svayaṃvare kila prāptā tvam anena yaśasvinā /
analyzed: vacanam praṣṭum ārebhe kathām kāṃcid anupriyām  svayaṃvare kila prāptā tvam anena yaśasvinā
translated: began to ask her about some agreeable story.

original: rāghaveṇeti me sīte kathā śrutim upāgatā // / / //
analyzed: rāghaveṇa iti me sīte kathā śrutim upāgatā
translated: It is said that you were obtained by this illustrious one in a svayaṃvara, O Sita. This story has come to my ears.

original: tāṃ kathāṃ śrotum icchāmi vistareṇa ca maithili /
analyzed: tām kathām śrotum icchāmi vistareṇa ca maithili
translated: O Maithili, I wish to hear that story in detail.

original: yathānubhūtaṃ kārtsnyena tan me tvaṃ vaktum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: yathā anubhūtam kārtsnyena tat me tvam vaktum arhasi
translated: You should tell me in full how it happened.

original: evam uktā tu sā sītā tāṃ tato dharmacāriṇīm /
analyzed: evam uktā tu sā sītā tām tatas dharma cāriṇīm
translated: Thus addressed, Sita, who was devoted to dharma,

original: śrūyatām iti coktvā vai kathayāmāsa tāṃ kathām // / / //🔽mithilādhipatir vīro janako nāma dharmavit /
analyzed: śrūyatām iti ca uktvā vai kathayāmāsa tām kathām  mithilā adhipatiḥ vīraḥ janakaḥ nāma dharma vid
translated: said Let it be heard and then told that story.🔽The lord of Mithilā was a brave king named Janaka, who knew dharma.

original: kṣatradharmaṇy abhirato nyāyataḥ śāsti medinīm // / / //
analyzed: kṣatra dharmaṇi abhirataḥ nyāyataḥ śāsti medinīm
translated: Devoted to the duty of a kṣatriya, he righteously ruled the earth.

original: tasya lāṅgalahastasya karṣataḥ kṣetramaṇḍalam /
analyzed: tasya lāṅgala hastasya karṣataḥ kṣetra maṇḍalam
translated: While he was plowing the sacrificial ground with his own hands,

original: ahaṃ kilotthitā bhittvā jagatīṃ nṛpateḥ sutā // / / //
analyzed: aham kila utthitā bhittvā jagatīm nṛpateḥ sutā
translated: I emerged, piercing the earth, the daughter of that king.

original: sa māṃ dṛṣṭvā narapatir muṣṭivikṣepatatparaḥ /
analyzed: sa mām dṛṣṭvā narapatiḥ muṣṭi vikṣepa tatparaḥ
translated: That king, intent on throwing away his handful [of seeds], saw me.

original: pāṃśuguṇṭhitasarvāṅgīṃ vismito janako 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: pāṃśu guṇṭhita sarva aṅgīm vismitaḥ janakaḥ bhavat
translated: And with her whole body covered with dust, Janaka was amazed.

original: anapatyena ca snehād aṅkam āropya ca svayam /
analyzed: anapatyena ca snehāt aṅkam āropya ca svayam
translated: And out of affection, he who had no son, himself placed me on his lap,

original: mameyaṃ tanayety uktvā sneho mayi nipātitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama iyam tanayā iti uktvā snehaḥ mayi nipātitaḥ
translated: And saying, She is my daughter, he bestowed his affection on me.

original: antarikṣe ca vāg uktāpratimāmānuṣī kila /
analyzed: antarikṣe ca vāc uktā apratimā amānuṣī kila
translated: And a voice was heard in the sky, unlike any human voice, saying,

original: evam etan narapate dharmeṇa tanayā tava // / / //
analyzed: evam etat narapate dharmeṇa tanayā tava
translated: So it is, O lord of men, she is truly your daughter by Dharma.

original: tataḥ prahṛṣṭo dharmātmā pitā me mithilādhipaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prahṛṣṭaḥ dharma ātmā pitā me mithilā adhipaḥ
translated: Then my righteous father, the lord of Mithila, was delighted,

original: avāpto vipulām ṛddhiṃ mām avāpya narādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: avāptaḥ vipulām ṛddhim mām avāpya narādhipaḥ
translated: And having obtained me, the lord of men attained great prosperity.

original: dattā cāsmīṣṭavad devyai jyeṣṭhāyai puṇyakarmaṇā /
analyzed: dattā ca asmi iṣṭa vat devyai jyeṣṭhāyai puṇya karmaṇā
translated: And I was given in marriage to the elder queen, by the one of meritorious deeds,

original: tayā saṃbhāvitā cāsmi snigdhayā mātṛsauhṛdāt // / / //
analyzed: tayā saṃbhāvitā ca asmi snigdhayā mātṛ sauhṛdāt
translated: And I was brought up by her, with affection, out of maternal love.

original: patisaṃyogasulabhaṃ vayo dṛṣṭvā tu me pitā /
analyzed: pati saṃyoga sulabham vayaḥ dṛṣṭvā tu me pitā
translated: But seeing that my youth was suitable for union with a husband, my father

original: cintām abhyagamad dīno vittanāśād ivādhanaḥ // / / //🔽sadṛśāc cāpakṛṣṭāc ca loke kanyāpitā janāt /
analyzed: cintām abhyagamat dīnaḥ vitta nāśāt iva adhanaḥ  sadṛśāt ca apakṛṣṭāt ca loke kanyā pitā janāt
translated: Became distressed with worry, like one impoverished by the loss of wealth.🔽The father of a maiden in this world, even if equal to Shakra on earth,

original: pradharṣaṇām avāpnoti śakreṇāpi samo bhuvi // / / //
analyzed: pradharṣaṇām avāpnoti śakreṇa api samaḥ bhuvi
translated: Suffers humiliation from people who are equal or inferior to him.

original: tāṃ dharṣaṇām adūrasthāṃ saṃdṛśyātmani pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: tām dharṣaṇām adūra sthām saṃdṛśya ātmani pārthivaḥ
translated: Seeing that humiliation not far away for himself, the king

original: cintārṇavagataḥ pāraṃ nāsasādāplavo yathā // / / //
analyzed: cintā arṇava gataḥ pāram na āsasāda āplavaḥ yathā
translated: He could not reach the other shore of the ocean of thought, as one without a raft.

original: ayonijāṃ hi māṃ jñātvā nādhyagacchat sa cintayan /
analyzed: a yoni jām hi mām jñātvā na adhyagacchat sa cintayan
translated: Knowing that I was not born from a womb, he could not find a suitable match for me in his thoughts.

original: sadṛśaṃ cānurūpaṃ ca mahīpālaḥ patiṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: sadṛśam ca anurūpam ca mahīpālaḥ patim mama
translated: A king who would be suitable and appropriate as a husband for me.

original: tasya buddhir iyaṃ jātā cintayānasya saṃtatam /
analyzed: tasya buddhiḥ iyam jātā cintayānasya saṃtatam
translated: While he was constantly thinking, this idea arose in his mind:

original: svayaṃ varaṃ tanūjāyāḥ kariṣyāmīti dhīmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: svayam varam tanūjāyāḥ kariṣyāmi iti dhīmataḥ
translated: I, the wise one, will myself choose a husband for my daughter.

original: mahāyajñe tadā tasya varuṇena mahātmanā /
analyzed: mahā yajñe tadā tasya varuṇena mahātmanā
translated: At that great sacrifice of his, the great-souled Varuna

original: dattaṃ dhanurvaraṃ prītyā tūṇī cākṣayasāyakau // / / //🔽asaṃcālyaṃ manuṣyaiś ca yatnenāpi ca gauravāt /
analyzed: dattam dhanuḥ varam prītyā tūṇī ca akṣaya sāyakau  a saṃcālyam manuṣyaiḥ ca yatnena api ca gauravāt
translated: Affectionately gave him the best bow and two quivers with inexhaustible arrows.🔽Which could not be moved even by men with effort, due to its heaviness.

original: tan na śaktā namayituṃ svapneṣv api narādhipāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat na śaktāḥ namayitum svapneṣu api narādhipāḥ
translated: Even in their dreams, the kings were not able to bend it.

original: tad dhanuḥ prāpya me pitrā vyāhṛtaṃ satyavādinā /
analyzed: tat dhanuḥ prāpya me pitrā vyāhṛtam satya vādinā
translated: Having obtained that bow, my truthful father

original: samavāye narendrāṇāṃ pūrvam āmantrya pārthivān // / / //
analyzed: samavāye narendrāṇām pūrvam āmantrya pārthivān
translated: First invited the kings and said this in the assembly of kings:

original: idaṃ ca dhanur udyamya sajyaṃ yaḥ kurute naraḥ /
analyzed: idam ca dhanuḥ udyamya sajyam yaḥ kurute naraḥ
translated: The man who can string and draw this bow,

original: tasya me duhitā bhāryā bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya me duhitā bhāryā bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: My daughter will undoubtedly become his wife.

original: tac ca dṛṣṭvā dhanuḥśreṣṭhaṃ gauravād girisaṃnibham /
analyzed: tat ca dṛṣṭvā dhanuḥ śreṣṭham gauravāt giri saṃnibham
translated: Having seen that best of bows, heavy like a mountain,

original: abhivādya nṛpā jagmur aśaktās tasya tolane // / / //
analyzed: abhivādya nṛpāḥ jagmuḥ aśaktāḥ tasya tolane
translated: The kings, unable to lift it, went away after saluting it.

original: sudīrghasya tu kālasya rāghavo 'yaṃ mahādyutiḥ /
analyzed: su dīrghasya tu kālasya rāghavaḥ yam mahā dyutiḥ
translated: After a very long time, this Raghava of great splendor,

original: viśvāmitreṇa sahito yajñaṃ draṣṭuṃ samāgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśvāmitreṇa sahitaḥ yajñam draṣṭum samāgataḥ
translated: came to see the sacrifice along with Vishvamitra.

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāmaḥ satyaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāmaḥ satya parākramaḥ
translated: Rama, whose prowess lies in truth, along with his brother Lakshmana,

original: viśvāmitras tu dharmātmā mama pitrā supūjitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ tu dharma ātmā mama pitrā su pūjitaḥ
translated: Vishvamitra, the righteous one, was well worshipped by my father.

original: provāca pitaraṃ tatra bhrātarau rāmalakṣmaṇau /
analyzed: provāca pitaram tatra bhrātarau rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: He said to my father there, These two brothers Rama and Lakshmana,

original: sutau daśarathasyemau dhanurdarśanakāṅkṣiṇau /
analyzed: sutau daśarathasya imau dhanuḥ darśana kāṅkṣiṇau
translated: are the sons of Dasharatha, desirous of seeing the bow.

original: ity uktas tena vipreṇa tad dhanuḥ samupānayat // / / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tena vipreṇa tat dhanuḥ samupānayat
translated: Thus addressed by the brahmin, he brought the bow.

original: nimeṣāntaramātreṇa tad ānamya sa vīryavān /🔽jyāṃ samāropya jhaṭiti pūrayāmāsa vīryavān // / / //
analyzed: nimeṣa antara mātreṇa tat ānamya sa vīryavān  jyām samāropya jhaṭiti pūrayāmāsa vīryavān
translated: In just a moment, that powerful one bent it,🔽and the powerful one immediately strung it and drew it.

original: tena pūrayatā vegān madhye bhagnaṃ dvidhā dhanuḥ /
analyzed: tena pūrayatā vegān madhye bhagnam dvidhā dhanuḥ
translated: As he drew it with force, the bow broke in the middle in two parts,

original: tasya śabdo 'bhavad bhīmaḥ patitasyāśaner iva // / / //🔽tato 'haṃ tatra rāmāya pitrā satyābhisaṃdhinā /
analyzed: tasya śabdaḥ bhavat bhīmaḥ patitasya aśaneḥ iva  tatas ham tatra rāmāya pitrā satya abhisaṃdhinā
translated: and the sound it made was terrible, like that of a falling thunderbolt.🔽Then my father, firm in his promise, raised an excellent water vessel

original: udyatā dātum udyamya jalabhājanam uttamam // / / //
analyzed: udyatā dātum udyamya jala bhājanam uttamam
translated: and was ready to give Rama to him there.

original: dīyamānāṃ na tu tadā pratijagrāha rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: dīyamānām na tu tadā pratijagrāha rāghavaḥ
translated: But Raghava did not accept it then,

original: avijñāya pituś chandam ayodhyādhipateḥ prabhoḥ // / / //
analyzed: a vijñāya pituḥ chandam ayodhyā adhipateḥ prabhoḥ
translated: without knowing the wishes of his father, the lord of Ayodhya.

original: tataḥ śvaśuram āmantrya vṛddhaṃ daśarathaṃ nṛpam /
analyzed: tatas śvaśuram āmantrya vṛddham daśaratham nṛpam
translated: Then, having greeted her father-in-law, the aged king Dasharatha,

original: mama pitrā ahaṃ dattā rāmāya viditātmane // / / //
analyzed: mama pitrā aham dattā rāmāya vidita ātmane
translated: my father gave me to Rama, who is known for his self-control.

original: mama caivānujā sādhvī ūrmilā priyadarśanā /
analyzed: mama ca eva anujā sādhvī ūrmilā priya darśanā
translated: And my younger sister, the virtuous and beautiful Urmila,

original: bhāryārthe lakṣmaṇasyāpi dattā pitrā mama svayam // / / //
analyzed: bhāryā arthe lakṣmaṇasya api dattā pitrā mama svayam
translated: was given by my father himself as a wife to Lakshmana.

original: evaṃ dattāsmi rāmāya tadā tasmin svayaṃvare /
analyzed: evam dattā asmi rāmāya tadā tasmin svayaṃvare
translated: Thus I was given to Rama at that svayamvara.

original: anuraktā ca dharmeṇa patiṃ vīryavatāṃ varam // / / //
analyzed: anuraktā ca dharmeṇa patim vīryavatām varam
translated: And I am devoted to my husband, the best among the valiant, in accordance with dharma.

original: Rāmāyaṇa / Ayodhyākāṇḍa /
analyzed: rāmāyaṇa ayodhyā kāṇḍa
translated: Ramayana. Ayodhya Kanda.

original: anasūyā tu dharmajñā śrutvā tāṃ mahatīṃ kathām /
analyzed: anasūyā tu dharma jñā śrutvā tām mahatīm kathām
translated: But Anasuyā, who knew dharma, having heard that great story,

original: paryaṣvajata bāhubhyāṃ śirasy āghrāya maithilīm // / / //
analyzed: paryaṣvajata bāhubhyām śirasi āghrāya maithilīm
translated: embraced Maithili with her arms and inhaled the fragrance of her head.

original: vyaktākṣarapadaṃ citraṃ bhāṣitaṃ madhuraṃ tvayā /
analyzed: vyakta akṣara padam citram bhāṣitam madhuram tvayā
translated: Your speech is clear, the words are beautiful and sweet.

original: yathā svayaṃvaraṃ vṛttaṃ tat sarvaṃ hi śrutaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: yathā svayaṃvaram vṛttam tat sarvam hi śrutam mayā
translated: I have heard all about how the svayamvara took place.

original: rame 'haṃ kathayā te tu dṛḍhaṃ madhurabhāṣiṇi /
analyzed: rame ham kathayā te tu dṛḍham madhura bhāṣiṇi
translated: I delight in your story, O you who speak so sweetly.

original: ravir astaṃ gataḥ śrīmān upohya rajanīṃ śivām // / / //🔽divasaṃ pratikīrṇānām āhārārthaṃ patatriṇām /
analyzed: raviḥ astam gataḥ śrīmān upohya rajanīm śivām  divasam pratikīrṇānām āhāra artham patatriṇām
translated: The glorious sun has set, having brought about an auspicious night.🔽At the time of dusk, the sounds are heard of birds that have been scattered during the day,

original: saṃdhyākāle nilīnānāṃ nidrārthaṃ śrūyate dhvaniḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃdhyā kāle nilīnānām nidrā artham śrūyate dhvaniḥ
translated: returning to their nests for the sake of sleep.

original: ete cāpy abhiṣekārdrā munayaḥ phalaśodhanāḥ /
analyzed: ete ca api abhiṣeka ārdrāḥ munayaḥ phala śodhanāḥ
translated: And these sages, wet from their ablutions, are engaged in examining the fruits,

original: sahitā upavartante salilāplutavalkalāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sahitāḥ upavartante salila āpluta valkalāḥ
translated: coming together with their bark garments drenched in water.

original: ṛṣīṇām agnihotreṣu huteṣu vidhipurvakam /
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām agnihotreṣu huteṣu vidhi purvakam
translated: In the Agnihotra sacrifices of the sages, offered according to the rules,

original: kapotāṅgāruṇo dhūmo dṛśyate pavanoddhataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kapota aṅga aruṇaḥ dhūmaḥ dṛśyate pavana uddhataḥ
translated: the smoke, tinged with the color of a pigeon's feathers, is seen being driven by the wind.

original: alpaparṇā hi taravo ghanībhūtāḥ samantataḥ /
analyzed: alpa parṇāḥ hi taravaḥ ghanībhūtāḥ samantataḥ
translated: The trees have few leaves, but have become dense all around,

original: viprakṛṣṭe 'pi ye deśe na prakāśanti vai diśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viprakṛṣṭe pi ye deśe na prakāśanti vai diśaḥ
translated: so that even in distant places, the directions are not visible.

original: rajanīcarasattvāni pracaranti samantataḥ /
analyzed: rajanī cara sattvāni pracaranti samantataḥ
translated: Creatures that roam at night are moving about in all directions,

original: tapovanamṛgā hy ete veditīrtheṣu śerate // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ vana mṛgāḥ hi ete vedi tīrtheṣu śerate
translated: while these forest deer of the penance grove are lying down at the sacred fords of the Vedas.

original: sampravṛttā niśā sīte nakṣatrasamalaṃkṛtā /
analyzed: sampravṛttā niśā sīte nakṣatra samalaṃkṛtā
translated: Night has set in, Sita, adorned with stars,

original: jyotsnāprāvaraṇaś candro dṛśyate 'bhyudito 'mbare // / / //
analyzed: jyotsnā prāvaraṇaḥ candraḥ dṛśyate bhyuditaḥ mbare
translated: and the moon, covered with moonlight, is seen rising in the sky.

original: gamyatām anujānāmi rāmasyānucarī bhava /
analyzed: gamyatām anujānāmi rāmasya anucarī bhava
translated: Go, I give you permission. Be a follower of Rama.

original: kathayantyā hi madhuraṃ tvayāhaṃ paritoṣitā // / / //🔽alaṃkuru ca tāvat tvaṃ pratyakṣaṃ mama maithili /
analyzed: kathayantyā hi madhuram tvayā aham paritoṣitā  alaṃkuru ca tāvat tvam pratyakṣam mama maithili
translated: By your sweet speech, you have gratified me.🔽O Maithili, adorn yourself in my presence.

original: prītiṃ janaya me vatsa divyālaṃkāraśobhinī // / / //
analyzed: prītim janaya me vatsa divya alaṃkāra śobhinī
translated: O child, beautify yourself with divine ornaments and give me pleasure.

original: sā tadā samalaṃkṛtya sītā surasutopamā /
analyzed: sā tadā samalaṃkṛtya sītā sura sutā upamā
translated: Then Sita, adorned and resembling the daughter of a celestial,

original: praṇamya śirasā tasyai rāmaṃ tv abhimukhī yayau // / / //
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā tasyai rāmam tu abhimukhī yayau
translated: bowed her head to her and went towards Rama.

original: tathā tu bhūṣitāṃ sītāṃ dadarśa vadatāṃ varaḥ /
analyzed: tathā tu bhūṣitām sītām dadarśa vadatām varaḥ
translated: The best of speakers saw Sita adorned in this way,

original: rāghavaḥ prītidānena tapasvinyā jaharṣa ca // / / //
analyzed: rāghavaḥ prīti dānena tapasvinyāḥ jaharṣa ca
translated: and Raghava rejoiced at the gift of affection from the ascetic woman.

original: nyavedayat tataḥ sarvaṃ sītā rāmāya maithilī /
analyzed: nyavedayat tatas sarvam sītā rāmāya maithilī
translated: Then Maithili Sita told everything to Rama,

original: prītidānaṃ tapasvinyā vasanābharaṇasrajām // / / //
analyzed: prīti dānam tapasvinyāḥ vasana ābharaṇa srajām
translated: the gift of affection from the ascetic woman, with garments, ornaments and garlands.

original: prahṛṣṭas tv abhavad rāmo lakṣmaṇaś ca mahārathaḥ /
analyzed: prahṛṣṭaḥ tu abhavat rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā rathaḥ
translated: Rama and the great warrior Lakshmana were delighted,

original: maithilyāḥ satkriyāṃ dṛṣṭvā mānuṣeṣu sudurlabhām // / / //🔽tatas tāṃ śarvarīṃ prītaḥ puṇyāṃ śaśinibhānanaḥ /
analyzed: maithilyāḥ satkriyām dṛṣṭvā mānuṣeṣu su durlabhām  tatas tām śarvarīm prītaḥ puṇyām śaśi nibha ānanaḥ
translated: seeing the honor shown to Maithili, so difficult to find among humans.🔽Then the moon-faced descendant of Raghu, delighted, spent that auspicious night,

original: arcitas tāpasaiḥ siddhair uvāsa raghunandanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: arcitaḥ tāpasaiḥ siddhaiḥ uvāsa raghunandanaḥ
translated: honored by the ascetics and perfected beings.

original: tasyāṃ rātryāṃ vyatītāyām abhiṣicya hutāgnikān /
analyzed: tasyām rātryām vyatītāyām abhiṣicya hutāgnikān
translated: When that night had passed, having consecrated the fire-worshippers,

original: āpṛcchetāṃ naravyāghrau tāpasān vanagocarān // / / //
analyzed: āpṛcchetām nara vyāghrau tāpasān vana gocarān
translated: And those two best of men asked the ascetics who lived in the forest.

original: tāv ūcus te vanacarās tāpasā dharmacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tau ūcuḥ te vana carāḥ tāpasāḥ dharma cāriṇaḥ
translated: And those ascetics who lived in the forest and followed dharma said to them:

original: vanasya tasya saṃcāraṃ rākṣasaiḥ samabhiplutam // / / //
analyzed: vanasya tasya saṃcāram rākṣasaiḥ samabhiplutam
translated: This forest is infested with demons.

original: eṣa panthā maharṣīṇāṃ phalāny āharatāṃ vane /🔽anena tu vanaṃ durgaṃ gantuṃ rāghava te kṣamam // / / //
analyzed: eṣa panthāḥ mahā ṛṣīṇām phalāni āharatām vane  anena tu vanam durgam gantum rāghava te kṣamam
translated: This is the path by which the great sages go to the forest to gather fruits.🔽But, O Raghava, it is not possible for you to go through this impassable forest with your wife.

original: itīva taiḥ prāñjalibhis tapasvibhir dvijaiḥ kṛtasvastyayanaḥ paraṃtapaḥ /
analyzed: iti iva taiḥ prāñjalibhiḥ tapasvibhiḥ dvijaiḥ kṛta svastyayanaḥ paraṃtapaḥ
translated: Thus, the ascetics, with folded hands, performed the benediction for that scorcher of enemies, Raghava.

original: vanaṃ sabhāryaḥ praviveśa rāghavaḥ salakṣmaṇaḥ sūrya ivābhramaṇḍalam // / /
analyzed: vanam sa bhāryaḥ praviveśa rāghavaḥ sa lakṣmaṇaḥ sūryaḥ iva abhra maṇḍalam
translated: And with his wife and Lakshmana, he entered the forest, like the sun entering a mass of clouds.
